description:
Loved the Hawaiian Teriyaki bowl!

Delicious and good sized portion. This location is small, but in a nice area.
author: GARY C.

description:
I always got their Fish Tacos whenever I come here. It's fresh, crispy with good salad that comes with edamame. 

It's a popular place. Compare to the Tacolicious, I would come to Pacific Catch for their Fish Taco.

Gotta eat the "FISH Taco" when you are in San Francisco, man!
author: Julie L.

description:
Have had many good experiences at Pacific Catch near GG Park and in Corte Madera so I can say with conviction that the Marina location needs to seriously up its game or it will tarnish the Pacific Catch brand. This is based on a recent visit in which meat was undercooked in a teriyaki bowl and fries  in a fish & chips dish undercooked, cold and soggy. The posted 88 health score didn't inspire confidence either.

Responded to email in response to this review, never heard back. Minus a star.
author: Paul M.

description: Excellent food. The staff was so friendly. We had the best poke bowl ever the fish and chips kicked ass too. Highly recommend it will go back next time in town.
author: Michele L.

description:
I'd eaten at Pacific Catch in Corte Madera once. It was a special event. Today I was delighted to discover that this location on Chestnut is just a mile from my workplace! Because I was short on time for lunch, I decided to order a meal for delivery, and I got a colleague to order with me.

I was really impressed with the fast turnaround. After ordering, our food took 30-35 minutes to get delivered. Each dish was packaged nicely, and the wonton chips and lettuce leaves were also in a separate paper sleeve. I appreciated how all the packaging used was compostable.

The entrees were delicious, and the wonton chips were crunchy and fatty -- just the way I like them!

My co-worker and I ordered the following, which amounted to $30:
- 1 original poke
- 1 salmon poke
- 2 orders of rice

After tax, tip, and the delivery fee, our total order was just over $40. Overall, I'd order delivery from them again if I was a in pinch for lunch!
author: PaHoua L.

description:
Great food, attentive service,  but this Marina neighborhood location is tiny and cramped: 2-3  tables outside and about 5 inside with counter stools, so only eat-in for your most basic dining occasion.

Really a neighborhood take-out place. Wish it was near my house!
author: cee b.

description:
I used Yelp Delivery to order from Pacific Catch while I was in the city for work and I was pretty impressed overall! 

I always make the mistake of ordering fried food (I had the fried fish taco, the fried shrimp taco, and the calamari. I know, I was hungry) when I'm getting delivery and it never quite has the right crunch but that's totally on me. Even with that flaw in my ordering strategy, the food was great! I especially loved the sauce that came with the calamari. So delish! The tacos were also amazing, and they were the perfect blend of fish, cabbage, and their unique sauces per taco. 

I think if/when I eat Pacific Catch again I'll definitely want to go in person so I get the whole experience. However, even without that, my food was delivered super quickly, and was still top quality.
author: Hannah D.

description:
I would not recommend ordering takeout here. The man was snappy and rude when we tried to get our food, saying it wasn't ready(fair enough)...however once I asked again about 5 minutes later he pulled a bag that had been sitting there...form ore than 5 minutes.

Our food was soggy and subpar.
author: Cheyenne H.

description:
This place is very small but with an interesting menu and delicious food. They have indoor and outdoor seating areas with a total of maybe 6 tables.
Their ahi tuna appetizer was really good. The chips could be not a greasy and better but I was judging this dish based on the quality of their ahi tuna :)
Salmon bowl was listed as one of their house specials, and it was very filling and perfectly cooked.
Overall, we really enjoyed everything. The waiter was really nice as well. The only small complain I have that he used way too much cologne and it ruined our food experience a little bit as the smell was super strong in a tiny little place...
author: Irina R.

description:
"Pacific....Catch me at another restaurant"

It had been a few years since I last visited Pacific Catch, a place that used to be known for its fresh seafood and tacos. I was surprised to see the restaurant had changed so much. It's now just a poke joint. Although they still have some old favorites, almost every table had at least one poke bowl order.

The menu is a bit confusing. There's a poke section in the front and a rice bowl section (that has poke) later in the menu. My partner ordered from the poke section and was asked if they wanted rice, while I ordered from the rice bowl section. [SPOILER ALERT: They just charged us for two rice bowls with poke].

The bowl is a decent size, but you can usually get more toppings at a cheaper price at any other poke place. Overall it's pretty standard, aside from the addition of cilantro to the salad section.

Service was so-so. Jeffrey tried to grab my bowl while I was still eating for some reason. He also failed to clarify that we ordered the exact same thing (albeit from two different sections). We were kind of surprised when the order came out.

Overall if you want poke, you might as well just go to one of the many places that specialize in it now.

Protip: Happy hour varies by location. This one only has happy hour on weekdays, while the inner sunset has one on Saturday too.
author: Joel L.

description:
We tried this place out because the pics on yelp looked great! The pictures were sadly deceiving :( We were going to eat in but they were closing earlier so we just said we'd do take out. We ordered a Japanese Wasabi Bowl with seared tuna and some fish and chips. The food came out and they knew we were waiting but they didn't hand us the food for 15 mins. I thought it was someone else's food so I sat waiting and eventually got up to see my name on the bag. 

When I opened the fish and chips box, I was shocked to see the plastic cups that contained the sauces melted!! Common knowledge NOT to put plastic into the same box as something that is hot and steaming!! The fish was super bland and the fries were super salty. The poke bowl was not worth the 16 something dollars. 

Won't be back.
author: Monica L.

description: Nice relaxed seafood place. I had the fish and chips and loved it. Everyone in my party was pleased with the food and the dishes had a nice contemporary feel to them without trying to hard. Nice for a cheaper date or if you find yourself having a hard time choosing from all of the great food on Chestnut Street, this is a safe pick.
author: Leslie T.

description:
Stopped by after a hike and heard about the good happy hour deals, but we were a bit early and starving. Between two people, we shared the brussels sprouts with bacon and calamari. The brussels were my favorite, I love calamari, but in small doses; these were decent. I went for the cod taco and shrimp taco with sweet potato fries. My favorite was the shrimp taco, the sweet potato fries were good too, but I was so full halfway through my first taco. 

The salad bowls looked delicious as well. Such a variety for a small location. Will have to come back and try more in the future. Customer service was helpful and friendly too.
author: Nani V.

description:
Had an order to go. But unfortunately the two tacos I ordered were deep fried in batter so when I ate it, it was soggy in the center. You would think they would be smart and put the deep fried stuff in a separate container. Sigh, can't have it all.

I ordered the two taco combo with the Alaskan cod and shrimp

Cod had a weird flavor to it. The picture isn't appetizing. The ratio of ingredients were off. But I'm not complaining that it was a big chunk of cod. It was on thespicy side but not overpowering.

Shrimp was my favorite. Ratio, slaw, sauce. I recommend it

The combo came with a side salad. The sauce thankfully came on the side. I liked all the components to it. It was surprising as the salad had no description of what it would could contain. I loved the bits of edamame beans. However, it had one grape tomato. Not even sliced? Weird.

It was definitely weird to go order, but I did love it all.
author: Lynn C.

description:
I like that this place has a variety of food. Great place for lunch and you can shop in the area after.

You can leave your name on the waiting list and walk around.. they will call you when your table is ready.

I had the poke plate with brown rice. The portion was pretty big and the fish was really fresh. My bf ordered a rice bowl since he didn't want raw fish. He enjoyed his meal as well.

Definitely want to come back here to try more things!
author: Jessica S.

description:
In San Francisco and throughout the Bay Area, one can find a Pacific Catch Fresh Fish Grill restaurant.

The Westcoast Fish House is best known for serving poke and for 13 years, they are best known for their poke bowls.

We had our Uber driver take us to the Chestnut area near Lombard St., a location with many delicious restaurants nearby.

But for this day, my mind was set on Pacific Catch Fresh Fish Grill and it's Poke Bowl.

Sure, poke is a big thing right now but for Pacific Catch Fresh Fish and Grill, it was never a trend for the restaurant as this is what they have been serving for 13 years since the restaurant first started.

For $16, you get your money's worth as the Poke Salad Bowl is huge and filling, but everything together was delicious.  The poke was served right, the wasabi was not too invasive to your palate, the shredded nori and avocado added to deliciousness of the meal.

The location is much smaller than it's 9th avenue counterpart, but the Chestnut location is packed with people but convenient.  There is not a huge wait to get a table when I was there and customer service was excellent.

I've already convinced myself to try more Pacific Catch dishes, whenever I am in the San Francisco area.

If you are clamoring for delicious poke, Pacific Catch Fresh Fish Grill in San Francisco should be on your poke restaurant bucket list.
author: Dennis A.

description: I'm addicted to their spring roll dessert!  This is one of my go-to take out places.  The food is always tasty and the staff is professional and nice.  With all the turnover of businesses in the city, I'm glad that this one is still around!
author: Ann E.

description: I am very picky when it comes to Seafood and I like Pacific Catch. Good food with friendly service. It is a little tight inside and probably not the best location for large groups. I got the ahi salad with poke which was very good, left feeling satisfied and light.
author: Sunil R.

description:
I was visiting a girlfriend who recently moved to the city so she wasn't SUPER familiar with what we should eat around her place but never fear, Yelp is here! It definitely did not disappoint, yet again! 

Pacific Catch was absolutely stellar! Fresh, flavorful, great service, and an experience I won't forget! I wish that I lived closer because I would be a regular for sure. It is quite small so there isn't much room for groups but it is perfect for a lunch date with your bestie or a catch up with a colleague. 

They bring complimentary edamame to start - yup, won me over right there! Then we split the shrimp ceviche to start and it was to die for. I loved that the avocado was like a guacamole consistency, not just chunks. Then we split some of their seasoned french fries because the photos on Yelp had me drooling. 

BUT GUYS - the real winner was the Ahi Tuna Poke Salad. Holy heaven, it was PACKED with ahi, like definitely a few servings, way more than I expected. The dressing was also super tasty and they did not skimp on the avocado {my favorite!}. My mouth is watering as I type this review because I want it right now! :) 

If you're in the area and haven't been yet, GO RIGHT NOW. You'll love it!
author: Hailey P.

description:
Babeeeeee, yassssss!
Poke time! Poke time! Gimmie all your poke time!

Pacific Catch does a wonderful job serving fresh beautifully plated food. OMG did I say the poke was AWESOME though? BECAUSE it was!
I'm literally poke drunk typing this review. 

My husband had the fried trio with spicy fries. Excellent for fried food. The coconut shrimp are just like mine at home, full of coconut flavor thru thru! Just wonderful. 

Can't wait to see y'all again!
author: Milan F.

description:
This was our first time at this location.  We decided to pay this spot a visit after working out in the Presidio on a Friday, during lent...so, that means fish it is!  We have been to the Pacific Catch in Downtown San Mateo a few times before, and I was expecting the same service, atmosphere, and great taste.  This location had 2/3.  It looks small from the outside, and looks are not deceiving.  We walked in, and since we had a wheelchair, we were told that there was only one option for tables since it is packed so tightly.  It was right next to the door, and we were greeted by the cold, gusty, SF wind whenever someone opened the door.  

They served a small side-dish of edamame, but sans pretzel goldfish (San Mateo had these!) and it was salty!  The server was friendly and helpful with the recommendations.  It was happy hour, so we were able to get the California Poke for $6 (his recommendation).  The poke was good, and it will keep me coming back to Pacific Catch.  We shared a 3-piece fish and chips with seasoned fries and a side of chipotle sauce per the server's recommendation (yum!).  It was the right amount of food, perfectly flavored, and crispy..and not too oily!  Our tummys were definitely satisfied.  

It's hard to get to the restroom if the bar is fully seated, which was the case at 5pm.  My girlfriend who is in a wheelchair had to use the restroom at the food spot next door so we didn't disrupt 10+ people during their meals.  We asked if there was a back entrance, but the staff told us there was a step, and then advised us to ask the restaurant next door.  They were helpful at least.

3 stars because the food never disappoints and the staff were friendly and helpful.  However, only 3 stars due to feeling sardined next to other tables, access to the restroom, and there only being one option for tables if you have a wheelchair in your party.  

I'll be back to Pacific Catch, but not to this location.
author: Ashley S.

description:
Went back for the first time in over a year.
Love this little spot for a nice lunch- we took it to go and ate on Marina green & it was lovely. You must get the seasoned fries with your sandwich - so good! We got the Ahi sandwich w spicy aioli instead of the wasabi sauce & the mahi sandwich w/ salad. The dressing on the salad is so good and light, love the edamame in the salad. We both liked the mahi sandwich better (w/ avocado and tomatoes) maybe they should add that to the ahi? It was just missing something. I don't usually like coleslaw and there's def doesn't change my mind- needs more Sauce or something. Def ask for a side of hot sauce w the meal!
author: danielle a.

description: What a find in the Marina! We came here on a beautiful weekday for lunch. Shrimp, mahi mahi, and baja tacos were delicious with a side of sweet potato fries. The tacos were slightly on the drier side however. We ordered a side of thai coconut shrimp (amazing with the side of duck/sweet and sour sauce) and brussel sprouts with bits of bacon. Our final dish was a grilled salmon salad with a generous helping of avocado, grilled cauliflower over a bed of greens and brown rice with quinoa. Easy 4/5.
author: Andrew Z.

description:
This place was terrible. We ordered the mahi taco, spicy chicken taco, Baja shrimp taco, and shrimp ceviche. The mahi and chicken were over cooked and incredibly dry. The mahi was worse than eating plain canned tuna. We didn't eat it. The shrimp was not even close to being fresh. It was obviously cheap and old. 

I don't know why this place has such great reviews. The quality and cook of the food here was a awful.
author: Jo B.

description:
Favorite place I ate in a while -

The people who work here are very humble and attentive - our waiter was awesome 
We sat at the bar- I had the poke plate with 3 types of poke (salmon /tuna / crab)
It was incredibly fresh and tasty -

I would be here all the time if I lived in SF
author: Nicole G.

description:
Coming here after spending the day at Crissy field beach with two big dogs was definitely the right choice!!!

It was about 75-80 degrees around 5pm in the city (on a Tuesday), and the place was decently busy, not too overcrowded. It is small inside, totally a more intimate setting, and they offered two small tables for outside seating.

We happened to come during happy hour 4-6pm and ordered a few tacos and a poke bowl. Their Thai iced tea was awesome, not too sweet and perfectly creamy. I believe they do free refills for non-alcoholic beverages, as my friend got some type of lemongrass iced tea.

Our waitress was friendly and quick to get our orders, the kitchen staff was quick to get our food ready as well, and we had no complaints. My Cabo shrimp a la carte tacos were the best thing I've had this month, and their seasoned fries platter was enough to share between my two friends and me. 

I recommend coming here for sure if you are near the area! Great service and great food. What more could you ask for?!
author: Cassandra K.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by the restaurant. I had only been to the one on Irving years ago and wasn't impressed. 

Atmosphere: Really small restaurant. Has seats for about 12 at tables and another 6 at the counter. Lots of people coming in for take out. 

Service: The owner/manager (?) was super friendly and accommodating. Even though the restaurant was a little crowded, and we needed a table for 6, he basically rearranged the furniture to accommodate us and let me sit at the table even though it took a little while for my friends to get there. 

Food: 
- Salmon sandwich: The salmon was really moist and citrus aioli was delicious.
- Seaweed salad was really fresh and flavorful 
- Poke trio was a great meal - came with three generous portions of fresh fish and several side dishes

Could definitely see myself coming by for a quick meal or takeout.
author: Amanda C.

description: We went there after a really long bicycle ride from downtown to the Golden Gate Bridge and we were craving for fresh seafood ! We saw good reviews and we decided to push the door of Pacific Catch. It is a really great place, the service is excellent and the food was way beyond our expectations. We had salmon sandwich with seasoned fries and lobster roll : everything was delicious. It was affordable despite the pretty touristic area.
author: Maëlle W.

description: The food was great. The customer service is great. Everyone is very friendly. I would highly recommend this place to any family or friends. I got the Hawaiian teriyaki rice bowl with brown rice & steak . Food was great but I was sitting at the bar shoulder to shoulder with no arm room .
author: Courtney C.

description: My wife and I stumbled across this place on Saturday and were pleasantly surprised , starting with appetizers our meal and service . This place is small , we got there just before the  lunch rush . We both enjoyed it all  , so get here and expect a wait  for the goodness , you will be pleased
author: Dan C.

description: Loved this tiny hole in the wall Mexican/Asian seafood place.  Does great take out but also a pleasant place to visit--especially during happy hour
author: Gia B.

description: Tasty fresh seafood with Mexican flare, good drinks and a cozy environment. Excellent place to visit for happy hour. Very reasonably priced.
author: Paulie E.

description:
Typically, I eat poke exclusively for lunch since it's on the lighter side, and I feel like you need to eat a LOT of it for dinner if you want to maximize your value. Well, Pacific Catch makes it super easy with their Trio plate.

Mine came with a hearty serving of original, salmon avocado, and California style over a bed of half white/half brown rice accompanied by seaweed salad. You say poke doesn't fill you up, either? Order this - you'll be STUFFED by the end of your meal. If not...you have a very large appetite. At least you'll have had a tasty poke experience.

The space is very tight inside the restaurant, but I suppose it's a cozy place to grab a bite to eat before moving along to the next locale. Service is friendly and efficient, so even if the place is packed, you shouldn't have to wait long for a table.

If more poke places had portions like Pacific Catch, I'd be eating poke nonstop!
author: Jerry C.

description: Pacific Catch was soooo yummy. Staff was very friendly, food came out extremely fast, and my Salmon Avocado Poke was delicious. Would go back in a heartbeat.
author: Katie F.

description:
Date of Visit: 4/6/17

Found myself needing to avoid a sudden downpour and stumbled upon Pacific Catch. A quaint, relaxed vibe with a very solid Happy Hour (1/2 off all Bar Bites!) awaited me. 

I started with the Cali Style Hawaiian Poke (Ahi, crab, citrus aioli, avocado, tobiko, shredded nori, soy) and Thai Coconut Shrimp (5-spice crispy shrimp, Thai sweet chili sauce). Both were good portions and very fresh; the citrus aioli on the poke really made it pop. A few tacos followed (Grilled Steak and Mahi Mahi), both of which were just the right size, and made to order right in front of me. Paired with a couple regional beers and a friendly staff, this spot was definitely a good catch - pun intended.
author: Colter H.

description:
Pacific Catch is a tight squeeze but definitely not a disappointment. Nice Marina location so it's pretty close to tons of other shops & eateries. If you're solo or enjoying a couple's experience I suggest grabbing a seat at the bar. Service is fast, super friendly is the food is superb. 

I tried the Pacific Soft Shell Crab Salad. This is a pretty light dish so if you're hungry opt for it as a starter. Fresh & small, yet filling & delicious. The soft shell crab comes lightly battered & browned and soooo tender to the touch. It pained me to eat the cute little son of a gun; but I had to. 

~Christy
author: Christy A.

description:
My experience here in the past was great but this time I  thought my poki bowl was just ok. Nothing memorable and a tad bit salty for my taste.  

The only bonus was our server. She was nice and our bottle of wine was half off.
author: Liz N.

description:
Loved the place.
Loved the salmon chowder, the best chowder ever. My daughter doesn't like chowder but if she eats this, she will love it.
The best Ahi sandwich ever.
Shrimp Ceviche was OK, cannot say the best one but OK. Good enough to keep 5*s.
Great Thai ice tea.
Loved the dessert filled with cheese cake filling spring role.
Will be our first choice now if we are looking for seafood.
Great service.
They make everything after the order.
Cons- place is too too small.
author: Honest O.

description:
The best Ahi Tuna Tacos anywhere. Was here years ago and brought friends back just to experience these tacos. Everyone agreed that they were the best hands down! Only other tacos I have ever had come close, and I am from Texas and eat them weekly, is in Cabo. I suggest you try a tuna taco and get extra Chipotle sauce. 

The ribs were amazing as well. Great flavor from the peanut sauce. Come hungry and Enjoy!!
author: Craig H.

description:
Three poke option: Generous sized, meaty, moist, soft pieces of fish (mostly).

Traditional poke: Not too salty, liked the miniscule ginger bits. 

Salmon poke: Didn't taste too strongly of anything other than salmon, but could tell they definitely added salt and pepper.

California poke: This is the only one that tasted slightly different than regular fish, but even then, still good. The fish on this looked a bit older (less vivid in color, not as soft) and this was covered up with mayo so it wasn't visually noticeable. No! Don't do things like that to your customers.

Seaweed salad: the usual, although not quite as fresh as I would have liked.

Wonton chips: Yum and tasted fresh! Hard to go wrong with these.

Veggies on the dish: A refreshing crunch the oiliness of the chips and the denseness of the fish!

3 for taste overall, 4 for fish quality. A tad under 3.5 overall.

--
Edit: Been on a tuna poke binge lately (I know, I'm surprised too!) and arrived back here. The traditional poke was pretty heavy on the soy sauce  but the fish was a good red color, though not the prettiest red you ever did see. No spiciness on this, even though the menu said it was. The salmon was ever so slightly sour from the lemon, but otherwise had that buttery and salmon-y taste I crave. The shallot oil flavor was there, but not super strong. The California ahi tuna fell short for me-- the mayo had curdled the fish, leaving it slightly hard on the edges. The fish pieces were also smaller than those on the other two....
author: Nicole H.

description:
5 stars hands down!! I have not been to this location yet, but I was so glad I did! Pacific Catch is always a great option when I'm craving fish or when I have company in town. Today I found myself in the Mariana running errands and decided to choose this place for lunch. I was very impressed by how clean and well put it was. I was seated right away, offered a selection of drinks and was given complementary edamame before I could blink! Definitely a good feeling.

Where I sat, I was able to see the line cooks preparing orders and I was excited to see fresh food being cooked in front of me. What made it the more comfortable was when the Chef asked everyone how they were doing.

I started my order with the California Poke and was in love by the first bite! The tuna was fresh and the wonton chips we perfectly salted. It was nice to eat something that gets you exited for your main dish! That was then followed by steak tacos. Again, every bite from my tacos was packed with flavor. Such a great choice if you're indecisive like me!

I'm so happy I chose to eat here and I definitely recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a place to meet up with others or if you're just in the mood for good food! I was beyond satisfied with my service today!
author: Marie S.

description: I really enjoyed catching a happy hour here when I was in town, Racer 5 all the way.  Also, we got some delicious grub.  I enjoyed sitting at the bar too because the server was attentive and steered us to the right direction with our meal selections. The fried fish was perfection.
author: Chris Raymond H.

description:
Always when I'm visiting San Francisco I go to this wonderful place.  Everything is very tasty. You get your food very fast. Here very nice people are working.

This is my favorite place.
author: Nick N.

description: Great food and service! I didn't know this was the original Pacific Catch restaurant...cool. They also retrieved and held our stroller after we left it on the sidewalk. Would definitely recommend this place :)
author: Joel D.

description: Bland... that's how the sushi tasted. I didn't think you could make sushi bland but yes you can.  The rice was tasteless as well. The food was togo so maybe that has something to do with it .  I thought they had too much rice and just the flavor want their . Maybe the avocado was bad but overall I couldn't finish the meal. Sushi lovers , stay away.
author: Jorge C.

description:
Would eat the Hawaiian Teriyaki bowl every day if I could. I've gotten it with half salad/half brown rice with Salmon at least a dozen times and it never disappoints. Delicious glaze but still feels like a healthy meal. Best part is they give you unlimited edamame to snack on while you're waiting for your meal. 

One negative is that I've found food is not as good / portions are not as big when you get it delivered as opposed to dining in.
author: Ashley K.

description: This place is "Top-Notch!"   I arrived at 6:00 straight up and the staff honored the Happy Hour drink and dinner menu for me.   Food was great, prices were fair and the service was great.  Calamari and the Ahi Tuna Salad are highly recommended.   I had a glass of wine that was also most enjoyable.   Definitely worth another trip back for sure.   Highly recommend.
author: Mark C.

description: I went to pacific catch once in the marina district and it was pretty good. Decided to try this place out since it's close to my work. They have their own tiny parking lot but it can only fit like 6 cars in there. We were seated by the host right away when we got in. Tons of open table in the afternoon. I got the Japanese wasabi rice bowl with Hawaiian poke with extra poke for $5 extra. It was pretty good but I thought it was a little too salty for me and way too much rice. My boyfriend got then lobster roll with sweet potato fries. Surprisingly it was really good! Bill total came out to be 50$! Would definitely come again whenever I have the chance.
author: Tina C.

description:
Stumbled on this hole in the wall by accident and I can safely say I have never been so thankful for an accident!! This place was amazing. Tiny and quaint, but the food spoke for itself. I had yhe island Tacos and chose 3 different options, chicken, beef and shrimp. My husband had chicken, mahi and shrimp. Each taco had its own unique ingredients and taste. The 3 tacos along with the salad was more than enough food for each of us. 

Also, I drink water like its going out of style and Jeffrey never let my cup sit empty. Again, so thankful to have found this gem in San Francisco.
author: Shauna R.

description:
You can never go wrong with this place! 

Each time that I go here, I love it more and more. 

Can't ever leave this place without ordering the Hawaiian Poke Trio. The fish is always so fresh and so flavorful. 

Happy hour is even better! There are so many items to choose from and they are all so well portioned. 

If there's ever any doubt as to which place to visit for lunch or dinner, don't think twice and visit this restaurant. 

For even more convenience, this restaurant is located in multiple spots in San Francisco, so there is always a possibility to try it out.
author: Julia K.

description: My husband and I came here together for dinner on a Wednesday evening. We wanted to take advantage of the happy hour menu, and when we arrived it wasn't very busy. Our server was Melate who was very sweet and friendly, however we hardly saw her and she was very slow to get to us throughout the night. A different girl Jasleen came to drop off our food and when we told her our order was incorrect she immediately went to fix the problem. We also asked if she could ask our server to come by, and instead Jasleen took initiative and helped us with ordering another drink. Our fixed order came out pretty quickly, which was nice. A gentleman had to come by and  pick up our bill, so like I said, we really didn't see much of our server. Otherwise food was pretty good and flavorful.
author: Katia L.

description: The food is amazing and the service is fast and efficient!! I personally enjoy watching my food being made, let's me know that my food is being made from scratch.
author: Jon D.

description: It's been a few years since I had Pacific Catch. Not sure if the food has gone downhill or if it's because I ordered delivery. Half of my poke had pieces of paper stuck to it. On top of it the $5 of added crab tasted more like tuna salad. $30 for a bowl I could barely eat because I was worried about ingesting paper. I called the restaurant to warn other customers and they're "looking into it".
author: Jaime Y.

description: This is a chain, but not a large one from my understanding.  The poke trio was great.  My favorite was by far the ahi, but the salmon was close behind.  The signature w/ avocado and crab was good but the ahi got lost in my opinion.  My wife had some great tacos (fish and beef.)  While I was in Hawaii I not only fell in love with poke, but with Muai Brewing's Coconut Porter, so I was super stoked to see it on the menu.  Service was great too.
author: Adam B. J.

description:
My daughter & I were here for a late lunch....
We ordered the bbq & grilled salmon sandwiches. We ordered the calamari off the regular menu & the waiter showed us the "happy hour"  menu with the calamari at half price....

I exchanged the side of fries for a salad. My daughter requested red potato fries.

The full plate of calamari was golden & was cooked perfectly. The salad was beautifully prepared....the salmon delicious.....thanks to the excellent chefs! 

The waiter was pleasant and attentive! 

The bill was under $50. 
I will definitely be back.....
author: Cherlyn S.

description: Great tasting tacos and fish & chips.  Has my Anchor Steam Beer. Yay!  Trying their Bass tonight.
author: Roy C.

description: So yummy. If you love fresh fish this is a great spot. There are tables to sit outside as well as inside & at the bar. My boyfriend & I sat at the bar since all tables were taken. They have a variety of fresh poke, rice bowls, fish sandwiches and starters. I ordered the seaweed salad which included strings of cucumber & a citrus vinaigrette. I also ordered the hamachi ceviche that came w/avocado & wonton chips. Both were excellent. My boyfriend got the ahi poke bowl which was awesome. It was huge & came with avocado, seaweed, brown rice, fresh greens and cucumber. If you are in the mood for healthy fish options this is your place.
author: Nancy F.

description:
A must stop when we revisited SF. We walked from Embarcadero over to Marina as a family hike and couldn't have eaten at a more refreshing restaurant. The food, just like last time, was worth every penny. My ahi tuna was perfectly seared. There were plenty of greens and the seaweed salad was a nice touch.

Only wish the service was better. We felt rushed in and out and the two servers working the floor were very impersonal.
author: Carlin T.

description: Enjoyed an evening a Pacific Catch with three other couples. We enjoyed a variety of wonderful dishes and Jeffrey, our server, was a delight. The place is small but the service is fast. Also, the carry-out business was hopping while we were there--so it seems a good option.
author: Annette B.

description: This place was AWESOME so delicious, best tacos I've had in a while, they smelled and looked so good there was barely time to take pics
author: Ethna P.

description:
It's been a long time since I've been here, and now I'm kicking myself for not visiting sooner. This place is tiny, with 4 or so tables and a counter. Luckily the wait doesn't seem too long. I heard a lot of "15 minutes tops!"

We ordered the Japanese rice bowl with Hawaiian poke (the most popular protein here), ginger carrot bisque (big heaping creamy bowl with fried prawns), Teriyaki bowl with salmon (perfectly cooked), fish tacos, and salmon sandwich. With the bowls you get an option of brown or white rice, or half salad. The dressing is a light version of the miso you get all Japanese restaurants, y'know the kind that smothers iceberg to death, but here they know a little goes a long way. 

Really, everything was fresh, clean, colorful, and affordable, and everyone here is easy going and just, cool. I couldn't even come up with any criticism other than the sunset location just doesn't have the same charm as this place. Most of all, I enjoy the variety and flavors in healthy ingredients. A burger and fries just can't beat really good fish and avocado.
author: Natasha P.

description: I guess you shouldn't order the salads. The lettuce is def not fresh. Gross!! And to make matters worst I am watching the news report on an E.coli  outbreak in romaine lettuce.  Get it together!!!!!!
author: Stef A.

description:
For our office lunch on Friday, May 6th, we ordered delivery through Caviar. It arrived around 12:30pm.

Taco Platter (3 tacos) with a Small salad ($16):
*Traditional Baja Taco: Battered fresh crispy catch, tomatillo-avocado salsa, creamy jalapeño sauce, cabbage mix
*Chicken Taco: Spice-rubbed grilled chicken breast, avocado, house pico de gallo, lime crema, chipotle aioli
*Pacific Steak Taco: Marinated grilled skirt steak, crispy sweet onions, cilantro, cabbage & sriracha aioli

Their menu is extensive, but I landed on the tacos. My favorite taco was the chicken taco. It had the best balance. The fish taco flavors were good, but the fish suffered from the transit time as it was soggy. I wanted the fish to be crispy. The steak was my least favorite. The pieces of steak were too big, tough and chewy. Made it really hard to eat. The small salad was fine, though I wish they provided a different dressing. The creamy dressing didn't go with the delicate mixed greens.

I can't say much about the atmosphere and service in the restaurant as we got delivery. But their food was just okay.
author: Elena N.

description: We ordered delivery, it was cold when we got it and I wound up getting food poisoning from it. So no, I wouldn't recommend it, unless you want to spend the next day hugging a toilet and then attached to an iv for four hours.
author: Kimberly R.

description:
Average family style restaurant. Reasonable, bit dishes lack presentation and all look the same.  Brocoli served absolutely plain.
Decent but not exceptonal. Not enough salmon in Salmon Bisque. Same for parchment wrapped halibut. Friendly staff and good service.
author: Girly Foodie F.

description: Popped on on the way to santa rosa. Had the ahi tuna sandwich, hands down one of the best sandwiches I've had.  Fresh ingredients and they cook it right in front of you.
author: Jeff B.

description:
I would rate Pacific Catch three and a half stars.

We shared the salmon poke and the fried coconut shrimp. The pole was served with fried wontons, so we used them like chips to scoop up the poke. The fried coconut shrimp were crispy with a mild coconut flavor.

They didn't have any beers on draft, but they did have Anchor Steam in a bottle.

Check out @adventuresofanyfoodie for some pictures from our experience:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BQ0pdA2A4aq/?hl=en
author: Joseph T.

description: I love their rice bowls, specially the Japanese wasabi bowl! I like to pick Hawaiian poke + crab salad + brown rice. It's not cheap, but the portions are bug, filling, and super tasty!
author: Sui N.

description: We came here with the family for the first time. Would is healthy and delicious. Service is amazing.
author: Ella B.

description:
Not going to lie, we walked a good mile to a mile and a half trying to find this location. It was our first weekend moving to the bay area and we were really determined to find a local restaurant in the city. We later came to find out from a friend of ours that this is actually a chain. Knee slap!

It is a little hole in the wall in terms of available restaurant space. We sat outside since it was a beautiful sunny day - we did have to put our names down and walk to a bar close by to have drinks until a table was ready. I believe they text you letting you know when your table becomes available. 

The food options were all very interesting, I had tacos and my husband had the salmon bowl. Everything had a great presentation, but in terms of taste it was nothing out of this world.

Service was also lacking quite a bit although they seemed to be quite busy that day - it was bad in the most fundamental ways though, unclean table and no menus for an unreasonable amount of time, etc.
author: Rafaela S.

description:
Excellent restaurant to eat at if you're craving seafood! The place is a little small and they are always packed even at off-times but it's worth the wait. Service was super friendly and nice.

We ordered the crab chowder special (~$8) as an appetizer which was delicious. It wasn't too heavy or rich. 

For entrees we got the mixed catch basket ($16) which had fried oysters, coconut shrimp, and fried Alaskan cod with french fries. I loved this dish! Everything was perfectly fried. My favorite was the oysters, especially with the tartar sauce they serve with it. The spicy tuna rice bowl ($16) was huge. It was packed with fresh ahi tuna, seaweed salad, and vegetables. Definitely a good option if you're looking for something healthy.
author: Linda X.

description: This little hole in the wall makes some really special food. We had a curry lobster bisque as an appetizer, it was different yes but ahhhh-mazing! Highly recommend it, especially on a cool night. I had the wasabi rice bowl with poke tuna and let me tell you that I have had 300 of these in different places, this was.by far the best I have ever had! Try it, you won't be disapppointed. My husband had the Korean BBQ rice bowl with ribs, he loved it! I tried a bit and even though I dont love ribs, these were magical! Well done guys! I'm sorry I dont live around here because I would be here all the time.
author: Yessy M.

description: I am so glad my friends and I decided to eat here for dinner!  The restaurant is small so we did have to wait awhile but it is a gem in the Marina.  We ordered an appetizer of their calamari which was delicious and I ordered their fish tacos.  My friends had their poke bowls.  They were pretty fast and our waiter was very friendly.  I was really impressed and I agree with the reviews given on Yelp.  I do wish the restaurant was bigger so there wouldn't be as much of a wait but I think it's worth it.  I highly recommend coming here if you're in the Marina.
author: Mikayla M.

description: I can't say enough about this place. Quite possibly the best eating-out experience I've ever had (and I don't say that lightly!) I'm on a road trip with my fam and we wanted something local while in the San Fran area, so we opted for this. It's super small and focuses mostly on take-out, but after about a 40 minute wait, we jam packed into a couple tables and it was only awesome from there. The manager (maybe owner too?) Jeffrey was absolutely phenomenal. He waited our table and was so knowledgeable about the menu, he was able to answer every dumb question my brothers asked hahaha. He definitely made the experience. The food was amazing (vouching for all 5 of us) and then Jeffrey even brought us dessert on the house because he enjoyed serving us and felt bad for our wait time. It wasn't even necessary, but goes to show that this restaurant really cares about its customers, and beyond the food, that's all that really matters!
author: Daniel E.

description: Amazing food! Fresh seafood and great service! Definitely will be back soon small tight environment but very nice and clean
author: Nicole B.

description: Solid place to eat!  Food is consistent, service is good.  Everything is always fresh.  Have tried several items on the menu including fish tacos, poke bowls, poke salad.  Today was a combo of fish tacos and shrimp tacos.  Shrimp tacos are Ono!  Wish the restaurant was a little larger and roomier, but otherwise a good place healthy place to eat!
author: Calvin J.

description:
We. Had the lobster bisque,  the. Poke Trio, and the Baja Shrimp Ceviche. Everythibg was excellent. The seafood was fresh
 Everything was seasoned perfectly. The service was attentive and fast and the pricing was very reasonable. Altogether it was a great experience.
author: nima d.

description:
We were happy to get a table immediately, though outside can be a little chilly if you're not dressed for it. 
The friendly wait staff quickly got our drinks; they have a variety of bottled beer and wine, lemonade, and soft drinks (which they refilled without asking).
The food was delicious- I had the bowl with salmon, brown rice, salad, ginger. It was the perfect combo, tasted fresh and healthy, and I appreciated the rice was not dry. Fish and chips also very good. 
The manager gave us some helpful info about the restaurant as he brought an amazing dessert out for us to share gratis.
We had a very good experience there and would definitely return! 
The only improvements I could suggest are having better heat lamps and beer on tap.
author: Whitney B.

description: This restaurant is very small, but the interior is very nice. Has a wooden and wicker look to it. The atmosphere was better than the cuisine. The fried Alaskan cod was good, but the Mahi was incredibly dry and had a very odd taste to it. The restroom and overall restaurant were both clean. I was expecting a bit better, but not horrible.
author: T T.

description: Was looking for something light and healthy before catching a movie and came across this restaurant. I normally love poke, but sometimes too much of something isn't a good thing.  I tried the Trio platter which had Salmon, California style Ahi, and Serrano Ahi.  The first bites were delicious, but after a while the raw fish started to get to me.  My husband had ordered an Salmon Salad which was delicious!! Definitely going to order that next time for my main dish.  All in all I would go back for a yummy, light dinner
author: Run.It.Off V.

description: Enjoyed the service. The dishes are all well made, but the taste is impressed. The restaurant is tiny, but there is a bar on which you can sit. I would return, but would like to explore other restaurants in the area.
author: Maeve G.

description:
I really like Pacific Catch because for the food. A variety of good seafood dishes, from rice bowls, salads, tacos and more. A place I come for some comforting food. This location is a lot smaller than the others but its my favorite. 

I usually or always get their seared ahi tuna hawaiian bowl. I get it with half brown/white rice and half salad. The bowl comes with something like a slaw, seaweed salad, sliced seaweed, sweet ginger and avocado. YUM! I always add a side of their spicy fries too. It's so good with their spicy mayo dip. Simple and delicious!
author: Sandy B.

description:
The OG Pacific Catch - tiny but mighty. 

I've dined at several other locations across the Bay Area, including Mountain View and Inner Sunset. And each time, I find something new and tasty on the menu. 

This time around, I tried the special Tom Kha soup, which was just the way I like it. Made to order and a nice combination of sweet and sour. Note: this is not served in a flaming pot like most Thai restaurants. Pacific Catch isn't a Thai restaurant, they merely serve a smattering of globally inspired dishes.

Traditional poke is plenty for two. My friend and I had just gotten back from a Hawaiian vacation and were excited to have a little taste of the island on a foggy SF evening.

Tons of fresh seafood options if you're looking for swordfish, mahi, salmon, etc., but this time I went with the Mixed Catch basket. I'd never had chef's fried options before and our server promised that he makes a mean fish 'n' chips. Why not? 

That basket of goodness comes filled to the brim with coconut shrimp (my favorite), crispy oysters, and Alaskan cod. With French fries of course. A ton of food for one person, I'd recommend splitting with your +1. Not too greasy and just the right amount of batter.

White wine, good company, and fresh seafood is not a bad way to spend an evening in the Marina. Guess that's why this particular location has been doing so well for over a decade.
author: Abby S.

description: Best thai coconut shrimp I've ever eaten. Everything tastes so fresh, even the sauces.
author: Elizabeth W.

description: I ordered the fish and chips. It is suppose to come with jalapeno tartar sauce, coleslaw, and fries. My fish arrived soggy, incredibly overcooked with no tartar sauce or coleslaw. It was inedible. I tried calling the restaurant five times with no answer. I will never order this chain again.
author: Meghan W.

description: Small spot, but delicious. Really enjoyed the poke and the house salad. Tacos were tasty. I enjoyed the cod more than the mahi mahi. If I lived in SF, I would definitely go back to try more!
author: Adrienne D.

description: Really amazing staff. Good food and the serving size is sharable for two. Food timing is about right. You don't feel rushed but you feel welcome.
author: Reyzell M.

description:
I got the salmon salad and it was incredibly disappointing. The salmon itself was fine, but the salad as a whole was pretty gross. As I left I saw that other people had gotten the salad and had few bites and were done with it. 
To add on the the very mediocre salad, the service was subpar. It took a while to get water and the waiters were just not very attentive. It is a smaller restaurant with about 5 tables so there is really no excuse to not have better service.
author: Francesca D.

description:
Very good! For seafood lovers especially, Pacific Catch is a fantastic choice. Fresh, delicious, filling dishes that are totally worth the price that you're paying.

I took my mom and sister here when they visited me over Labor Day Weekend. We didn't have our weekend plans set in stone at all, so we just walked in on a Saturday night. The hostess was super flexible and said that though the tables were full now, she would call me when the next one was available so that I didn't have to wait outside in the cold - very generous! Also, the starter plate of edamame beans was such a delightful and unexpected treat to start off our meal. (If you're getting a rice bowl, save some of the edamame to mix into your main dish - it adds so much texture!)

My mom and I are huge fans of raw fish, so getting to try the Hawaiian Poke was a must! We both wound up getting the Japanese Wasabi Rice Bowls with Hawaiian Poke, and we were so impressed. Everything from the taste to the quality of the ingredients was just outstanding. The poke itself has a lot of flavor, and I could totally just eat a bowl of it by itself. We got our rice bowls with half rice half salad, which was a refreshing swap-out, since the greens just made the dish that much lighter and more refreshing. I will say that the sauce was pretty strong with the Wasabi flavor, so if you're not a fan, maybe go for a different rice bowl. My mom also got a lot of sauce in her bowl, so that was a little overwhelming for her... if you're sensitive to too much sauce, definitely ask the waiter/waitress to make note for light sauce!

My sister got the Korean Barbecue Skirt Steak Rice Bowl. She is a super picky eater, so I was super surprised and happy to find that she actually really liked her dish! The steak is cooked a perfect medium rare, and the toppings mesh perfectly with the Korean Barbecue sauce. The sauce was kind of splotched onto the rice in the bowl though, so there were some areas that had a lot of sauce while some didn't have any at all... and there was no way to mix it all together evenly. Overall, a delicious dish though - loved the shaved omelette as an addition to the bowl :)

Service is super fast, so even for walk-ins, I don't think you have to wait super long (but there is limited seating, so try to get to the restaurant early if you don't have a reservation).

Flavor profile was fantastic and really tickled my taste buds. A couple of little things that could be improved upon, but overall, I was very happy with my experience at Pacific Catch and have already recommended several of my seafood-loving friends to come here!
author: Sheila D.

description: Good place. Went here and ordered the Poke trio- had Original, Macadamia nut and serrano. It was really delicious. Also like the seaweed salad. We were served water and some snacks while waiting for our order.
author: Leanna C.

description:
Woah, so tiny! If you can get a seat, the food is pricey, but very tasty. The service was excellent and the waitstaff was friendly. 
I would probably recommend takeout from here because of the seating situation.
author: Portia H.

description: Cozy atmosphere and very good food = good value.  It's a relaxing place to spend a Friday night and you can count on good food. It's not a special occasion place IMHO. I had salmon poke and it was very good. My partner had the lobster roll and said he loved it. Nice location across from the park for a stroll afterwards. Service was fine. Quick and friendly. Nothing to write home about but no issues.
author: Audrey M.

description: Rice bowl with ahi tuna was delicious, filling, and reasonably priced.  Service was great as well.
author: Carter C.

description: I love all the choices of seafood entrees on their menu.  Came here with a group after a meeting.  The seafood was fresh and flavorful but, a little pricey.  Service was good.  I would try it again.
author: Alisa B.

description: We ate at Pacific Catch as it was a restaurant around our Lombard St. hotel. Pacific Catch is extremely small, so it probably isn't good for a group meal. We ate at the bar as there was no other seating available. I had the poke rice bowl, which was a huge portion of rice, fish, and veggies. Everything was fresh and we were served quickly. Among the numerous restaurants on Chestnut Street, Pacific Catch is a solid choice.
author: Nicole B.

description:
And yet again pacific catch never disappoints you!! 
Anywhere anytime always the best food..
author: Farwah K.

description: Very very good food. The fish tacos are amazing and the ahi bowls are equally delicious. The menu is limited to beer and wine but they have some good beers, highly recommend!
author: Hallie M.

description: Found this place on Google and gave it a try.  Did not disappoint. I had the Hawaiian Poke salad, my wife had the Hawaiian Poke Rice bowl, and they made a special plain grilled chicken and rice bowl for my 4yr old daughter.  We also tried the soup of the day. All of it was delicious and fresh tasting. Quite possibly the healthiest and most delicious meal I have eaten while on vacation.  Louis was our waiter and he was fantastic making sure we had everything we needed. He even let me try a sample of the Thai Tea before buying to make sure I liked it. Would definitely come here again.
author: Steven A.

description:
Happy Hour!

Did I say Happy Hour?

In case I didn't... let me just say...

Happy Hour!

Went on a tuesday, (bottled wine 1/2 price) they had a wine we liked.

Portions were good sized, food was clean and tasty.

Staff were excellent.

Thanks!
author: J.M. B.

description: The place is small and pretty crammed, but it actually makes the place cozier or whatever. Sat at the bar area even though name was put down for a table, but the service after was friendly and good. Food was delicious. Had the Hawaiian rice bowl, Soup of the Day, and Mahi Mahi sandwich. And beer. Food came fast and they make it right in front of you. It seems to be always packed. Down to come back if I'm in the area.
author: TJ P.

description:
Easy bite in the Marina district. 
The restaurant is small but they had immediate seating at the counter overlooking the kitchen. They serve a small bowl of complimentary Edamame as an appetizer. I ordered the California poke bowl. Came with tuna, crab, large chunks of avocado. Everything was fresh, filling and healthy at reasonable prices. The service was quick. Lots of shops nearby. Is a great area to walk around.
author: Sarah S.

description: delicious food ! After waiting in line for mackd for like 40 min we came here. Besst decision ever ! Freshest fish and veggies! And calamari was bomb. Speedy service and explained everything . I got the wasabi bowl with ahi tuna which was huge and the the steak taco. The steak was delicious and med rare. See a must. Happy hour is great cause they are 3 .
author: Paul A.

description: Such a great gem! I loved the small menu, fresh items posted daily on the restaurants chalkboard. The food was fresh and the service was friendly. My favorite was the calamari steak. We hope to go back again soon!
author: Christina S.

description: I put clam chowder bread bowl into Yelp and this came up. They do not have a clam chowder bread bowl, but what we got was awesome. We went at an off hour after getting off plane, and there was only one other occupied table.  It is tiny in here and we sat at bar and watched them prepare our food. Our daughter got the Korean rice bowl with shrimp. I think it was $15 and had 12 shrimp. She loved it. I got a salad with crab and there was a lot of crab and I think a half an avocado on it. My husband got fried fish and a salad instead of fries. Guy behind bar was super nice.  I'd definitely return!
author: Jennifer L.

description: Great happy hour, $4 beer no draft but they give you chilled cups so works out. Small inside but that's ok it's so nice outside so sit out and enjoy
author: Kristina R.

description: Wonderful waiter Luis! Manager was great made sure we were taken care of and we were. Food was excellent; 3 of us. Ordered calamari appetizer was very good; teriyaki rice wonderful and a large portion; fish chips & chips yummy; 1 steak taco great flavor 1 chicken taco a little spicy but still good. Excellent margaritas not made from premix. I would highly recommend this place.
author: Cindy C.

description: Great place for fresh poke/fish & the coldest beer in town. Casual, great service, will return.
author: Carrie L.

description: Simple, Fresh, and Delicious. I come here quite frequently and the staff are always pleasant the food is fresh. The location itself is small and it can get really busy on the weekends, but the wait is totally worth it. I ordered the fish tacos and the Three Taco Platter with Sweet Potato Fries. Each taco comes with its on sauce perfectly paired for each protein, $1 extra for sweet potato fries. The fries were really yummy and crunchy. I also ordered the chipotle chicken salad. I've never had a better salad. This salad is filled with flavor. The piece of chicken is quite small but that salad itself is huge, sharing size.
author: Olivia S.

description:
This is my favorite place for poke bowls. What makes it special is the sauce that they drench the rice in. My culinary senses think miso sesame dressing. It was definitely a nice surprise (if you're reading this, sorry for ruining your surprise!). I also liked the variety of greens that were in the poke bowl. Not to mention the fish was chunky and fresh. 

Some cons are the restaurant size (tiny) and parking (street). But I'm a huge foodie and I like to rate mainly based on food, so 5 stars!
author: Evelyn N.

description:
I'm a huge fan of the one dish I've ever had (and will probably only ever get): the Japanese wasabi rice bowl with Hawaiian poke and salmon. I get this with 1/2 brown rice and 1/2 salad. You could also do full salad if you're avoiding carbs.

$16 may seem pricey for a poke bowl, but this is not your ordinary poke bowl. In fact, I could probably share this with someone...but I won't. They give you a ton of fish & sides like ginger, seaweed salad, and avocado, so you'll definitely leave satisfied. Mix it all up for maximum pleasure.

Pacific Catch is casual and fast enough to dine here after a workout (i.e. when you look like a hot mess). The restaurant is quite small so expect to wait during peak hours and weekends.
author: Valerie L.

description: Great food! Great service! I'm so glad we tried this small place. Call 1 hour before you want to be seated; they accommodated 7 of us.
author: Eva S.

description:
This is the only restaurant where I am willing to pay nearly $20 dollars for a portion of spicy tuna. 

Hands down the best spicy tuna in the Bay Area. Place is a bit pricey but always satisfied. 

Highly recommend the inside out California sushi roll or the Japanese bowl with spicy tuna
author: Eva A.

description: We had the fish tacos and salmon sandwich. I haven't had such fresh fish for a long time. Flavourful and delicious. Would go back there in a heartbeat
author: Vaibhav D.

description:
This is the smallest PC location I have been to, but it was also very charming with great service and an excellent meal.
I had the taco plate with fries, while the seasoned ones were a bit salty, the tacos were great, very good quality fish, spiced and cooked well, a light and healthy lunch.
Not much seating so it can get pretty full, but we came early when they opened and had no problem getting a table, though it did fill up quickly.
Food comes out very quickly, presented nicely, maybe a bit pricey for the portion size, but the quality made the price seem worth it.
Nice stop while in the area, I'll be back to try something else next time!
author: Nijole T.

description: This place was the first real dinner experience we had for our "girls vacation" in California and it was delicious! Reasonable pricing with amazing customer service for food that tasted absolutely AMAZING! Everything was prepared well - nothing under or over cooked. Would definitely recommend and would love to go back again if I'm ever in the area again!
author: Ashley D.

description: Jeffrey was fantastic. The ribs were the best. Great place. Highly recommended. My dad actually said it's the best ribs he's ever eaten!!
author: S G.

description: We stopped by Pacific Catch because there was parking nearby. We had never been before, but you can bet we'll be going back when we are in San Francisco again from our home in Sonoma County. What a gem of a restaurant!  The food was fresh, delicious, and organically sourced. Every thing we ordered was perfect. Add to that the excellent and friendly service and you get dining perfection!
author: Debbie D.

description:
"Pacific Catch" caught me by surprise as a lot of the dishes were Asian-Fusion. 

Pro:
-Can eat clean/healthy as it as various salad options and their bowl mix has an option for brown rice. Would recommend their crab salad!
-Good portion
-Would recommend their short rib appetizer
-Cozy and nice interior

Con:
-pricey for entree salad
author: Linda K.

description:
Visiting SF and needed a place nearby to get food for take out. Overall this place was good! It didn't take too long to get our food and the staff was really friendly. I have to eat gluten free and they do have a gf menu- however, it is not very big considering what they offer on the regular menu. I thought for sure I would be able to get some tacos but they come on flour tortillas...why not offer corn tortillas too?! 

I got the mahi mahi salad...I wished there was more to it but it did have really good flavor. My husband and brother got fish tacos which they raved about. I'm also kind of glad we did take out because it's super tiny inside!
author: Christina C.

description:
Every time I come there, I always come away feeling like a million bucks. I don't think I've ever had a bad meal here. The food is just super fresh and I feel like I'm getting a healthy meal, too. 

Don't miss out on the wasabi bowls, that's probably the best dish on Chestnut street.
author: Alice W.

description: Our server Jeffery was great! This review is for the food. Calamari was good! Lobster bisque was WAY too salty! The lobster roll was good but too much dill for my taste.
author: Punkster S.

description: My husband ordered the mixed catch with seasoned fries and was food poisoned. He's been miserable for the last 24 hours. The food was not great, the fries were gross. The edamame were the only highlight. 10/10 would not recommend.
author: Thea B.

description: Love their ahi poke bowl with brown rice and excellent sweet potato fries. It's the closest poke bowl I've found to the ones in Hawaii.
author: Sharon V.

description: Ordered the Hawaiian Ahi Poke Salad with salmon and avocado additional sides via caviar delivery. It was delicious and large enough (with the salmon/avocado) that I couldn't finish it all in 1 meal. Would recommend.
author: Emily C.

description: This is the BEST food! My husband and I tend to be very picky, especially about fish and freshness. This spot is just delicious! The food is amazing, and the staff are too! Seriously, we can't wait to come back here during our next SF trip.
author: Kirsten C.

description:
MMmM this place is the bomb! My girlfriend and I had three appetizers at happy hour that filled us up! 

We got the Korean ribs for $8! Such a sweet sticky like teriyaki-ish flavor with a bit of a bite at the end! They fell off the bone. So freaking good! 

Then we got the ahi. I think that was $8 as well! delicious. The ahi was tossed in some kind of soy marinade. Very tasty. The crispy little won tons were great to snack on as well. 

We had the calamari. $6-8? I don't remember the price. They were crispy and flavorful! The also do a little something different. They fry super thin slices of lemon which I thought tasted unique and delicious. My friend on the other hand, hated it. I also think there were thinly sliced red jalapeños but I could be mistaken. 

Finished the meal off with a glass of red wine. Dry and yummy. Went down smoothly. And also the dulce de leche spring roll. So so so good. 

The waiter (older man) did NOT take good care of us. But, the chef in the kitchen m DID. He cooked our food and took our order and got us waters and refills. He even gave us a little side of shredded carrots on the house.
author: Laurissa B.

description:
This one of the best hole in the wall place . Super authentic and Try the Korean BBQ rice bowl with salmon .
The Baja ceviche is must try ... 
finally I can say I came hungry and left with happy tummy
author: Sujay R.

description:
Decided to go to the nearest restaurant that didn't have a line after just finishing the Nike womens half marathon. Not too many food places close to the end point that weren't super crowded. Ordered the three taco entree with two fish tacos and one steak taco (short rib?) and the short rib rice bowl. Overall, the food was pretty disappointing. The tacos were mediocre, steak was probably the better choice. The fish taco was probably the second worst fish taco I've ever eaten. It wasn't tasty at all. The rice dish tasted good however there was only like 5 pieces of beef in it. It was definitely not worth the price. Overall I think that the food is overpriced and quality not so good. My BF and I left hungry since we didn't want to just be eating rice.

Gave this place some extra stars though because service was great. Everyone was friendly and efficient despite the rush.
author: Susan M.

description:
If you're looking for a good restaurant in the Marina district with good prices and good food, definitely try this place out! Every time I pass by here to go to Brandy down the block, the food always smells delicious. Thank god we came in time for happy hour which means cheaper food means happier wallet. We ordered five different plates:
- Mahi mahi tacos with sweet potato fries $14
- spicy fries $4
- calamari $4
- Korean steak rice bowl $16
- Thai coconut shrimp $6
The food came really fast under five minutes and we had to spend another five minutes just to take pictures since the lighting was just too good. Service here was amazing, asked if we needed anything whenever they walked around. Although this location is smaller than the one in sunset, it's very cozy in here. The fries are crispy and my favorite dish would be the calamari. It's good and didn't have a fishy taste to it. I would definitely come back here for their food and because of their prices.
author: Lisa W.

description: I ordered a salmon sandwich and Im so happy I did. The fish was fresh and the bread was perfect :)
author: Brittney F.

description: Pacific catch is amazing food and service. Great Happy Hour (mon-fri 4-6 drinks and half off apps). The size of the restaurant is small but both times I"ve been it hasn't been an issue. The server I've had is amazing. Fish is fresh and the appetizers and entrees are very generous portions, especially for the price.
author: Haley H.

description:
I yelped this location and chose to dine in for lunch with my boyfriend. 

the location is very small. there's about four tables to the right of the entrance & a few bar seats down the walk way. we opted for the bar seating; for more room & that way we wouldn't hear everyone else's conversation.

I had the two taco platter:
pacific steak: marinated skirt steak, sriracha aioli, crispy onions, cilantro, cabbage, lime crema
can't shrimp: crispy shrimp, cabbage, avocado, pico de gallo, jalapeño tartar, lime crema

the steak was well marinated & tasty but the taco as a whole was dry and I found my self reaching for my water cup after every bite. the shrimp taco was delicious though! perfect crunch from the shrimp batter & cabbage. wonderful moisture from the pico de gallo & avocado. 

the boyfriend had the California style poke: ahi tuna, hand picked crab, citrus aioli, avocado, tobiko, shredded nori. he didn't really like it, hardly ate a quarter of the thing. he also said it was way too salty. 

our meal was about $31 & I honestly wished we would've kept the money, gone down a building & had tacolicious instead.
author: Allyssa P.

description:
the 2 stars is for the food but  I would give them 5 stars for service.  I arrived really hungry and was looking forward to a delightful (and delicious) serving of crab cakes, spotted it on the Menu and saw 'West Coast crab cakes', even though my mental image was that of a Maryland crab cake, i ordered it.  Lo and behold a lovely plateful of fries/ coleslaw (with apple) and chipotle aioli arrived, with the crab cakes.  I was disappointed that the darn thing was DEEP fried!!! Who deep fries crab cakes??? Its NOT a donut, people!!!!  

Anyway, remember I said was hungry? So, I dive into the crab cake - reach the middle and it is FROZEN!!  I don't make a scene (I am classy, that way), draw the attention of the person in charge, who offers to replace it....well, I have eaten up quite a few fries and unwilling to subject myself to more grease.  So, I tell him to 'adjust' my bill!!!  I am ready to leave and another team member stops by to apologize and says,' Its on us, no bill!'  I look inquiringly, and yes, indeed, no bill.  So, I thank them for this gesture, for owning up that the crab cake did not meet expectations and leave some change (well, I ate the fries and my Dad has it ingrained in me - there is no free lunch!) and leave.  

Will I return to this place?  Yes, of course after their Chef has taken a trip to Maryland to learn how to make crab cakes and this location becomes famous for it!!!
author: Chitra J.

description: I paid $18 for a "Korean BBQ Rice Bowl" which means a whole lot of rice, 3 small pieces of meat, and a couple slices of zucchini lol. I'm sure the people are nice, I did take out and couldn't tell, but wow that was not worth $18. Won't be back.
author: Navya B.

description: This place was amazing!! I got the Alaskan Wild Salmon taco and the Steak taco and they were both delicious! Food was very fresh and the customer service was great too! Definitely coming back!
author: Donna F.

description:
I live in Los Angeles, so when I am visiting the lBay Area, dinner at Pacific Catch is mandatory. The menu offers something for everyone. High on my list are the bowls. They are flexible such that you can request an all salad base, or split it with part brown/white rice. The fish is always fresh and cooked to perfection with a choice of Japanese or Korean accompaniments. 
I like to order the sweet potato fries to share as an appetizer.  The price point is comfortable in that you feel you've received good value for the price. You will love this place!
author: Margaret L.

description:
Solid place in the marina with fresh seafood, an extensive menu, and a cozy seating arrangement. 

Their eclectic menu draws inspiration from various cuisines along the pacific rim. My lunch date ordered the traditional baja tacos (cod, cabbage, avocado-tomatillo salsa, jalapeno tartar) with regular fries and I went with the Japanese wasabi rice/salad bowl with Hawaiian poke (wakame salad, daikon salad, sprouts, ginger, avocado, shredded nori, and a soy-wasabi sauce) because another yelper suggested it. 

We really didn't have to wait long for the food to arrive. It looked so appetizing that I was tempted to begin eating, but I was able to retrain myself for a bit and take a few quick photos. The wasabi bowl was rather tasty! Tuna in the poke was fresh. The salads were delicious as well. The whole bowl was rather refreshing and I didn't feel too guilty about eating it! However, I feel like there was way too much of the brown rice, even with the half salad option.

As for my friend, she loved her tacos!

The drink menu was alright as they had some wines and some craft beers, but I really wanted some sake. Anyway, I ordered the the coconut porter by Maui Brewing and was immediately handed a can and a nice frosty glass. I would recommend getting that if you enjoy craft beers.  

This location is wonderful! Okay, so the view from the restaurant isn't that great. However, you can walk off your delicious meal and enjoy the view of the Golden Gate from Crissy Field, or you can head down to union street and grab a few more drinks! haha

Pacific Catch has some great food and I'll probably stop by again for lunch. Check this place out!
author: John B.

description:
Ordered greens and poke thru DoorDash. Got all white rice - and the bowl was thrown together, mostly rice. 

I've had this many times before - who's in charge today??
author: R. P.

description: This is my favorite restaurant. I only get one thing -- Japanese Wasabi Bowl with half greens and half brown rice. Order this and you cannot go wrong. IT IS SO GOOD. Also download the app Thanx and you can receive rewards like a free dessert and free entree.
author: Lauren J.

description: I went here for lunch this afternoon and gotta say, was not impressed. I ordered a poke bowl and a Thai iced tea. I've never had poke before- i was expecting it to taste really fresh but instead it was so salty, I couldn't eat it. The drink was just okay- kind of bland and the cream tasted just a bit past it's shelf life. Just a little bit. If it wasn't the cream, something else  about the drink was off (and I would say I've probably had at least 100 Thai iced teas in my life- it's my fav).
author: Bailey C.

description:
The Japanese wasabi rice bowl was delicious. I split this rice bowl with a friend, and was ecstatic that the waitress was happy to split the bowls, and each bowl came out with the perfect amount of food, and beautifully presented. 

I ordered Japanese wasabi rice bowl with seared ahi tuna and white rice. Everything aspect of the bowl was delicious, and flavorable. 

My waitress was very helpful, she kept my water glass refilled every time I finished it, and kept the table supplied with extra teriyaki sauce, and edamame. 

All in all my trip to pacific catch was a great one, and I can't wait to go back. Especially knowing how easy it is to spilt a rice bowl.
author: Hannah L.

description:
DELIVERY REVIEW ONLY!

I love love love poke. So anywhere that sells a variety of any raw tuna or poke dish is a must try for me. I loved all the different options they had on their menu, but it left me deciding for about 30 minutes what I wanted since it all sounded amazing and the dishes are somewhat expensive (for quality fish they have to be). I ended up getting the bowl and my husband got the tacos and we were both very satisfied with our choices. I will definitely return but hopefully I'll actually eat there in person next time.
author: Brittini S.

description:
We ordered food for lunch take out. So, in that sense, this may not be reflective of the experience in the restaurant. That said, when ordering takeout, my bar is already pretty low so I'm willing to forgive a lot. But, there were so many miss steps that I felt compelled to post.

Where to begin? The most egregious - the chips were stale and old. Yes, completely stale. As in, you bite into it and it feels like cardboard with that musty smell from a bag bought 6 months ago.

Next - the korean style ribs. Ribs are actually something that has some tolerance for takeout since they are often moist and don't require a crunchy texture like fried food would. But again, old, dry and the sauce tasted like salted vinegar. It was gross. Again, common sense - don't serve overcooked, old pork. 

The rest of the orders were largely forgettable. Poke was fine. Shrimp ceviche was gross, soggy, and a mess. The rest of the tacos were just ok. 

I've been told the food at the location is good, but these were some pretty stunning disasters that we got in our order.
author: Ajit K.

description:
We went expecting something average to good and we got something GREAT!

My husband and I were both blown away by the freshness and amazing taste of the dishes.

We started with a carrot ginger coconut soup which we split. Perfect to have during this cold weather! It also had crunchy shrimp in it. Wow, super good.

Then, we both got Japanese Wasabi bowls. Their best seller apparently. I got the one with grilled salmon, hubs got the Hawaiian Poke. The salad, varied veggies, wakame and brown rice went great with the fish.

We answered a survey after our meal and got to have free dessert. We got a fried dulce de leche based dessert which tasted awesome. The presentation was also beautiful! We also got a pumpkin ice-cream scoop.

The manager was near us the entire time, super enthusiastic, happy to be doing his job & telling us the Pacific Catch story. Don't you love people like this?

I highly recommend this place on one of my favorite streets in SF, Chestnut. Looking forward to going back ASAP!
author: Leslie S.

description: Gotta get some poke. This place is SMALL. Compared to the one in Campbell or Mountain View, you will think this is ridic. I think you can fit max 20 people at this place with a few tables in front, outside and a few bar seats. We snagged those since there was no wait. We shared the california poke and the salmon poke and a salmon bowl. It was good and the ratio of avocado to fish was solid. I saw this legit ass dessert that had a cookie, ice cream, and caramel drizzle but I didnt get it. This Marina area is so cute since there are shops and food all along. Parking is super difficult so good luck.
author: Amy H.

description: Amazing tacos! Also ordered the tuna poke bowl with rice which was good too, but preferred the tacos. Great service and friendly staff- would definitely eat here again!
author: Alyssa S.

description:
The perfect choice for a casual dinner with utterly delicious "clean" food (think giant zen-like bowls of fresh steamed veggies, healthy proteins and brown rice with light sauces). 

As others mention, the space is tiny and packed with small tables. This claustrophobic kind of atmosphere may give pause, but go on in because it's worth it. Although sitting at a bar/counter is rarely my choice when dining, this was the only option as the place was understandably packed on a Friday evening. It was all good however, as I was soon rewarded with a glass of red wine and the aforementioned giant bowl of bliss!

Vegetarians take note: although the menu is dominated by fish (naturally, considering the name of the restaurant), you can substitute marinated tofu for almost anything. I had a tofu wasabi bowl and like I said, it's perfection! You have an option to allow for 1/2 greens, 1/2 rice instead of mainly rice and this is a great idea because believe me, the amount of rice is generous in the half option. I loved the dollops of pickled ginger, daikon, shredded nori, sprouts avocado and greens because I'm the ultimate clockwise eater.
