The sesame seeds complimented the entire shebang perfectly and just let me bathe in the accompanying wasabi tamari sauce (our awesome server gave me extra, unprompted, when I mentioned that I'm a sauce fanatic). My G/F dining companion appreciated all the options and they of course brought a G/F soy sauce along with regular. They care here! 

If I lived close by, I'd order out here on the regular for sure. The ambiance may not be my cup of tea exactly, but the food is just what I'm always looking for when I don't have time to whip up a healthy, satisfying meal.
author: Joi B.

description: Such local/casual spot with amazing food options! We selected 5-6 different plates from the menu and it all turned out to be amazing but all time fave is the Hawaian Poke!! You have to try this place its so worth it!
author: Merve C.

description:
The Mahi Mahi is great - but the sauce seemed too acidic.

A really sweet and original joint from Honolulu. Spicy French fries were also great!

A small but nice place to go to; I recommend!
author: David G.

description: Pretty awesome food. Fast, friendly kitchen and staff. It's a small place, with a long bar top along the kitchen, and it's a joy to watch the kitchen at work.
author: Cason B.

description: Awesome, cozy place! Sat at the bar area. Fish was fresh and tasty, service was friendly and quick. Felt like a hole in the wall; just what us tourists were looking for!
author: SAnne H.

description: Had a solo lunch here and it was tasty. The coleslaw is a sesame coleslaw & it's quite nice. Small quarters, so don't come with a big group. But I do enjoy seeing my food cooked in front of me while sitting at the bar.
author: Serenity S.

description:
I posted this on FB but I'll put it here too. 

5 stars? No way. 

Don't get me wrong, service has been great. With that said when I ordered the "chalkboard special" of rainbow trout (which I was super excited for since I haven't had it since I was a kid) it came out looking decent, skin was crispy lookin, half the fish had a green sauce half a red sauce. 

As I started digging in I started on the green sauce side. Sauce was tasty, fish was a little dry but skin was still crispy so whatevs, I pressed on. By the time I got to the red side I realized the skin was no longer crispy since it had been sitting in the juice from the beans, salsa and coleslaw on the plate .  After my first bite of fish with the red sauce my tastebuds were immediately annihilated by the heat from the spices... don't get me wrong. I like a good kick to some foods but when eating something like trout that has its own distinct flavor that I'm looking for a mouth numbing amount of spice is not what I want. From that bite on I was only able to imagine the taste of the fish. 

Pretty disappointed since this is supposed to be a fish place yet they hide the fish behind way too much spicy heat.
author: John S.

description:
Pacific Catch is my favorite restaurant ever! This is the third location I've been to and it never fails me. One downfall of this location is that it is really small. You're going to have to wait for a table. 

Get the poke!!
author: Kelly G.

description:
I am most definitely a fan of Pacific Catch! The combination of good eats, great service, and a chill/cozy environment leads to this 5 star review.

First off, the food is delicious! My favorite is the wasabi rice bowl w/salmon. There is a lot going on with different textures throughout the dish. The salmon is prepared perfectly and not dry. Cucumbers add a nice crunch in contrast to the creamy salmon. I love the soy wasabi sauce mixed in the rice! The fried oysters are really good too. 

Our server was super cool! She was super sarcastic but funny. I wish I remembered her names. Being our first time at Pacific Catch, she was really helpful with providing menu suggestions. 

Just found out Pacific Catch is opening up in the East Bay at the new Persimmon shopping center in Dublin. Can't wait to have one closer to home!
author: Paul C.

description:
I've known the name Pacific Catch for a while now, and have always associated it with premium quality poke. I finally got to try it, and I don't think it fully lived up to my expectations.

I ordered the California Style Poke, which is ahi tuna with crab, avocado, cucumber, tobiko, mixed in a lemon aioli, and topped with shredded dry seaweed, served with crispy chips. The texture tuna tasted like it was seared, which wasn't stated on the menu, so I was a bit thrown off when I took my first bite. I could barely taste the fish, which was drowning in a sea of other flavors (pun intended, hah). I did like it though, don't get me wrong, but this may be a good dish for those who are just getting used to eating raw fish. For the more experienced, go with the Original or Salmon, which look like they're not overpowered by a myriad of other stuff.

The restaurant itself is really small. There was only one table that could fit more than four people, another one or two tables for four, and a bar seating area for maybe six people. If you're really craving Pacific Catch, your best bet would probably be to order to go so you don't have to stand squished next to the door waiting to be seated in the tiny tiny space.
author: Sabrina C.

description: Went there foe lunch and had the salad. Pretty good and good quantity. Clean and fresh. Good yam fries. Worth the wait but somewhat pricey. Fusion Asian cuisine.
author: L. G.

description: This was an interesting restaurant with a mix of fresh fish and Asian and Mexican influences.  The meal started with edamame and I equally enjoyed the fresh mahi mahi and traditional Baja tacos, each which had some great sauces.  It was a nice touch to also have spiced fries on the side.
author: Jenny L.

description: I recently came in for lunch on my break and had a wonderful experience. It was absolutely a great lunch. I was warmly greeted by a gentleman and he had such a warm personality. I wasn't sure what to order since everything look so delicious on the menu. He recommended the wasabi rice bowl and introduced himself as the new GM. What a great experience and would definitely come again!!!!
author: T C.

description:
Came here for my friend's post grad dinner! I definitely recommend calling ahead since the place is pretty small. They'll take down your number and call you once a table is available. There's some limited seating outside too, but it can get pretty cold up here as we all know lol. They have a outdoor heater but you'll literally be on the street sidewalk with no partition if you don't mind the foot traffic/SF characters (a dude literally came up to my friend, not to congratulate her on graduating, but to compliment her on her feet...).

Food was bomb! Complimentary already peeled edamame is served while you wait. We all ordered different things, but my wasabi poke rice bowl was perfect minus the great amount of rice that I couldn't finish haha. Other than that, our table had zero food waste cause everything was so damn good!!

Their servers are sweet and really good about checking in yet giving enough space for intimacy. They served my friend complimentary dessert to congratulate her which was just a cherry on top of their great customer service too.

I'd definitely recommend for small intimate groups/if you want to order out some good fusion food in the marina!
author: Anjelica K.

description:
Pacific Catch hits all sorts of wrong for me. I understand space is limited in general, but this restaurant was literally smaller than my bedroom. The food was relatively mediocre, maybe I expected too much out of the seafood considering how it's next to the bay. I can name a whole lot of places that serve the same food but better quality and lower prices.

I tried my best to enjoy the food, but when sauces and seasoning are used to the point where I can't taste the freshness or even the seafood itself then something is wrong. 
 
Simply put, Pacific Catch overcharges for mediocre food.
author: Derek T.

description: My parents and I were waiting by the bar for a extra seat to open up (only 2 and 2 were open at the bar). The staff wouldn't serve us until all 3 were seating and the ladies next to us refused to move down a seat. Waiter was super rude and said we should just wait outside for 30 minutes. YEAH RIGHT. We walked right out and to the next restaurant. Unfortunately, I will never be back after being treated so poorly.
author: Kara N.

description: Came here for lunch on a Sunday with two friends and a puppy. We were quickly seated outside (very limited seating inside and out). Food was great! We shared fish tacos, chicken taco, steak taco (my personal fav!) and a salmon rice bowl - which came with grilled pineapple. I should also mention the edamame that was served as we were seated, it was delicious.
author: Melissa C.

description: This was our first visit to this restaurant. We found it on Yelp where it had good reviews. However we found the food to be taste less. The Udon broth had no flavor as did the few morsels of food within it. The entire kitchen and wait staff spoke loudly to each other in Spanish during our entire meal. If you are looking for a relaxing restaurant with a flavorful meal we suggest you look elsewhere.
author: Pritika D.

description:
Hubby and I have been to this fine establishment near the corner of  Fillmore and Chestnut twice now, and have absolutely loved it each time. The offerings are fantastic, the staff is wonderful, and the price is fair for SF. 

First time 'round, we both had the rice bowls, which were huge and filled with tons of fresh ingredients. Second time 'round, I had the Chipotle Mahi Mahi salad with skirt steak substitute and hubby had the salmon sandwich. Let me tell you, one of the BEST salads I've ever had! I really liked the creamy tomatillo dressing. Hubby couldn't stop raving about how great his sandwich was. 

We will make a point of coming to this stretch of Chestnut for further culinary adventures, but it'll be hard NOT to try more great dishes from Pacific Catch!
author: Devo S.

description: The flavor is good. But I got a half rice/half veggie beef bowl. That consisted of a quarter of a plate of wilted salad and 2 cups worth of rice with 5 small slices of meat. So I paid $20 for a whole lot of rice? I could have bought 50lb of rice at the store for less than $20.
author: Bex O.

description: This is my most frequented restaurant as it's near me and has high quality food. I don't get tired of the menu since I just rotate between tacos (salmon and shrimp are my favorites), bowls and fish plates. Their desserts are amazing, especially the fried cheesecake. The only challenge is it's so small it's risky to try to bring more than 1 friend with you as you'll probably have to wait a bit.
author: John G.

description:
I've been eyeing this place since the last time I visited San Francisco 6 months ago, so needless to say, this was my first meal stop when I landed in the city again. 

Food-wise, I loved it. Space-wise, be prepared to talk about nothing important since chances are the rest of the restaurant are probably listening on your conversation too. The tables are put so closely together that I had to (as politely as I could) tell my friend to talk more quietly multiple times throughout our meal. 

For starters, we ordered the Sweet Potato Fries & Baja Shrimp Cerviche which were easily the highlights of the meal. The fries were cooked perfectly and came with ginger wasabi aioli & sweet thai chili dipping sauces. I could wasily have settled for another order to eat as my entree. I went with the California Style Poke instead which seemed more like another appetizer than an actual meal, but still delicious.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Tiny little shop, probably better for takeout. We ate at the only available table (outside). Service was reasonable. The menu was surprising to me based on the name of the store; I didn't expect the tacos and the poke. I ordered fish and chips which were OK but not mind-blowing. I think I would have been happier with a salad and I don't know why I didn't order one. Or I should have tried the poke. Hubby ordered a plate of various fried sea creatures and he gave me all the clams (I think they were clams? Maybe oysters) because he didn't like them. The fries were OK, with an interesting seasoning blend. It's totally decent but I probably ordered the wrong thing.
author: Monica F.

description: Great atmosphere, service and super fresh seafood. Only four tables and no pre-reservations so need to be there on time before dinner.
author: Andreas K.

description:
The poke and the clam chowder were very good, but what we LOVED was the fish taco trio!!! Tender, juicy, and tasty, the shrimp and Alaskan cod tacos were probably some of the best fish tacos we've had!

Seating area is tight and bustling, so not a particularly relaxed area to talk.
author: Kelly Z.

description: This place is AMAZING! Fresh food, deliciously seasoned. I wanted a light lunch really craving seafood so we decided to dine here while walking the shops in SF. The best food I had while in SF. I had the 2 taco combo with fries. I had the cod & shrimp tacos both with fresh pico de gallo, salsa, crisp lettuce. All served on a warm corn tortilla. Soooo good. My hubby had the Hawaiian salmon bowl he enjoyed it an said it was filing an flavorful. The iced Thai tea was SOO good. My only complaint was how small it was but hey I think that's how all SF is lol. Definitely try this place out.
author: Leslie E.

description:
Great small seafood restaurant on chestnut! I love the tiny space it provides. Staff is nice and the food is great. There is a small outdoor area to sit and eat and a small area inside for smaller groups.
You can also choose to sit by the bar and eat while the chefs are cooking up the delicious meals.
Overall, a great experience! Second time I'm here but will definitely come back once I'm in the area.
author: Sean K.

description: Had the inside out sushi. Loved it and the prickly pear margrita..  very tasty. Would definitely come again..customer service on point
author: Kamron W.

description: Excellent from moment you enter until you leave (not counting the excellent memories). Busy, yes, but that's for a good reason... People love it! Fish is fresh as can be, and distance between grill and table is so short the fish (or other meat) arrives on your plate HOT and delicious. Generous with drink refills and complimentary edamame to start. What's not to love? I'm going back this week!
author: Ian M.

description: Super delicious calamari and coconut shrimp. We also had a 1/2 price bottle of wine (on Tuesdays). Definitely recommend for happy hour!
author: Kayla K.

description: A wonderful way to end the weekend!  We arrived just before the evening rush and were promptly greeted. We grabbed a seat at the bar to be closer to he grill on a cold day -  watching chef turn out dish over dish.  TRY THE RIBS!  The sauce was absolutely amazing!  Salmon avocado poke bowl was a killer.
author: Danielle B.

description: We loved Pacific Catch, perfect for dinner with kids and everyone enjoyed their meals.  Very accommodating for our group.  It was wonderful!
author: Elizabeth N.

description: I never give reviews, let alone one star to anything. I'm the kind of person who gives every uber driver 5 stars. This place is a chain and it shows. There's no attention to detail and my raw salmon poke had the skin left on. All of the fish tasted stale and "fishy" in a bad way. It was so bad that I came in starving and didn't finish my meal. I actually lost my appetite after tasting the food, which had never happened to me before. Service was ok, the guy who was serving us was nice but he sat around staring at the walls... which was awkward. I seriously have no idea why this place has such a good rating.
author: Pariya G.

description:
I've never had Hawaiian poke and have always wanted to try it. I instantly decided to come here after seeing its high Yelp reviews and it's conveniently located just blocks from where I am. I came here on a Wednesday night and had to wait 10 minutes. The wait is shorter if you don't have a preference of table/bar seating. The restaurant is small with limited seats. They have an open kitchen where you could see the cooks preparing the dishes. 
The food didn't meet my expectations. I ordered the sushi-grade ahi salad and substituted it with the Hawaiian poke. The poke was drenched in sauce and was too salty for me. The bowl was huge and they do give a generous portion of fish and vegetables. It's a pretty good deal for a $15 dinner in the city. If I ever come back, I'll have to try out their other dishes and hopefully they won't disappoint.
author: Helen C.

description:
This place has the best poke that we've found on the mainland.  I'm very picky with poke and have been searching for poke that is comparable to Hawaiian poke.  

We started out with the poke appetizer.  Pretty good portion of poke and it is DELICIOUS!!!  Great flavor and super fresh fish, served with wonton chips.  We liked it so much that we decided to get the Japanese Wasabi bowl with poke.  Generous portions!!!!  It's a big bowl of rice (I suggest getting half salad), with lots of veggies, avocado, seaweed, a yummy wasabi sauce, and of course POKE!  Liked it so much that we went back 2 days later to get more.  The second time we got poke again and my fiance tried the Hawaiian teriyaki bowl with marinated skirt steak.  Has a great island feel, steak is so tender and delicious.  The pineapples give it a nice sweet flavor.  

****TIP***: check in on four square the first time and you get a free dessert.  Whatever you do, make sure to get the fried dulce de leche spring rolls!!!!!  It's one of the most delicious desserts I've had.  

Sit at the bar and you can watch the cooks make the food.  It's actually quite entertaining and you'll want to order everything you see them make.  They are really talented.  Also, the staff is super friendly!  

Overall, great place to go for some quality food and great service.
author: Lisa G.

description:
I use to go to the San Mateo location and have moved to the east bay and miss eating at this place. 

My favorite is the tuna poke. There are 4 different kinds.You can order the trio sampler which has 3 different types of tuna poke. I always get the original which is really good! It's seasoned with sesame seeds and soy ginger sauce. It my absolute favorite. I pair it with some sweet potato fries. 

This location was much smaller than I anticipated and I haven't been to the Marina in ages. That being said it was still enjoyable. Although I put my name on the list and was told I would get called when a table was available and no one gave me a call. I walked over to a bar across the street. After no one called me for over 45 minutes, I eventually just walked over and then we were sat 30 minutes before they closed. 

Great restaurant, but I prefer the San Mateo location.
author: Ebonie M.

description: I love the food here ! Not much seating so you maybe have to wait a bit until you're seated. There are tons of shops and/or coffee shops along that street to help kill time until you're seated.
author: Ruby V.

description:
Excellent seafood! Namely, poke. We came for lunch. The place is small, very limited seating, so I would imagine on busier days there would be a line out the door. We ordered 2 different varieties of poke, as well as salmon. It came with a nice salad, seaweed, crunchy wontons, and everything tasted great together.  Service was fast, staff was friendly, and everything was clean.

The location is also really good. It;s on the main road near a bunch of other interesting shops and dessert places. Check them out!
author: Jenny B.

description:
I went to Pacific Catch on a Friday night with a friend. We weren't able to make it here for happy hour but I definitely have heard good things about the happy hour!

When we arrived around 6:30pm, it was really busy and packed! The hostess told us it'll take about 15 minutes for a table, the wait was definitely shorter than that. 

We were seated in a promptly manner. I like the little dish they give you when they serve you your water, it looks like its edamame and little pretzels. Yum!

We decided to order the calamari and the mixed catch basket with spicy fries. The server had a good sense of humor and was very nice. He asked if we wanted our calamari as an appetizer and the other dish later. We did, so we were served our calamari first.

Food:

Calamari - I like the sauce that comes with it. Beware, there is a kick to it! The calamari came out cool/luke warm, which makes me think it wasn't freshly deep fried which is a little disappointing. I think it was well-battered and crispy. I like it, but then again, how can you go wrong with calamari? If you make it wrong, then I am just speechless. Calamari is usually my safety to-go dish. 

Mixed Catch Basket - So I definitely like the spicy fries. I don't think it's spicy but the cajun taste is distinct. I like dipping in the sweet thai chili sauce. Although I have a bottle of sweet thai chili sauce at home, I still like it. The sauce is nothing special. You go to an asian grocery store and you buy the sweet chili sauce that looks the same color. It is such a tasty sauce though! I like the oysters and shrimp in this dish. For some reason, I wasn't expecting the shrimp to be so coconut-y but it did describe that to me in the menu. The fish was a little dry and a little boring, I wasn't impressed. I think the fries wowed me out of everything in the dish because it was unique. The fried foods were fresh and crispy. No one likes soggy fried foods.

Not bad place for fusion seafood, but also it doesn't make me go WOW, I need to come back again.

Note: If you are a UCSF student, tell them you're a UCSF student so they can give you 10% off.
author: Margaret L.

description:
Pacific Catch lures in tons of people with their delicious food but then has to pack everyone in like sardines because the restaurant is so tiny...  If you don't like sitting so close to another party that you can hear every word of their conversation...then dining in at this place is not for you.  You're probably better off ordering to-go.

Here's the deliciousness that I tried:

- CABO CALAMARI: Good!  The spicy chipotle aioli dipping sauce was a nice change from the usual tartar and marinara sauce that usually comes with calamari appetizers.

- JAPANESE WASABI BOWL WITH HAWAIIAN POKE: Impressive bowl size but I felt like most of it was filled with rice.  Would've been better if it came with more fish!!  The flavor was awesome though and I felt healthy eating it.  I also liked that I was given a choice of white or brown rice.

- FRIED DULCE DE LECHE "SPRING ROLLS": Snagged this free dessert by checking into Pacific Catch on Foursquare for the first time. Yippee!  It was cheesecake stuffed in fried "spring rolls" and served with vanilla bean ice cream with caramel sauce drizzled all over!  So good!  If you're trying to be healthy though, you may feel guilty eating this.  You've been warned.

If you like fresh seafood and sinful desserts...Pacific Catch will have you hooked! ;)
author: Francesca L.

description: The food has become increasingly hit and miss, in my opinion. They also changed the format and ingredients to a dish I used to get all the time, the Korean BBQ bowl, for the worse. That said it happens, restaurants change their menus and dishes, so the real crux of my review is the mixed up takeout orders and flies that I see hovering in the restaurant. The place should be cleaner. Last time we ate there we both got sick
author: Matthew v.

description: I wanted to like this place. We came during happy hour (mon-fri 4-6) which is a decent deal. The seasoned fries are so good. The tacos were bad though, flavorless and the fish didn't taste amazing. Super disappointing to say the least. I thought tacos would be a pretty safe bet for something yummy. Girlfriend with me loved her steak taco. I wouldn't come back again, I didn't even finish my meal. On the upside the waitress was friendly and service was pretty good.
author: A S.

description: Smallest seafood restaurant I have ever visited. Good food reasonably priced for a San Francisco restaurant. I ordered the Sole, that was great. My friend ordered Swordfish, not so great. If you are claustrophobic, sitting inside may not be a good idea. They have 2 tables outside, you may wanna wait for those.
author: Ash A.

description: I've had poke for the first time in Hawaii so I was happy to have it again. It was good and fish was fresh. The staff was very friendly.
author: Danai P.

description:
I liked this place a lot!!  Thanks to my friend Mel D. I tried Pacific Catch's wonderful seafood platter (fried) and SHRIMP TACOS!!  Yes, I was yelling shrimp tacos!  Those were so awesomely delicious.  If I could, I would've ordered more of those shrimp tacos to stuff myself.  

The place is tiny and you may need to wait depending on the day, but when you get that table of yours, get those shrimp tacos (well...unless you are allergic or just hate shrimps).  

Metered parking was not too difficult to find, although I found someone leaning on my car while waiting for her table at some restaurant my car was parked in front of.  Seriously, who does that?
author: Angela W.

description: One of the best innovative fusion foods in SF. Despite the small store, the menu has good variety and perfectly mixed different types of cuisine with fresh seafoods. One more thing, the service here is pretty warm and good, attentive but not very pushy, gave good suggestions with a smile on their faces. Highly recommend and will def come back!
author: Wendy C.

description: Found this place on a bike ride from the Golden Gate Bridge back to fisherman's wharf. Great food: we had the tacos, fish and chips, 2 types of sandwiches, and ribs and they were all delicious. Would definitely come back.
author: Kendell F.

description: The steak taco was pretty amazing. The fried fish taco was just ok. I love fish tacos and have had some of the best in San Diego so I am a tough judge. Also service was a bit slow even though it was pretty empty.
author: Ami P.

description: SO fresh and so clean! Love this place...Something for every seafood taste...However the Poke, any one, is the real gem here.  Next time I'll just get the poke trio, cuz its that good.  The price is justified in the quality and portion of the food.  The service is always helpful and attentive.
author: Kris Marie D.

description:
This place is pretty lauded for seafood quality and quantity but I'd personally give it a B/B- rating. Both times I've been here the food has has definitely been filling, but not satisfying. General flavor of the fish tacos/poke bowls is nothing crazy delicious or out of the norm. I think you're mainly paying for the nicely decorated plates, trendy Marina location and oversubscribed real estate (hence, the crazily limited and narrow restaurant seating?) . 

Most recently, the fried calamari appetizer we ordered had an over-salted batter and my wasabi salmon poke bowl was not at all fresh. Salmon pieces seemed mildly cooked from sitting out in the heat all day. The bowl's redeeming quality was probably the miso dressing, cold seaweed salad, and overall healthy feel.

Given Pacific Catch enough tries and not coming back unless they figure out some secret sauce!
author: Arushi S.

description: Fish and chips were on point! Staff was friendly and attentive. Great place for a quick bite to eat!
author: Ashley R.

description:
It must really mean something if I headed here twice during my six day stay in San Francisco. My boyfriend and I took a chance here not knowing what to expect from their exterior, but I'm glad we found this sweet spot. 
The restaurant is very accommodating and offers brown rice or even half rice half salad if you're feeling a little health conscious. We both had a variation of the Hawaiian Poke wasabi rice bowl and it was literally the best tasting sashimi I've had in my entire life. The soy marinade was perfect and must've included some sesame oil. The salt level was never offensive and unffffff just believe me when I say this made me all tingly on the inside. The portions were HUGE but that didn't stop me from devouring the masterpiece comprised of tuna, avocado, tobiko, pickled radish and cucumber.

This place is most certainly a must try.
author: Renee L.

description:
Great seafood and excellent poke! The daily specials are also a great option.

Place is tiny (seat about ~25) so reservation is recommended!
author: Eilen L.

description: Ordered the taco trio with steak, shrimp, and traditional baja fish and have to say I was VERY underwhelmed. The batter on both the shrimp and the fish was not crispy and there was too much mayo/sauce for my liking. All three "meats" lacked flavor. I also ordered the spicy fries which were not spicy at all but had good flavor. If you've ever had crab fries (old bay seasoning) though from the east coast these are nothing special. With so many other great taco/seafood/fusion spots in SF, I'd skip out on Pacific Catch
author: Tian S.

description: Amazing! I was passing by and thought I should try - I'm amazed with the good and the service... great value too.
author: Parisse M.

description:
Superbra mat! 

Vi provade följande:

Baja Shrimp Ceviche 
lime, Fresno chilies, avocado, cilantro, tortilla chips.

Japanese Wasabi 
seaweed salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori, soy-wasabi sauce,  salmon.

Ahi Tuna 
seared ahi tuna or Hawaiian Poke, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, soy-wasabi vinaigrette.
author: Johan E.

description: INCREDIBLE food we ordered the mahi mahi tacos and poke chirashi and both were absolutely wonderful. Atmosphere is tight but not too loud and very friendly. Would recommend to 10/10
author: Yamboy D.

description: Everithing! I make a 7 days travel trought the pacific coast an thist its the best restaurant! All the food its amazing the service its the best you have to try the coconut srimp and the poke trio! I gibe them the highest rate
author: Jose S.

description:
The food was delicious but the portions were very small especially for the price.  Specifically the clam chowder bread bowl and fish and chips.  Be selective about what you order, other dishes may be better bang for your buck.  Overall wasn't too impressed.

On another note, the restaurant is really small
author: Chris P.

description: Discovered this awesome restaurant while visiting the City by the Bay earlier this month. It's tiny and you might have to wait for a table but it is so worth the wait. The ahi poke bowls are incredible as are the fish tacos.  I also loved how friendly and personable the entire staff was.  Delicious and fairly priced dining with great service. EAT THERE!!
author: Desiree C.

description: We went here with a couple of friends since we thought they took our passport dining card, which they didn't.  The low review is for the lack cleanliness, lack of flavor and slow service!  The booth we sat at, the table was disgusting as it had something sticky on there and it wouldn't wipe away!  I had to put a napkin in front of me to not get my hands, arms, and elbow sticky!  When we ordered bottled sparkling water, we were brought liquor glasses to use and they smelled horrible, like rotten eggs and bad fishy!  I had to ask for another glass as I could not stomach the stench.  We all pretty much ordered the Alaskan Salmon special they are running but each and everyone of them lacked flavor or weird flavors that didn't even go together!  For about $30 a dish they better offer something tasty!  Our service was really slow and every time we asked for something we had to basically chase our server down to remind her to please bring it!  She was very young and I assume she was new.  I'm sure she'll catch on as time goes by!  Overall the whole experience left something to be desired!  We probably won't be back!
author: M j.

description:
This is one of those places where when I'm eating it I think to myself "does it get any better than this?". Answer is probably not. Whoever dreamed up the Ahi Wasabi sandwich is a genius. 

Not the cheapest place in the bay. But damn is it good.
author: Nick D.

description:
We had:
- Calamari
- Edamame
- Swordfish
- Mixed Catch Basket

EVERYTHING we ordered was delicious.  I really recommend getting the Calamari or your just missing out.  The seasoning is perfect.
author: Kaci W.

description:
We found this placed out of sheer frustration.  Traffic out of the city was a nightmare.  So we turned to our Yelping community and a coworker of my wife's.  

Pacific Catch is a small place, no that is not fair.  It is tiny.  We sat at the bar and were able to watch the cooks prepare everything.  

It was happy hour so I sampled their tacos.  I had three different tacos.  One was mahi, another was their traditional fish taco I don't recall the third.  I also had an order of sweet potato fries.  The tacos were ridiculous.  The slaw and sauce were fresh and delicious.  The sauce was well balanced and have it a hit of citrus I live in fish tacos.  
The sweet potato fries were so good.  The salt was added the instant they came out of the oil and. The salt crystals were large and in perfect balance with the potato. 
I washed it all down with a local IPA.  
I would love to come back.
author: Scott S.

description:
HANDS DOWN THE BEST PESCATARIAN RESTAURANT EVER! We stumbled across this gem with our original intention to go to Tacolicious. The wait ended up being over half an hour so we decided to go next door and we were seated immediately at Pacific Catch. 

I had the steak, shrimp, and mahi mahi tacos and boy was it to die for! I topped it off with some Sauvignon Blanc and I was in heaven! My boyfriend had the wasabi Ahi Tuna sandwich which was perfectly seared (bonus: warm bread). My boyfriend still dreams about the sandwich!

Very friendly staff and our waiter even recommended some ideas of his own pertaining to beer.
author: Shela D.

description:
I love their poki bowls, salmon and most of their fish options here. 
I always ask for 1/2 salad with brown rice and it's delish. With lots of greens and a little bit of rice and the sauce on the side.  Healthy and yummy.

My only issue is their service, it's hectic and all over the place and it stresses me out to eat there. N parking around the corner sucks!!   I usually end up ordering take out, and that's a fast 15 mins.
author: ThuZ W.

description:
Stopped by here for some lunch with an old pal.   I've been wanting to try this place for a while now.   Without hesitation I went for the Japanese Wasabi Rice Bowl and Hawaiian Poke California Style.   If you haven't been to Pacific Catch and are a seafood lover, then this is the place to be!  
Service was good, waiter was nice and prompt to refill our drinks.   Had a bit of a wait to sit, but that's to be expected without calling ahead.

Looking forward to trying many more menu items!!!
author: Tony S.

description: Messy and scrumptious tacos with a side of fries.  Legit Mexican with a Hawaian twist.
author: Anya P.

description:
This place serves the best food ever! I love seafood and the way the entrees are prepared are so good. It can be a little pricey here but the portions are huge so its worth it. I ordered one of their Asian rice bowls and the way the flavors mixed were amazing. The only downside about this place is that there are hardly any seats so you have to get lucky and hunt down a table. Other than that, you will not regret coming here. 
.
author: Shan M.

description:
Very good food, and the portion sizes are HUGE!

I've been wanting to come here for a while now and I'm so glad that I did.  The food was absolutely amazing and came in much bigger portions than I was expecting.  I would highly recommend the spicy fries, poke, and a rice bowl.  A friend and I both got that (split the fries and poke) and hardly made it through half of everything! 

It's a small place but we didn't have to wait to be seated which was also a plus on a Sunday night!
author: Julia K.

description: I had the hawaiian mahi mahi rice bowl and my dad had the japanese wasabi rice bowl with ahi tuna...both were delicious!!! I highly recommend this place.
author: L L.

description: It may not live up to Hawaii poké but for San Francisco this place really fills the poké void in my gut. I always order the poké bowl because honestly how could you not? Doesn't hurt that it's a block from my house either.
author: L L.

description:
The bf and I ate here over the weekend. It's a small restaurant with only six 2 seater tables inside. These can be pushed together if you have a party of four. There are also a few seats outside and some stools at the counter but I prefer to sit at a table where it is not so chilly. I would not come here with a big group since there is such limited seating. 

We ordered:

Japanese Wasabi Bowl with Hawaiian Poke and Seared Ahi ($15.5 + $4.5 since we got two meats): The bowl traditionally comes with rice but can be substituted with half rice, half greens or all greens. We chose to go with all greens. I'm always pleased when restaurants let me trade rice for something more delicious and nutritious. Between the poke and the ahi, I would definitely choose the poke. The searing on the ahi is nice but the poke has great flavor. The sauce is tangy and intense with a little spicy heat. The salad dressing has a wasabi taste and a bit of heat. There's also mixed greens, wakame salad, and ginger. Overall, I think it was a pretty healthy meal and it comes in a big bowl. My bf and I split this dish. At the end I was full but he was still hungry. I think he would have been more satisfied if he'd gotten his own bowl. 

Wakame Salad ($4): We were originally going to get the roasted vegetables until the waitress informed us that the vegetable was corn! I do not consider corn to be a vegetable. I am very thankful she told us beforehand or I would have been very disappointed. However, the wakame salad was just okay. It reminded me of the seaweed salad from Costco. I'd skip this dish. 

Service: Friendly and attentive. No complaints here.

Overall: If I came back I would order the Japanese Wasabi bowl again but with poke only.
author: Ella C.

description: Fantastic lunch , we first walked into the place next door but wasn't feeling it, and realized it was going to be a mediocre generic American Italian meal, so luckily made the right choice and left. Great sole special, friendly waitress or manager . We sat at the squeezed in bar and had a good time. Just quality, respectfully cooked food at great prices.
author: Allen W.

description:
Very cute, casual little restaurant. I came with two colleagues on a Friday afternoon in search for lunch after an event at Fort Mason. It was a beautiful day so we decided to sit outside. 

Our waiter was really nice without being overly attentive and the food was delicious, even if it was a little pricey. The food came in a good amount of time - not long enough for any of us to notice. We passed the time by making conversation.

I would definitely come back - the food alone is enough for me to return. I want to try everything on the menu.
author: Veronica H.

description:
I have been wanting to try this place and finally got a chance to do so today for my bachelorette brunch. This place doesn't take reservations and its pretty small inside but for a table of 8, we actually got lucky and was seated right away outside. They def turned on the heat fan for us and the waitress was very attentive. Our table got a mix between the salads, rice bowls, and tacos. Everything was a big portion and looked very fresh. I myself got the Ahi tuna salad bowl. It tasted great and the Ahi not only looked fresh but tasted very fresh. It was seared perfectly and the toppings that come with the salad were very tasty and fresh as well. I also got a chance to try the Poke salad and the poke was on point as well. I didn't get dressing for my salad but teh poke salad did have it. It was def not over whelming but gave it a nice flavor. it was very light as well. 

Overall, great place and will def be back
author: Tao Tao W.

description: Good but not great. All the fried food tasted the same. The shrimp tacos were better than the Baja tacos. The salmon chowder was delicious, though. Service was a bit spotty.
author: Karen K.

description:
UPDATE: Pacific Catch contacted me to let me know that they have passed on my feedback re: the fish tacos. I thought this demonstrated great customer service and so I am increasing my rating by 1 star.

I dislike restaurants that overprice their meals and restaurants that don't serve tasty food. Unfortunately, Pacific Catch commits both these sins.

I ordered two baja fish tacos (made with the daily catch, cod) with the side salad. Sadly, the tacos was terrible. This came from the fact that other than a little cabbage, the only flavor in the taco came from heaps of green salsa that tasted weirdly bitter/sour all at once. The fish itself had no flavor (or maybe it did and the salsa fried off my tastebuds so I couldn't taste it??). Yuck! I will say that the side salad was delicious, with great dressing and crunch from the edamame. 

To make matters worse, my meal came to $17 after tip, which in my opinion is way too much to pay for two tacos at lunchtime, especially ones that didn't even taste good! I really wanted to like this place, because I love seafood and because the menu here has so many interesting-sounding dishes. I might give it another try because of the positive yelp reviews and because the menu has many interesting items on it, but unfortunately I can't give it any more than 2 stars right now.

Tip: Take advantage of the outdoor seating! Fun people-watching.
author: Neha S.

description: Strong place to grab a good bite to eat! We were wondering down Union St. / Chestnut St. and found this gem. The tacos are great, and so are the seasoned fires.  Wine was fantastic as well! Sitting outside at night can be a little chilly, but there are heaters that help. I would go again the next time I'm in town.
author: Matt C.

description: My Poke bowl was out of this world. I was so full but couldn't stop eating it because the ingredients were so well seasoned and fresh.
author: Maria R.

description: Great little stop to grab tacos, had the shrimp and steak. Shrimp was super delish and the shrimp where big!
author: David O.
Nyc L.

description:
Hole in the wall...literally. Only six tables (of two) and a bar (overlooking the kitchen) seating about 8-10. Et voila, c'est tout!

Got there around 1:15pm and took the last table. By 1:30pm there was a waitlist for a place to sit and a long line of hungry customers more than willing to wait.

Dad ordered the special: Mahi Costa Rican. Fresh (and generous portion) of Mahi fish garnished with chimichurri sauce with a side of slaw, dirty rice (Cuban style) and a fried plantain with sour cream. Amazzzzing, and only $14!

I got the Mahi Hawaiian bowl ($13) and when I asked for 1/2 the order of rice instead of a  full order the amicable waiter offered to substitute half of my rice for salad.

Server was stellar. It looked like he was doing a perfect dance from kitchen to tables.
Glasses were always full and before anyone needed a refill dude was one step ahead of us! 

Prices were very fair considering the quality and amount of food served.
 

They cater and offer take-out.
author: Gabriela G.

description:
Craving a decent order of fish and chips, my Yelp search yielded Pacific Catch off Chesnutt and Filmore. Like almost all parking in SF, the seating at lunch time was difficult to find and quite snug once we got a table to sit at.

Sitting elbow-to-elbow with another table, we ordered some fish and chips (sweet potato, spiced, and normal fries). We also enjoyed some fried prawns and clams. Overall the potential grease fest was actually not that greasy. The portion of fish was decent and the shrimp and clams were pretty tasty. The fries were Ok at best. The spiced fries were the worst of the bunch and the sweet potato fries were the best. Overall the food was around 3.5 stars.

I would tend to round up my overall review when I'm in between ratings however the service did not do Pacific Catch any favors. Although the place was busy for lunch, it does not seat that many customers. Service was slow when taking our order and refilling our drinks. Our server didn't even check in our our meals!? We were desperately looking for refills and extra ketchup and tartar sauce but by the time our waitress came around we were nearly done with our meals.

Thus, Pacific Catch did catch this southern California Yelper on vacation but it ended up with a 3 star review in the end.
author: Stan W.

description:
This restaurant is the bee's knees! I got the spicy ahi sandwich with spicy fries, and my friends got the tuna poke rice bowl. We also shared an order of the calamari. The calamari was amazing because it came onions and lemons too (I don't actually like calamari but my friends loved  it). 

The rice bowl was HUGE. It had avocado and ginger and cucumber and pretty much everything delicious you could imagine. My sandwich was amazing. Lightly seared ahi with lettuce and tomato and chipotle aioli. I was getting so full by the second half that I just took the ahi out and ate that. 

The fish was to die for! Tasted fresh and very well handled. 

All in all it was a wonderful visit and I can't wait to go back soon!
author: Samantha W.

description: Just here to recommend the Thai Coconut Shrimp starter ($9 for 7 pieces). It was a surprisingly delicious combo and I would definitely go back to get just this starter! The Macadamia Nut Brownie Sundae ($8 or free with the Thanx app) is AMAZING. The chocolate sauce has a hint of caramel which just makes the entire dessert 5x better. I would recommend sharing the dessert between three people because it's a lot to finish!
author: Erica S.

description: I had the Japanese Wasabi rice bowl (seaweed salad, avocado, daikon sprouts cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori, soy-wasabi sauce.)  It was a good time and I'll gladly go back.  Next time I want to try other items....and also dine-in instead of getting food to go.
author: Shaun W.

description: California poke was good, didn't like the wonton crips as much though. Calamari was average, a bit too greasy...
author: Adele Z.

description: A-freaking-mazing!!! The service was excellent, Amy, you rocked it!! She knew the menu inside out and was suuuuper helpful! You're a gem and a rare breed!! The food was incredible! So yummy!!!
author: Derek N.

description: I really love the dishes here, and the seafood always comes with great mixtures, variety and sauces. Most dishes come with everything in them, really - seafood/proteins, veggies, carbs, something else different like grilled pineapple or edamame. The pan-asian ricebowls are always great(my favorite is the Hawaiian Teriyaki) but most things on the menu are delicious anyways! This location is small, though, so dont plan on getting in quickly or having lots of space. This space really doesn't fit many people and they are serving lots of orders to deliver so service can be shifty at times.
author: Hanna C.

description:
I fall in love with their happy hour menu. This Monday I brought my friends from Boston back to the restaurant. My friends love their food. We went to the Pacific Catch on chestnut street. I used to go to the location on 9th avenue. It was my first time in chestnut street, the place was pretty tiny.  At first, I thought I walked into a wrong restaurant. I checked the menu and realized that it is the one. We got there at 5:45 and I asked the waitress if we could order from the happy hour menu, the waitress responded "yes, as long as you order it before 6." She immediately seated us and let us looked at the menu. Unfortunately, because we really want to place an order as soon as possible, we had not choice besides sitting at the bar for party of 3.

We ordered the poke bowl from regular menu, and from the happy hour menu we ordered coconut shrimp, California poke, sweet potato fries and calamari. The food were served pretty quickly, it took only 10-15 minutes. The sweet potato fries were so good. Every time I go back, I always ordered sweet potato fries and I always wanted to get more at the end. I used not to like sweet potato fries, but after trying their sweet potato fries, every once awhile I have a craving for the sweet potato fries. It was amazing. The coconut shrimp is very crunchy. The poke bowl was really good. My friends tried one from Hawaii and she said this poke bowl reminds her of her experience in Hawaii. She loves it. 

I highly recommend everyone to try their sweet potato fries, especially people who don't like sweet potato fries. Trust me, after you try one, you would just keep eating more. 

The price was very fair too. All the food (5 dishes) we ordered for $45ish. You should definitely give the restaurant a try~
author: Xueying Z.

description:
Amazing food and fantastic service! I only wish they had more room for customers (this is SF, so I would never count that against any restaurant). It was a busy Saturday afternoon when my friends and I went to Pacific Catch for dinner. We ended up waiting a lot longer than the hostess originally estimated. There were a few tables of people finished with their food and sipping on their drinks longer than expected. When we finally were seated, the Manager of Pacific Catch walked over to our table and offered us a free starter - calamari was delicious! 

I would suggest on weekends arriving in the afternoon, placing your name and number on the list, go for drinks near by, then come back when you're called. The food and service is worth the wait. The Hawaiian poke bowel is now a new craving of mine. 

I appreciate a restaurant that takes the time to notice any discomfort their customers are going through and offers great customer service, along with amazing food. Thanks, again!
author: Erin D.

description: Stopped into Pacific Catch for dinner on a recent trip to San Francisco. I'm not big on seafood, but the menu looked interesting. It was pretty crowded on a Monday night at 7, so we sat at the counter.  It was great watching the chefs prepare the food. Everything looked really fresh. Luckily there was a special, I ordered 3 pulled pork sliders on mini Hawaiian rolls with pineapple slaw ($9). They were FANTASTIC! Dining buddy ordered Thai Coconut Shrimp with sweet potato fries, also excellent. They also have a great craft beer selection ($6 each). Friendly and attentive staff, great experience overall. Will definitely return the next time I'm in town.
author: Kristen M.

description: Omg. So fresh and delicious . California roll and ahi tuna salad were soooooo delicious and fresh. California roll salad has real crab . I could eat here everyday mouth in heaven .
author: Valerie P.

description: Pacific Catch was a welcome post 9:30pm dinner after SF Art Market on Thursday night, when a lot of places were already closing/closed. We sat at the bar in this little place. The poke bowl was the perfect late night hunger thing. Light, warm, filling, crunchy....and, well poke. You choose the bed of either white or brown rice or lettuce. $16 for a large bowl. I actually could/should have split, but my friend isn't a raw fish eater. There were plenty of other good sounding options such as fish tacos. Hot green tea was good and server/hostess was very friendly. Street parking was manageable...mainly due to the hour.
author: Linda M.

description: Service is absolute shit employees are rude and ill-equipped to do what is already too easy of a job. Waited over 40 minutes and our table was given away because "they thought we weren't coming back" we put our names on the list ... we want to eat. Will be telling all friends about this terrible experience. Also the bathrooms are nasty
author: Nl B.

description:
I love Pacific Catch :)! I've been to the Marina location and the San Jose location and both have the same menu and the same excellent quality. 

I usually think of Pacific Catch as more of a lunch place, since they serve lots of seafood-themed salads and sandwiches, but I definitely wouldn't mind getting one of their rice bowls for dinner!

The Pacific Catch in the Marina is quite small and so it's definitely NOT a great option for groups. The last time I went, Ms. M and I grabbed the last seats at the bar. 

I think that for what they serve (i.e. fresh fish and fresh produce) and for the cooking technique (I've never had an overcooked piece of fish here), the prices are on point. They have an assortment of starters, and the Korean Ribs ($11) always catch my eye (and I saw the chefs preparing this dish and they look awesome), but it is hard not to stick to fish! They also offer "Meal Sized Salads" (hell yes), with prices ranging from $10.50 for their veggie salad to $15 for their real crab salad. They also have fish and chips ($10-$14), sandwiches with a choice of side ($12.50), tacos, and island bowls with an assortment of proteins ($15).

So far, I've tried (see photos):

Salmon Sandwich ($12.5) - Grilled salmon, avocado, tomato, and citrus aioli. The salmon was juicy and tender. The aioli was also creamy and delicious. And, I highly, highly recommend that you choose the sweet potato fries over the side salad. I think it may be $2 extra, but Pacific Catch is actually my favorite place for sweet potato fries. Ms. M thinks that they are so good here because they cut the fries at the perfect size.

Crab Salad ($15) - Real crab, avocado, cucumber, ginger, carrots, & shredded nori with soy-wasabi vinaigrette. This salad is HUGE and it is SO good. All of the ingredients are fresh fresh fresh and the balance of the flavors is excellent. The dressing was tangy and flavorful and the crab added savoriness and texture. I also thought that the amount of crab given was quite generous. I ate this after a morning run at Crissy Field, and thought it was the perfect post-workout lunch. I would definitely order this again!

Finally, I would also add that my favorite vegetarian apparently loves the Pan Asian Bowl with half salad / half rice (apparently this is something you can request) and tofu! She apparently thinks the tofu here is amazing! Since I'm going demi-veg these days, I will absolutely be ordering this next time :).
author: Eileen E.

description:
Dear Pacific Catch, where have you been all my life?
As a mega enthusiast of all things seafood, my taste buds couldn't be happier to have discovered you.

From the friendliest of servers, a small but warm 'n welcoming environment, this place has quite the menu to please many seafood lovers like myself. I was walking through Fort Mason with a friend and having moved to the Bay area recently, we saw a jogger through the park and asked where to go...she suggested we try this place out, and now, I want to thank this kind civilian for sharing such a wonderful food providing spot for us to check out. I am forever grateful mystery jogger!

The prices are great, we sat up right at the bar, watched the chef's cook everything up, looked fresh, delicious, and smelled amazing. Service was great, food was prepared fast, and served up nicely in plates. I ordered the Korean BBQ bowl, my friend and husband ordered the fish and chips and everything was eaten with "oh my mmmMmm! mmmM's!" after every bite. 

We also ordered up some calamari to get started on our feast and wow, it may just be the best I've ever had. Prepared perfectly, not fried too much, but just enough..and they come with some amazing dipping sauce and peppers. Now imagine a smiley happy face. Yup, that's what I think we looked like eating this. Order some for an instant smile!

The fish and chips isn't your typical dish. This one comes with amazing fries, fish, fried oysters, and fried coconut shrimp. DEEEEEELISH! The Korean BBQ comes with a variety of meat or fish but I chose the grilled salmon. It was perfectly prepared. 

We loved it so much, that we ventured into the Marina all the way from Berkeley just to eat here 2 days after the first time we went. It was glorious and highly recommend you check it out if you haven't yet!
author: Akvile D.

description: The Japanese Rice Bowl is off the charts amazing here! Don't be scared by the word wasabi, it is not spicy at all and you don't taste any wasabi. SO DELICIOUS! We will come back next time we are in the Bay Area, for sure!
author: Sharon D.

description:
Decent spot. 

This place has good food - the tacos are super yummy and the poke is delicious. 

This location is smaller and more intimate - much better for a night out, but does feel a bit like a chain. 

Service is decent. 

Pricier than I would have thought.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
We came by here the other night and ordered the Grilled Salmon sandwich and the Salmon special.  The sandwich was VERY yummy and it came with fresh and crisp french fries.  My salmon special came with broccolini and mushrooms that were cooked perfectly - not over done and not too much oil.  It also came on a heaping portion of mashed potatoes that my husband thought were instant.  The salmon itself, however, was just okay.  Nothing to brag home about, but not bad either.

On top of the good food, they offer generous portions and great customer service.  We'll definitely be back.
author: Negar A.

description:
Love the ahi tuna salad here! This is a great place to get takeout/delivery from on late nights of work! 

Very fresh, very filling.
author: Meaghan H.

description: Tasty food and friendly staff. We went for lunch and ordered salad and tacos (fish, shrimp and chicken). Very recommended if you are looking for a quiet lunch spot where both quality and quantity are featured.
author: Mariona B.

description:
Not much to say that hasn't already been said about this place.

The food was really good. I enjoyed a steak taco and mahi mahi taco. My S.O. liked the poke trio. Their lemonade was good too -- a nice balance of sweet and tart. 

Our waitress was very friendly and personable. We had great service throughout the entire meal.

The space is small, and there are too many tables in such a small space. We were so close to the people next to us that at one point my S.O. said, "I'm thinking about getting the swordfish." To which the lady at the table over said, "Oh, it's very good!" I guess what I'm saying is keep the personal details to a minimum because it's too crowded for conversation.
author: Lyndsey M.

description: Poke is great here. We ordered the Japanese rice bowl with poke, and that was great. The service was really good. We arrived right before closing time and they seated us patiently.
author: Mohammad m.

description: The crab salad is melt in your mouth. The sweet potato fries are crispy and prefects. Top it off with a nice selection of beers and boom you've got great weekend lunch spot. Service was also excellent , Jefferey took great care of us and we will be back
author: Stuart T.

description: Such a great spot! My friend and I sat outside which was so nice and the service was great too. I got a Hawaiian rice bowl with salmon which I highly recommend!
author: Ilana B.

description: Really flavorful dishes and great staff. Great location and cozy environment. Highly recommend the Poke Trio! The sweet potatoes fries and dipping sauces were awesome. You won't be disappointed.
author: Jeremy M.

description:
Great spot. Not far from Fishermans Wharf yet worlds away in the experience. Very friendly staff. Amber was fantastic and so nice to talk with. 

I had fish and chips with coconut shrimp and fried oysters. Add a cold Anchor Steam and you have the perfect SFO meal. 

Small place but a seat on the sidewalk out front adds to the ambience. Definite recommend
author: Paul M.

description:
We walked in on a Saturday afternoon to get some late lunch (~1:30pm) and the place next door tacolicious was PACKED. The wait for Pacific catch was about ~20 minutes and we were seated at the bar. 

We all ordered the taco combo (2 tacos with salad or fries) and it was Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaamazing. Seriously, the best sweet potato fries I've ever had and the BBQ salmon taco was so good. 

Instead of going to tacolicious come here to get your tacos...you won't be disappointed. The chefs are fun to watch from the bar and you can't beat the super fresh ingredients.
author: Molly S.

description: Great little place with a fabulous service and great quality food. You get a lot for what you pay for CANT WAIT to return
author: Samineh H.

description:
Thanks to Soo S. I was able to experience one of the best fish taco's and poke in town!  Her husband dropped us off to find parking couple blocks down from the restaurant.  This is a very busy area so parking can get tricky especially on the weekends.  The restaurant is very small and fits barely 20 people.  There is a dog friendly patio outside but that's limited to 6-8 seating.  However, it's worth the wait.  

The menu is quite interesting where you can order your choice of taco's but still be able to share a bowl of Hawaiian or Korean mixed rice bowl with a side of cilantro and hot sauce.  The dishes are very well prepared with fresh ingredients and there's something for all those picky diners.  

It was hard for me to decide between the sashimi bowl and their famous fish taco's.  If I could eat both, I would've ordered those two dishes!  Instead I have  decided to stick with what they were known for and also couldn't resist after looking at someone else bite into their fish taco.  

We ordered the poke and fried oysters as our appetizers.  It was a perfect start to calm our hungry growling tummies.  My three fish tacos came with either the sweet potato fries or the spicy fries.  I'm glad to have ordered their sweet potato fries!  Everything came out piping hot and very fresh.  

Too bad LA doesn't have a Pacific Catch.  I can understand and feel Michelle T.'s sadness that we both don't live closer to this restaurant!   Boo~~
author: Christy L.

description:
3.5 stars.

My bf and I were craving some fish and chips and came upon this place. The wait was short but the tables were so close our neighbors had to shift their table over so we could sit down. The food was decent. The shining star of the meal was definitely the sweet potato fries - they were nicely salted and perfectly crisp.

For tacos, we shared traditional cod and cabo shrimp. They were ok, I think you can get the same taste at other places. For fish and chips we got the mixed catch basket which had fish, shrimp, and oysters. The fish and shrimp tasted pretty good and I looove tartar sauce. I'm not a fan of oysters though, but that's just me.

The food was good but not amazing. It's worth visiting again if I'm back in SF and want a quick seafood bite.
author: Helen D.

description:
STICKY RIBS!!! I didn't believe how good my friends claimed these were until I tried them. But heaven in your mouth doesn't even do them justice. Just try them! 

Other than that I had the Mahi Mahi in the teriyaki bowl which was pretty big.
author: Jenn C.

description:
The first half of my time here was a little fuzzy because we had just come back from the SF Vintner's Market. We had initially intended to go to Tacolicious, but the wait was 45-50 mins, and there was no way I could wait that long to eat. This place looked promising, and I'm pleased to say that it didn't disappoint. 

We were seated right away since we opted for the bar area. My friend and I ordered the ahi tuna poke to share. It was good but just a little too much on the salty side for my taste. I then ordered two tacos, a mahi mahi and a chicken. Both were so tasty, but the mahi mahi was definitely my favorite! 

Glad Tacolicious was packed because this is a place I plan to come back to!
author: Karen G.

description:
Small interior but delicious foods. 

Wasabi bowl hitthe spot real good. Lots of fresh ingredients and good solid tuna poke. 

California poke was a bit different but good nonetheless. Comes with potato chips to smear the poke on. Good stuff.
author: Chai S.

description: Outstanding!  We each had a rice bowl.  I had the Hawaiian with mahi mahi.  My wife had the korean with shrimp. Excellent preparation,  freshness,  and flavor.  It's a short uber ride from the wharf.  Not many tables, so everything is spot on freshly prepared.  Very good service tops it off.
author: Tom F.

description: The dinner was perfect. Staff is hilarious and helpful. The Cabo Calamari appetizer was to die for: perfectly crispy, perfectly seasoned. The price point is not bad at all for the amount and quality of food you get! Will be back.
author: Jessica W.

description:
Yummy! Their food is awesome and creative. Came here with a friend for dinner on a weekend and had no problem getting a table, and we had great service! 

Lots of their dishes have avocado in them, so really how can you go wrong? I also recommend the sweet potato fries, cause everyone loves sweet potato fries and these are good ones at that.
author: Marilyn M.

description: Came here for lunch on a Saturday at the perfect time, was seated right away at the counter. It was cool being right there watching your food being prepared. I had the spicy ahi sandwich with sweet potato fries and my wife had chicken and shrimp tacos (separately). My tuna was seared nicely, sandwich was awesome. My wife who really doesn't like seafood loved her shrimp tacos. Also, for what we had the prices were better than expected. Will be back for sure.
author: Mike S.

description: I had rice bowl with crab salad. It was good and filling. The food was generally all good, but they have limited seating. Have to wait for a while to get seats. And the seats may be just by the door so it can get windy and cold. Otherwise its in a cute neighborhood so u can go around the shops nearby while waiting for the seats. They call you when your seats are ready.
author: Erika S.

description: Nice little joint. Fresh seafood , nice service, good food . Great place if you are looking for seafood.
author: Natalya V.

description:
I dont know how this place has a 4 star rating, but well i got tricked into it, i could tell that nothing like whats on the pictures looked alike what i had. This is a chain eating place (doesnt get to be a restaurant to me) i didnt know that, otherwise i wouldve never come here.

Had the FIVE Coconut fried shrimp with the Cajun fries and it was just a really OLD refried experience and on top of that they where over fried, my companion got the chicken tacos and well the tortilla came in to be almost broken and there was just 3 tiny strips of chicken and a bunch of greens. 

I came in on a Sunday early evening, place was half full, being a small place it was really tight to sit, but i dont argue that, what i argue its the awful food that those latino guys cook, that by the way will be talking all of bunch of bad words about anything in spanish, also annoying rocking tables.

And the service was half way, the was some gray hair dude that was really inattentive to what you tell him or ask for. There was other waitress that did look out but wasnt my waiter.

AVOID...it
author: Jipperster R.

description:
The menu's the same as at the Inner Sunset original (?), but the layout of this location's interior just throws everything off.  I understand that narrow storefronts don't offer a lot of options to restaurants with full kitchens, but why present everything as being identical when it's not?  Would it be as simple as calling this place Little Pacific Catch?  Maybe not, but we'll never know, because it feels like a bait-and-switch even though it might technically not be.  Or maybe a smaller menu would help?  Something just feels off about offering the full menu in a decidedly less than full dining room.

The service is fine, but a couple of the people who helped us were snarky.  I don't mind a little snark every now and then, but two servers in a row just tips the scales into Annoyingville, sadly.

If you haven't figured it out already, try the bigger Pacific Catch on Lincoln.  This one basically serves no purpose.
author: John S.

description:
Reasons why they're awesome:

1.  Staff is SO personable, nice, and thoughtful.  They often ask to bring out extra sauces, greet you like a friend, and never make you feel like a burden if you ask for something.  

2.  Sweet potato fries are amazing.  I crave them sometimes.

3.  Bowls are flavorful and filling.  Healthy variety of dishes.  BF loves the fish and chips. Tacos are legit too. 

Five stars for being a great neighborhood spot for two (since space is small).  I always leave happier than when I arrive :).
author: Amy G.

description:
This place is really tight and small but the service is friendly and fast.

My husband had the Opah which was served with sweet potato fries and grilled veggies.  The pepper butter for the grilled corn on the cob was really quite tasty.  My husband enjoyed his dish.  He thought the tomatillo salsa was delicious and that the sweet potato fries were the best he's ever had.

I, on the other hand, was quite disappointed with the Hawaiian Poke.  I understand it had a sesame-soy maranade but it was just way too salty, like super-salty.  I had to keep munching on the wonton crisps and take many sips of water to wash out the salty taste.  We were asked a couple times if everything was OK but I didn't want to complain about the saltiness.
author: Rose A.

description: Good concept, solid execution, delicious fish that's a bit light on salt and thus overall flavor. I tried the shrimp, mahi, chicken, poke & steak and they were all fresh - which is great. Maybe I'm spoiled by the fish tacos in Southern Caifornia, or maybe I'm a bit too salt(flavor)-reliant. Either way, the food was good, you won't feel guilty for eating there, but better spots exist. That said, in the Marina you probably won't find much better.
author: Evan L.

description: Delicious salmon chowder and fish and chips!  Located in the Marina area, parking was a bit challenging, but it was worth going around the block a few times.  The seating area inside is small, but there are seats at the bar and outside.  This was a definite find!
author: Joni P.

description:
I eat here way too much; its that good, and the service is so friendly.

If its your first time, get the Wasabi Poke Bowl. Just do it, you won't regret it.

I usually get it with double protein and half greens/half brown rice. They are always pretty fast too, which is great.

Only reason its not 5 stars is I usually find myself spending around $40 for one person, which is pretty darn pricey. But the fish i fresh and it tastes great, so doesn't bug me too much.
author: Alexander J.

description: Driven up to SF several times for lunch or dinner here.  Wasabi bowl with Hawaiian poke haunts me.  It is consistent, perfect and so well balanced.  Every time.  Best baja fish tacos, sweet potato fries and coconut shrimp too.  We love the staff.  Professional,  pleasant and always friendly.  Our favorite place in Lower Lombard area of the city.
author: Ray F.

description: Loved it! Great customer service. Steak and shrimp tacos were amazing. Only had to wait 10 minutes for seating on a Sunday at 6pm. :)
author: Sarah L.

description:
Extremely fresh, creative and delicious! Their dishes also tend to have room for personalization, which I appreciate.

After reading about the wasabi bowl in countless reviews, we decided to give it a try. You can select your protein over a generous bed of vegetables and avocado, and we opted for the hawaiian poke. The fish was bright red and juicy (very Instagram friendly) with a satisfying, not-too-tender texture. It was wonderfully seasoned with sesame and some kind of garlicy herb to add a finishing kick. Not quite like sashimi but still raw, it was unlike any other fish dish I had tried before! With the bowls, there are also options for having brown rice, and making the bowl 1/2 rice 1/2 salad. 

The three of us also ordered three tacos, which we were able to individually select. We tried the popcorn shrimp, steak, and grilled mahi mahi. These were so good!! They all had a salsa/guac base with slight variations depending on the meat. The steak was my favorite, followed by the slightly sweet popcorn shrimp. It's in the details, but I like how we were able to choose one of each taco to sample the different flavors-- many restaurants don't allow for this kind of flexibility. 

If you're into fresh seafood presented with interesting fusion flavors, I would definitely recommend making a trip up to the Marina just for this restaurant.
author: Angela H.

description:
I had this place bookmarked ever since my fiance brought up attending his friends' wedding in SF. We ended up dining in Pacific Catch over a reunion lunch with his ex co-worker and her date. We arrived around 12:30 and were luckily seated right away. There were only about 4 tables inside and 2 tables outdoor. The family who literally arrived behind us had to wait a good half hr and throughout our meal, there gathered a crowd waiting to be seated.

We were immediately given 2 small side dishes of *unshelled* edamame upon seating. Our waitress was quick in taking our order yet took her time in explaining the menu/special of the day. We ordered the two salads - seared ahi tuna and California poke, two taco trois - one with cod, carne asada, and salmon with regular fries, one with carne asada, salmon, and mahi mahi - with sweet potato fries. The food came out in no time and came in generous portion especially the salad! The veggies and the fish were extremely fresh in my salad. The wasabi dressing gave it a nice kick. I tried my fiance's sweet potato fries - crispy on the edges and lightly salted. Definitely no sauces needed. We were all impressed by this place and our lunch couple was amazed how they lived in SF for so long and have not heard of this place. They are definitely returning to try more items on the menu. What a great healthy satisfying meal, only wish we have something similar in the city!
author: Wing C.

description: terrible service, the fat white waiter guy is rude. this will be my last time to the restaurant. if they close in two years, i wont be surprise. the foods are over priced.I ate the poke they made, and I had diarrhea that day.
author: SynCity P.

description:
Small place but quick service and excellent food (especially when you are craving poke after having had a poke high in Hawaii!). My boyfriend and I started with a taco and a side of corn. Both were good.  

I ordered the Ahi poke wasabi rice bowl (amazing flavors -- couldn't get enough) and my boyfriend ordered the skirt steak bowl.

Would definitely come again for a rice bowl (and no need for anything else as the portion size is generous).
author: Siv L.

description:
Great atmosphere and even better food. Intimate gallery setting creates an interactive feel, and the food/portions were outstanding. 

The ahi tuna poke was mouth watering and the tacos were great. They let me mix and match the tacos rather than sticking to one type.
author: Mae W.

description: This was excellent.  We got rice bowls--mine with poke, his with crab salad.  We both ate the whole thing.  The price was reasonable and our waiter did a good job.  Next time, I'm getting the tacos--they looked amazing.
author: Erin M.

description: Overpriced but great presentation! The trio ahi was a bit fishy (aka not so fresh) and the beef teriyaki was lacking flavor. The sweet potato fries were really good tho! High price for small quantity and quality.
author: Wendy T.

description: Loved this place! We snuck in and sat at the bar. It was fun to watch all the fresh delicious food getting prepared. My teriyaki rice bowl with poke was my favorite meal from my trip to San Francisco (yes, the mix of hot and cold was weird but who cares it was delicious!) I will definitely be back on my next visit to the city.
author: Kayleigh S.

description: I was in San Francisco recently and my friends and I stumbled upon this place. It's a nice the in the wall spot. We came on a Sunday night and it was packed. There's only 4 tables and a bar. We were immediately greeted by this nice guy. We had fried calamari and mixed seafood platter for apps. I had the Korean bbq ribs for my entree. Prices were good and servings were big. Will come back when we visit SF again.
author: Harper B.

description:
Pacific Catch, I expected more out of ya...

Their original poke was meh. The chicken with rice was even more meh. The highlights of our meal were the avocado salad and fried oyster. 

Overpriced for what they serve. Not coming back.
author: Linh L.

description: Came here for a nice Sunday Lunch the other weekend. I've heard the name "Pacific Catch" over the years and wanted to try it out but every time I go to the Marina I end up at tacolicious, it was time to mix it up. The food here at PC is great! My friend and I had a combination of fish taco's and fries and everything was flawless. Pretty large portions for a seafood spot, we were definitely stuffed by the time we left. My only complaints are that the service could've been a little better (more attentive & chipper) and he outside seating was also pretty crammed compared the T-Lish next-door. Again those two things weren't a big deal especially with how great the food was.
author: Dan D.

description:
Certainly not as big as its Sunset location, but just as good.  I ALWAYS order the same two things:

Either a Sushi-grade Ahi Salad (except I substitute the Seared Ahi with Poke) OR the Pan Asian Rice Bowl (with Poke).  They are identical except one comes with more carbs because it's not a salad.  The great thing about the rice bowls is that you can also get brown rice instead of white rice.  Both will fill you up, but not weigh you down, which I love.

Sometimes it gets hard to choose between Tacolicious and Pacific Catch, but... both are great options if you're deciding between the two!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Wow, not very good.   I ordered the veggie salad with grilled ahi.  Sounded like a good idea cuz the list of veggies was great with sunflower sprouts, edamame beans, mixed lettuces, etc.   But the tuna was REALLY low grade.  And about half way through it was all CAKED with dressing.  Just caked.  Absolutely inedible, yet I didn't feel comfortable returning it because somehow the top half was not.  It's like there was POOL of a cup of a dressing at the bottom of the bowl.   

Never, ever again.  Even if you got the dressing on the side, something was really off here.  The salad itself including tax and tip was $19.  Omfg, not worth it to leave half.  (Waitress nice tho).
author: T S.

description: My mom and I stopped here for a late dinner. We had korean bbq bowl and hawaiian teriyaki bowl. The food wasn't bad but i think it's bit overpriced for what we get. The portion was big because there is too much rice. Not much meats. The service wasn't great either.
author: Jessie J.

description:
Had dinner here last time I was in SF - A salmon Asian bowl. 

Very friendly service, but the food was quite ordinary; it wasn't very well seasoned or well presented. Had to ask for Teriyaki sauce on the side just to get a little flavor into the dish. There is much better food to be had in this quarter in this price range.
