I sat at the bar, where I could watch the grill work...and the dishes being washed. Not exactly the best ambience. 

I'm not planning on going back.
author: BettyLou H.

description:
This place is tiny! It always amazes me how restaurants in San Francisco can make the smallest spaces work for them. Although it looked like there was no way we we were getting a table, there happened to be 2 small tables available for us.

We ordered some beers- I had the Bikini Blonde Lager which hit the spot. We also shared the corn crab chowder and it was superb!!! I highly recommend it. 

Although the place was packed our waitress never neglected us and she gave us great friendly service. 

Extra info: They were having a crab feast until Jan 13th. which happens annually.  Good to know for next year! I definitely recommend trying this place out but expect it to be crowded and to wait if you don't make a reservation.
author: Luci N.

description:
Chirashi poke was completely awesome. So fresh, so flavorful. 
The grilled salmon was also excellent. The shrimp stuffed eggplant was brilliant! 
The Pacific catch mai Tai was a bit weird. Got a spicy kick.
author: Viv B.

description:
I don't often give a five star rating, but really I couldn't think of any reason not to.

We arrived in SF the same day and just looked up "salads" and this came up. Fish sounded good to everyone. Sadly, on a Friday night, parking was a beast so we spent near 30 min trying to park.

Once we arrived we were seated almost immediately - good timing but for 6 people that was basically a miracle. I'm sure out hunt for parking helped.

Servers were attentive and appropriately attentive, so no unwanted hovering but our food arrived promptly and our water glasses stayed full. Our server was able to answer when I asked which fish were farmed and which wild caught.

Everyone was happy with their food. I ordered the three taco combo. I had one cod, one shrimp and one salmon taco. The cod was divine and both others were lovely, too. And they didn't skimp on the fish portions. The little corn tortillas really had to step up to hold all that goodness!

The cost wasn't cheap, about $39 tip and all for my baby and me.  But with the quality and service I think it was worth it. Not to mention, everyone left happy.
author: R Clark G.

description:
The food here is always excellent! It's been awhile since I lived in North beach and this great restaurant was only 1 bus ride away... Hawaiian poke bowl with sriracha... great ambiance with outdoor seating... what more can you ask for?

Whether you're a tourist or a native, make sure to eat at this place at least once... it's great for brunch if you're in the Marina often...

Oh but did I accidentally give this place a 1 star? 

Yepp I did... the male waiter with the shaved head has the MOST rotten attitude... he even scolded us for suggesting that we put our names down... we had to wait for 1.5 hours (which was worth the wait) to get a seat for 4 at this place, mind you, we were at Tacolicious having their unique drinks and enjoying ourselves... it was only 30 minutes after we had our first cocktails at Tacolicious that we came back and received the service of a female hostess/waitress that had the utmost demeanor and attitude... she not only took our names but asked for our number so that she can call us should there be a table available... we were NEXT DOOR, why the male waiter didn't think of this was beyond us (perhaps he forgot that he worked for the service industry and that perhaps smiling would be enjoyable for customers he's serving)! What delightful employees both our waitresses were...

ONE rotten apple CAN ruin your business... If I'm out with friends again and that same waiter was working there, my money goes to Tacolicious...
author: Nathan D.

description: The best fried fish tacos I have ever had! Anything fried is amazing... A little on the saltier side though for those that are picky and shesh!
author: Katie H.

description: I was in the area and wanted to eat something tasty and light.  I quickly found this spot and was very happy.  We ordered Poke and a bowl and enjoyed both.  I always like sitting at a bar watching over the kitchen. Great spot.
author: Ethan S.

description: Fabulous food!! Great menu with choices for both fish and meat lovers.  The  pokes were great we had Californian and Original which were so tasty and the kids had steak and chicken teriyaki dishes.  Good service as well. Oh and the beer and wine deals at Happy Hour makes this destination even more worth it.  Go there!
author: Sean B.

description:
Spicy Fries: SO MEH. Not worth it and didn't like the dip. 

Hawaiian Poke 3 ways: Not as good, smaller portioned, but more expensive than the poke bowl. Opt for the poke bowls instead.

Sea Bass Ceviche: Amazing! Their best ceviche out of all HANDS DOWN, I want to drink all the sauce that it is sitting in. Is that gross? It comes with these delicious purple potato chips. It is a special so unfortunately they don't have it all the time.

Tropical Shrimp Tacos: Also their best taco, the only one that is not breaded. 

BBQ shrimp tacos: No good at all. Avoid Avoid Avoid!!!

Creme Brulee Spring Rolls: They are surprisingly good and do not have the same skin as a spring roll. They tasted like sweet biscuits which went well with the ice cream and caramel. Yum.

Mochi balls: They bring out a couple mochi balls (vanilla and coffee) cut into quarters, with a side of fudge sauce (tastes like Mcdonalds fudge which I have zero problem with). It was unexciting but good nonetheless. 

Overall I'm giving a 3 because I was extremely disappointed with my shrimp tacos. I ate 1 out of 3 tacos, and it put me down $15. Everything else though was above average or very delicious. Make sure you choose your entrees wisely!
author: Jess C.

description: The vibe was relaxed. Super nice staff. I went at kind of late at night during the happy hour. I got the mixed platter which consisted of fried oyster, fried cod, and coconut shrimp. The shrimp was amazing. Cod didn't have much flavor and the oysters were kind of "fishy" tasting. The drinks were good though! I would go back to try the sushi.
author: Kelly W.

description: What an awesome find! Thanks Yelpers! I was in SF and needed a good place to eat. This place is small, have great service, and excellent food!!! We had the original Poke and Calamari for appetizers. My main course consisted of the two fish tacos (original and Mahi Mahi).. Good stuff! I plan to return!
author: Sergio C.

description:
LOVE this place!!!

I always get the wasabi bowl with hawaiian poke; the ahi tuna is soo delicious!  You can also order it with half salad half rice, and the salad dressing is super flavorful.

Bf tried the mahi mahi which also was really good, but of course I liked my poke bowl better!  Sweet potato fries are also delicious.
author: Cal C.

description:
The line at Tacolicious was insane.  So my friend and I went next door to Pacific Catch.

We started off the the ahi poke.  The dish overall was very salty.  I think it came from the wonton chips.  It didn't help that the marinade was soy-based, so I wasn't a fan of this ahi.

I ordered two tacos- Traditional Baja and the Mahi mahi.  Both were delicious, and my favorite was the mahi mahi.  The lime crema made the dish very flavorful.  And the sweet potato fries were yummy, too.
author: Vira P.

description: I've always enjoyed the food here, but recently they really went above and beyond. Last week, I had decided incredibly last minute to put in a catering order for same day pickup. In 45 minutes, Pacific Catch put together an amazing order for about 30 - 35 people. They're large catering rice bowls were a huge hit, jam packed with fresh, filling, delicious food. We ordered salads, edamame, and rice bowls (teriyaki chicken, ahi, and beef). They really pulled through without sacrificing quality, quantity or service leaving me and our office team impressed. Such a treat from the average catering work-lunch menu!
author: Lauren V.

description:
2.5 stars

Typical marina lunch place, truly nothing special. The space is very tiny and crammed, and the food is just ok. The poke had a lot of sauce on it and is served with a good mix of ingredients, which their target clientele probably like, but all together - the poke is probably comparable what you can get from Costco.  On a scale of 1 - 10 (with 1 being crappy cubes of meh fish and 10 being awesome Hawaiian poke), the poke here is probably a 4.  what bumped this down to a 2.5 from a 3 was that they served it with mushy rice.  Not a fan...

Probably wouldn't go back, but not completely unpleasant either.
author: Lisa H.

description:
I was actually disappointed when we arrived at Pacific Catch.  The place had a Baja Fresh vibe to it, not quite fast food but not full on restaurant either. 

I'm glad I gave it a fair shot.  It's a popular joint, so there was naturally a wait.  The servers were friendly and efficient, and they really make an effort to let you know that they want to find you a spot.

Aside from the friendly staff, the food was a pleasant surprise.  The ahi tuna was refreshing.  I had it on a bed of brown rice, with a side of seaweed salad and sliced avocado.  Very tasty. The fried salmon came crispy and warm, accompanied by a helping of sweet potato fries.  The fish was seasoned and cooked well.  Food came blazingly fast and I never had to flag down my server to ask for a refill.  The Hawaiian Poke appetizer was great, it complemented the crispy wonton crisps.  Prices were fair.
author: Angel S.

description:
Really delicious fresh fish.

Get the wasabi bowl with Hawaiian poke.
author: Patrick T.

description:
PACIFIC CATCH. HOW I LOVE YOU. for your beautiful fish. and small cute outside dining area. and the fact that you're a 15-20 minute walk away from me. and you're on cute little chestnut street where people watching is entertaining. 

I love pacific catch to death. i've been to this location about 10+ times. for lunch and dinner. 
+ happy hour prices are bomb. from 4-6 pm. used to come here after highschool with my bestfriend. haha. 
+ AHI TUNA TARTAR appetizer bomb. bomb bomb. 9$ regular price but they give you a ton of fish. comes with crispy wonton chips! 
+mahi mahi sandwich. 14$ super tasty, super fresh fish. 
+ i love their sweet potato fries with sweet chili sauce too! it comes with sweet chili sauce or wasabi mayo. not a wasabi fan so chili sauce it is! 
+shrimp ceviche. during happy hour about 6$. so fresh, can definitely taste the lime. 
yum: not too huge of a fan of their wasabi bowls cause they're pretty big. actually they're huge and i'm more of an appetizers person. 

this place is such a love of mine that anytime i have people outside of SF over i HAVE to take them here. guess what. they fall in love with pacific catch too.
author: Kayla O.

description: Loved the wasabi bowl at the location in the sunset.  Get it with that seared ahi, oh man.  This Marina location didn't disappoint.  Great quality ingredients and decent price for the quantity of food you get.  The service was good- i really liked that it seemed like they were excited about the food they serve
author: Charles C.

description: Great food! We sat at the bar and could watch them prepare our food. There were a lot of people, so it took a little while. Apparently they had accidentally made an extra serving of sweet potato fries and the waitress couldn't think of someone better to give them to since we were waiting for our food, hehe. I'm not into sweet potatoes, but I actually kinda liked their sweet potato fries!
author: NericePhotography L.

description:
O dear...my friend won a NYE meal holy beejezzus..so much food..ahhhhh

i had the salmon..it was good..jus not the crap on top of it..too much wine..didnt reduce too much..

the dumpling wasn't bad..flavorful..the ribs? HOLY SHIT they are good..yes they are THAT good..the ceviche was ok..I think i've had better..my friends dug the purple potato chips..that was eh to me..the chowder was really good..i enjoyed that the most out of all the apps..

everyone else had the sole special..it was mountain high and everyone had some 'soul' by the end of the nite..


dessert..omg..the brownie was good and i loved the ice cream..the ice cream (vanilla bean) was super good..the cream puff wasn't my fav..it had like cheese inside the phyllo dough..tho the baklava looking thing was really tasty..the almond honey cereal shot was HEAVEN...it was hecka good..the mochi ice cream (coffee flavor) was ok..it's jus mochi..it came in chocolate, coffee, and vanilla..

overall everyone was stuffed..i had the Riesling wine..and it was good..

what a night!
author: Minerva L.

description:
I got a take out from this place. Even though my order was messed up, i will still come to sit down and eat sometime later!

There is only 1 thing that you MUST order: Ahi tuna poke. I was craving for the fresh, lightly seasoned, chunky hawaiian ahi tuna poke, so i got a take out from this place! Even though its a take-out, the poke was pretty fresh and was exactly what I was craving for!

Other things i got along with the poke were not that impressive. Spicy tuna roll was just average

Will come back for the poke though!
author: Ruxin H.

description:
Something for everyone here. Love the tuna salad, sweet potato fries for the husband, and fish and rice bowl combos for the hungry college students we took to lunch. Have done take out multiple times and prefer that as the restaurant is really small. Love the one in the Sunset too.....that one is bigger and I recently I have been going at non busy times so it seems more spacious. Either branch is great.

 Good food, fish is ALWAYS fresh and the size of the plates are enough (unlike going out of sushi where I seem to have no off switch and keep ordering till someone needs to intervene.)
author: Dani K.

description: Huge rice bowl with lots of good stuff. I had the Japanese Wasabi one with poke and crab. Very good. Very fresh. Completely worth it. Took a while for someone to take our order and they forgot to add my extra order of crab, but they fixed both things pretty quickly. Would come back. Probably will.
author: Lucas C.

description:
I had never been here before and had no idea what kind of food it served (although I guess I assumed fish). I was in for a delicious surprise! My boyfriend suggested popping into this place while we were in the area, and he didn't know what it was either (other than, duh, fish). Backstory: we'd just gotten back from a trip to Maui a few days before.

What a treasure! I was missing all the delicious food back in Hawaii and Pacific Catch was the perfect place for my poke craving. I got the Ahi Poke Wasabi Bowl which apparently didn't have wasabi (awww) but had very fresh fish! So yummy! I could eat here every day. My boyfriend ordered the opah special and was served the salmon special instead, which he at first tried and then realized it wasn't opah. The server quickly solved the issue, but my boyfriend was a little bummed he'd brought up the error, since he decided he liked the salmon better than the opah.

The rice bowls have generous (and again, very fresh!) portions. You can also choose brown rice over white for no extra charge. I wish they had a Pacific Catch closer to my neighborhood so I could eat here more often!
author: Katie V.

description:
I love coming here for lunch.  For some reason, the food here is better than its other location in the Sunset.  My favorites include the Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl, Crispy Oyster Basket, Baja Tacos, Mahi Mahi Tacos, Cabo Shrimp Tacos, and sweet potato fries.  Everything is super-fresh, like eating from the waters couple blocks down...okay, maybe a lot cleaner than that.

Tip: Come early.  Not just because this place is small and fills up quickly, but it takes like 572,301 times to circle around for a parking spot in the Marina.
author: Ally W.

description:
Food and service is great.  The salad for 7 bucks I think they call starter was excellent. 
Tacos great. Coke is great too.
author: Mike M.

description:
This PC is tiny but fun. Some of the other ones are much bigger but I think it's fun to sit at the bar/counter. 

The rice Japanese Wasabi rice bowl with poke is really tasty...and it's a good size portion! Also the coconut shrimp starter is very good too. I've had the tacos which are good but I think the rice bowls are the best. I need to try the seared ahi sandwich many others were having- looked great.
author: Derek S.

description:
You'd better like raw onions!  Both of the bowls and pokes we ordered were onion bombs, even though onions are not listed in the ingredients.  
The lack of correct/complete info on the menu is the real problem - with such an overpowering taste it should be mentioned.  (Overpowering to those of us who don't like them).
All else about the food was very good, but we couldn't enjoy our meal.
We ordered via Postmates (all went very smoothly) so there was no way to return it or speak to them about it.
Not sure we'd order again.
Menus need to be updated/complete.
author: Ellen H.

description:
When the waitress comes out and asks "what would like to drink? we have coke, beer, wine, and some really delicious homemade lemonade", we obviously had to try this lemonade, as it was the only drink with positive glowing adjectives attached to it. hahah. And extremely delicious it was! 

Corn & crab chowder, Spicy mahi mahi sandiwch, and Hawaiian poke bowl were shared between the two of us for lunch, and needless to say, we were barely able to eat dinner later that night because lunch was so filling! Everything was amazingly flavorful and spectacularly tasty. The sweet potato fries: yes. The soy-wasabi sauce on the ahi tuna poke bowl: double yes. Such fresh ingredients and a non-oily, non-greasy feel makes you feel super good afterwards! :) 

highly recommended!
author: Tuwie N.

description: Had a great dinner at this restaurant- food was great and service was awesome!  Server Misael was the best!  Perfect way to unwind after a stressful day- thanks for take care of us so well Misael.
author: Rachel M.

description:
I hate long reviews, never get past the first paragraph - so here it is condensed.
Went into Pacific Catch in the Marina on a busy Saturday night. Chaotic busy, line out the door.  Our server Jeffrey offered the special, done. Food was amazing. It was an awesome sight to see how he had this crazy night totally under control. So attentive, but not overwhelming.  Top notch.  It was not by choice that I returned. The first time I was there the skinny redhead server was cold, non engaging, and quite frankly, gruff. At that time I had made up my mind that I would never return. 1 star. After my experience with Jeffrey - 5 star. If you see the redhead with the shaved head - keep on walking.
author: sharon t.

description: When you eat at a "nice" restaurant, you pay a premium for atmosphere. This location, however, is the size of a small fast-food joint, yet charges the same as a "nice" restaurant. Otherwise the food's decent.
author: Inigo M.

description:
We ordered from Pacific Catch for a group of us that had to stay late at work. We ordered the food around 6:30pm and were told the food would arrive at 7:30pm. 

When the food didn't arrive we called and they told us it wouldn't be much longer. Since it was would probably take another hour for another place to deliver, we decided to wait. 

Well, long story short the food didn't come until almost 9:30. Everything was soggy, including the sweet potato fries. And to be perfectly honest, none of the food was very flavorful. The Korean beef ribs were mediocre, as were the tacos. 

There was nothing redeeming about this place and their customer service was lame.
author: Tim S.

description:
Food: 
1) Crab/Cheese sandwich: Not a huge fan...the bread was too heavily buttered. The crab meat was pretty good (not imitation crab meat so yay!). I felt like it lacked some flavor though. For having such good quality of crab meat, it deserved a bolder flavor. It was a little bland for me. 
2) Shrimp ceviche: Really tasty! It was super sour! I  LOVE sour but I think it might have been even a bit too sour for me. But everything tasted amazing! The shrimp was really well flavored!

Ambiance: 
Small store front, with an even smaller interior. The kitchen takes up about 50% of the restaurant space, the rest of the space can hold a few tables and some bar space that lines the wall. You are eating elbow to elbow basically. Aside from it being incredibly SMALL, it has nice decor and furniture. Very rustic yet modern arty type feel. It's definitely in the hip category!

Service: 
Excellent! Really friendly and welcoming!

Price: 
Pretty pricey/fancy food. Be expected to dish out some dough for your food. 

Overall: 
I had a good dining experience and would love to come back to try other things on the menu.
author: Amiee H.

description: SUPER fresh food, cool atmosphere and great service. This place is perfect for a quick lunch after walking to visit the bridge views. Pleeease get the poke - anything with poke.
author: Kyle M.

description: Great food at a very reasonable price.   Have not been disappointed by anything I've ordered yet.   Fresh seafood and try the lemonade.
author: Chris B.

description: Stopped by here after hearing that they had the best seafood in the area. Our server was great, and clearly loved the food and his job. I ordered three of the tacos - Baja, shrimp and chicken (the server said they were his three faves) and my boyfriend ordered the Baja, mahi and shrimp. We heard Baja was the best, but personally my favorite was the shrimp. It had a delicious sauce on it, while the Baja was drier. The chicken was a bit too charred. The sweet potato fries were amazing though. They had two delicious dipping sauces - a creamy ginger dressing and a Thai almost marmalade. Our server accidentally opened an extra hard cider, and the place was closing soon so he gave it to me for free (I'd give him 5 stars if I could!). Great atmosphere - definitely a good place to give a try to. I've heard their salmon poke is excellent
author: Diana E.

description: Great ceviche and crab soup. The employees were first class. Very helpful and friendly to tourists. Loved it!
author: Kylan B.

description:
So delicious! I came with 3 friends on a Sunday night around 7:30PM and it was packed. This place is small, so be prepared to wait for a table if you don't want to sit at the bar. 

The food is fresh, flavorful, and relatively healthy. I had the 3 taco platter and chose to go with the mahi mahi, cod, and shrimp. All three were amazing! The tacos were loaded with pico de gallo and an avocado-tomatillo salsa that balanced the fish flavor perfectly. You also have a choice of a side salad or fries (which I've heard are very good as well). I opted for the salad. It was surprisingly good - definitely was not expecting that. 

The 3 tacos were really filling. I think I was only able to finish them because 1) they were delicious and 2) I was really hungry. 

My friends ordered the wasabi ahi bowl and really enjoyed it. Actually, all the menu items looked good. I will definitely be back to try the poke. 

Service was fast, efficient, and friendly.
author: Anna N.

description:
Atmosphere: 3/5 stars
Very small so make sure to get here semi-early if you want a table. They have outside seating too but if its windy it wouldn't be too enjoyable.

Service: 3/5 stars
Our server was very friendly but really busy so we had to flag him down a couple times in order to get any sauces, etc. Also I would have ordered another glass of wine if he asked but it sat empty for most of my meal.

Food: 5/5
Poke trio - by far best part of the meal. The trio comes with the ahi, crab, and the salmon/avacado. So fresh and delicious. Usually salmon is my favorite but the ahi tuna was perfectly firm, fresh and delicious. Definitely recommend.

Wasabi rice bowl: I subbed out the tuna poke for the salmon poke. I wish I would have gotten the tuna because there wasn't a whole lot of salmon but the flavor itself was delicious. I wish there would have been more seaweed salad and veggies in the bowl. When I was done eating the veggies and meat there was a 2 pound mound of rice left over, haha. Very filling and good  value though.

Overall delicious and I will definitely be back. My friend ordered the chicken tacos which also looked delicious. Next time I will get the ahi poke and try the tacos.
author: Jane B.

description:
This place is absolutely amazing! Now I understand why there is always a line to get in! 

The food is incredibly delicious and fresh! I had a fresh fish taco and grilled steak taco with salad! My son had a freshly fried chicken strips and fries and my mom had the Hawaiian Teriyaki mahi-mahi  rice bowl with pineapple! 

This place is small, a few tables inside and 3 tables outdoor! they do have a small outdoor heater for these chilly San Francisco nights! While waiting for our meal, we noticed a lot of take out going on! 

The waitress was extremely nice and took great care of us! Eating out with a 2 year is a challenge but she immediately brought out crayons and paper which kept Jameson entertained until our meal came! 

Can't wait to go back and try other items on the menu such as the fish and chips!
author: Stephanie M.

description: Oh my goodness is this place good.  I was in town for a conference last week, and while sightseeing near the Golden Gate bridge, my friend and I stumbled upon this little restaurant.  Man am I glad we did!  We both ordered different types of tacos, and they were all delicious.  We ordered off the happy hour menu so each taco was $3.  We also ordered the spicy fries, which are basically just seasoned fries, and they were were AMAZING!! I only wish this place was in Chicago so I could go back.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
Great service, big portions! We ordered the calamari appetizer and upon recommendation from the server, ordered one ahi poke wasabi bowl to share. The calamari was really crisp and tasty. Not oily at all. It also came with lemon tempura mixed with the calamari which was a tasty surprise! It kind of reminded me of the basil those boba places fry with crispy chicken. Tapioca Express anyone? The chipotle mayo sauce they provided with the calamari was too salty for our taste buds. The calamari was already seasoned so they tasted better w/out the sauce. 

The server was really cool and without us even asking, she split the ahi poke wasabi bowl into two separate bowls. I thought that was really thoughtful of her. And for $12, this was a really good deal. I loved the fresh combination of tuna, avocado, seaweed salad, and ginger on top of rice. I have to note, however, that we found the soy seasoning for the poke to be a little too salty as well. It soaked into the rice so most of our rice was salty and it was a kinda hard to finish. We did finish all the tuna and other toppings though!

I still want to give this place 4 stars because of its location as well as the quality and price of the food. And let's not forget the service!
author: Sue K.

description: We came in because they advertised here on Yelp as having gluten-free options although the menu is very limited. When I ordered, the GF options were not available so I had to sit and watch my family eat (unless I ate just appetizers and I didn't want that) The food isn't really all that plus there are no tables really, we had to sit at the counter. This is ok but you do get all the fried food stink right at you. Yum.
author: Yesenia C.

description:
One of my favorite dishes in the city: Wasabi poke bowl with brown rice and half salad!!! It always taste the same... fresh, flavorful, and so delicious :) 

I've ventured off a couple times and got other dishes but this is always my favorite. I'd recommend it to anyone who likes seaweed salad and ginger. These are 2 flavors in this dish that I think really stand out. Also, the wasabi has a kick so watch out for that! 

Another favorite is the sweet potato fries which somehow always have a perfect coating of embedded salt! A nice little appetizer before I munch on my poke bowl!!
author: Victoria L.

description:
I wish we had a place like this in Texas! I love the concept of an Asian-fusion rice bowl but many times restaurants fail to reach the full potential of having great selection.  Pacific Catch had just the right ingredients that meshed well together and everything was so fresh! 

The place has very limited seating and being so popular, it was hard finding a place to even sit down.  Eventually you will find a small table squeezed right next to someone else, a sure way to strike up conversation about what they are eating as well.  The service was good and our food came sooner than I expected which is always a nice surprise.

I tried the Japanese Wasabi with Ahi Tuna and Hawaiian Teriyaki with Grilled Chicken.  The Japanese Wasabi was definitely my favorite of the two and the Ahi Tuna was just absolute perfection.  The sweet potato fries were also tasty but the bowls definitely stole the spotlight.
author: Alice N.

description:
GET THE KOREAN STICKY RIBS 

They are seriously the best ribs my family and I have EVER eaten! Also, the Thai Coconut Shrimp are very delicious. The food was so good, GO HERE. 

Only downside is it can be difficult to park
author: Bethanie C.

description:
OK, I don't know if this place deserves five stars or not, but the wasabi poke bowl damn well does.  (I recently went to a restaurant in Huntington Beach, CA that serves ONLY poke bowls with various sauces.  Seriously.)   It's a bunch of perfectly textured raw poke with a perfectly seasonsed savory sauce, greens, and rice.  

Oh yeah, they have a massive menu with other fish items that people who don't use Yelp order for some reason.  Coming with friends, I had the fish of the day twice: once was meh and once was really good, like 4 stars.  But not wasabi poke bowl good.  I think I've made my point.

They also have pretty well known sweet potato fries.  Yes, sweet potato fries are kind of a thing now just about everywhere I go in the Bay area.  I don't know if PC are leaders or followers.  Whatevs.  Usually I like sweet potato fries, but they seemed somewhat incongruous here (and suddenly noticeably less healthy) next to the poke bowl.

Keep in mind the marina location is much MUCH smaller than the GG park location so seating is kind of hit and miss.
author: Aaron M.

description: I brought my in-laws from Mexico to visit the city and we came across Pacific Catch for a late lunch. The service was great. I liked that they took my number and called me when our table was ready. My in-laws had the shrimp, mahi mahi, and chicken tacos. They were all delicious. I had the crab salad, and it was to die for! The crab was fresh and the dressing made the salad come alive! I will definitely come back!
author: Victoria M.

description: OMG!!!! This place is amazing, the food was so fresh and delicious. The service was awesome! Highly recommended and will go again if I'm in town!
author: Wepiha T.

description:
Gets better each time I come here. Still can't believe a fast casual chain has the best fish I can remember. I regularly visit the one in the Marina for their salmon. If you like fish and haven't had the summer salmon salad from the wild salmon menu, you are missing out! 

Today I ordered ahead but somehow they lost the order - I get it, Sunday nights are really busy (really, any night, since this place is so great). I went 20 min later to pick up my food and since they didn't have it, they gave me free soda and assured me it would be right out. It only took ~5 min and they were so nice! Pac catch will continue to be a weekly ritual for me.
author: Jonathan K.

description: We had earned our lunch with a walk across the Golden Gate and back and were not at all disappointed. To start we shared the poke trio - terrific! My husband had cod tacos which were delicately battered. I had the wasabi rice bowl - the tuna was perfectly seared and the dressing was full of flavor. Tiny little place but well worth the sacrifice of personal space.
author: Sherri H.

description:
I visited Pacific Catch with my best friend last night and we were very impressed with the delicious food and great service we received!

I have been here once before and really enjoyed it, so I'm glad the bestie is into fish and wanted to come as well. We arrived 10 minutes after Happy Hour had ended :( but luckily there were a couple tables open, so no wait! Our cheerful waitress was very attentive and gave us our space at the same time, which was perfect. 

We ordered a carafe of chardonnay to drink (gives you two glasses each for half the price!!) and I ordered the ahi tuna bowl, half salad and half brown rice. If you don't want to have a ton of leftover rice at the end of the meal, you should definitely order your bowl this way. The tuna was very tender and everything was seasoned well in the bowl. My friend had their traditional and mahi-mahi tacos with sweet potato fries and was satisfied. She wasn't a fan of the breading on the traditional taco, but really loved the mahi-mahi taco!

Note: this restaurant serves FRESH and often times local seafood, so yes, you probably will be paying a little more for your meal than you would at a fast food chain. This is quality food, people!
author: Liz G.

description:
Really quick, friendly, attentive service. The portions were also way larger than i expected!  I only tried a couple things but I'm sure everything on the menu is really delicious! 

The space is on the small side but the tables turn fast so don't come here if you plan on chit chatting with your girlfriends or boyfriend all night long.
author: Clarice C.

description:
Awesome deal during happy hr b/t 3-6pm! You can't beat awesome generous portions of $3 sweet potatoe fries, a la carte tacos, & $6 hawaiian poke & cabo calamari! It was our first time here. We attended the yelp holiday party, and was able to try the awesome poke there. We were dying to check this place out, and having some more of the tuna. Even better, we received coupons for free poke at the yelp event. SCORE!!!

The huge chunks of tuna are to die for..and i could have a whole plate to myself. definitely must try here.

the place is real small & intimate. service was good. great spot for lunch if you're shopping on chestnut =)
author: Gina N.

description: Excellent steak tacos,mouth watering Fish & Chips! Decided to take the fam to San Fran (before the kids went back to school)umm,umm,umm- is all I can say,would recommend Pacific Catch,to anyone who craves good food!
author: T M.

description: Good environment, good service, mediocre food. Do NOT get the poke rice bowl. The rice to poke ratio was the worst I have ever seen. I had an entire bowl of rice leftover after I picked through the poke and the other somewhat good stuff.
author: Brian J.

description: Delicious hawaiian ahi salad!  Lots of food and the fresh seafood is worth the price.
author: Alex S.

description: Love love love them! Salmon tacos a-must-try, sweet potato fries, all kinds of rice bowls with fish. If we are in the area we always stop by here. Everything on the menu is tasty.
author: Svetlanko I.

description: Overrated :-/ We had high hopes for this restaurant and we're excited when we were told by our waiter that food is fresh (never frozen), and cooked to order (never left under warmers). That said, per our taste buds neither statement rang true with us. I ordered the Chef Special - Crispy bacon wrapped prawns w/ greens and quinoa salad. My husband ordered the Mixed Catch Basket. Both were okay - not good or great. The fry was overwhelming, not light and it overpowered the flavor of the food beneath. Food was served room temp and cold before we were halfway through. Sauces intended to offer "heat" or "spice" did not, and were disappointing. Service was attentive and quick and the table w/ open window to street was nice and created a feeling of space in an otherwise small, tight restaurant. Not a bad experience but the food wasn't good enough to bring us back for another try.
author: Corey R.

description: If you are looking for a great little place off the beaten path then check them out!! Totally known by the locals, as I saw lots of take out orders being filled. Place can only hold about 50 people but we got there early & had no problem. Happy hour is what I'd recommend. Big portions of poke & very quick service. Make sure you check in with yelp for free dessert! Get the spring rolls! You won't regret it.
author: Chrissy K.

description:
UPDATE

I've gotten delivery a few more times, and the food has been consistently better. I've avoided the poke, but the other dishes I've had have been great. The chipotle chicken salad has been my favorite so far.

ORIGINAL REVIEW BELOW

I was actually pretty disappointed with Pacific Catch. This is a delivery review for Caviar, so maybe the in-restaurant food is better. The actual logistics was great - food was well labeled and delivered on time.

I got the wasabi bowl with poke + extra tuna + extra seaweed salad (when work is paying, why not?). The seaweed salad, ginger, and avocado were all good. However, the daikon portion was not dressed so a bit flavorless and weird, the poke was really not high quality (it was decent but not great) and overly salted, and the ahi tuna again was OK without being great (it was pretty well cooked/seared, if a little dry, but the seasoning was lacking). Given that my meal was something like $22, I would have expected better. Oh well.
author: Rohan N.

description:
Fresh and tasty, good service, and decent prices! 

This place is usually busy, but we beat the rush by coming in at 6:15 on a Tuesday night.  We could've went somewhere else in the Marina that had a happy hour (Pacific Catch's ends at 6) but it was still sunny and warm and an open table outside, so we nabbed it.  

Luckily, PC just started a special on Tuesdays-- 1/2 priced bottles of wine! My sister and I ordered a bottle of Rose (normally $28 for $14) and it was quality wine.  Our waitress brought us a little dish of lima beans (which was good because we skipped on appetizers).  I ordered the 2 piece fish and chips for $10 (I'm from Wisconsin and we eat fried fish all the time) and my sister ordered the Hawaiian Poke bowl with brown rice for $15.  Our entrees came out within a reasonable time.

The food was great!  I ate everything on my plate-- the fish (some type of Cod) was not too deeply breaded, was tasty and not salty (like I sometimes get in Wisconsin).  My dish also came with a good slaw and delicious sweet potato fries.  My sister's dish was good too-- I tried her Poke (my first time) and it was a big serving (she had leftovers).  

I managed to save room for dessert and ordered a local caramel swirl ice cream for $3.  It was a good sized amount and I was able to finish it all myself.  

Definitely coming back!
author: Roya B.

description:
Wasabi poke bowl and happy hour woohoo! 

Yeah it's a small spot on chestnut but if you are ever around during happy hour this place is definitely worth going to! I have been going to Pacific Catch for years now and I still can't help but consistently order the same things. Everything is fresh and everything so far has been delicious. I still prefer the one off of Irving though only because I feel cramped in this location.
author: Jacqueline C.

description: I would say this is a 3.5/5 type of place.  I tried the Thai Coconut Shrimp.  Pretty basic coconut shrimp with some thai chili sauce.  The tacos were okay.  I got the baja and the cabo shrimp.  Finally I got the seared Ahi wasabi bowl.  It was good, not amazing.  I fish could be a bit fresher.  The service was great, people were friendly and attentive.  The fries were the best part of the meal.
author: Paul W.

description:
Small place and it was packed when we arrived on a Thursday at lunch time. I was excited to get their salmon poke bowl. Huge portion! I ended up giving it 3/5 because the rice was was not sushi rice. It was soggy and too soft. Disappointing. 
Hubby got their California salmon sandwich and he liked it. Simple and flavorful. 5/5
Kids got fish and chips. At hey enjoyed it, although the fish was a bit oily. 4/5
Overall it's a good place.
author: Cecilia C.

description: Could be my favorite meal ever! Definitely order the bowl - best combo.  Coming every time I come to SF!
author: Tahoe L.

description: I tried their regular Ahi Poké and sweet potato fries at the outside lands festival this past weekend and had to go back to the restaurant for more, it was so good!!! We tried the "California Poké" instead as we were feeling adventurous and honestly I wish I would have gotten what I came there for because I didn't really care for it...there was a lot of mayo and crab, it tasted just like a California roll minus the rice and seaweed. We also got the shrimp taco a la carte which I really liked on the happy hour menu. I recommend this place for the regular poké and the sweet potato fries 100%. The dipping sauces they bring with the fries are soooo tasty
author: Melina N.

description: I usually don't eat meat, but I ordered the Salmon Poke and it was great. The fish isn't fish-y, which means its super fresh! I also had a Hawaiian beer, which paired great with the meal!
author: Shaelyn W.

description: The Californian poke was fresh but overrated and this price should include rice or be an entree instead of it termed as an appetizer. The lemongrass iced tea was an unpleasant indescribable flavor (how I would imagine bud light to taste like). A meh experience but would recommend trying out The Sunset location as there is more space. You will be squished and the waiters (with nowhere to stand) walks constantly over you.
author: Nancy Y.

description: This is one of my favorite places to go in the Marina. Highly recommend the chicken and baja style fish tacos, some of the best I've ever had. Also the spicy french fries are great, ask for the chipotle aioli sauce on the side, perfect combination. I wish I could come here more often.
author: Josue V.

description: This is one of my favorite places. Their ahi bowl with half salad and half rice is just amazing. It's simple and delicious. It's also very reasonably priced for a huge bowl with ahi and all the accoutrements. Come in when they have half off bottle of wine night and you have the perfect little date night or girls night spot. They also let you put your name in and then go grab a drink somewhere on the block and will call you when your table is ready which is great if there's a bit of a wait.
author: Lily C.

description: Pacific Catch is a very reliable choice for service, quality of food, and atmospherics.  The location is great as well - right in downtown San Mateo.  The value of this restaurant starts with its interior - very good lightning, beautiful bar, fire place in the back, and is ideal for a date or even a casual dinner.  The is a wide variety of entrees on the menu ranging from Asian fusion to sea food.  The service is attentive and friendly.  I typically order the fish, but have also tried the Asian Fusion bowls which are great.  I have never been disappointed with the food.
author: Kevin O.

description:
I really like this little seafood place. The food is delicious, fresh and healthy with generous portions. The ahi tuna wasabi rice bowl is my favorite thing to order, with plenty of fish, good sushi rice, fresh dressed greens and pickled ginger. Meal sized-salads are great too, and the happy hour from 4-6 has good food deals, such as $3 tacos (normally $5). Poke is quite popular here, but overseasoned for my taste.

Pacific Catch is somewhere between a casual eatery and sit down restaurant, with a few tables, counter seating, and plenty of takeout orders. Perfect for eating alone at the bar with a glass of wine.
author: Cecilia L.

description: This place had the best seafood tacos ever! The combination of cabbage sauce and seafood was perfect. The fish was cooked right! Great dipping sauces. And sweet potato fries was a plus! The marina location was smaller than the one on 9th avenue but the food was still quality.
author: Marian P.

description:
I have been to both locations. Needless to say both locations are wonderful! Clean, fresh food, and served beautifully! 

Menu is simple but impressive!
Not pricy at all, just right!

Have to try this place it's fantastic! yum~
author: Mae M.

description: Oh my the poke was absolutely delicious. Came with brown rice . Seaweed salad, nori and avocado . I am so glad I finally got to try this place. It was a perfect lunch
author: Jay A.

description: We had a fabulous experience here! They accommodated our large group into their small space with ease and friendliness. Service was friendly and efficient. We never felt rushed, despite the restaurant being very busy and my group was taking up lots of their seats! Our food was phenomenal. Everything tastes fresh and flavorful. Baja tacos are a must have! Dessert took a little long to arrive, but our server advised it would be complimentary due to the extra time. Service at its best!
author: Kristi M.

description: This place is just solid. Food is good, servers are friendly, and an interesting menu. The lack of a 5th start is mostly because of ambience and it's not a super high end eatery, but for what it is no one does it better. I've never had anything I didn't like, and highly recommend the BBQ Salmon and Chicken tacos with the side salad, which was a pleasant surprise - instead of the typical wilted greens slathered in dressing, it was edamame and daikon with a delicious soy dressing. Both of the tacos were really delicious with interesting flavor profiles, and you can never go wrong with the Wasabe rice bowl.
author: Lance K.

description: Food has gone downhill. What happened? Calamari were soggy, the salmon shrinked, even missing some mushroom in the salad. This place used to be good. What happened???
author: J C.

description:
Came here after checking out bridesmaid dresses at Bella Bridesmaids. I wanted to check out Umami burger however my cousin didn't feel like having burgers so she found Pacific Catch down the street. 

We ordered shrimp ceviche cocktail and sweet potato fries appetizers to share. For my main, I ordered the japanese wasabi rice bowl with white rice and seared ahi tuna. The bowl looked extremely delicious but after taking my 4th and 5th bite, I lost my appetite. I'm not sure if it was the sweet potato fries or shrimp ceviche cocktail that got me full or the endless amount of rice towards the bottom of the bowl? The rice was also slightly undercooked as well. Otherwise service was great and attentive however I think they should expand this place. This particular Pacific Catch is tiny.
author: Jocelyn T.

description:
Seared ahi tuna sandwich...spicy fries...and a passion fruit iced tea.  That's one spectatular lunch!

Totally cute place on one of my favorite streets in the city, Chestnut.  Surrounded by all kids of great shops, bakeries, and other cafes -- this place offers some healthier items with fish, some chicken and even some beef -- salads, bowls, tacos, and sandwiches.  If you are feeling a little naughty for some fried stuff -- fish and chips -- and it looked so good.

Great, friendly service.  Small amount of tables (10ish inside, and 2-3 outside), still, I was able to get a great spot at 1230pm on a beautiful sunny Friday afternoon.

There's 4 locations in the city, hunt them out...it's quality food and well priced.
author: Randy B.

description: Really friendly staff, and flavourful food, especially considering everything we got was deep fried. We ordered the fish and chips and Mixed Catch Basket. The sea salt was a really nice touch.  If you sit at the bar you get dinner and a show with the open kitchen, warm too considering its 10°C outside, nice to see our food being made. It was a little odd having a waiter as well though, since the chef could have just passed it to us when he was done. Overall, very impressed what they have been able to pull of with maybe 12ft wide.
author: Cameron R.

description:
Food is fresh and delicious! Everything from tacos to salads to appetizers to fried whatever to sweet potato fries!

Very limited seats. Even if they don't have a line, they're usually packed.

Bring a jacket or maybe even an extra jacket in case you were lucky like me to sit in front of the door...at night...with the bone-numbing wind slicing through your flesh. 

Be ready to catch any falling objects during congested hours where people's butt cheeks are constantly brushing the side of the tables. I don't recommend trying to catch the soy sauce.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I have always loved the food at Pacific Catch and today I was really upset when I thought that I had gotten bad service, but I was wrong. 

I picked up my to go order and it was the wrong order. We drove all the way to the beach, walked out and found a nice picnic spot, and got comfortable before we figured it out so we were upset to have to turn around, but even more upset that we were tantalized by the contents of the bag that wasn't ours - 4 delicious poke appetizers. When I arrived the staff had my original order ready and told me I could keep the 4 poke apps they accidentally gave me. That more than made up for the mistake! I was pumped to start chowing down and a little mishap that had me grumbling turned into Poke Fest 2014 thanks to the staff at Pacific Catch. I was so excited I totally forgot about my hangover. There was even enough left over to give my homeless friend Wile E Coyote. 

The seared tuna salad was delicious. Mahi Mahi tacos were pretty decent. Those buttery chips that come with the poke app were really good.
author: David L.

description: Great place to eat! Complimentary edamame appetizer is always a plus. Got the salmon sandwich special with sweet potato fries and it was delicious. The boyfriend ordered the Hawaiian Poke bowl- you can order it all salad, rice, or half and half. All of the fish were fresh and delicious. We also checked into the business through Four Square and we received a complimentary dessert: Fried Dulce De Leche Spring Rolls. Satisfied from beginning to end.
author: Grace L.

description: First time eating here.. Hands down some of the best sea food tacos iv ever had, so fresh they taseted as if they where caught earlier that day
author: Chris R.

description: Seems very overpriced. I ordered the salmon poke, small order, no rice or chips and it was over $15. Not worth it.
author: Therese M.

description: My favorite place to go to whenever I'm craving for fish and chips! They are one of the best places that serves the best fish and chips in San Francisco. Yup, that's right...not kidding! I love their sweet potato fries too, always order them! The only thing I don't like about this place is I guess how small their restaurant is that sometimes the wait can take a while. So come here during the weekdays when there are less people in the area :)
author: Mia O.

description: One of the only fish places in the marina. Got the poke and it was so salty it was almost inedible. Also kind of expensive
author: Alex C.

description:
Was in the neighborhood doing a little shopping and decided I needed food. Two minutes reading Yelp reviews led me here.

Tiniest seating area I think I have ever seen. Six tables seating two people each, and that's it. We got crazy lucky and there happened to be a spot available. Tables are jammed together to the point that I could have quite reasonably reached across the table next to me and taken something from the table on the other side of them. Maybe not the kind of place to have any sort of private conversation.

Food was outstanding. Had the 3-piece fish and chips with the seasoned fries. Oh so good. 

Service was good. How could it not be? All six tables were in the space of a king-size mattress. Kind of hard to get forgotten. But friendly nonetheless. There were several people picking up takeout. I have a feeling that's pretty common. Folks know there is no way they will get a table so they order for pickup instead.

An excellent option if you are in the area. But nothing that really screamed "drive across town to eat here".

Four stars.
author: TJ P.

description:
Not bad not bad not bad!

Came here this weekend, and its a small little spot, but we squeezed in the back on the bench top like seats. Ordered a orginal crispy taco order with spicy fries, and a seared ahi rice plate with a bottled beer. 

Great fries. and the tacos were great. Lots of flavor and juicy fried fish was delightful. The seared ahi tuna wasnt for me but i tasted a piece of tuna and it was nice and fresh with a perfect sear. 

Id like to come to this place again.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
This was my regular spot about 5 years ago, and I recently stopped in to check it out again after all this time. 

The food was consistent as ever; the ahi salad was as fresh and filling as I remember. 

I went back a couple days later and tried the barbecue salmon sandwich - glad I did. It's my new favorite item, and I'll be back for it again soon. 

I have to knock off a star because of how ridiculously cramped the space is. I feel a bit bad for the staff having to navigate around such a small space, but they all seem to keep a good attitude and maintain excellent customer service.
author: Don T.

description:
Geez, what isn't tasty here? I had such a hard time choosing a lunch item. But I went with one the signature sandwiches, Spicy Ahi with Spicy Fries. Yummy! Next time I might try the fries plain or sweet potato.  Another friend had an iphone and got a free dessert via FourSquare and our group ordered the Mochi Fondue. It was okay, the melted chocolate was good but I would have preferred other mochi ice cream flavors.  

Service was excellent and friendly. 8)
author: Jen K.

description: Food was delicious, service was great......wish I had time.....got to go order .....but, would of been nice.....definitely will be back to this place
author: Yvonne V.

description: Love the food here! So far I've had fish & ships, a crab melt, and a ahi sandwich which were all very tasty. I recommend this place for anyone craving seafood because this place will surely hit the spot!
author: Robbie P.

description:
Came here for Father's day with the family and loved it! 

The place is kind of small and I can see how there could be a wait. But, we were lucky and got there for an early dinner with no wait! The fish here is fresh and delicious - for a reasonable price too! 

We had the poke appetizer (yum!!); sticky short ribs rice bowl; ahi grade salad; mahi mahi tacos; sweet potato french fries (DROOL) and the special for the day (grilled ono).  The portions were perfect and everything was  so flavorful. I'm definitely coming back here.
author: Michele P.

description:
A worthy catch in my book.

As a hungry first timer I wanted something filling, so I went straight to their Pan Asian-Rice Bowl section of the menu. Each rice bowl is prepared in one of three styles: Japanese Wasabi (sushi inspired), Hawaiian Teriyaki (sweet & tangy) and/or Korean BBQ (korean cuisine).

I went with the Japanese Wasabi and opted for the healthier brown rice. The Seared Ahi caught my eye (slightly raw tuna) and chose that as my meat.

I was taking it to-go and ordered a couple more things. Their sweet potatoes fries as an appetizer and two desserts items, which I got for free because it was my first time checking in with Foursquare (such a sweet deal).

The rice bowl was AMAZING! They mixed the rice in a soy-wasabi sauce which complimented the Seared Ahi quite nicely. It tasted subtly spicy and rather healthy. The filling portion was large and also included wakame salad, avocado, sprouts, daikon salad, ginger, sesame seeds and shredded nori. As a to-go order this was all spread out on a wide and recyclable paper plate.

The sweet potato fries were pretty addicting but what I became of fan of was their Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls". It tasted like fried heaven! At first glance it looks like a largely lumpia or fried egg roll, but once you bite into it you'll receive the sweet flavor of vanilla cheesecake & caramel sauce. They even give you extra caramel sauce on the side if you want some more sweet dipping action. The second dessert item I got was their lychee ice cream. It was nothing special, but I hear they change their flavors every month.

I enjoyed this all in the comfort of my apartment. It's a good spot to grab dinner on the go as long as you call ahead of time. This location is small but looks cozy. Maybe I'll sit in next time.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Service was great!  I was debating between the 'classic' and the Californian poke and the waitress gave me a small sample to taste and compare.  

Ended up getting the classic (didn't like the flavor of the Californian though it sounded good on paper).  Great seasoning and generous portion size.  Perfect for a healthy post-run lunch!  Well... healthy-ish (considering the fried wonton chips on the side).  :P
author: Christine C.

description:
My order:
1) Hawaiian Teriyaki with grilled Mahi Mahi
2) Japanese Wasabi with Hawaiian Poke

SO GOOD! The food came out perfectly cooked. The flavors, amazing. The right amount of this-n-that to keep each bite interesting. This particular one was pretty small but we were seated right away. Sat at the bar, which is always fun, watching the cooks do their thang. Staff -- very nice & accommodating.

OH AND!: half off bottles of wine every Tuesdays for you thirsty h*es! heh

Def a five star spot, definitely will be coming back. Plus, its located in the marina -- nice for an after-lunch stroll either along the street where the shops are -- or at the marina, duh!
author: Thy N.

description:
Although i wanted to love it, I didn't. Perhaps it was an off night.

Looking at the menu, it was exactly what I was craving. Some healthy fish options. Hawaiian poke in a pan-asian bowl served wasabi style? Yes please. It looked prettier than it tasted. The brown rice was over cooked and the vegetables were over-seasoned. The poke was a good consistency but slightly on the salty side. I am a huge fan of poke bowls but perhaps I will have to try something else here or go to a different location because I was definitely underwhelmed.

My advice is to only come if you have a small party and if you have a hankering for fish. It is good but not in the realm of great (at least on my first visit). A lot of potential though.
author: Diana Y.

description: The food here is absolutely tasty and amazing. My husband and I came here for bunch before leaving San Francisco definitely a place we would love to come back to when visiting. Highly recommended. The place is small but they also offer seating outside but again there's not much space. I think the food makes up for it :) it was seasoned perfectly and my husband even like my dish he ordered a cocktail on accident he was expecting a big portion of fish so he finish his cocktail and said next time he's going to order what I ordered.
author: Malina H.

description:
Love love love this place! My boyfriend and I come here often when we're looking for a fresh and quick bite. We always share a coconut shrimp appetizer, he'll get the fish and chips with sweet potato fries, I either go for the fried oyster basket with a side of salad (lovely wasabi dressing) or the ahi poke salad. 

Uber refreshing, a lovely haven in the midst of expensive Marina eats. Not that it's cheap or anything, but the food is worth its price. Perfect alternative to sandwiches and pizza when you need a casual dinner. 

Oh - and unlimited refill for thai ice tea!!
author: Fiona S.

description:
Food is fantastic, but the lady at the table next to is with her shoes on the floor and her bare feet on the chair is disgusting. I'm
Surprised none of the staff hasn't said something. It's a bit distasteful... 


About the food! Delicious, fresh and always great! I love their salads... Giant... Filling and they melt in your mouth. Their staff is phenomenal, kind and helpful.
author: Adyson S.

description:
My friend and I were in the Marina area to stop by Brandy Melville and stumbled upon this little joint. We walked away smiling with our bellies full! It was a great experience! We loved the complimentary edamame appetizer in the beginning. We ordered the wasabi rice bowl with poke. Absolutely delicious. Before we ordered we asked our waiter if it was big enough to split and he was honest and said yes! They even split it into separate bowls for us. We also ordered the sweet potato fries. Don't know if we were just hungry but they were amazing. Could be in part to the sauces that accompanied them. We also received dessert on the house from Four Square. Deep fried cheesecake 'eggrolls'. 

All in all an amazing lunch. Clean, fast, delicious!
author: Linda Z.

description: I really wanted to like this place but there is nothing exciting about it and that's it. We were visiting the area and wanted something fresh and modern and that's why we gave Pacific Catch a try. First of all, the service is friendly. Menu is boring. Food is ok but nothing to write home about. And let me tell you about the decor and ambience. If I could give negative points for that I would. There is nothing distinctive nor exciting about being inside this place. You can't tell where you are. Everything is generic and drab. I don't know why I would take my time eating my meal here because I'd rather do take out and be eating in my car.
author: Denise B.

description:
14.08.21     visited half dozen times in est 8 years
                   Eat and run review

Food ------------------- 4
Place -----------------   2 super cramp ... I here for the food

Pro:
    Solid food
    Reasonable price.
    Good service
    Shrimp was super fresh (clean snap when u chew into it!)
    Very fresh fish
    One of my favorite "bread and butter" seafood place 

Con:
    Cramp
    Popular therefore ... u have to wait
author: S.K. Y.

description: Amazing cosy restaurant for seafood lovers! I tried the Japanese Wasabi bowl with grilled salmon, and it was both delicious and filling. Only thing I would recommend is adding raw tuna instead of the salmon, I feel that it would be a better combination. Right on Chestnut street in the Marina, you can find yourself in the "Over the Moon" creamery minutes later for a mouthwatering ice cream!
author: Raya K.

description:
The ahi poke bowl was tasty with very decent portion. I loved the avocado and the loads of veggie they put inside, very fresh and flavorful! Their drinks were delicious as well, loved the mojitos. 

Service was friendly, but slow since they were busy. Would definitely come back if I'm in the area.
author: Becky W.

description:
I had really high hopes for this restaurant going in. When we got in we were ignored for an awkward amount of time, we had to ask if we could sit down. 

We had the sticky ribs as an app and they were amazing, some of the best ribs I've ever had. Ribs were really tender with a really unique sauce.

For entree we had a salmon teriyaki bowl and fresh catch basket. The bowl had way too much rice and not enough sauce. The basket was overly breaded and too deep fried. They should get rid of this item, it just can't live up.

The service was even more of a let-down. Our waitress was border-line rude and very impatient. The service definitely totally took away from the experience of the restaurant. Another big let down for this spot being so highly rated.

This place didn't live up to the hype, but hey maybe I hit it on an off night. Hopefully you'll have better luck!
author: Timothy H.

description: This place is hands down amazing. The menu isn't overloaded, and the meals are just outstanding. They use fresh oil every day, and you can taste it. Very fresh fish, great bowls, great fried stuff. Could go twice a day.
author: Stefan S.

description:
HOLY SH**T!!  Best-anything-on-the-menu!
Could not have been more impressed!
tuna poke app was incredible and huge portion- definitely want to share it
sweet potato fries we ordered based on everyone's rave reviews but they weren't that special- just regular sweet potato fries- the dipping sauces were great though.
BBQ salmon sandwich was incredible- the side salad and asian slow was delicious!
The grilled mahi teriyaki rice bowl was amazing!!!
The servers were so nice and split everything in half for me and my boyfriend- the portions were really generous that even though we split everything it was a ton!!
Dont walk- run here!
author: Dena R.

description:
I love this place!

I've been here a few times and it's always a treat, so I don't know why I haven't written a review yet.

My b/f & I went to Pacific Catch over the weekend (it's the one thing we both look forward to when we visit Chestnut St.), and ordered the Hawaiian poke, which I'm pretty much obsessed with, and the ceviche, which now I'm more obsessed with than the poke.  The b/f got the edamame.  Simple, but a lot of places get it wrong.  Pacific Catch was not one of them.

I've also had the fish & shrimp tacos here before.  Not the best I've ever had, but pretty good.

Fresh & delicious, what more can I ask for?  & Friendly service +++

We sit at the bar, but there are a few tables in the restaurant.  I wish we had one in LA!
author: Grace C.

description: I was having a major craving for fish tacos and we decided to try Pacific Catch. I got 2 tacos: the Baja and the grilled Mahi Mahi. Both were very good. The spicy fries are a must! My husband got the fish and chips and the fish was crunchy and we'll seasoned. Also service was great, we sat in the bar area which overlooked the grilling action. Would definitely go back.
author: Samar S.

description:
I was very sad to say but nothing that I tried here was good! All the tacos fish and shrimp were cold cold cold. Coconut shrimp over cooked. Hawaiian ckn bowl over priced and nothing special. Sticky ribs were ok just ok. 
I will not return
author: Joannah P.

description:
Absolutely yummy, decently priced and I will eat here more!  We went to the location near Fillmore and the Marina

The menu is varied for a medium size menu.  My spouse and I both had pan asian rice bowls.  He had the Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl and I had the Seared Tuna.  His was really tasty and mine was even better!  The bowls had a two types of seaweed: dry and a nice seaweed salad as well as some incredible sauce.  I was also able to have half rice and half greens in mine!  Everything was incredibly complimentary and I have a new place to add to my top favorites! It would not be good for a crowd as this place is not the largest.  Service was excellent too!
author: Courtney B.

description:
This place has awesome, extremely fresh food! I have been back twice in one week and can't stop thinking about this place. Most people talk about the restaurant next door, but this is the gem they should go to. The food is flavorful, but very clean and fresh. The portions are hearty enough to not leave you hungry, but the food isn't heavy at all.

I love the Ahi tuna Salad, the California Roll Salad, the Hawaiian Poke the sweet potato fries, and the Spicy Mahi Mahi sandwich.
author: Mina E.

description: Treated poorly & told to leave for no reason by the manager after quietly waiting for a table for 10 minutes. I simply asked about a couple of empty tables & counter spots. Reported to their headquarters & got a rapid response saying they'd look into it. This was last night @ 9pm. Never a problem @ the 9th Avenue location & treated with respect there. This is my 1st & only Yelp review.
author: Sue C.

description: This is my first time at Pacific Catch. It was highly recommend by a friend. My friends and I arrived for a late lunch, (4 of us) it was completely packed. We waited about 15-20 mins. We sat outside and the waiter (don't remember his name) was awesome! He was friendly and attentive to our table. The drinks, appetizers, food came out super fast! Don't think we waited more than 10 mins. Food was awesome! We ordered the Calamari, it was battered just perfect. We also had the fried oyster basket with seasoned fries. The oysters were delicious! It came with 3 dipping sauce. My girlfriend and I shared the Wasabi bowl with seared ahi tuna and brown rice. It was so goood!! Everything was done just right. The portion was huge, plenty of food for the two of us. Overall, first time experience was fantastic. Next time we visit Marina area I will definitely be stopping by.
author: Judy L.

description: Got the crab and corn chowder and grilled salmon from British Colombia. Both were really good. Not a lot of crab in the soup but it was still tasty. The avocado-tomatillo sauce that came with the salmon was awesome, and the fish wasn't overcooked or dry. A little heavy on the seasoning but I still enjoyed it.
author: Brianna C.

description: Lots of excellent Yelp reviews brought us here. A friend was in town; with a severe allergy to corn he has to be really careful about restaurant food. Pacific Catch was able to accomodate him with little difficulty. The wasabi rice bowl was very filling for lunch. The gilled veggie side dish consisted of three corn pieces, which was a bit disappointing, especially for the friend. We were served quickly, the servers were friendly. There were other more adventuresome dishes on the menu that I'll be checking out!
author: Art H.

description: Unusual and interesting plates! Vary tasty! The service was great!
author: Loukas P.

description: Great place for a ahi poke best tip is to sit outside or in small dining area the bar area is very cramped and service is mostly from the side with very little room to get by I sat at the bar by the grill and could feel the best from the grill
author: Jason L.

description: Excellent food and outstanding service! We are going to miss eating at Pacific Catch on Chestnut in the Marina. We are relocating to Southern California & hoping Pacific Catch location is open there someday.
author: Marlo F.

description: Small place but was seated much faster than I expected. Ordered fish tacos - absolutely delicious! Very kind staff.
author: Julia J.

description:
Decent happy hour! Small food menu at good prices!

We got beers and the California Style Poke and the shrimp ceviche. Both were really good, but I'm still dreaming about that Poke. I could have eaten 3 bowls of it.

I may be back for another HH just for that. Dinner menu looked a bit overpriced.
author: Haley J.

description:
I fell in love with this place...

Especially its Teriyaki Rice Bowl with steak. It is absolutely filling and delicious. 

The service is super fast and friendly. Good for a quick lunch!
author: Monique T.

description: Just get the wasabi rice bowl with poke and don't look back
author: Andrew K.

description:
Great vibe, delicious food, super service with a smile, on the 'happening street..Chestnut.
Go! enjoy the fun.  Had the Rice bowl and was enough for three meals.  Sooo good. and the prices are very fair.
author: Susan M.

description:
My boyfriend and I wanted a quick, easy, and reasonably healthy dinner in a timely manner in the middle of the week. Some of his coworker's had mentioned Pacific Catch was worth checking out. We've lived in the Marina for 3 years now, and had never been.

We walked in around 6:30 pm and barely beat the rush. We sat at the counter and overlooked the small, open kitchen. (This place is super tiny!)

I ordered the Mahi Mahi Hawaiian bowl, and he ordered a salad. He LOVED his salad (not that I can remember what it was)... We also split a side of brussel sprouts- and while flavorful, they were a little spicy for my taste.

The Hawaiian bowl, however, was delicious! My ONLY complaint is the fish to rice ratio. Next time I want a double order of Mahi Mahi and a half order of the rice!

If I'm in need of a quick bite, I'll totally be back.
author: Annalise F.

description: This pacific catch is alot smaller than the one on Irving street, with slight differences. This one didn't give the edamame and goldfish appetizer, and didn't have sushi on the menu. The food was overall very good, but it gets VERY crowded.
author: Y R.

description:
Is this a chain, because it certainly feels that way!

The food was good tasting, but not mind blowing...but good enough to go back...

but regardless of good tasting food..the price point simply did not match.  I see people mentioning large portions..and perhaps I just ordered the wrong thing...but did not get a large portion nor did I enjoy the (i think it was) 4 dollar miso soup.
author: Red R.

description:
I have overwhelming love for the Pacific Catch in the Inner Sunset - so I figured it was time to visit their original location.

Unlike the huge Inner Sunset locale, this place is incredibly tiny and it's understandable why they don't take reservations, especially considering how popular this place is.

While both locations are casual - this particular location  - seems to be even more so - evidenced by the array of food  - left by some kids - underneath our table - before we even sat down. The lady seating us - pointed it out - and yet still sat us down. A little strange  - but with such cramped quarters in this intimate space- we all just felt lucky to even be able to secure a table.

Our meal and the service was extremely smooth throughout the night. I ordered my usual - a salmon wasabi bowl with brown rice. The portion, like in the past, was massive and the salmon was cooked perfectly with an array of fresh veggies and a delicious sweet wasabi sauce. 

We also ordered the classic dessert winner - the dulce de leche spring rolls - which, I definitely recommend sharing with someone. Light crispy rolls filled with cheese-cake like filling and drizzled with caramel sauce.

Pacific Catch is wonderful. They offer up fresh, affordable and healthy dishes. But given the choice - of this location and the Inner Sunset location - I would definitely advocate for the Inner Sunset venue. You can usually always be seated quickly, you don't have to worry about your seat being knocked by people trying to squeeze by it, and it just has a classier feel about it.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I was craving a salad, and Pacific Catch seemed a better choice for that than Thai or Italian. 

The ahi tuna in my Sushi Grade Ahi salad was perfectly seared, and there was just enough of it. The soy-wasabi vinaigrette dressing was perfect -- the salad wasn't drowning in it as it often can be. I'm not sure I've ever had fresh ginger in a salad before, but it created a nice contrast with the ahi and the vinaigrette.

My dinner date was quite happy with his linc (ling?) cod special, fresh from Monterey Bay. 

Our server was adorable -- friendly and helpful.  (It turns out I'm the first person who's ever guessed she was from Romania, lol.) She suggested a lovely Chardonnay that we were both happy with.

The french press decaf after dinner was amazing. Even my dinner date, who rarely drinks coffee, was captivated by the aroma, and joined me for a cup. :-)
author: Holly N.

description: Went here for dinner and had a Japanese Wasabi bowl with Tuna.  It was awesome!! But let me start over. We had a shrimp ceviche for an appetizer and I was ready to drink the juices - it was that tasty.  Then for dinner I had the rice bowl and if I have any complaints it's that I wish there was more tuna and more avacado!  Add to that the friendly and prompt staff and this place is a must visit.
author: Nicole B.

description: I was really excited to eat here with the multiple review sites that said it was great.  I had the seared mahi mahi appetizer which was ok. I also had the mahi mahi poke which i couldn't even eat Way too much sauce! I felt sick after a few bites. My 3 year old son eats everything and he wouldn't even eat my wife's fish taco with the cod. Don't get the spicy fries they are not spicy just drenched in salt. The service was actually great the waitress was very friendly and so nice to us and our children.
author: John S.

description:
Rude! I called to make a reservation because I was going to dinner with my parents, who are old and can't walk much. The guy said all of the tables were open and they'd been slow, so come on down. We walked the literally 1 block between my apartment and the restaurant, only to find all of the tables taken and a 30-minute wait. At that point, I was already angry, but the lady said I could leave my number and they'd call when a table opened and then they'd hold the table. Why didn't they just hold a table when I called 5 minutes ago? Worst of all, they never called! What jerks. 

I used to get take out here all the time but will never be back after such a rude encounter. 

Seriously, with a place that only has 3 inside tables, they should take reservations, or at least hold a table when you call ahead.
author: Jamon B.

description:
This is the best poke I have ever had!

We got the poke trio - three different preparations of poke. Absolutely amazing.

Then we had the poke bowl. Very traditional poke taste, but amazing none the less.

We also had the fish and chips with the sweet potato fries with the spicy seasoning. The fish had a nice, crisp breading. The tartar sauce was creamy, oniony, garlicy, and just such a great compliment to the fish!

I ate sooooo much, but no regrets.

The person next to me had the tacos, and they looked amazing. I will be coming back to try those!
author: Eric C.

description: My husband and I had take out last night. And as always, the food is amazing. I love how quickly they prepare the food (10-15 minutes) and they do such a great job making the food look so appetizing even when it's in a plastic to go box. Our favorites: ahi tuna poke appetizer, ahi tuna poke salad and ahi tuna poke wasabi bowl. So yummy that it's a great Sunday take out dinner to finish off the weekend! :)
author: Kyoko T.

description: Shrimp and baja tacos were good. Steak rice bowl was meh. Service was so so. Don't go late.
author: Michael A.

description:
Came here on a whim with a friend one night (who had previously eaten here before) after searching up and down Chestnut Street for a decent place to eat. I checked out the menu and we agreed to hang out here for the night.

The venue is SMALL. Like...don't talk about dirty things at the dinner table because the people next to you can hear you small. I think this place can accomodate about 25-30 people safely and that MIGHT be an exaggeration.

After waiting about 10 minutes we were seated at the counter. I Would have preferred a table, but at this point, I'm not being picky.

Menu was a little all over the place for me. Didn't see anything that really stood out and ended up ordering the Coconut Shrimp with a side of coleslaw. It was okay. A lot of shrimp for the buck. Accompanying slaw was pretty legit also. Nothing mouth dropping, but enjoyable.

Also, someone should consider taking a couple of the stools from the counter area. I found myself constantly nudging the girl on my right and I'm pretty sure she thought I was trying to start a fight with her, haha.

Final verdict, enjoyed the meal but definitely won't need to come back here anytime soon.
author: Trav M.

description: Great seafood. Really really great. Reasonable prices. Efficient service. Tiny. Crowded. Worth it.
author: Mark M.

description:
