Not exactly cheap considering it's a small place with so-so service but the food was very fresh and tasty so I'll round up my 3.5 stars to a 4.

I loved the wasabi bowl with Poke! Very high quality and good portions, the perfect breakfast for me :)
author: Christopher Steven O.

description:
Reminds me of Bear Flag Fish Co. in Newport Beach. Slightly different menu, but the same concept: dishes with fresh fish and vegetables. Pretty yummy! 

The sweet potato fried were ok, but I've had better at other places. 

Oh their mochi was tasty too, AND it comes with warm chocolate sauce to dip in!
author: Martina M.

description: WOW - this place is awesome! I placed an online order using Caviar for delivery to my office. Everyone loved it! I ordered the Hawaiian Ahi Poke Salad and Spicy Tuna roll. One of my coworkers ordered fish tacos and spicy french fries...DELISH! When the food arrived, everything was super fresh and in perfect condition. This totally surpasses some of the crappy lunch options available in the FiDi! I'm a total fan! Can't wait to make my next order:)
author: Krystal C.

description: Amazing food Ceviche was so good. Our server Jeffrey was great he made our visit so much fun and memorable.
author: AugustanScott R.

description:
We rolled in for dinner around 8 p.m., and this place was packed! In typical San Francisco style, the outdoor seating was dine at your own risk, as the night was getting chilly and there was no other source of heat. We decided it was better to just do take out than try to sit 6 inches away from a neighboring table.

I had the Hawaiian Mahi Mahi Teryaki bowl and the boyfriend had the steak tacos. Everything was still warm after our walk home, and we only had to wait 20 minutes in a crowded area! I've worked in the service industry for years, so I recognized a crazy rush as soon as we walked in, so I wasn't expecting any type of fast service, but this was exceptional! Mine was enough portions to have lunch the next day! The menu was definitely different, and we both loved our entrees! I hope to catch it at a different time so we can dine in, as they have a decent sized bar as well!
author: Megan H.

description: i been searching for a rice bowl like the ones they serve here for a while now and i finally found it. A+ it was really filling i couldnt finish the whole thing. only problem i had was it was a little on the pricey side but the taste makes it worth it..
author: Donnae K.

description:
I go for the tuna salad whenever I'm here- it's hella outstanding. 

I've tried the poke- which while tasty, doesn't do it for me the same way the seared ahi does. The daikon is actually my favorite part of the salad. I never really thought of myself as a "daikon-guy" but there you go. 

The sweet potato fries are fantastic, although I find the paired chili sauce a little too sticky-sweet. I think the fries actually taste better unadorned (or maybe with daikon).

Last time I came here my friend ordered the mochi balls. You get a thing of fondue to dip them in, and I'll be darned if that's not a great time. It was very nice of her to let me eat most of them. 

The outdoor seating is awesome on a nice day. Plenty of good people/little-dog watching. I like to make a big show of how healthy I eat here, so I usually stop a couple of passerbys and teach them the evils of processed carbohydrates. Try it! You'll make friends.

Seating inside is a little dicier, the tables are all crammed right next to each other. Seems to be fine when you're rolling with one other person though.
author: Ryan D.

description: Best fish tacos I have ever had! Great service, great food. Will definitely be returning next time I am in San Fran
author: Emily A.

description:
Hubba hubba. Not only did we manage to find the best hotel in San Fran (talk about free parking  ), we also stumbled upon this delicious restaurant only a block away!

Our favorites: sweet potato fries served with Nuoc Cham Ga sauce; wasabi bowl

Great portions and fresh fish! 

PS kinda disagree it's not a great date place...unless you don't like cozy restaurants and delicious food!? just my two cents!
author: Nancy K.

description: I've been looking for a good seafood place for a while now. Luckily I happened upon this place when I was looking for happy hours on Voo (https://tryvoo.com) and it turned out to be a great seafood place (I should have known anyway look at the name!) Anyway, A couple friends and I checked it out and it was great. Definitely recommend. Go for the Poke if you're not sure what to get because it is fantastic! 10/10 recommend
author: Peter B.

description: We stopped in to have dinner and were stunned by the charming waiter Jeffery, whose description of the food had my mouth watering! And he did not disappoint, my husband and I were served exquisitely prepared sole in a champagne caper sauce, the special. I am not a big fish fan, but I ate every last crumb on my plate. The potatoes and asparagus were also deliciously prepared. For desert we had the dolche de leche, which had my husband doing audible gasps at how good it was, A light pastry filled with a cheese cake filling served with real vanilla bean ice cream with caramel sauce. Heavenly! truly a place where food is elevate from sustenance to art.
author: Pamela B.

description: My first time here and I was blown away by the freshness and flavors! I had the three taco platter with salad, a shrimp taco, mahi mahi taco, and traditional fish taco. Perfect crunch without being soggy. Sauces were full of flavor. Delicious rub on the mahi mahi. All three impressed me so much I cannot wait to come back! Quick and friendly staff!
author: M O.

description: Loved the poke. Citrus and raw fish is a match made in heaven. It's something you can overindulge in without feeling guilty. We ordered the ceviche, poke trio, and tacos. And the poke was by far the best of the three.
author: Anna A.

description:
i've been a fan of PC for years... hmm... actually... correction, my fan-ship is only on certain things on their menu...

I am a fan of:
- cripsy oysters
- wasabi bowl with poki
- salad with poki

and if i order these, i know i wouldn't be disappointed... because there are other stuff on their menu that i dont think deserves 4 stars.... 

came here for dinner last night 8/26/2010 with lg... he's never been, so i thought it'd be nice on a nice warm night (that eventually turned bone chilling cold... that's SF!) to eat a wasabi bowl.  there were a couple of daily specials, which looked decent... so we got:

- grapeful ceviche : So tart and watery... it's NG (NO GOOD!)
- pacific crispy oysters: a MUST... the fried oysters are always delish... only thing that bothered me is that the oil was not fresh clean oil... oysters came out dark brown... which means, they've been using that oil for a while now... time to put in a batch!
- yellowtail special - lucky I didn't get this... lg did... and the fish was... hmm... dry... and it was $18 bucks! NG no good... 
- poki wasabi bowl - never fails... always good.

the service here is always friendly, but i swear, dinner last night was so stressful... because... i'm surrounded by marina folks... seriously, i was.  i got table near the door and it was super packed after we got seated... foot traffic is super heavy from to go orders... and people crowding in the door way to get seated... and everyone's talking... i'm thinking, oh my god... get me out of here! i dont want to worry someones @ass knocking my water over!!! 
(NOTE TO SELF: if dining here, sit at bar or table away from door... or better yet... go to sunset location for FULL BAR... and personal space)

i've also tried other stuff on their menu times past... fish and chips... tacos... sandwiches... but it's almost always a disappoint if i dont order the usual... 

stick to the oysters and the wasabi bowl and u'll be a fan too... or anything with ahi poki! haha the seared tuna is a hit or miss sometimes too... depends on if they over cook the tuna... i like my tuna RED thank you...
author: Kelly H.

description:
Quick tip - Order the sweet potato fries and ahi poke salad. 

Pros - Great tasting seafood.

Cons - Parking. Small Restaurant.

I use to work down the street from this place and it was always baked esp on weekends. The restaurant is tiny, but wait isnt that bad since people are in n out. My favorite dish is the ahi poke salad. You will love it if you like sashimi with a nice salad mix. The sweet potato fries are also really good. They were one of the first people to serve it before it become such a main stream side order. The bbq fish sandwich is also really good and tacos!

I would recommend parking down in the marina green (down the street toward the water). it is free till 10pm but its a nice 4 block walk.
author: Ryan R.

description: This restaurant was recommended for a great casual atmosphere and good food.  We were not disappointed.  Great food AWESOME service.  If you are in the Fishermans Warf area take a walk away from the crowds and get some great great fresh food. Jeffry and Nolan what can we say??  You are our best new found friends and terrific hosts..  Thank you.
author: Scott G.

description: Probably my new favorite spot, just bummed that it's an hour from our house!! Delicious rice bowls, we had the hawaiian ahi poke wasabi bowl (not sure why it's called wasabi since there was no wasabi though) and the teriyaki bowl with mahi mahi and extra chicken. Really really delicious, my only complaint is that it could have done with a lot less salt. Next time I'll just ask them to go easy on the seasoning. Seriously delicious, I'll be back!!
author: R G.

description: This place is so small but yet so busy!  My friend took me here yesterday for dinner and had their Mahi2 taco.  It was spicy but it was so good!  I guess my almost two hour trip here was worth it (I was stuck in traffic).
author: Lorie N.

description: I was hesitant, older, small restaurant tucked in between other places that were larger and noisier ( drunkier ). Pleasantly surprised. Intimate atmosphere, great food, with some real gluten-free options, not just salads.
author: Brett S.

description: This is my go-to restaurant for a quick and delicious meal!  Ahi tuna wasabi bowl is AMAZING.  The service is always friendly and the food tastes great.  They also have an awesome happy hour.
author: Kandis P.

description:
This place is pretty awesome for two main reasons: speed and quality. 

I got the Ahi Tuna salad, which is pretty standard, but consistently delicious and it takes maybe 5-7 minutes to get to your table after you order, which is more than I can say about 90% of restaurants in SF! 

The rice bowls and salad bowls come in good sies, and on Tuesdays there's half priced wine, which is amazing. 

If you're pretty decently hungry and want food ASAP, I'd definitely stop by Pacific Catch, since the food is fast and delicious! Also, if you're in the area on Tuesday, be sure to stop by for 1/2 priced wine!
author: Noah T.

description:
NOT A DATE PLACE, but totally awesome.

The environment is very casual; nothing fancy at all.

The food is pretty darn delicious.  I got the Poke Wasabi Bowl, which is honestly epic in size and definitely came with enough fish (in contrast to other reviews).  We also got the sweet potato fries, which were crisped perfectly.  My friend ordered the tacos, and those looked awesome as well.
author: Daniel D.

description: Sushi bowls!!!! The food was excellent and the manager there was incredibly helpful and friendly. Come to LA!!!! Also bring the manager with you :)
author: Sara Q.

description:
The restaurants manager contacted me after reading my review dated  5/9/12  to apologize for giving me food poisoning with their rotten sashimi.  I asked for my money back, it's been almost a week and no response from the restaurant manager.  

Why even bother contacting me to apologize if you're not going to do anything about it?  All I ask is to be refunded the entire amout I wasted at this restaurant.

Consumers should stay away from this place.  You'll get sick and won't even get your money back.
author: Cindy C.

description: Should have rated it a 5 from the get-go...still my favorite casual place in the city!
author: Heather K.

description:
After a long wait, we finally got a table.
We should left, we both got the worst case of food poisoning!
Perhaps, the "Health Dept." should pay a visit to this establishment.
author: Francesca P.

description: VERY disappointed in Pacific Catch. Went there for my mom's birthday and when they served my parents their food they didn't even bring plates. I had to go up and ask for plates. Then after dinner I had asked the host if they could bring desert with a candle in it for my mother as a surprise for her birthday. Instead they brought her a desert menu and said since it was her birthday it was on the house  (ruining the surprise) and once they brought it (after 20 minutes) there was no candle and no birthday song. VERY disappointed in pacific catch. They are snobby and rude and do not listen to their guests. I will not be eating there any time soon, nor would I recommend it to anyone
author: Allison S.

description: This place has my new favorite meal: the spicy ahi tuna sandwich. We brought our dog with us and the waiter was very accommodating to her as well! I am already planning my next trip back to get that sandwich again...
author: britt h.

description:
My favorite at Pacific Catch is the Wasabi Ball ~ !!!! 

It's quite big, but since it's so fresh and well-balanced, most of the times I finish all of it ^^ I have taken my friends and family who visit me from out of town to Pacific Catch a lot. My parents are very very Japanese and are picky about any Japanese imitated dishes. Many of the places I have taken them are not so great, but they truly enjoyed food from here. 

Hmmmm writing this makes me hungry for another wasabi ball !!
author: Sayaha A.

description: Wow, had to update my previous review from a few days ago because my husband and I cannot stay away!! Again, our meals were perfect and what made Pacific Catch a perfect 5 star (hell, I'd give them 100 stars if I could!) restaurant this time was the service. Jessie was our server and she could have not been more attentive, personable, and sweet. She made sure that our drinks were always filled, our needs met, and that we had a really fantastic meal. After our meal, we were chatting with Jessie and another really great server (I'm sorry, I didn't catch her name! She had fabulous red hair and awesome red glasses!) and they could have not been more friendly! I'm really hoping to go back for lunch tomorrow before my husband and I fly out to the second part of our honeymoon but I'm not sure we'll have enough time:( but honestly, next time we're in San Francisco, I know this will be on our list of places to visit again! Mary (the owner) has a great thing going, keep up the awesome food, amazing service, and come out to VT! :-p
author: Catherine K.

description:
Oh my gosh! Had lunch here in the marina and I had the most pleasant experience. 
We were planning to go to Tacolicious, which is next door, but they were filled up so we decided to try out this restaurant. 
My boyfriend and I had Pacific Ceviche Trio - so fresh and tasty (not to mention healthy!). We also had girlled salmon and it was amazing. The place is pretty small so we got two seats over the counter, which we didn't mind. 

A total gem and we're glad we tried it! If you're ever in the area for some fresh seafood, give this place a try!
author: Tessa A.

description: Pacific Catch is delicious and consistent. The service here is also awesome- everyone is so friendly and the food comes out quick! The kitchen is extremely efficient. Highly recommend! The space is tiny with only a few tables but they always make it work...wait isn't too long generally. Highly recommend!
author: Ashley S.

description: The food is fresh and amazing, and the service is outstanding. We had a server named Corey and his recommendations were spot on. I am definitely coming back. They need to open this place in Santa Monica!
author: Alexzi G.

description:
Eh, my wife had been bugging me to try Pacifc Catch. Well we found ourselves in the City on a Wednesday afternoon around lunch time and I thought, what better chance. 

It's a small trendy place, I think 6 tables and the counter, there was a short wait of about 20 minutes. The staff was very friendly, but the food was about average, I had the Hawaiian Teryaki Plate w/ Mahi. It was so, so, lots of rice and a very small paper thin portion of over cooked Mahi. the crispy onions and grilled pineapple where not enough to get this dish over average. The best part of my meal was the tiny basil grilled artichoke,

My wife had the California Opah, which was on special, her fis was cooked perfectly and was very tasty. Still for all the hype, I must say I left disappointed. I will give Pacific Catch another chance, I think perhaps I ordered a very plain entree and may have expected to much.
author: Gary A.

description:
I'm definitely a fan. A friend took me here on a nice weekend afternoon for lunch. We were lucky to get the last 2 seats at the bar, but I wouldn't have minded waiting either. In fact, It seems like when I pass by this place, there's usually somewhat of a crowd waiting for a seat.

We sat down and ordered an appetizer-- the hawaiian poke (marinated sushi grade ahi with sesame seeds and wontons). Delicious! It was salty, but a good salty. Nothing too overwhelming. Mixed with the wontons it was just delicious.

My friend ordered the wasabi rice bowl, and I had the mixed catch basket. My basket came with their signature sweet potato fries (VERY yum), fried oysters, fish, and coconut shrimp. Also a little side of home made cole slaw (I ate the whole cup it was so good), a sweet sauce for the shrimp, and tarter sauce for the fish.

I love how at the bar you can watch the chefs prepare everything. All the food was very fresh, and made with love.

Can't wait to come back on the next nice day for lunch. Mmmm!
author: Ashley D.

description: I do not live in the area, which is probably a good thing, since I would eat there almost everyday. I honestly contemplate driving all the way from Sacramento just to get their sushi bowl. Its amazing.
author: Julia B.

description:
What an awesome little lunch spot! Before moving to SF, my boyfriend had raved about his love for Pacific Catch's Hawaiian Poke rice bowl. We happened to be in the area around lunch time and decided to stop in so I could finally give this place a whirl! I wasn't overly hungry so I opted to grab one fish taco a la cart ($5) + a grilled artichoke side ($5) while he, naturally, opted for the rice bowl (around $15). 

Everything was so, sooo good. Fresh and flavorful. I loved that they had fish tacos that were GRILLED, not overly grossly fried like so many places. I shared my artichoke and we were both fans -- I mean, how can you go wrong with grilled artichokes? I had a bite of his beloved rice bowl and was in love immediately. I was taking mental notes so I could recreate that goodness at home! Just so many good flavors and so many great healthy options. Perfect little lunch spot! The seating is really limited inside so be prepared. There's outside seating with heaters which is great if the SF weather is working in your favor. :)
author: Shannon E.

description: Super small restaurant with a little wait time but not bad. Our server was awesome and a great people person. I like Pacific Catch because it offers seafood that doesn't break your wallet. The menu is cool because you can order your seafood in a bunch of different ways. They have tacos, salads, asian entrees, etc. The deep fried oysters were awesome! Crispy but not too much batter/coating keeping all of the oyster's seafoodness. My friend got some salmon sandwich with sweet potato fries which he loved. I got a wasabi bowl with seared tuna which was pretty good until I got to the rice. I'm not sure why but it was extremely salty.  I'll be back when I'm having a craving.
author: Jaclyn N.

description: Food and service were exceptional. I went for take-out. Felt pricey for take-out but really liked the food.
author: James A.

description: Stumbled into this place while we were looking for a place to have dinner.  It's small restaurant with really good foods. Our server was amazing! He gave us a big sample of poke when we asked him about it. The foods like I mentioned was really good. We got a platter to share and I also got a rice bowl on top of that. I will definitely come back the next time I'm in SF
author: G T.

description: My second time here now! It's in the Marina area in SF, where I frequently visit my sister. I went there recently and tried the Chipotle Mahi Mahi on their meal sized salads. It's a very healthy size and will satisfy your taste buds. They also serve edamame, which is always the best appetizer. Always feel healthy leaving Pacific Catch!
author: Sabrina S.

description:
The food here is fantastic. A friend and I shared a sushi starter, then I ordered two tacos for my dinner. I tried the Mahi Mahi fish taco and the steak taco. Both were fantastic! Be aware though, their menu in the store is a little different than the one listed on yelp. There's no salmon taco. The thai iced tea is also delicious, and you get free refills! (Which is great because it's 90% ice and 10% tea. The entire glass was filled with ice.)

This place would receive five starts if the service wasn't HORRENDOUS. I kept it at four instead of three because the place was packed and the table next to ours was a party of like, 15. I'll up/downgrade the rating depending on how it is next time I come in. It took us over 10 minutes to get the iced tea and water we asked for, then it took around 20 to get the starter, and another 20-25 for the actual meal. When we finished and asked for the check, it took our waitress 10 minutes to bring it, plus 10 minutes to actually take it back from our table! And it's not like she wasn't around. She passed our table multiple times without even checking on us. It was ridiculous, to say the least.
author: Adriana N.

description: The food is really good, with lots of interesting choices whatever your preference of cuisine. The service left a lot to be desired, though. We waited for about 20 minutes for our desserts, at which point my partner - who had ordered chocolate mochi with chocolate sauce - was brought a plate of chocolate and coffee mochi, and told, with no apology, that they had run out of chocolate sauce. Perhaps it would have been nice to give him a choice what dessert (if any) he had, in that case? I had to remind them to bring my ice cream; and the mochi tasted weirdly stale and crumbly. Still, I would go back.
author: Kate R.

description: For some reason they apparently don't have miso soup anymore! Me so (jokes) sad that they discontinued it! :(
author: D K.

description: Great food and service. The supervisor was extremely friendly and considerate of some of our dietary restrictions. I live in Santa Monica, and would love to have Pacific Catch close to home!
author: Amit R.

description:
My favorite seafood restaurant in the Bay Area, hands-down. The fish is super-fresh, and the dishes are beautifully prepared and provide interesting variety. The wait-staff are very friendly, prompt and helpful, and prices are reasonable.

One warning about the Chestnut location: it is TINY. Plan to sit at the bar, because the chance of you getting a table is very small. It's also loud, with so many people crammed into a small space. Try their main branch in the Sunset District if you want a quieter, less claustrophobic dining experience. The up-side to this spot is the nearby parking garage -- finding parking in the Sunset is damned near impossible on a Friday night.
author: Chris L.

description:
You can't go wrong with the Wasabi Rice Bowls!!!

Loved everything in it -- Rice topped with a bunch of delicious veggies, and a fish of your choice. I got the salmon, which was pretty good. I wish I got a little more sauce on mine because it was a little plain, but I'm still happy, because the salmon itself had enough flavors. The fish was cooked perfectly! Moist, and not flaky.
My friend got the poke wasabi rice bowl. I mooched a piece of his, and I liked it... probably better than my salmon! His fish was drenched with sauce and made it too salty after a couple of bites, though. Oh yeah... and we got the basket of sweet potato fries, which were eh. My friend really likes sweet potato fries so he adored them but me, it was whatevs. Sadly, we came here for a really late lunch and ordered 10 minutes before happy hour and the waiter didn't give us the happy hour discount on the fries =/ Oh well... It was only $2 cheaper.

I wouldn't mind coming back here. It's like a Japanese-seafood house fusion... pretty nifty! Never been anywhere like here before. I like. Very tempted to come back here for happy hour and to munch on some goodies.
author: Janet H.

description: Ready for the most amazingly delicious and amazingly priced happy hour 4 to 6 pm $3.00 tacos (lots of varieties) plate of mixed sweet potato and spicy fries. Sushi ahi tuna in sesame-soy marinade and other delicious small plates. So good we came back for lunch a couple of days later to try more amazing dishes. Had the fish fry, also amazing and chipotle chicken salad. If I lived in this town, this would be my go to restaurant. The waitress would not let us leave without treating us to their fried cheesecake spring rolls with vanilla ice cream and caramel topping dessert that was more delicious with every bite and worth every freaking calorie!
author: Carl F.

description:
Food was pretty good here. Fresh, unique tastes.

The only thing I didn't like was that we sat at the bar and the way the food was prepped and cooked in front of us was a bit unclean and unsanitary. If you're going to put the kitchen in front of customers it should be kept in good order for sure.
author: Scott B.

description: Love this place, go there often and get the teriyaki steak bowl repeatedly. Great take out too, with a cool beer selection. Small on the inside and the tables are a little cramped, but really great service and reliably delicious food.
author: Sarah B.

description: This dining experience was so perfect. The food was delectable and the flavors exploded in my mouth. Our server was so on top of his game and was very attentive to us. It was a wonderful time!!
author: Emily L.

description:
What a great place for some Japanese & Seafood fusion!

My friend and I were visiting the city and yelping where to eat for our first meal. We were staying near Fort Mason and didn't have a car so we were restricted to 1 mile radius for foods. After short search, we decided to check this place solely on ratings and boy they are correct!

When we got there, the place was already full, the cute waitress told us it'll be 5 minutes for a table to open up so we waited outside. However, about 4 minutes later, another couple walked in and sat on table where we were suppose to be seated. The waitress was so busy she couldn't tell them there was line front of them -- she apologized and offered us an appetizer for wrong-doing (we were okay with it either way, but will take free food!).

When we were seated, she quickly brought the house-famous sweet potato fries with two kinds of sauce - white and red. The white sauce was amazing... I'm not sure what they are but great. We also noticed everyone else having this mysterious orange drink -- we ordered ones too, turned out to be Thai Iced Tea - but it wasn't great.

I ordered the Japanese Teriyaki Bowl with Mahi Mahi. My friend got the house-special salad. Both were fantastic. We didn't talk much because we were so busy downing our plates. We waited for nearly 20 minutes, but finished our foods in about 7 minutes. It was that good.

Overall, this cute joint reminded me of Hawaii - which I greatly miss. I also think this can be a very fun/solid first-date place. Not too fancy, not too expensive, but just right enough to impress her with foods and decor - at least I'd bring a girl here.

My friend and I are going to open up one just like this in Washington DC -- only we'll call it Atlantic Catch.
author: Josh S.

description: I cannot begin to describe how scrumptious this food was.  We shared the calamari, coconut shrimp and soup and loved them all.  We had two of their specials and couldn't have asked for more.  Great atmosphere and neighborhood feel.  Our server Jessie was amazing as well.  Great food done right!
author: Robert W.

description:
Pacific Catch was a surprisingly good catch (ba dum bum). the family and I were wandering around the Marina and we were craving fish. Lo and behold, the sign for Pacific Catch even had the the words "Fish Grill (something of that sort)" under it. Sold!
I almost missed the entrance, this place is pretty small! But we got seated at the bar, under the sun roof (AMAZING!) The service was outstanding. The wait staff were incredibly helpful and friendly, the chefs were nice as well. 

Appetizer: We were starving by the time we sat down so I immidiately ordered the calimarri. And it was the best calimarri...HANDS DOWN. The batter was so flavorful and the spicy dipping sauce they had was amazing.

Main course: I had a seasonal dish (it's apparently salmon season). I forgot the name of the dish, but it was grilled salmon (i think you already figured that out) with a peach/berry type of.,...slaw? It was really good and the star of the dish. There were also fingerling potatoes. They came in a sauce that kind of smelled like marsala. However, the potatoes were kind of dissapointing. I thought the salmon should've been tastier and the texture for the slaw was a bit strange, due to the raspberries. Don't get me wrong, I still enjoyed the dish, but it wouldn't have been my last supper meal. 

I can't speak for my other family members, but they had the fish & chips, shrimp & chimps, and the ahi tuna bowl. They seemed to like their meals.

And btw I had their Thai Iced Tea and it was probably the best Thai tea I've had to date. Impressive.

I wish I had room for dessert because I saw that there was mochi fondue!!! WHAAT?! 

Hopefully we can get back to Pacific Catch soon, since the tacos, rice bowls, AND THE MOCHI FONDUE, are calling my name.

And keep up the great service!!!
author: Cindy B.

description:
Came here twice for lunch and really liked this place as a casual beachy-surf-dude-like eatery for asian fusion! It's not mindblowing in the sense that you're smacking your lips for originality or anything b star bar-like, but more a solid place to swing by for a seafood chow, when you're feeling particularly beach-seafood-cafe-like. 

YUMS: 
-Asian rice bowl- seared ahi wasabi bowl. Oh yeah this was yummy, though maybe a little on the oversauced side but these rice bowls are definitely really popular here. 
-Sweet potato fries - crisp and flavorful
-Seared ahi tuna sandwich - pretty good!

S' OK: 
Tacos - not bad, but not special 

Like their casual selection of beers like Longboard, etc. Seafood is fresh and plentiful. Like the selection. It's a really small joint - like the size of a skinny coffee shop-  so best for groups of 2.
author: Cecilia T.

description:
I had some free time for lunch and the ScoutMob application downloaded on my phone. You don't know about that when I wrote this review (10/2010), but you soon will. If you don't have the iphone/android application stop reading this and download it. It will save you 50% on lots of good restaurants.

Anyways, I wasn't impressed with my lunch even though I saved half off the normal price. 

I started with the Ahi Poke appetizer which was so insanely salty/soy sauced, that I couldn't finish it. Bad start.

For an entree I had a Baja taco and a mahi mahi taco. Both were fine but way messy to eat. Covered in sauce was hard to pickup and eat like a non-neanderthal. The salad that came with it was really terrible. Get another side. 

For full price this would have made me very sad, but saving $10 made it more bearable.
author: Taylor A.

description: I got the chipotle mahi mahi salad and it was great! The customer service was excellent, the waiter was very accomodating to me wanting almost everything on the side :P the food was very fresh and delicious! Would definitely come back! Not to mention the jasmine green tea was delicious!
author: Andrea C.

description:
Great food in a casual, intimate atmosphere. My favorite dish is Trout and the dessert - Dulce Delce is truly hard to resist. I can name at least 5 "upscale" overpriced restaurant who serve a similar fish dish for 3 times the pricess which has way less flavor. I will surely be back again and again. 
The service is quick and friendly.
author: Arkady I.

description:
I signed a receipt with tip for $56...checked my credit card statement, they decided to add $10 more to make it $66. Sketchy....

I actually do like the food...I'll just be keeping an eye on their charges.
author: Cheester O.

description:
i loooooooooveeeee the food here. the seafood tastes so fresh! 
My favorite spot to sit is at the bar, it's so interesting to watch them make your food (: 

I've been here twice and their poke bowls are just... AMAZING! 
also their sandwiches and tacos are pretty darn good as well ! it's good and different, i will definitely be back again. Plus the location is perfect if you want to go walk around before or after to shop or get a drink, maybe even some dessert or froyo ! 
 take ya date hereeeee!(:
author: Jane N.

description:
Had the Lomi Lomi (salmon poke served with fried wonton skin) and the Oni (grilled trout on rice).  

The Lomi Lomi was delicious - fish was fresh, seasoning was appetizing and wonton skins crispy but not oily.  Would try more of their Pokis for sure.  

Unfortunately the Trout was the opposite.  The sauce was not bad, but the rice was soggy and the trout very overcooked.  Quality of the trout dish was "food court level".  Not what I expected from this well rated establishment.

Credit where credit's due though.  Service was great once we got seated (there was a bit of a wait) - really friendly folk and attentive enough given how busy they were.  Cheers to that.

P.S.  Extra charge for green tea was also unexpected ($2 a person!).  I guess I should have asked....
author: Adrian K.

description: I came here for brunch on Sunday and ordered the Hawaiian poke salad, which was pretty delicious and giant! It consisted of Hawaiian poke with mixed greens, avocado, sprouts and soy-wasabi vinaigrette. The only complaint is that it was slightly too salty (probably due to the dressing). I'd recommend getting this again but with dressing on the side.
author: Lillian C.

description: The raw tuna here is amazing!! Small place but the food is outstanding! Highly recommend
author: Sara R.

description:
It's real hard to stand out in the city when you're an itty bitty, especially when you're standing next to the mega jugs. Uh hm.. Tacolicious.  Still, you just have to work that itty bitty like you're the spokesperson for that committee. And that's exactly what Pacific Catch does.  

Why 5 stars?

- An itty bitty interior propogates a more intimate scene.. I don't mind if my elbows clash other guests, gives reason to pop a hello.
- A very Happy hour, $3 menu!
-BBQ salmon tacos*! Chicken tacos! Mahi Mahi tacos! $3 each (Happy Hour)  
- Spanktaculous sauce that makes those tacos so dammmn goood! (Part of the $3)
- Sweet potatoe fries! With Spanktaculoso sweet and sour sauce. $3
-Spend $25 in feeding two.
- Get full, happy and venture into the Marina again.
- Help your girl pick out a pair of leggings at Gap, while being heterosexual.
 - Spend $50 on that special pair of leggings at Gap.
- Get unhappy.
But..
- Realize how good your tacos were.
- Get Happy again.
author: Sani S.

description: A pretty good spot. Started with Cali-style Poke for appetizer, with assorted fried seafood for entree. My date picked a seafood salad. All of it was pretty tasty; the fried seafood had just the right amount of breading and had minimal grease. Would definitely come back if I got the chance!
author: Stephen L.

description: Best Tacos and Calamari...EVER. Seriously good. Did I mention the best fish tacos I've ever had?
author: Rachel S.

description:
I'm assuming timing and wrong choice had everything to do with this mediocre experience.

My best friend and Elite Yelper Tiffany V! somehow convinced me this place was worthy by eating there consecutively for 3 days and texting me non stop about the catch that was Pacific Catch. One night, mouth watering for something, anything, and mourning the loss of master, I finally got her to take me there and we got there kind of late. I ordered the Poke Bowl because of the tuna element that lured me, so deceivingly I might add, because it had about as much Tuna in it as a bento box and a mountain of rice underneath. I ate all the tuna, all seven cubes of tuna and left the rice as a statement to the staff that the proportions were far from even and I would not have it. Not for $15.00 anyway. I am a rice factory in my own home, I had cheaper and more proportioned tuna bowl Westfield Shopping Centre. This was unacceptable.

Tiffany! and her friend Eli ordered drinks. The bar had to be the slowest because I'm sure my dessert came before their drinks did. 

The dessert was really good though! it was an array of mochi sprinkled with chocolate decadence and powdered sugar. 

I gave a good tip for a bad experience which is my very own kiss of death and blatant message that I will never return! call me when my the tuna bowl has either more tuna or has changed their name to rice bowl, then maybe my trust will return. seriously, call me when it happens. my number is 408 489 0750.

lol, I'm kidding. I've always been theatrical.

P.S. california roll salad?! worst idea ever. back to the drawing board. Pacific catch.
author: Olivia Vanessa R.

description: My bf and I ate here our first night in San Fran. First service was awesome. Our server Jeffery was very attentive, knew the menu really well giving us suggestions. He even let my bf taste some of the wine to make his decision. I started with the sweet potato fries and wasabi aioli... YUM. And my bf had the crab chowder which was delish. I had the filet of sole with crab and my bf had the bbq spiced salmon. We both preferred his salmon which was very flavorful. My sole could have used a little more garlic and salt. But loved that the dishes came with broccolini.
author: Ashley P.

description:
When the line for Tacolicious is too long, this is the perfect place to try as a back up.  Their island soft tacos are freshly made with various types of fish, such as mahi mahi and salmon.  If you order the platter, you get their signature sweet potato fries on the side for a deal.  Other delights include their fish and chips as well as their daily specials.

Service is fast and friendly.  The ambiance is a small, cozy mom and pop shop with an outdoor seating area that is well lit.  Parking on the street can be tough, but Fillmore usually has some spots.
author: Jenny L.

description: The food was amazing. Me and my partner were visiting and found out many restaurants were closed for President's Day but we found this spot. The place is actually small but the food is amazing also the service we got was the bomb. I was craving some Thai tea the waiter came back with a glass half way full and said "we ran out of tea but this is on me." She was so apologetic about it and half way through my meal she brought me a full glass of Thai tea. She said this is on me also, we just made a new batch. That's what I call service. They do care for customers so I would highly recommend this place. Portions are pretty decent so go there with an empty stomach. Enjoy!! BTW our waiter had a tattoo on the back of her ear a puzzle piece. She was so nice. Thank you.
author: Fernando L.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in SF. I'm obsessed with the Japanese Wasabi rice bowl. Chestnut street is adorable too. Relaxed atmosphere with great food & friendly service - doesn't get much better than that. I HIGHLY recommend!
author: Andie J.

description:
If this review was based off solely off of the dessert, then I would give this place 10 stars. I LOVE the dessert here! We had the dulce de leche spring rolls and it was caramelized banana with vanilla ice cream. Soooo good. I swear it's orgasmic. I almost cried tears of happiness after eating it. haha.

Back to the main meal, this is a great place to go if you want lots of fried foods or a wasabi bowl.

We had the french fries - both sweet potato and spicy fries. I think I liked the spicy fries better... but my friend Jenn swears by the sweet potato fries. I think she must've ate two baskets by herself. haha sorry for calling you out girl. :)

The calamari was good. I order that everywhere I go. It's my stable appetizer dish. :) 

I had the tokyo salmon which was basically fish n'chips but using salmon instead of a white fish. It was ok but seriously, I was on fried food overload. 

My friend had the ahi poke bowl and that looked more healthier than my basket of fried fish. 

Anyways I'd come back just to eat the dessert. It really was THAT good.
author: Cynthia C.

description:
I've always wanted to come here having seen this chain around SF in several places...and finally landed here for lunch today.  This location is super tiny with only a few tables/bar spots, but the waiters and waitresses are friendly and the atmosphere is pretty cozy.  The old couple next to us was really sweet and cute and made eating here even better.

I ordered the japanese wasabi rice bowl with white rice and seared ahi tuna. OMG the seared ahi was perfect, and was warm and tasty on the outside and the perfect touch of freshness on the inside.  I wish there were a few more pieces, since there was so much rice in the bowl that I ended up getting tired of eating it.
author: Liz W.

description: Pacific Catch is one of my favorite spots on Chestnut. Always guaranteed to get fresh seafood.  The rice bowls are filling and the ability to get 1/2 rice 1/2 salad is a great option for those who are trying to eat healthy or calorie count. Korean sticky ribs are tasty as is the poke. Service is always friendly.
author: Lenneal G.

description: Cozy little fish taco joint at the end of chestnut street. Super popular for good reason. These fish tacos are so fresh and absolutely delicious. We need one in LA desperately!
author: Jackie K.

description:
I came here for lunch on a very cool day in the city. This place is pretty small and cramped. Personally I don't like other people sitting so close to me when I'm eating.

I ordered the Hawaiian Poke Japanese Wasabi Rice Bowl. This was definitely a LOT of food. I wasn't able to finish it because it was so big. It comes with wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori & soy-wasabi sauce, your choice of brown or white rice, and fresh hawaiian poke. The rice has some wasabi embedded it in giving it the right kind of spice and flavor to it. So if you love wasabi, get it! There's a good amount of rice too. The hawaiian poke was really fresh.

I also tried some of the seared ahi, omg really really good. I'd definitely get this one next time.
author: Desmond T.

description: Great food, great service, reasonably priced. Very small place though, so I'd recommend visiting off peak hours.
author: Imre S.

description: Fantastic spiced rubbed salmon and crab shower. Excellent service. Try to get a seat outside due to tight quarters inside.
author: Mike M.

description:
Pacific Catch is a place that makes me want to move to San Fran! :)  

Me and my hubby were recently visiting the Marina area for a week and on our first day we discovered Pacific Catch. Thank you Universe! The first thing we tried was Grilled Artichoke- OH MY GOD! it's the best thing I have had in a very long time. I had a food orgasm from the first bite!  ( Let me tell you I don't get a lot of those)  Then we ordered Wasabi Bowl and it was so healthy and delicious - brown rice, seaweed salad, some other delish salad and a whole bunch of goodness in a plate. 

The service was very friendly and attentive and the whole place felt very homey and comfortable. 

In the week that we were in San Fran, we went back to Pacific Catch 4 times and every time we ordered different things ( except the artichoke of course, I had to have it every time I was there, haha) This place is no worse than any high end restaurant ( minus the crazy high end prices).  

Every time we were there the place was full , so once we sat at the bar and once on the patio, but regardless of where we were sitted, we always enjoyed the food and the experience. OH, you must try their Miso Soup, it's probably the best one I had. Yum! 

If you live in the Bay Area, you absolutely MUST visit the Pacific Catch. Please have some Grilled Artichoke for me! :) hehe
author: Mimi I.

description: Tried their Japanese wasabi bowl with hawaiian poke.  My friend said that the bowls are known to come with a lot of rice, so I opted for half rice/half greens.  The freshness was obvious, and the flavors were delicious.  It came with a good portion of poke and a variety of different veggies.  I added a little Sriracha for an added kick, and it was spectacular.  My bowl was very satisfying.  I would definitely come here again and again.
author: Gina J.

description: I've been to other Pacific Catch locations before,  but this one uh totally rocks.  The only drawbacks is that the place was smaller than the others i've been to (there seemed to be only 2x4 person tables), the parking on the street was a whopping $5.50 a freaking hour on Saturday (lol what??)  and I had to wait quite awhile just to use the restroom (another buck to the SFMTA).  But oddly the small footprint makes out for a higher quality experience (food and service-wise).
author: Ryan Y.

description:
Pacific Catch is easily my favorite restaurant in the Marina! I've been numerous times in the past few years, and they never cease to amaze me. Their staff is ALWAYS friendly and courteous.
My favorite sandwich is the least spicy of the ahi, and definitely get a side of the sweet potato fries! If you get any of the plates or bowls... you will get a lot of food! So be prepared.
There aren't many tables and it gets a little crowded. Although, there's a few more seats at the bar.
You should definitely make a stop anytime you're in the area. There's lots going on on this street, so after a lunch or a dinner, you can keep the day/night going.
author: Jeanette K.

description: Been frequenting this place for years & this review is way overdue! My fav Wasabi Bowl w/ Seared Ahi & Side order of Fried Oysters & Ahi Poke. Simply Deliscious, refreshing &perfect for a sunny day out in the Marina. Can't wait to try the new location in San Mateo...
author: April M.

description: We just left this wonderful restaurant and can't wait to return. The food was fabulous but our waiter was superb. Jeffery steered us in all the right directions with food and drinks. He kept us entertained throughout the evening. The atmosphere and friendly staff pushed this into a five star experience. The poke and grilled salmon were out of this world. We loved every minute of our Pacific Catch experience and we will definitely be going back!!
author: Nadine M.

description:
"Don't yelp angry." If that's what they say, well then "they" clearly don't get their take out orders screwed up regularly.

I have been coming here for years. At my peak, I was eating here twice a day. It is less frequent now, but I still LOVE their food. Nothing beats an ahi poke bowl with brown rice and an extra heap of poke. 

I rarely dine in, instead choosing to call ahead and pick up to take home. Lately Pac Catch has been getting my orders wrong approximately a third of the time. That seems like a lot, I think. 

Forgot the extra scoop of poke (that they didn't forget to charge me for); white rice instead of brown; and even a completely wrong dish once! I have now gotten in the habit of checking my order myself before I walk out, but I don't always catch it at quick glance. However, I most certainly notice after I get home and tear it open only to find the wrong food staring back at me. Taunting my hungry face. 

Food: 5 stars.
Ability to consistently and accurately fill my take out order: 1 star.
author: Brian T.

description:
Before talking about the food, I would like to say the service here is very good!!! All staff are very friendly even though they are extremely busy in peak hour!!! If you share the food, they are happy to split for you~

We ordered Wasabi Rice Bowl with Hawaiian ahi, it is quite good (although not as good as in Hawaii... XD). Also we ordered a salad with tuna as well, that's refreshing~

The line there is really long for lunch hour, and they will assign you table only when all party is here. So, you cannot drop your husband in the line and then go shopping :P
author: Carolyn P.

description:
Pac Catch is fresh and tasty, especially for lunch! You can order online, then run in and pick up. Every time I have done this they have my food ready to go and hot still. They have the timing thing down!

My go to is the Japanese Wasabi Rice Bowl ($13.50) and I get the ahi tuna. I love that its a large meal for one, but also doesn't leave you feeling weighted down mid workday. One of the times I ordered this the ahi was a little cut up on some of the pieces, like it was roughly cut or pulled apart then stuck back together or something? That can be unappetizing, but its only happened once, luckily.

The sweet potato fries with wasabi mayo are a yummy side if you need just a little more. Great lunch, cute spot, horrible parking outside :)
author: Natalie N.

description:
Came here again for lunch before going to the Walt Disney Family Museum. Parking around this area is frustrating to find, but after circling the area couple times, we found parking right in front, only good for 30 minutes though so we had to order fast and eat fast. It was pretty crowded but luckily we got seated pretty fast.

This time around, I tried the seared ahi tuna wasabi bowl and the BF's BBQ eel wasabi bowl. I LOVED IT! The bowls come with so much stuff and the tuna was fresh and lightly seared with delicious sauce.  You can't really mess up BBQ eel.  Both bowls were a pretty good portion, a lot of slices of tuna and a big slab of eel.  I usually don't eat a lot in one sitting, but I devoured the bowl (also because of the time frame) and already I wanted more.  Too bad parking sucks here or else I could come here a lot more often for these wasabi bowls!
author: Katherine C.

description: So tasty! Came with my girlfriend and her parents. The only problem is how small the restaurant is, so seating was awkward. The food makes up for it big time though!  I think it's better than Woodhouse Fish Company and it's one of my go to places for quick reasonably priced seafood.
author: Nader A.

description:
I've been to the Corte Madera location several times for lunch and have always liked the food, but never made it to this location.  It seems like every time I walk by it's packed with lines going out the door.  However, I got there early today when there was no line and was able to sit outside and enjoy the gorgeous SF weather.

The food was as enjoyable as it is at their other location and the service was good.  I had the lemongrass-ginger iced tea (very refreshing and they gave me a free refill) and a light and healthy ahi tuna salad with field greens, daikon, carrots, avocado, and a soy-ginger vinaigrette.  

I would like to go back and try some of the other dishes like the tacos or rice bowls, but I'd need to be in the mood for take-out (there aren't many tables) or get there on the early side.  The food is good, but I wouldn't wait in a line when there are so many other choices around the area.
author: Kimberly B.

description:
The Spicy Ahi sandwich is quite possibly the best seafood sandwich I've ever had. I regularly drive 40 miles for this sandwich, with no qualms.

The sweet potato fries and the little red dipping sauce is also quite phenomenal.

When a Chubby Kitty tells you that some seafood is good, you'd better believe it!
author: Chubby K.

description:
I cannot say that I am a person that believes in love at first sight, nor divine intervention (I think Ophelia is a whiny and over dramatic arse) but I created a Yelp account solely to write a review for this restaurant. 

Upon sitting down and essentially being introduced by name to the entire staff that would be taking care of us--in a charming Gilmore Girlsy coordinated sort of fashion--we were recommended a red that was affordable and delicious. 

Normally as a vegetarian I find seafood places/places my friends drag me to as underwhelming and typically lack great options for me. Our waitress turned out to be a vegetarian and recommended I substitute fried tofu (fatties for lyfe!) for the steak and mahi mahi tacos, one of which had an amazing Sriracha-based sauce that made my brain explode.

Got the sweet potato fries spicy style and proceeded to demolish all of it, and some fried artichoke, and 2 glasses of wine, and wasn't ashamed of myself. I considered writing this review and laying it out in InDesign and flyering it all about town in exchange for the amazing (apologies ahead of time, I'm about to use the word mouthfeel) mouthfeel provided to me here.

I regret my decision to come back to Michigan because I'm now a serious flight committal away from shoving more of these tacos in my mouth. If you live near this restaurant and you aren't a regular, I don't understand you.
author: Kristen C.

description:
Totally awesome restaurant. We came here after watching the sunset by the bay and were able to find a seat almost immediately, though we overheard waits of up to an hour for people who came right after. The service was friendly and attentive, and the food came out pretty quickly.

As for the food, it was absolutely delicious. I got BBQ salmon tacos, and they were exquisite. Extremely flavorful with a great blend of sauces and even avocados, and perfectly cooked, it's up there with the best food I've had in San Francisco all summer. 

My only concern would be getting a seat, as I feel we got pretty lucky. There's not a lot of seating and demand is high, so get there not during peak hours.
author: Jeff S.

description: Yum. Yum. YUM! I frequent this little nook on Chestnut about every other week. I am their Japanese Wasabi bowl addict. As we all know we are very health conscious here in the marina with our yoga pants and Nike Free's, so after my bowl I feel fresh, full and satisfied. I have tried all three fish toppings, Hawaiian poke, seared ahi and grilled salmon and am confident to admit the SEARED AHI takes the cake. I also opt in for half lettuce and half brown rice to cut back on the bulk of this dish, although I feel as if this is the way it should be served anyway! The place does resemble a bit of a closet, so it doesn't work for large groups, but on a whim you can pop in and grab a seat at the bar or dine on the 1 of 2 tables outside. I prefer to call in, and dish it out at home after a long day! PAC CATCH, it's official -you are now added to the speed dial :)
author: Mya C.

description: I love Pacific Catch!  This location is pretty small, so I usually get my order to go.  The food is delicious and Jeffery ALWAYS takes such great care!  After a long day at work, it's always nice to receive his touch of customer service.  I usually get the tacos (they're all great) with sweet potato fries.  My BF usually gets the fish and chips.  It's the bomb.com.  Recently, we've been eating here at least 2-3 a month.  In fact, I'm having their tacos as we speak...  :-)
author: Maria C.

description: A hole in the wall, indeed.  Don't be put off by the decor (or lack of), or the size of the place.  These folks can deliver to fantastic seafood.  We did the takeout deal, as there were no places left inside.  But, given that, their food is 5 star, and because of the location averages out to be a 3+ but rounded up to a 4.
author: Marshall W.

description: Great food, reasonable price, and good location. We had their seared tuna salad, poke bowl, mahi tacos, and sweet potato fries. Everything was very fresh and delicious. The service was very good and quick. Probably best to go during off peak hours because the indoor seating and outdoor seats are very limited.
author: Paulina B.

description:
Well, golly. I really wasn't expecting to like this place! Scratch that -- before I read the Yelp reviews, I wasn't expecting to like it, based on the look of the Sunset location and on the review of the Sunset location's food given to me by someone I trust. But you Yelpers are right, and I am happily surprised to be able to endorse at least one of the Pacific Catch locations. The place is small, as has been mentioned, and when my brother and I went, it was on a Tuesday night at about 9:15 or so, and it was pretty crowded. 

We started with the calamari and then both had the grilled opah with pineapple chutney, mashed purple potatoes, and spinach. The calamari was nicely fried and came with fried lemon slices, which was an awesome touch. The chipotle aioli that accompanied it was packed with chipotle flavor. The opah was perfectly grilled (tender, flaky) and had a lovely charred flavor. The pineapple chutney was a little sweet, but was well balanced with cilantro and red bell peppers. The spinach was garlicky and tasty, and oh my goodness, those mashed potatoes were almost buttery enough to satisfy Paula Deen. (Almost. But obviously, she'd have added another stick of butter, y'all.) They satisfied *me,* no doubt; it was all I could do not to eat every last bite. But the dish was easily enough for two meals, especially with the starter. 

Also, the service was really friendly. I had a Scoutmob coupon PLUS two gift cards, and the waitress and waiter took those with nary a sour face or curl of the lip. Seriously, folks, that alone is worth a star in my book. I hate when restaurants get bent out of shape when you use a coupon that the restaurant itself agreed to issue. Not so at Pacific Catch! 

Anyhoo, stepping off my soapbox now to say, this is a great little seafood joint! I will definitely return for some tasty fish!
author: Jessica K.

description: This is my kind of place. No frills, just quality, inventive food in a quirky little spot in the heart of the marina. I had the copper river salmon entree and the shrimp ceviche with avocado. Both were excellent! That along with the friendly serviced we received will keep me coming back. Nicely done pacific catch
author: Mark N.

description:
I a little writing this review but that's okay because I've been to Pacific Catch a few times now and its been amazing each time!.

So let me get the bad stuff out of the way first. Pacific Catch is small, too small because the food is so good that they really need more room to feed more people. 

Now for the good stuff that make Pacific Catch so wonderful. 
Although it small in here service is great whether you're at the bar or one of the tables indoors or out. The menu is amazing especially if you love poke! Don't fiight it just get the Hawaiian Poke Bowl it might be the best thing you eat in 2012. Another great item to try in the Korean BBQ bowl I like skirt steak so I really enjoyed this bowl. This bowl didn't make me dance but I did boogie just like I did the gangsta boogie to the sweet potatoe fries which were way better than I expected and the Calamari is really good as well. 

I wish I could tell you a good time to go so I'll just say go anytime and be ready for a little wait but its worth the wait believe me! it really is worth the wait!
author: Karim R.

description:
It's a lot smaller than the sunset location, but the bathroom was clean, the staff were uber friendly - every single one of them - they seemed like they really enjoyed working there - always a good sign - and the food was excellent, and came out in lightning fast speed given they had a crowd in the restaurant. 

we ordered
Original Poke appetizer, fish and chips kids plate and the special which was a hawaiian fish with mash potatoes and salad and it was EXCELLENT not to mention they made sure it was gluten free for me.

Dessert which was devoured by hubby and kid was the caramelized dulce de leche spring roll thing which was DIVINE - kinda like cheesecake caramel and filo dough served with excellent vanilla ice cream. 

THANK YOU. Had a great time!
author: Win H.

description:
I used to really like this place. I ate here all the time. I moved a little bit farther away and hadn't been there in a few months.  When I came back, I found out that they took the fried oysters off of the appetizer menu and don't serve unagi at all in their wasabi bowls. Two of my favorite dishes are basically gone (Fried oysters are better split than eaten by just one person). 

Their fish specials are generally okay and the tacos are good but I no longer have a reason to come here unless I feel like paying a bit too much for seafood.  If I'm doing that, I might as well be getting sushi.
author: Jeff L.

description: My boyfriend and I have never stayed in this part of SF before. We walked around the neighborhood looking for somewhere yummy and comfortable. Pacific Catch offered both. PLUS, service was incredibly fast, friendly, and gracious. Will definitely be coming back.
author: Jana S.

description:
That's a lot of fish.  I like fish.  It's good and all healthy for the brain, they say.  However, sometimes I like some variety in a menu.  Just in case I go with someone who really wants fish, but I may feel like something else.

It's a great place and everything is nice and fresh.  I just wasn't terribly impressed with anything.  I understand it's a chain, but I want something more if I'm giving you 4 stars.  

Give me something to crave!
author: Andy S.

description:
I'm no stranger to this place - it's my default place for takeout thanks to their online ordering awesomeness.

Favorites - 2 tacos platter with salad:
1. steak taco 
2. salmon taco

Usually I don't have "usuals" since I like trying new things, but these two items are pretty special.  They sound mundane and perhaps even boring, but the combination of the different ingredients in the taco really is quite awesome.

dessert:
Fried cheesecake springroll with ice cream - I absolutely have to get this whenever I eat in instead of take out.  (I also tends to recommend strongly ;)  to my friends so I have someone to split it with.)  I believe this is the only dessert where I don't mind having caramel on it!  Yes, it's that good.

Generally anything with ahi tuna here is pretty awesome as well.

Shrimp cocktail thing - no good.  Hawaiian poke - good.
Daily specials - it's really a hit or miss.  I've had awesome ones like crab chowder(?) and not so good ones with random fishes.  Overall, love this place, lively atmosphere, good comfy food, and most of the servers I've had are super amazing awesomeness.

Will come here often!
author: Jessica L.

description:
For some reason I thought this was going to be a place was going to be a little bit more fancy I guess because it was a seafood spot but its really small and reminds me of a crab shack. 

So small that when I went to leave I almost knocked over the table next to us because it was so close. 

The food was pretty good thought but a lot of the themes were fried other than the huge salads which I wish  I would have gotten. 

I thought it was really cool that they have a special where you check in on Foursquare you and get a free calamari order when you spend more than $10 bucks.

Order that, the poke- this was my favorite practically with fresh tuna and the crispy wontons. 

I ordered the two tacos- one steak and the other one was prawns but it was fried.   It came with sweet potato fries which were good. 

My boyfriend ordered mussels and he thought it was going to be fresh but they ended up being fried. 

Good food but next time I will definitely try the salad.
author: Anya R.

description: When I'm craving fish or want to indulge but be somewhat healthy, I head to Pacific Catch!  Sandwiches are great (get the side of spicy sweet potato fries), but my absolute fave is the wasabi bowl with poke and brown rice.  Great combination of flavors and textures!  One star off because it's kind of small so it's hard to get a table and/or wait is some times a bit long.
author: Cin S.

description: This small and cozy place met us with prompt and amazing hospitality! The food was amazing and delicious. They are more than happy to let you sample some of their delicious food and drink options. I will return to see them again the next time I am in the neighborhood.
author: John R.

description:
Good catch.

Had a BBQ glazed salmon sandwich topped with tomato and red onion. Very good and almost big enough for two.

Small salad on the side with edamame was a nice touch.

Ate at the counter overlooking the kitchen. Late afternoon apparently avoids the crowds other yelpers have referenced. Sunday paper added to the relaxing bliss.

There was a bit of a confusion with the bill and the owners quickly messaged with a solution. Really appreciated that.

Good food and good service means four good stars.
author: Jason B.

description:
Pacific Catch in the Marina is a tiny restaurant that packs a big punch! Always enjoy the food at Pacific Catch at both locations. A four star restaurant in my eyes!! 

Wanting to order something other than my usual Japanese Wasabi bowl with Hawaiian poke or seared ahi, I settled on one of the chalkboard specials, a Hawaiian white fish. This flaky, well seasoned and generous portion of fish was exactly what I wanted. Served with brown rice, tomato confit and a grilled artichoke and red peppers and a fresh tarter/aoli type sauce for the fish, the dish was devoured. Though one would think I would have been quite full from the delicious appetizers my dining companion and I ordered. 

- Hawaiian poke is always a favorite of mine. Seasoned with just right amount of heat and plenty of the crispy wontons! 

- Korean sticky ribs were new on the menu, so were a must try. Fall off the bone tender, sticky sweet and savory goodness! Will order again. Good way to off set all the other seafood we were to consume. 

- Calamari is pretty standard, but appreciated the red peppers and spicy aioli as it I always prefer a little heat. What makes these exceptionally awesome is that we got this starter for free all because I checked in at Pacific Catch Marina on Foursquare for the first time. Nice promo, huh?! 

Friendly staff and outdoor seating makes this Pacific Catch very delightful!
author: Marie B.

description:
I'm a sucker for their wasabi bowl with brown rice and hawaiian poke, their salads, and most everything that they end up having as a chalkboard special.

Bummed they took the grilled artichokes off the menu because those were equally bomb.

When I'm in the mood for something fresh I love calling in and picking some Pacific Catch to-go.

I recently went with my roommate Christie K. and we both mentioned on Twitter how excited we were to be there and have a great table outside on the patio, and they tweeted back at us that they were happy we were such big fans-- and comped us 2 glasses of wine!

That's service.
author: Brianna H.

description:
Came here with a friend for catch-up lunch and it wasn't crowded, we got seated by the window really quickly.  Now the one complain I have is that the gaps between tables were very very narrow. You can't get up without slightly sweeping the table next to you, that means other people's ass right next to your food. 

The food makes everything better. 

My friend got the Sushi Grade Ahi -- seared ahi, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger, carrots & sesame seeds with soy-wasabi vinaigrette. How can you not get it after reading the mouth-watering description right? It was so good. The meal-size salad was definitely enough for two girls to share. the sushi grade ahi was tender, soft, and delicious. The dressing they made for the salad was genius too. I hate ginger, I can smell ginger from 20 feet away and I wouldn't go near it. But although this dressing has ginger in it, it was very mild and I didn't mind it as much. 

I got their Spicy Ahi -- grilled rare ahi with avocado, tomato & chipotle aioli.
SO GOOD. The bread was nicely toasted, and the stuff that's in the bread was just phenomenally put together. It was spicy enough to boost your appetite but not so strong that you want a sip of water after each bite. There were two pieces of sandwiches, and I gave my friend the other one since I'm having some of her salad too. We didn't finish the whole salad, oh I forgot to mention there were fries as well. The fries were crispy, and delicious. 

It's a really cute place, and you can walk around Chestnut streets before/after you eat. It's just a very nice, slow-paced, relaxing area for a sunny afternoon.
author: Erica L.

description:
This place is really hard to get to. Especially for those who have never been to San Fran (like myself) It's a tiny shop. There are 3-4 tables inside and a few chairs at the bar. The other seating is outside which is only enough for maybe 6-8 people. 

The food was great. We had the Fish, Steak, and Chicken Tacos and the Fish and Chips. They were all very good. We also had the Spicy and Sweet Potato fries which were seasoned perfectly. 

I would give 5 stars if I didn't feel so claustrophobic in the dining room.  However, I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a good fish taco in the Bay Area.
author: Austin C.

description:
I'm writing this review more as a confession than anything else because of the terrible guilt and remorse I feel after being hungry on Chestnut and NOT going to Lucca for the first time in my life.  But I needed a sit-down joint, so it had to be done. 

Pacific Catch is a consistently good option for this reason: the poke bowl!  Their daily specials are always fresh and delicious, too.  The location by the park is much easier to stomach because this one has such limited seating options, but our wait at the marina wasn't terrible (15 minutes on a Saturday afternoon).  

Overall, this is a great stop for a relatively fast and always delicious lunch.
author: Sacha M.

description: Always good, reliable and fun! I love the tacos and the salads ...also, they have a great happy hour from 4-6!!!
author: Lauren B.

description: First time coming here with my girl. All I gotta say is speed, freshness, and the best customer service ever. We decided to change our appetizer order last minute (our Thai coconut shrimp just came in) to the poke appetizer and the owner (I think) said don't worry about it. Very small fast paced environment. I love cozy spots like this. Will be back for sure!
author: Rich H.

description:
I love their ahi poke rice bowl.  The combination of the ahi poke, seaweed salad, pickled ginger, avocado, and wasabi dressing in this bowl of rice all goes so perfectly well together.  UH-MAZING is all I could say.  The poke is cut up into bite sized pieces  and marinated with just the right amount of sauce.  I always order this bowl with brown rice for an extra kick of nutrition.

I also love their California salmon sandwich.  Salmon, avocado, aioli sauce on the softest ciabatta bread I've ever had.  The salmon is grilled to perfection.  I always order this with sweet potato fries.  Their sweet potato fries are served with a sweet chili sauce.  It is the perfect combo.
author: Gloria Y.

description: The menu is so diverse.  There are tacos, salads, rice bowls, and sandwiches.  I LOVED the korean bbq rice bowl with sticky ribs and brown rice.  I loved the cucumbers, eggs, and daikon that come with it.  If they had kimchi in there, it would be perfect.  But I understand since the menu is not completely asian influenced, and I know that kimchi is not a favorite for everyone.  All the other rice bowls looked delicious and I am definitely gonna come back to try the Poke Bowl and the Ahi Bowl.
author: Kimba V.

description:
Was very impressed with fish tacos & overall quite good service / ambiance. If you have a party of 5+ would recommend calling ahead as the place can only accomodate for 10-15 people TOTAL. 

 Definitely will come back to try other things!
author: Dmitriy V.

description:
Wow this place was a great find! The sweetie and I were in the mood for some food, but nothing overwhelming so after walking up and down Chestnut Street we decided on this place after changing our minds from burgers, and boy was it the the right decision.

Nice, small but clean place that had outdoor seating but honestly it was too chilly for that. Sat against the large window/booth area and peeped the extensive menu of delicious items to choose from. 

After much debate I opted for the 2 taco plate and chose the cabo shrimp and mahi mahi. Wow the shrimp was so crispy and all the addings complimented off each other from the smooth buttery avocado to the crisp shrimp and lettuce. The lime crema and jalapeno tartar are so good, I wondered why they don't have that sauce in a bottle and sell it. My mahi mahi was too, good as well. Nice and juicy with just the right amount of spice rub to not over power the fish itself.

I also got a Kona Longboard Lager to go with my meal and everything was just tasting and feeling right. Overall, everything was great from start to finish. Service kinda took a back seat but that's ok, it being my first time, I was more interested in the food anyways. Can't wait to try Pacific Catch back here at home in the South Bay, Chestnut definitely was tasty though!

Prices are about average for good seafood, I can see how bills can get easily out of control with all the yummy apps they have but just do the 2 taco plate, you'll be satisfied, and if you really are feeling super hungry get the 3 taco plate.

Lastly, the sweet potato fries here were easily the best I've ever had anywhere!
author: James D.

description:
I am not sure what would make this place better. Two visits and the meals have been very tasty, fresh, and presented especially well--and the service has been excellent. Could the facility be bigger? I wish it was, but maybe then it would lose some of its appeal.
I had the Ahi rice bowl, and it was all of the above--extremely fresh, great taste, excellent presentation, with great service.
author: Signo U.

description:
This location is much much smaller than the Pacific Catch on Lincoln Way. There is outdoor seating in the front of the restaurant with heated lamps and some seats in the front with a longer bar area.

My friends and I came here for happy hour since it seemed almost impossible to get a seat for dinner. We ordered the basket of fries ($3) which was large enough for three of us to share. I had the hawaiian poke ($6) and it didn't taste too salty like most of the other places I've tried. We also had the Pacific Steak taco with marinated grilled steak, crispy sweet onions, cabbage & sriracha aioli. We all agreed that the taco was delicious! 

We sat at the bar and the waiter was extremely attentive and friendly and even joked with us because I arrived late. He also didn't have a problem with splitting the bill on multiple credit cards which was a plus!

I recommend coming here for happy hour or lunch because dinner just seems way too crowded.
author: Vikki K.

description:
I love the salmon teriyaki bowl here. I do half brown rice and half salad, If they delivered or had easy parking like their inner sunset restaurant does it would be 5 stars for me!

Update! They just told me that doordash.com does delivery for them! 5 stars it is now :)
author: Katherine L.

description:
Ridiculously expensive for what you get. Ordered a bowl for pick up and $18 later I was outraged to say the least. Will not return. 

Glaze on Fillmore is better bang for your buck.
author: Suzanne G.

description:
Loved their fish & chips.. also had the baja fish taco. (Happy Hour)
If you like lemonade as much as I do, you'll love their lemonade spritzer thing they've got there. 

I'll be back the next time I'm in town.
author: Anna K.

description: Food is good! When the weather is nice sitting outside is fun!
author: Matt S.

description:
Small place with overprice  plates. The quality of the food was ok!
It is more a mexican place than a seefood one
author: Susana R.

description: You should go here immediately. Actually, wait until a Tuesday night and then go to get half off your bottle of wine. We enjoyed everything that we ordered: ahi poke, edamame, grilled salmon salad and the fish tacos, but the ahi poke really stood out. It was incredibly fresh and seasoned perfectly, with the crispy wontons to complement it. Next time I am in San Fran, I will definitely be coming back.
author: Elizabeth J.

description: We were on vacation from Long Beach and visited this place. All I can say is that it was some of the best food I have had in a long while. I had the Pan Asian bowl, the rest of my party had the the short ribs, tacos, soup of the day, sweet potato fries, and for desert chocolate fondue. We came on a busy day, so we had to wait a while, but let me tell you it was worth ever minuet of the wait. Corey was our host and he keep checking with us when the next available table was going to be and just made our wait time very comfortable by giving us beverages and keeping us updated. Jeffery was our server and he was great on answering questions about the dishes and was polite and friendly. The hospitality was just so amazing; they were friendly and you could tell that it was genuine that they just wanted us to be comfortable and satisfied. We were definitely more than satisfied. They were so gracious about out patience that they comped an appetizer and a dessert on the house. I love this place and can't wait to be in San Fransisco to come here again! Wish we had this hospitality and few
author: Eddie R.

description:
My wife & I went to SF for "Fleet Week" & she wanted to find a place for lunch or dinner. Yelp came through big time.

If you like fish this is the place to go. I order the 3 taco platter and my wife ordered the 2 taco platter. You can mix and match from 6 choices. I ordered the Traditional Baja, Maui Maui & Cabo Shrimp. Not a single bad bite. the platter also came with sweet potato fries.

Great Lunch!

If you are in the Marina district, this is the place to eat.
author: Ronald M.

description:
I really like this place, everything I've had has been good. 

I love the ceviche, made my favorite way, with avocado and tortilla chips! could eat that for every single meal.
author: Claire b.

description:
This is my go-to, quick stop, guarantee great sea food spot! 

I order my regular favorites... For lunch I like the Ahi Sandwich with sweet potato fries or mahi mahi sandwich. For dinner I like the rice bowls usually with the Ahi. To start I always go with the coconut battered shrimp. 

The only reason I give four stars instead of three is because every time I have ordered their "SPECIAL" Ive been extremely disappointed. Ive made this mistake a few times and every time I wish I could return it and reorder my usual. SAD FACE. 

Overall, I highly recommend this place for lunch and dinner.
author: Dee C.
