description:
Great food, but staff that does not want to be there (and apparently isn't properly motivated/incentivized). Started calling tonight for takeout at 9:35pm and phone kept ringing and ringing off the hook; they don't close until 10pm on week nights, so while calling I decided to drive over to see what was happening.

When I walked in, ostensibly on a call with someone else, I saw the phone ringing and the red light flashing -- all while the staff intentionally ignored it. They had turned the ringer all the way down/off so it wouldn't bother them audibly; however, it was clear to me and anyone paying attention that they just didn't want to take any more orders tonight so they could get out as early as possible. (When I told the host/waiter about the issue he knowingly nodded, shrugged, and asked me what I wanted to order.)

Admittedly it's a cold, yucky night, but come on -- you've got a full 35 minutes until close! Fortunately for their owner(s) the wasabi bowls are too good not to go elsewhere (yet).
author: Patrick D.

description: Truly terrific - great service and drinks.  Fish and chips were excellent.
author: M C.

description:
Great service, tasty food (wide variety on menu!), reasonable prices -- I'm a fan.  One nice thing about the Marina is the expansive selection of solid to-go / takeout places.  

The staff is fast + friendly, seafood fare is delicious, and it is very clean.  Big portions too that you can take home.  

The inside is small (they do have a few tables outside (I think with heaters) but they turn the tables over pretty quickly -- I've never felt rushed or anything, but never waited as long as I would've thought I would have had to wait given the size of the place.

I would not recommend driving here -- 22 and 30 buses go right by, and I assume parking would be a royal pain.  Very fresh food & also at the Marina location you can order online to pickup!
author: Molly B.

description: I've been frequenting this PC location since it opened and have grabbed many a seared ahi tuna salad, salmon salad and poke bowl from there.  It is a great way to get some Asian flavor into your meal without having to go full sushi.  They also have a great happy hour if you've ever available btw 4-6pm on weekdays.  It hint he service at this location lacks a bit because everyone is so cramped in this space, how can you not get annoyed once in a while?
author: e w.

description: Mostly do takeout from here as the seating is limited and cramped. The menu is pretty simple, but the takeaway is: they know how to GRILL. I've had the mahi mahi to chicken to marinated skirt steak, and each left me with a great impression. The rest of the rice bowls seem a little hastily put together, but for the type of place it is, I don't expect a work of art. Portions are large, but really, just plain good grilling.
author: Victoria C.

description:
I used to eat here about once a week when I lived down the street. The servers were always friendly and the food was always good.

Great fish tacos! Except one time I found a piece of plastic in one of mine.

My favorite thing to order was the wasabi bowl with salmon- half brown rice/half salad. Mmm, the fish and rice were warm, the salad was cold, and the wasabi dressing was spicy- a great combination! 

They also have a good happy hour, but the place is small.
author: Jenna R.

description: I used to love Pacific Catch, but as it's grown, it's lost a bit of the pizazz that made it what it was. It's too bad they don't offer Eel anymore and the wasabi bowls are quickly made and served. Sorry P.Catch but I got to give ya a 3~
author: Shawn S.

description: Reasonable lunch option. A lot of their choices are on the weird side, even for a non-picky eater. Good fish, big portions, works well for takeout.
author: Rachel B.

description: The salads are huge and delicious! The fried fish entree was also great.
author: Nick S.

description:
Delicious food with affordable price. 

Went there because a friend of a friend said: "If you like Hawaian style ahi tuna, you need to go to Pacific Catch". I wasn't disappointed. Food is fresh, place small but remodeled and cute. Every time I am in Pacific Heights I always go there. My favorite dish is the ahi tuna salad - just substitute the ahi tuna for Hawaiian poke. You won't regret it.

PS. Don't forget to try the lemon grass tea and sweet potatoes fries.
author: Michal K.

description:
THE GOOD: The ceviche - one of the best I've ever had, but the shrimp wasn't diced. A little too big for my preference. The slaw - YUM. A unique twist on cole slaw with a sesame taste.

THE BAD: Oh my goodness, this place is small. If you extend your arms, you can easily grab the lady's boob next to you sitting at the next table. Yup. That close. Parking is also a biatch. Seriously, it's the Marina.

THE MEDIOCRE (I know you were expecting "ugly"): For our main dishes, I ordered the Seared Ahi Tuna Rice bowl and my bf ordered the Mahi Taco and the Baja taco. For myself, I'd say it was just okay. Definitely not worth the hype. I'm a little biased, however. I'm not a true fan of raw/semi-raw fish. My bf said his tacos were just "alright" also.

2 appetizers, 2 meals = about $45 including tip. Not bad.

Would I go back? Probably not because of parking and cramped seating.
author: Lena L.

description:
I randomly ended up here and enjoyed a fabulous lunch with La Novia. For once, the food in San Francisco was worth coming back for in the future. It's a muthafreakin' Marina miracle.

The dining area at Pacific Catch is super small and cramped, but they make up for it with huge flavor and excellent customer service. And even though it is located in the Marina, there was a quite the shortage of guys in pink polo shirts, shorts, and sunglasses. I guess the typical Marina "bro" is allergic to seafood? Or maybe they were all out shopping for white baseball caps? Or maybe they were just too hungover to wake up by noon?

The menu is filled with Asian fusion options. For a starter dish, I highly recommend the Hawaiian Poke. For $8.50, two people can easily share this appetizer that features plenty of large chunks of poke that are bursting with flavor. When La Novia took her first bite, I think her eyes change from green to blue to gray and then back to green. It's that damn good.

As for the main portion of the lunch, La Novia had a two taco meal ($10.95). For her sides, she chose a "small side salad & black beans." She isn't a fan of black beans and well, she likes her beans as she likes her men: girthy and a lighter shade of brown. 

Anyway, the small side salad needed a bit more flavoring; but her taco choices, which included the Grilled Mahi Mahi and the Spicy Chicken, were both very good. I felt the Spicy Chicken could have brought some more heat, but then again, we were in the Marina. However, for your convenience, there are bottles of Sriracha on each table to help spice up your meal (and your bowel movements). Nice.

I also opted for the two taco meal, featuring the Traditional Baja and Crispy Cabo Shrimp. But I opted for sweet potato fries on the side. The fries were okay. As for the tacos, the Crispy Cabo Shrimp taco was amazing, but the Traditional Baja was mediocre and it was "fishy" smelling. The smell got all over my fingers. Had La Novia not been at this lunch and I came home from a day at the Marina with hands smelling like this, she would have accused me of having an affair. 

Even with the "so so" sides and one funky fishy taco, I can totally see myself returning here as it's inexpensive, delicious, and pink polo shirt free. It's a muthafreakin' Marina miracle.
author: Archie G.

description: Much smaller than their Sunset location, but we didn't have to wait that long on a Friday night for 4. Disappointed with my Hawaiian Teriyaki bowl with chicken- mushy rice, little veggies. I was hoping I'd like the food here, since there used to be a time I loved Pacific Catch, but their Marina location was worse than their Sunset one. My friends seemed to like their fried foods however.
author: Sophia B.

description:
Great place to come for a delicious meal in a casual setting.

A few of my favorite things:
Hawaiian Poke appetizer- great to start your meal off or if your not too hungry have it as your meal!
The Shrimp tacos- so juicy and full of flavor
Fried Oysters- nomnom I LOVE LOVE oysters and they give you a generous helping of oysters in this dish!

and last but not least do not leave without getting an order of the leche rolls served with vanilla ice cream and drizzled with caramel.

Yum!
author: Jordan C.

description: I think the food is between a 3 and 4 star but I'm pretty happy with this place. I like coming here and eating at the bar when I want quick yet healthy food. I usually order the wasabi bowl with poke or the salad with poke. You get a little dish of edamame to nosh on ASAP when you sit down. I've never gotten take out here but am willing to try it in the future since I live in the neighborhood.
author: Kai C.

description:
I love this place. I've been here roughly 4-5 times and I must say I've never been disappointed. The Hawaiian Poke is delicious! So is the BBQ Salmon sandwich. The tacos are also really good, even though it might not be expected and you have Tacolicious next door. I recommend trying the steak taco and the Ahi taco. 

Also use Foursquare to checkin and if it's your first time checking in you get a free order of calamari. At least that was the case when I was there.
author: Eddie M.

description: crispy fish tacos , swordfish with brown rice and corn on the cob , lemon ginger iced tea , very satisfying food after a long run or hike , place could be a little small but the food is great so who cares.
author: NAEL K.

description:
Pacific Catch knows its role and plays it well. There are plenty of sushi spots in the area, stick to those when you crave it, but send all of fish requests this way. Their Mahi Mahi tacos are delicious. I wouldn't recommend a beer or cocktail here as it tends to get pretty pricey, but don't be afraid to rely on the bar seating. We had a table next to the bar that was quite lounge-worthy and enjoyable. The sweet potato fries are awesome but I did not enjoy their "spicy fries", which lacked the spice.  Please try the sweet sauce that comes with sweet potato fries, it won't let you down.

Calamari is a great appetizer, although be warned that the pieces are thick and a bit tough to chew on.
author: Nathan O.

description: Do not get their shrimp ceviche, god damn that was WAY too spicy/salty/lime-y to eat. So disappointing. Too expensive for me in general when you look at the price compared to serving sizes. The variety basket didn't have enough food in it & was WAY way too greasy, I am aware fried food is fried food, but this was coated and dripping. Maybe because I'm hungry as fuck after a 75 mile ride on my bike, but the only thing good about this was the fact I called in to order and eat outside the restaurant.
author: Ellie B.

description: I love the poke, normally just get the traditional style.  It's really good with the fried wontons.  Nice place for a quick sit down lunch when I'm in the Marina.  Shrimp ceviche on special was also really nice.  I haven't tried anything else here but I've never been let down so far.
author: Ryan K.

description: Pacific catch is in a great location and the service was fast. The sweet potato fries are delicious. I had the fish taco trio with mahi mahi, shrimp and salmon. They definitely were the best fish tacos I have had and a welcomed change from cod.
author: Megann J.

description: Great place for lunch or to enjoy a beautiful weather while eating. They have outdoor patio, but the inside is a little bit small (I don't recommend big groups like 5 or more).  Overall, I give it 3 star because the food and price are decent; however, service can be iffy sometime.
author: Vivian S.

description: Could not be more disappointed in this place. The quality used to be great; worth it to pay $15 dollars for a Korean BBQ bowl. Now, you're lucky if you get 3 pieces of meat on top of your $15 bed of rice. The sandwiches and sides are no longer packaged for takeout in containers, but wrapped separately. This makes for a soggy mahi mahi sandwich with overly chewy smushed bread and cold soggy fries (nevermind the tiny portion). To add insult to injury, half the sandwich had no fish on it. So no, I will not be returning.
author: Whitney B.

description:
I love this place!

I crave their fish tacos (all the fish variations are delicious. i avoid the fried stuff but i hear thats amazing too.) Their bowls are good if you aren't getting it to-go. The bowls are super healthy, with a lot of flavor. I like the tuna one. I've also had the salmon BBQ sandwich which is also delicious! And their sweet potato fries...mm mm mm!!!!!

the only reason i didn't give 5 stars is because it's really small and usually too busy to enjoy the second when i want it :(
author: Danielle R.

description:
This is probably my favorite restaurant in all of San Francisco.

I've got to be honest, the prices are a tad high, but it is completely worth it. I have been here about 30 times (it's my guilty pleasure) and not once have they disappointed me with their ultra-fresh Hawaiian poke that is to die for, and their spicy tuna rolls. Good spicy tuna rolls are so hard to find that this place masters them. The perfect amount of spicy sauce to tuna ratio. Perfect. 

I go here with my friends, my family, and we all love it. The atmosphere here is also great. I like when restaurants are warm and clean looking. I don't need fancy dining cloths and silver spoons, just some soft couches and they've got them!

If you come here during the day in the summer, people will be sitting mostly outside and some inside, all dressed in summer attire coming from the park which is right across the street.

Also, for all you soda lovers out there, like me, FREE REFILLS! Definitely come here and try: Spicy tuna rolls, Hawaiian poke, Ecstasy rolls and Hawaiian rice bowls, but everything else here is sure to please.
author: Deana T.

description: The rice bowls and sweet potato fries and sauces are AMAZING. Casual, quick, delicious food. One of my favorite spots in SF.  Usually busy but no reservation required.
author: Jason T.

description:
Miss this place since I moved out of the Marina....it was my quick fix for seafood since it use to be around the corner.  Really good, fast and somewhat healthy food. I think I've tried everything on the menu - courtesy of my former employer for feeding me in the evenings and weekends. My favorites: Hawaiian poke or sweet potato fries for appetizers and one of the rice bowls for entrée (usually got half salad and half brown rice) plus choice of fish or chicken.

The place was always packed since it is so small...so was nice I could swing by and get carryout.
author: Alex C.

description: 5 star bowl! I got the poki bowl with seaweed salad , rice, veggies, avocado etc. forgot the actual name and it was ahhhhhmazing! Everything I saw come out looked great! Lemongrass tea was light and refreshing ;)
author: Whitney B.

description:
Favorite location of the 3. By far the best service! 
Crab salad wasabi bowl, sweet potato fries, and spicy ahi tuna sandwich are our top picks! 

The Hawaiian pineapple martini at Corte madera is DELICIOUS!
author: Tiffany L.

description: Yummmm! I had the seared ahi salad. That was sooo yummy and very filling! My friends told me that if you order that salad to go though its much smaller. Also had the sweet potato fries which just so happened to be on happy hour. I'm happy :) Service was kinda slow. I'm pretty understandable about that but the place is tinyyyy! Haha. Oh & theres a charge for tea? Oh well. I'll be back to try more on the menu.
author: Natassia S.

description:
Downgrading to 3 stars as my recent poke salad wasn't so good.  The tuna wasn't as fresh and the salad fixings weren't either.
*********
I don't think I could ever eat here...way too claustraphobic, but I am sitting at my desk with a huge ahi poke salad that I can't finish. This is the BEST poke I've had in California. I am in love with my lunch. 

I usually avoid Marina bashing but here's a rare opportunity, lucky me, and lucky you....I have never been in a neighborhood where the sense of pedestrian entitlement is so flagrant....I felt like random well dressed or flip flop wearing good looking white people were throwing themselves on the hood of my car. WTF people????

The world is divided into two types of people:
-Those who look both ways before they cross, and try to cross at intersections in a busy area. A subset of this particular group of the human species always returns their shopping carts to the designated area.

-And then we have the citizens of entitlement and privilege, out in full force today on Chestnut Street, blindly crossing the street at will, leaving mayhem in their path, the Mr. Magoos of pedestrians.

/rant. 

I am very much looking forward to visiting the newer, much larger Pacific Catch at 9th & Lincoln!!
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
Ah what a nice day today, headed over to Crissy Field to let Darwin have his fun and then afterwards walked Chestnut St to take in the sights, sounds, smells, and handbags.

Stopped off at Pacific Catch with a friend and grabbed a sandwich to go. I decided on the wasabi ahi. Not sure I remember all the ingredients on there, but it was primarily seared rare ahi, ginger, and a wasabi sauce. I also had the sweet potato fries on the side.

Have to say I was pretty happy with the meal. I've never had an ahi sandwich before and the potent flavors worked out well. The high quality bread held everything together and I was able to eat napkin free (a good thing since we forgot to grab any). 

A solid afternoon snack... also fyi there is a park about one block east if you need a sunny place to eat.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Came here for Happy Hour.  Good prices on beers ($3.50) and on food.  There's lots of seafood taco options at $3 apiece which my group didn't take advantage of.  Here's what we ordered:

Sweet Potato Fries ($3):
http://s3-media4.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/T3-zPa8t7n2QtEuy5XmzZw/l.jpg
I'm normally not a huge fan of sweet potato fries, but these came out really nice, crispy and perfectly salted on the outside.

Spicy Fries ($3):
http://s3-media2.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/SCSkZMWwZoAPcJNsc5i_Ug/l.jpg
Delicious!  Debatable about whether or not I enjoyed these more than the sweet potato fries.

Calamari ($6):
http://s3-media3.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/P3ual1pfzE2e_3MLxip6yQ/l.jpg
Good, however the pieces of calamari were small, but at least the restaurant didn't try to overcompensate by putting a ton of breading on them (which I hate).  There's also thin lemon slices that were breaded, and were actually quite good.

Baja Shrimp Ceviche ($6):
Big pieces of shrimp with a very pleasant mix of avocado, cilantro, lime, and chili.

Hawaiian Poke ($6):
http://s3-media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/eH7l7IpH3sdcxZE-NUJ-Fw/l.jpg
This was the reason why I wanted to try the restaurant in the first place.  It didn't disappoint. 

The restaurant itself is casual and tiny, table-seating for maybe 12-15 people in the front, and approx the same number along the bar.  The service was good/friendly, but the restaurant was also half empty on a Thursday afternoon.  Not a hype-worthy place, but a pleasant place.
author: Jeanne L.

description: Please don't go... with all the places that serve great food in SF - this place belongs in the suburbs.  The food is tired not bad but not good either...
author: Michael S.

description:
I love summer, and I love fish tacos, and in my mind the two go together.  There is something about picturing a colorful 10 lb Mahi-mahi swimming through  tropical waters that feels very tranquil and summery...I try to ignore the part where it's body is deep fried and piled onto tortillas.

Hurray for summer, fish tacos, and sweet potato fries!
author: Jamaica Y.

description:
Delicious! My husband and I dined here for a late lunch yesterday after a full morning of walking around San Francisco and were not disappointed! The sweet potato fries were by the far the star of the meal, though both of our sandwiches were tasty as well. I had the spicy ahi sandwich while he went with the spicy mahi mahi sandwich. 

Get the sweet potato fries! They are amazing!
author: Kelly M.

description: Healthy ingredients (and portions), reasonable pricing, and relatively fast service. Tiny restaurant space, so expect to be cozy with your neighbors if you eat-in! Pal and I who had both never been before thoroughly enjoyed though. The rice bowls are plentiful and incredibly fresh. This is a great Marina option for take-out or a low-key dinner with a friend!
author: Zach N.

description:
This place is f'ing tiny! Don't let the size fool you because this place is BUSY. 

I hate to admit that I spend time in the Marina, but I was coming back on a bike ride from Crissy field and I was craving some salmon. 

Pacific Catch serves up a generous salmon rice bowl with some veggie sides that I love. The rice bowl is about $12 but comes with sushi rice and some quality salmon (by my estimation, anyways). 

The vibe is casual but it's a bustling spot. 

The person sitting next to us at the bar was having some fish tacos that looked amazing. 

This is a good, moderately priced place worth trying.
author: Carlos A.

description: I dont give my reviews based on price or other factors other than quality of food menu and ambiance. The food here is amazing , the menu is unique and the hole in the wall feel with nice set up is so cozy I love this place will be back for more, also price is reasonable you get more than what you pay for these prices are chain rest prices for better quality and taste.. :D
author: Estefania S.

description:
Whenever I walk by this place it is always busy and there is usually a line so the first time I've witnessed this place looking somewhat less busy I decided to stop in for lunch.  They make good use of this small space, but the dining area is very tight.  I had no choice but to take a table and chair setting because the counter was full.

I was actually looking at the grilled fish sandwiches on the menu when the red box with Japanese Rice Bowls caught my attention.  It sounded good and more filling than a sandwich.  I ordered a Teriyaki Bowl with salmon and brown rice.  The standard bowl is served with sushi rice, but I've always enjoyed the nuttiness and nutritional advantages of the brown rice, and besides it was only a dollar more.

Both of the wait staff were super friendly and the service was outstanding as I had this gigantic rice bowl (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5xp-qHGhzEzXevsSzYrwkg?select=6nRKReF6TyPpELefrYoolg) sitting in front of me in just a few minutes.  

I picked up a piece of the shiitake mushroom and found it to be nicely seasoned with just a hint of sesame oil.  The baby asparagus pieces were nice and crunchy.  The big stalks of Shanghai bok choy were a bit on the chewy side but were unseasoned so I got the natural taste of the vegetable.  The pineapple salsa which was served icy cold was outstanding bringing together crushed pineapple, chopped red onions and cilantro along with some fiery spices that shot flares up my nostrils.  The salmon was grilled tender and juicy flaky.  I thought it was great that the rice was not soaked in with teriyaki sauce.  There was just enough mixed in to give the dish a nice teriyaki flavor.  I loved how all of the different ingredients with their different flavors blended together so well.  Topped off with sesame seeds I found that the big rice bowl was a challenge just to finish, but I happily consumed every last kernel of chewy brown rice leaving an empty bowl and walking away with a full stomach.

Now I see why this place is so popular!  Free soda refills too.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: Big fan of Pacific Catch for years.  Solid calamari with aioli dipping sauce.  I like the Korean bowl myself and if we're feeling like fish tacos and Tacolicious is jacked, we head here.
author: Joe I.

description:
Very interesting menu... not your usual fast-seafood type dishes.  I had the Hawaiian Poke dish (off the chalkboard), which came with purple potatoes and a very good creamy sauce on top.  1 more side dish that I can't remember, plus a small spinach salad with salad oil.

Everything was very tasty!!  I'd love to try one of the wasabi bowls next time I'm in the SF area.  

One downside is street parking, so you might have to park a few blocks away... but that's the case everywhere in SF.
author: Ryan M.

description: Love the salmon bbq sandwich and the coconut shrimps. Service is quick, waiters are nice. On the pricey side though
author: Meryl C.

description:
Seafood with a hint of the Islands and Asian spices.

Our waiter greeted my friend and I warmly and led us to a table with a window view.  (Don't lean back because the windows are actually open).  I love it when waiters also offer suggestions on entrees and portion sizes if they know it's your first time.  

I confess, it was my first try of Ahi Poke.  I'm glad my first introduction to it was at Pacific Catch - fresh cubes of tuna mixed with scallions, sesame, soy sauce, and peppers.  A poke fan at first bite.

We split the fish and chips dish, which came with sweet potato fries, cole slaw, and breaded fish.  The dips included the more traditional tartar sauce, but also included a thai sweet chili sauce.  Fries were a good salty-sweet and the fish was fresh (but the batter was a bit bland).

Pluses for the fresh food, cute, bright, and cozy ambiance, and great service.  How many other waiters tell you the story behind their tattoo as they clean your table?  Love it.
author: Pauline L.

description: Great menu. Small restaurant but service is fast and tables turn quickly. Fish tacos are very good. Food cooked to order and they accommodate special requests.
author: Edwina P.

description:
Came here with an old friend from high school today. We sat down, ordered and settled into catching up when the waiter brought us our drinks. He ended up spilling an entire iced tea on my friend. The glass dropped so hard on the table that it broke in several pieces and of course my friend got totally drenched.

We ended up taking our food to go and eating it on a bench near the Marina so my friend's clothes could dry in the sun.

I really enjoyed my wasabi tuna sandwich and sweet potato fries. Our waiter was extremely apologetic about the accident and picked up the tab for lunch. I thought the situation was handled very well.
author: Miriam W.

description: went here with girlfriend and had the poke bowl with a shrimp cerviche..both gluten free. The quality of the fish is really fresh. It is a little pricey but i defiinitely recommend it.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Bad service, [very] limited seating, but a great place to grab a quick and relatively healthy bite. 

Had the mahi mahi tacos, loved every bite of it. Came with spicy fries, which were the best fries I've had in recent times

Friends got the terriyaki and wasabi rice bowls. The wasabi bowl was a little too spicy and redundant in its flavor, so I recommend the terriyaki bowl instead.

The place gets PACKED (it seats all of 20 people) and the service is bad. No reservations, so avoid the rush and go late or early.
author: Meghana D.

description: Went here yesterday and the service was fantastic. The food runner Maggie was one of a kind and always made sure we had everything we needed! Would definitely go back next time I'm in the marina!!
author: Jacob W.

description:
Tiny cozy place in the Marina that is typically packed weekend nights. It's one of those cool, in-the-know restaurants; you can tell because they have a foursquare check-in special!

"Pacific Catch combines the bold sauces, spices & preparations styles of Asia, Latin America and Polynesia with local California ingredients to create a new kind of fish house." SF, how you are known for mixing everything together and coming up with a delicious combination!

They feature menu items with everything fish. Fish burgers, sandwiches, dishes, tacos, so on and so on. We came in on a weekday night and were seated with no problem. The waitress was really friendly and accommodating, and the owner seemed like a genuinely friendly and warm guy.

Got the special seared ahi taco and the grilled mahi mahi with a side of sweet potato fries. The ahi was topped with crispy fried onions and sauce. Definitely packed a punch and the flavors went really well together. The mahi was more light and fresh tasting, with avocado-tomatillo salsa & lime crema (fancy foreign way to spell cream?) The tacos looked petite, but I was quite full and had trouble finishing my fries, which by the way, were amazing. Had trouble finishing them, but kept stuffing my face with them anyway. 

Nice place to come and chill with a small group of friends (4, tops)! You can laugh as loudly as you want without people giving you weird stares!
author: Carolyn K.

description:
Delicious!!!

I just love this place!!! I have been wanting to try it in ages and finally got there today with my brother and his friend. 
I let the server recommend a wasabi rice bowl dish with salmon which was just perfect. Everything very fresh and great flavours along with reasonable prices...

Also- big thanks to the other lady working who kept topping up our waters... We had done a big walk to get there so was totally parched!

THANKS!! Will be back :)
author: Lital K.

description: Small restaurant with really great, Hawaiian-ish food.  The wife and I had lunch here - she had a seafood salad with poke, which was delicious, and I had some of their shrimp and mahi mahi tacos.  Both were great and would definitely go back.
author: Ben C.

description: Offers a wide variety of appealing menu items. Portions are ample. Service was friendly.
author: Olivia P.

description:
Reminds me a bit of SoCal, like Wahoo or something, except with an Asian twist. The only part I don't like about this place is that it's small. I mean, it looks big when looking in, but dining here with a group is gonna be hard.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: Been going to Pac Catch for the last 5 years and have been disappointed in the direction that management has decided to take. Prices have continued to go up and portions are getting smaller. Not the quality and value it used to be.
author: Ron S.

description:
I love this restaurant! Not everything is an A but you just have to know what to order. 

I love the wasabi bowls. It's a very interesting dish that, I think it's safe to say, you can't find anywhere else. It sort of reminded me of bibimbap in the sense that it's a mixture of a ton of things: wakame salad, avocado, nori, daikon sprouts, sesame, ginger and cucumber in a soy-wasabi sauce. I ordered it with the Ahi Poke, which is cubed raw tuna prepared in a spicy sesame soy sauce. It was different and definitely yummy.

The sweet potato fries were also delicious. It was crispy, salted, thin-cut but I could still taste the potato inside. 

I think this is going to be a place I make frequent visits too. Beware though, it is kind of small, so there might be a wait :T
author: Thy L.

description: Ordered their new(?) tuna with chips dish. It is one of three dishes that they now offer. It was amaziiiing. I'm definitely not doing it justice since I can't remember the exact name. It was ahi tuna California style? Bomb!
author: Cesie A.

description:
I have no idea why tacolicious is taking away from this place.  The tacos are bigger, better and healthier.  Go there after for drinks....

The salads rock, I have had every single one!  The tacos - awesome.  This is what I want in a fish taco.  Great sauce, fresh fish, clean, nice cabbage, light but filling.  The sweet potato fries, yes please.  Crispy, but flavorful with different sauces, salty sweet and yummy.

The bowls, so many to choose from, all so reasonable, healthy, filling and flavorful.  Um sign me up.

No sake :( No hard drinks :(  Apparently I was the only person here who drank sake so go bug them and order some bottles.... Other than that I would give them 5 stars.
author: Alexis B.

description: Ate here on a recent weekend in SF. The food was very good, we went for fish and ended up ordering other items. I got the pulled pork sliders with pineapple slaw (super yummy) and my friend ordered chicken tacos and said they were great. We both got the ginger lemongrass iced tea which was refreshing and light.
author: Amy P.

description: Hawaiian Poke Trio and Rising Sun roll were pretty damn good
author: Tiger S.

description:
I wish I knew about this place earlier... all I can say about this.

My friend took me here trying to find a gift for another friend, and she said this is one of the best places she's been to. So we went and I came along with her. Apparently, I thought it was just for fish tacos but I was really wrong. I ordered a rice bowl; the Korean BBQ with two fillets of salmon, and oh boy, it filled me up and it was probably one of the best rice bowls I've ever had! Will be back for more, definitely!
author: Bryan S.

description: Great place to sit at the counter & watch the action if you're grabbing a bite solo.  Decent value for the prices.  Salmon piece on the sandwich a bit skimpy.  The sweet potato fries are deep fried yumminess!  Hint:  ask for some sweet hot sauce for dipping.
author: Kim S.

description:
Food is good = 4.5 stars
Price is a bit steep = 3 stars
Service is good and staff is friendly = 5 stars

The space is tiny, let me emphasize again, TINY, TINY, TINY, and packed with small tables but wait times are very reasonable. Seats 15 people at a time from the looks of it. 

An absolute must is to get the Wasabi Bowl. The Poke Wasabi Bowl is the best from the various bowls we've eaten.
author: Mike S.

description:
POKE WASABI RICE BOWL.

read all the reviews, ask any of the waiters... they will all say the same thing. try it!
author: Christina L.

description:
This is now one of my favorite restaurants in SF. Tuna wasabi bowl- half salad, half brown rice, all delicious!

There's nothing I'll say that hasn't been said, but for the love of all this is holy: go!!!

I'm dying to try the poke next time
author: Elle W.

description:
While the calamari seemed thin, the breading was also very thin making for nice crisp morsels, so, thumbs up there.  The Taco platter had an interesting salad with it (enough fried food for me with the calamari and tacos) that went well with the meal.

Baja taco, was just OK, seemed a kind of plain
Shrimp taco was really good, a wonderful salsa
Steak taco was pretty good, again, nice salsa

Overall a good relatively inexpensive meal.  The place is not huge, but that didn't stop me from enjoying the food.  I'll return.  Thanks!
author: Joe N.

description:
Amazing Ahi Sandwich!!!

Another great recommendation from Patty P, this was one of my absolute favorite stops in SF. 
Ahi and Avocado is one of my favorite combinations, and searing the ahi and putting it with avocado inside some wonderful ciabatta bread with a citrus aioli was heavenly!!! I couldn't get enough and couldn't help feeling sad after i finished it all, that i didn't live closer. My dude said that he was ready to make a trip again up north for this sandwich alone! He got his with wasabi mayo and sweet potato fries, which were amazing as well. We asked for dipping sauces for the fries and they gave us the sweet thai chili sauce and some wasabi mayo and it paired well! 
My relatives had some bowls- the ahi and salmon bowls, which were delicious as well. 
The amazing thing for me was that they made me a fan of their asian coleslaw, which had Cilantro in it! i enjoyed every cilantro filled bite of it!!! I cannot wait to come back for some more and be back earlier for their happy hour eats!
author: Michelle T.

description:
Every time I eat a mediocre meal, I kick myself because there are only so many meals in life. And especially now, when I'm only back in SF for 2 weeks.

Pacific Catch food isn't bad, just slapped together and too expensive for the preparation and the setting. The fried oyster app batter is weird, like a pure cornstarch, though it tasted OK. My ahi salad was so drenched in sweet dressing I couldn't taste the veggies. Ahi good though and there was lots of it. Total for a shared app, the salad and a Sierra Nevada $25 with tip which is just too much.

So, three stars. Not good, not bad, just OK. And it is remarkable with so much great food available nearby that we had to wait for a table at 10 pm.
author: Otis M.

description:
Are you kidding?? I've been coming here weekly  for the past two years and have not written a review?

Thair Wasabi Bowl with ahi tuna rule!
Their service rule!
The wait? Sucks...get take out instead.
author: Mimi T.

description:
I was extremely disappointed after eating here yesterday. After reading so many 4 as 5 star reviews for Pacific Catch and their Wasabi bowls, I dragged my boyfriend here for lunch. 

The location is extremely tiny. I don't know if there are more seats in the back but the front of the restaurant only have 4 tables, with another 4 outside on the sidewalk. 

After seating ourselves (maybe that's how this place normally is? I'm used to having a server seat us), we decided to order the Miso-glazed yellowtail special and the Ahi Tuna Wasabi bowl, along with a side of spicy fries. Between the time of seating ourselves and ordering, no server came to our table to see how we were doing. In a place that was pretty much 10'x10'. And we were one of 3 tables inside the restaurant. We had to snag menus from a table next to us. Then we had to wave down a server to jot down our order. 

The fries came out pretty quickly. They were nice and crunchy with a little bit too much seasoning for my taste. The yellowtail was tiny and the sauce was too sweet. The mushrooms did nothing to compliment the fish. I felt like I was eating a fish-version of a Chicken Marsala. The Wasabi Bowl was pretty good but I expected a lighter soy-wasabi sauce rather than the thick, mayo-like sauce it came with. Everything in the bowl worked well together overall though. 

Another complaint from me on service though: the waiter, again, never came to check up on us. He, however, did keep chatting it up with the table behind us. The table who had never been there before either. The table who got a refill of chips on their appetizer, along with free samples of another appetizer, when we didn't even get a nod or refill on our waters. Extremely awkward for everyone else in the restaurant. And it's not like we were sitting in a inaccessible area. Our table was the one the servers had to pass by everytime to get to any other table. 

Anyways, I won't be coming back anytime soon. Or ever. And if I do, it'll probably be the Richmond location and for a sandwich this time. Overall, HUGE letdown.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Everyone that visits me in SF more than once requests a return visit to Pacific Catch.  We usually go to the Chestnut street location, but the other location (near Irving Street) is great, too.  The service is ALWAYS on point (I've literally never been disappointed).  The food is consistent, deeeeelicious, whimsical in approach, and overall pretty healthy!!  The only complaint that I had about this restaurant is that I always finish my entire meal (and sometimes my friend's meals), so it's difficult to fit into the closely placed tables/chairs.  That said, I'd rather have more close seating than have less seating... because this place is always packed at meal times and totally worth the wait.
author: Katie V.

description: While usually a solid meal (even though over priced) will not be going back. Undercooked chicken on my bowl gave me awful food poisoning. Worst 24 hours of my life. No thanks.
author: Dominic N.

description:
This is a solid place for tuna poke so if you ever have such a craving, give it a try.  I've yet to be disappointed.  

On our last visit, we had:

Pacifico for hubby ($4.50) and lemongrass iced tea ($2.50) for me. While the iced tea sounds delicious, it ended there - it was flavorless.  

Poke appetizer - $8.50 - this is a must for me, period.  Again, never disappoint.  Big chunks with just the right flavoring.  The wonton chips or whatever they serve them with you can skip - it's always stale.

Baja ceviche - $7.95 - ok.

Oyster basket - $9.50 - fried oyster, interesting batter - tasty but it was too much fried batter for me after a while and I have to start picking it away.

Seating is a bit tight inside so be considerate.
author: Gloria H.

description:
I ordered the Mahi Mahi and Cabo Shrimp tacos. They both were excellent.  I preferred the shrimp more because it was battered nicely which added a crunch. My meal also came with their signature sweet potato fries that were also salted perfectly. Not too much, but still enough to taste it and counter the sweetness. 

Very good restaurant and will definitely be coming back.
author: Kelson P.

description:
I've gone here for years and I love this location, this concept, the menu and the service here. I've always felt that if a restaurant were specifically designed to please ME, then Pacific Catch could be it!

I order the Hawaiian Poke Wasabi bowl with brown rice almost every time I go. I love it. Really great flavors with so much freshness - I can't help salivating at the thought.
author: Claire M.

description:
Great Lunch Spot

Pacific Catch is a very small place on Chestnut but has some great food. My mom and I went here together last weekend and walked away very satisfied. I will definitely be coming back soon and exploring more of the menu

We both ordered the Tacos  (me: salmon & bbq steak; mom: mahimahi & shrimp) with sweet potato fries. I enjoyed both but prefered the steak while my mom thought her shrimp taco was better than the mahimahi. The Sweet Potato Fries were delicious. I usually go to Barney's for these, but I may have to start getting them from here instead.
author: Molly P.

description:
Stopped in for their happy hour, $3 and $6 from 3-6. 

We ordered their poke, shrimp ceviche and sweet potato fries. 

Poke- i love how they have nice big chunks, I wish it was a little more marinated since it wasn't full of flavor, but that didn't stop it from tasting good.  At least the fish wasn't fishy, plus! There were also plenty of wonton strips to go with it. 

The sweet potato fries came out freshly fried since they were super hot. The tarter and sweet hot sauce went perfectly with it. 

Shrimp ceviche- plenty of nice size shrimps with chunks of avocado. Great flavors of lime and a hint of coconut milk/cream. Also had a little spicy kick to it, which was great. 

Overall, the place was small, reminded me of a order and take to go type place, but service was good and the food was great. The rest of the menu also looked very good.
author: Annie D.

description: For an everyday meal or casual get together, this place is an awesome go-to place.  I highly recommend the wasabi bowl.  It was outstanding!
author: Joe S.

description: The sandwiches and salads are flavorful and fresh. Pacific Catch is always nice for lunch. I walk away feeling satisfied, healthy and well nourished :)
author: SF U.

description:
This is the one to go to.

It may be smaller, always crowded, and serves virtually the same food as 9th and irving.. but honestly this one has it down.  

Favs on the menu:
Wasabi Ahi Sandwich
Hawaiian Poke Japanese Wasabi Bowl

Top any item off with sweet potato fries and a beer and you're set for the day.
author: Christine K.

description: Superb for a quick and fresh feeling bite. If you like pacific / Hawaiian inspired (coconut shrimp, poke, etc.) than this is your jam.
author: Sandra S.

description:
I like this place. It isn't anything extraordinary or anything, but it's solid, and I love fish so I'm always happy to go here. Their special tacos are always good, and I usually get their tuna salad.. I can definitely recommend that! One of the best parts: you can order online and go pick it up.
Just get there on the early side, because this place does fill up quickly, even on weeknights! 
Also, just to reiterate what other people said: double check your bill! My server left off two things we ordered, so I don't have the same complaint that something extra was added, but maybe because it is so busy they were pretty flustered..
author: Ashley H.

description:
Very good!
Love the Hawaiian ahi salad and lemongrass ginger tea.
They have specialty beers from Hawaii and the shrimp tacos according to my boyfriend were SMASHING!
The waitress was quick and attentive.

Definately come here if you're looking for fresh fish, a little bit of Asia/Island eats. Nothing fancy just good food.
author: tiffany d.

description: I love this place! The food is AMAZING, the staff is friendly and great, the ambiance is exciting and lively, and I always want to go there when I visit San Francisco. A MUST!
author: Emilie D.

description:
A friend and I stopped by here for a quick snack because our other friend used to work here. Busy place! Luckily we were able to get bar seating that had just opened up. 

We shared the Hawaiian poke, which was very good! And tried the cricket cola -- very interesting, but pretty good. It's microbrewed cola with green tea.

Only setback is that  this place is tiny so there can be a long wait for seating. Good thing they're opening one on 9th Ave & Lincoln, where Canvas used to be -- it'll be a lot bigger and I'm sure they'll have good business.
author: Miss H.

description: This place is awesome. Not from the city and used yelp to find a little place to grab a bite and fell in love!!! Ahi poke is amazing the menu is creative and the vibe is unbeatable!!! Definitely worth checking out!!
author: Rachel B.

description: Although it is a chain,  I was happy with my experience at Pacific Catch! Perhaps no one else is health freakish enough to experience this, but... Whenever you are in the situation where you have to go out to eat with someone, but don' t really want to because you just want to have some tasty clean eats at home, this is the place to go. If you want to eat paleo, the salads are very good, with a good portion of protein included. If you are down with rice, the rice bowls are very well sized and delicious as well. Good prices too!
author: Lauren D.

description:
Solid 4 stars.My party had about 6 dishes but all I could really remember were the 2 sushi rolls we had: the inside-out, and the firecracker. 

The two sushi rolls we had were very good. I like the Inside-Out more because I'm a fan of spicy tuna and california rolls and this roll is a fusion of the two.
author: Forest S.

description:
Get Ashley! It's not on the menu but she could be your waitress ;-) 
personally I like the sandwich better than the bowls. 
Maybe because of the sweet potato fires and how sweet my waitress is! 
Love this place!!! I woke up yelping it and dreaming of coming back there again. That nice! ;-)
author: Ia-Ching b.

description:
Yes, they are kid friendly! They have a kids menu and friendly, understanding staff. (I came here with my nephew.)
Poke was nicely seasoned and not spicy, letting the quality of the tuna shine through.
Calamari was perfect - not overlooked, with a light and crispy batter. The fried lemons and chiles were a bonus!
author: Lyn G.

description:
I love this place.  I would probably cook the way that this place cooks when I have my own place one day.  The ahi tuna salad was exactly how I would have my salads-with raw fish.  However, the dressing was a bit too much for me but it was my fault, I should have asked for it on the side or something seeing how I don't usually eat salad with a lot of dressing. 

My dad got the ahi tuna burger and that was pretty good.  Brother got the fried fish and chips and that was pretty good too.  He really liked the dipping sauces.

However...  It is a small place, pretty cramped so it is best NOT to come here with a big group, 2-4 people would be the max.

Okay place but...  I can make most of the dishes at home anyways.
author: Elizabeth A.

description:
really cozy place..

I had Japanese wasabi bowl with crab salad which came with seaweed salad and some veges over rice. It was really good!!
I will definately come back again!!
Goosd customer service as well. My waitress was very polite and friendly.
author: Melinda H.

description: Delicious food and great costume service. So, I think nothing more need to be said;)
author: Ana A.

description:
Went here a few weeks ago with my other half. We both ordered ahi poke and more ahi poke. It was the ahi poke wasabi bowl. Let me tell you the ahi was mediocre and tasted ok. 

I would probably go back to try some other dishes but will not order the same as last time.

Try it out for yourself who knows your taste buds might be different....
author: Jeffrey M.

description:
great food, wonderful portions!

tiny little spot but great for people watching and hanging with some friends. the staff seemed a bit stressed, but overall a good experience.
author: J W.

description:
Hate to say it, but the past two times I've ordered carry out, there's been a hair in my food! Twice! In a row! 

The first time it happened I called them and they apologized profusely before giving me a refund. The second time (about a month later) I didn't call back, because I'm done ordering from this place.

Buy some hairnets, shave your staff's heads...do something! Your food is so good otherwise.

P.S. - I vurped twice while typing this review
author: Nick G.

description:
I really like Pacific Catch mainly because it doesn't try to be anything more than what it is, a simple restaurant serving simple food. Considering it's location in the Marina (and other locations in the Sunset and Corte Madera), it's actually not pretentious or overly trendy. The Marina location is actually pretty small, almost cramped, but it doesn't bother me too much because I've never had a problem getting a table.

Thumbs Up: Hawaiian Poke and Spicy Cabo Calamari
A-Okay: Sweet Potato Fries and Wakame Seaweed Salad

I want to make sure I set expectations. The food isn't mind-blowing by any means, but like I said, the restaurant doesn't try to be some fancy fusion place or foo-foo fast food joint which is what one might expect. First of all, I love poke! Secondly, this restaurant's take on this Hawaiian-style tuna dish was pretty good and failed to disappoint. The Fries and Calamari were pretty good too, but the sweet thai chili sauce was really what made those two dishes even better. Most of all, it's pretty reasonably priced which is probably what makes me want to come back again.
author: Jen N.

description:
Off the charts! This place is a great place for lunch and dinner.

King Crab soup, sweet potato fries, wasabi bowl with ahi poki, and of course a Maui Brewing Company Coconut Porter Beer to wash it down. 

Food and service A+ I'll be back!
author: Scott B.

description: Yes yes yes. Forever yes. I got a tuna salad, which was delicious, but I also tried the poke. Would recommend.
author: Clara H.

description:
Whether you're looking for a takeout meal, grabbing food with a friend, or entertaining a friend in town, P-Catch is the perfect place. It's teeny tiny and the ambiance isn't the greatest, but the food is always incredible. I've never had anything there that I didn't like.

Highly recommended: rice bowls sweet potato fries
author: Megan S.

description:
Want to grab a quick lunch and ordered the New England clam chowder in a bread bowl.  Very little chowder for such a large bread bowl.  

Typically good portions, taste, etc.  This will not be ordered next time.
author: Peter C.

description: It was OK, I won't be going back. I sat inside at the bar and they could have cleaned a bit better.
author: K C.

description:
D and I stopped in here tonight... we were *starving* and Ahi Poke sounded like it would hit the spot. I wasn't expecting much, but we ended up loving it! Our server was Jeffrey. He was very friendly, recommended several dishes and recommended a wine pairing. Since it was our first time there, we pretty much decided to go with his recommendations. We were not disappointed. We had the Ahi Poke (YUM!), some miso soup, 3 tacos (which came with our choice of fries - sweet potato please!) and baha style mahi mahi. Everything was delicious! I ordered 3 different tacos - steak (a special), crispy shrimp and traditional baja. All 3 were delicious and so were the sweet potato fries.

We will definitely be back!
author: Tara D.

description: I really like this place for a solid , not too bad for you, meal.  I always end up ordering the wasabi rice bowl with seared ahi, but I've tried several items such as the tacos, ahi sandwich, and the shrimp ceviche and it's all good stuff.
author: Tony B.

description: I loved the free edamame, with a little aioli! The fish and chips with sweet potato fries are really good and crispy!
author: Madeline S.

description: Tried this place based on the outstanding yelp reviews and was not disappointed. First off the server was excellent, super friendly, prompt, and made awesome suggestions. It's a tiny little place, which is expected for the area. We sat at the bar which is overlooking the grills. It was a bit warm but felt nice on a brisk SF evening. It was awesome to see the chefs at work. My friend and I both ordered different mix and match tacos. I loved the mahi taco, it was so fresh and had an awesome zesty flavor. I also got a shrimp taco which wasn't a stand out but was also quite tasty. My friend loved the steak taco but wasn't too crazy about the Salmon one. Wine glasses are a bit pricey and small stick with the beer options. Wish I lived closer so I could be a regular!
author: Melissa S.

description:
Now that I broke 100 reviews, I realized that to hit 1,000, I'll need a system.  So I'm trying one here:

Pros:  
Great fish. Try the daily catch fish special with sweet potato fries, corn on the cob, etc (fish changes, sides stay the same, usually listed on a chalkboard outside).  The bowls are good too, but for me no "Wakame" (wet seaweed) in the Wasabi bowl, although I still want Nori (dry seaweed).  I heard I can get extra edamame instead of wakame which sounds great.

Cons: 
At any busy time the wait can get crazy.  They have done a good job of hiring friendly staff the past couple of years to make the wait more manageable. 

Fun: 
There is a surprising amount of alcohol on their menu for a fast/casual place.  I guess when you're drunk you eat more fish?  Also look for the waiter who has a full on story tattooed on his arm.  Very cool!  Kind of reminds of memento.
author: Mike G.

description: Ate here to replenish our energy after pole dancing class.  The service was great and the food was delicious!  Started off with the special, which I believe was some ceviche with home made taro chips. I had the ahi tuna sandwich with sweet potato fries.  Mmm..scrumptious!!  Thanks for taking me here, Diana Lyn M.!
author: Lyn C.

description:
First off, if nothing else, go for the sweet potato fries.
They are by far more delicious than any regular fry simply because the combination of salt and sweet are well..sweeeeeeet.

That being said, I had the mahi tacos and they were tasty. Not too much in the way of filling, which was good because I was able to savor all of the flavors involved in the taco--those being the veggies, the sauces and the fish itself.

I snuck a peek at my fellow diners and it looked like the rice bowls with the sashimi were popular. (By the way what the hell is "poke"??)They looked healthy with brown rice as an option and were a good deal.

It was a little pricey, but then again it is in the Marina.

-1 star for the limited space. My poor neighbor had to deal with my ass squishing against their table when I was trying to get to my seat. My bad sir!
-1 star for crap parking. The funny thing is I walked there. *wink* But if I had to drive, they would defintiely get 1 star off.Consider it a pre-emptive observation.
+2 stars for  crispy fried sweet potato fries
+1 star for friendly staff
+1 star for overall quality of the food
+1 star for variety of food
+1 star for being flexible in their willingness to accommodate your requests
author: Kathy K.

description:
This is a tiny restaurant/bar that is warm and cramped.  
We sat at the bar because it looked more conducive to breathing than the tiny front space.
I liked the cazzy casualness of it.
   
We ordered sweet potato fries and split the California Roll Salad. 
The full size salad must be huge.  
Both of those were really good-I'm still thinking about them. (Update: It's now Now, and I've stopped thinking about them.)
    
The coconut shrimp were okay...I wouldn't order them again. 
I had coconut shrimp at a Carribean restaurant that had much more coconut, were sweeter...these didn't live up.
    
People passing behind us on their way to the bathroom had to flatten their bodies and splay their arms against the wall to get by.  
We kept apologizing and hunching over, trying to keep our hair out of the aoli. 
So it's more interactive than other restaurants. 
And all that yoga finds a practical application.
   
We had Sapporo Lights and devoured the sweet potato fries. That wasabi aoli was great on the salad, too. I could have just had the aoli and been happy.
author: Lame Lake Meese Z.

description: Just moved to SF and I've already been here TWICE! I've tried both the mahi mahi taco and the chicken taco. Both are very good. The sweet potato fries are a MUST!
author: Lydia A.

description:
I came here for happy hour and sampling.

I tried their shrimp ceviche and tuna poke appetizer.
The shrimp ceviche was amazing. Best I've ever had. The shrimp taste really fresh and not frozen. The chunks of avocado in lime juice were perfect for my taste buds.
Their tuna poke was too salty, maybe it needed some acidity or sweetness?

Overall, I like the place. I wish I stayed to try more of their food. Their calamari looks spot on.
author: Ashley T.

description: Was okay. In my experience, looks/seems better in the pictures/reviews than the reality on the plate.
author: Victor C.

description:
Went here with a friend of mine a few weeks back.
Finally getting around to the review.
I got the taco combo- one salmon, one mahi mahi with sweet potato fries on the side.
Five fries in I was good, ten in- still good, fifteen in...got a little old. I probably should have just shared mine with her, but she got some too. Tacos were tasty for a fushiony, non-mexican place. I liked the fish and the generous portion of avocado, but the sauces weren't different enough to distinguish the two tacos apart.
My friend got the Thai coconut shrimp which was super fresh, crunchy, sweet, spicy, and all around good. I had one and that was quite enough for me. Perhaps go with a bunch of people, do appetizers and have a taste of everything to keep it interesting =]
author: jeddie k.

description: Today was disappointing.  I had their mixed basket.  The sweet potato fries were dripping with oil.  The fish was mushy.  The coconut shrimp tasted like soap due to the lauric acid content in their oil (meaning they are using lower quality oil these days).  Seems to be going down hill, I use to love this place.
author: A J.

description:
Tiny, tiny place...but awesome, amazing food. My absolute favourite is the Hawaian Poke Japanese Wasabi Bowl with brown rice and salad.....It is a perfect meal for lunch or dinner. 

The sweet potatoe fries are also excellent.....haven't really tried anything else because the Wasabi bowl is soooo good, I keep going back for more.....If only I didn't live in the East Bay now I would be there once a week!
author: Ayesha K.

description: I can't believe I haven't reviewed Pacific Catch yet! I used to work at Wells Fargo (right next door) and came to Pacific Catch often for lunch! I love their Cabo shrimp tacos (with sweet potato fries of course) and Ahi Tuna bowls. Their coconut shrimp and fried oysters also earns an honorable mention! Their food is consistently good and always fresh!
author: Tiffany U.

description:
Amazing Fish, 
Sort of Japanese/American fusion. 
Tiny place.  Not a lot of seating.  But best fish I've had in SF thus far. 
And very nice staff.
author: Austin A.

description: I only come to this restaurant for Jeffrey. He is simply the best. His above and beyond service makes the long wait/crowded restaurant worth it. If not for Jeffrey, I do not think I would visit Pacific Catch as much as I do. He is so personable, always checks in to make sure I am 100% satisfied with my meal choice (if I happy to vary from my normal order), and he is always very accommodating to my needs. I highly recommend visiting this restaurant and requesting Jeffrey as your server!
author: R E.

description: Ate here 3 times during our week in San Francisco.  Staff is delightful and accommodating.  Food is delicious- loved the rice bowls and tacos.  Prices are very reasonable.  Had fun sitting at the bar and watching their incredible chefs cook.
author: Angela M.

description: I have almost no reason to go to the Marina (nothing against it, but it's across town) except for this restaurant.  It serves up fresh, flavorful, outstanding seafood in a casual atmosphere.  The rice bowls (with brown rice) and salads are equally excellent.  Healthy, delicious and at a reasonable price.  One of my favorites in the city.
author: Neill T.

description: Loved the tacos and fish and chips today. Sweet potato fries with the Thai sauce are to die for!! Our server was awesome and polite. The spring roll dessert was unbelievable! Overall great experience! Heads up, the place is very small- maybe six tables and a bar.
author: S P.

description:
This is one of my fav places to go in the city..
the Poke is always on point and the service is always great.
I have never had a bad dish or a bad experience.
author: Blake R.

description: This is one of my favorite neighborhood spots! The food is delicious, and the people who work there are really friendly. It's great that they have tasty options that are also healthy. I especially love the teriyaki bowl.
author: Leia V.

description:
My boyfriend and I have been here a couple times now and have been for the most part very satisfied.  The tacos are AMAZING and all of the fresh seafood dishes have been very good too.  The drink menu is quite impressive, and we've always gotten whatever the seasonal or special drink is and enjoyed it.

The latest time we went we got California rolls and another sushi roll which were only mediocre. I think while they seem to have seafood, tacos, and asian noodle dishes down - the sushi is their weak spot.  However, we have only tried about three different rolls, I think I may still stick to the tacos going forward.

Definitely try the sweet potato fries. 

Great atmosphere and they DO have a parking lot, which we only recently figured out. You can usually find parking on Lincoln or Chestnut though too.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: This place is sooooo good, The bowls are amazing! The vibe and servers are great as well.
author: Felicia M.

description:
When this place first opened, I couldn't believe how dead it was.  Because I actually didn't think the food was too great when it first opened, I took a few year hiatus from going back.  Because my friends recently have been going nutz over the place and literally eating there a few times a week...I decided to give it another shot.  This time around, I was definitely not disappointed...Food is tremendously improved...Dishes are now so fresh and tasty that I actually hit PC at least a few times a month!  The only annoying thing now is that there's almost always a line to get in.

Be Warned: Their sweet potato fries are extremely addictive!
author: Justin L.

description:
Sometimes the wait is worth it.... 

they are open all day, so try to avoid coming around lunchtime.  
I went about 1:30 and only waited 5 minutes.  That could be because everyone ate earlier to catch the Blue Angels cruising the skies.  

This place has consistently good food. Had the taco platter with their special catch of the day- rock cod.  It was good.  Also had the ahi tuna poke.  The size of the ahi is not the typical dice, it's actually the large chunks. This is good because you can actually see that the quality of the fish is good, and not mushed up to cover up the bad parts of the fish.  The ahi has a lot of sesame oil in it, so if you can handle that, it's all good.  

If you sit at the counter, you get to watch the kitchen people and the servers maneuver between each other and the small aisle they call the kitchen.  It works, they don't need that much room, as most of the menu items are fried or grilled.
author: Debbie N.

description:
This was my first time at a Pacific Catch restaurant. Came here for a coworker's birthday during lunch time. First thing I noticed was the size of this location. It was narrow, but cozy. I would estimate about less than 50 people would fit in there (please do not quote me). We waited about 10 minutes to be seated (party of 6). The only available seating were the counter seats and because we were on the clock, waiting was an issue so we took whatever was available.

I ordered the Teriyaki bowl with chicken (I know, boring), but I wasn't in the mood to experiment so I played it safe.

As I had mentioned above, we were here to celebrate a coworker's birthday so...what is a birthday without drinks?!

We decided upon a round of sake bombs. Unfortunately Pacific Catch does not offer glassware which support such of an activity. But, not to worry, we improvised. Instead of sake bombs, we had sake pours. 

Yes, we counted from 1 to 3 and poured the sake into the glass and chuggggggggggggggggggggged.  Good times.

Overall, I thought it was edible. I've heard good and bad things about this place. I think it's ok, nothing really struck me as unique. Maybe that's just me. Perhaps I might need to try the seafood next time.
author: Jason N.

description: I came here to use the 50% coupon from Scoutmob, best dish I had was the ahi poke, the calamari was also decent, the crab melt sandwich was ok - similar to other reviews, I didn't taste the crab flavor. The shrimp ceviche was also ok, a bit too much citrus for me. I'm giving 4 starts for the overall experience, good quick service and nice atmosphere, I would come back for happy hour and would try the crab chowder the next time.
author: Jia O.

description:
Love this place - quaint small and made it from these humble beginnings into much more 
The spicy ahi and vietnamese sandwiches are fantastic, as are the Baja tacos, sweet potato fris etc.
Wish they hadn't changed the Teriyaki Bowls - liked them more before.

Service use to be better but still good, fast, and usually friendly
author: Tom L.

description: Pretty good. Mahi Mahi tacos and spicy fries for me. Nice spot for a quick lunch.
author: William S.

description:
Came here for a late lunch/early dinner on Saturday.  It was our first time at this establishment and we'll definitely will return as this place was reasonably priced for the deliciousness they brought to our table.  

We were STARVING by the time we arrived and sitting by the kitchen with clear view of everything the cooks were preparing was dangerous.  We started with the Poke (tender and perfectly marinated).  For entrees, I ordered their Chalkboard Special, Baja Style Escolar.  It's a white fish that's generously rubbed with spices placed on a bed of avocado tomatillo salsa with sides of grilled corn, yellow squash, zucchini, red bell pepper, and sweet potato fries.  I would recommend also ordering a side of rice since the spices were salty, or just jack it from your friend if they order a rice bowl as I did with my husband.  He ordered the Hawaiian Teriyaki Grilled Mahi Mahi rice bowl and my sister in law ordered the Vietnamese Steak Sandwich.  THAT sandwich is a must have!!  The marinated steak was so tender and went perfectly with the veggies and the sriracha aioli sauce.

As we sat watching the cooks doing their thing, we were enticed by their Fish Tacos.. huge pieces of golden fried goodness!  We couldn't resist, so we ordered a Three Taco Plater as well.  

We were fortunate to find parking on Filmore Street (between Chestnut and Bay), in front of what looked like a school.  Upon our arrival, we did have to wait briefly, about 10 minutes or so, for seating.
author: Soo S.

description: Was drinking across the street at the Horseshoe and decided to pop over. I had the fish and chips and DH had one of the bowls with beef. Both were cooked well and I had a glass of wine. A tad pricey for what you get but food was tasty and you got plenty. Would probably go back.
author: Eastsac G.

description: Awesome food and great prices. We stumbled across it on our way to the Marina and will be going back!!
author: Michelle R.

description: I had the poke appetizer with a seaweed salad. It was good but nothing to rave about. I would go back because it was a pretty cheap lunch and healthy when looking for something quick. The server was very accommodating and nice. The only thing is she had horrible breath and every time she came to our table I tried to not breathe.
author: Ally V.

description:
I love this place! It is right around the corner from my house and whenever I am in the mood for a crispy fish taco or wasabi bowl, I know where to head.

Atmosphere: the resturaunt is on the smaller side but once seated, you feel completley comfortable. 

Food: I have only had a few items on their menu but I have LOVED everything I have eaten so far. My favorite I'd the wasabi bowl with brown rice and ahi poke.they serve healthy sized portions of all of their food. I usually can share two items with someone and be stuffed! The sweet potatoe fries are excellent. Crispy and delicious. I also enjoy their spicy fries. The grilled artichoke is awesome! I just recently had their fresh catch of the day taco with jalepeno crema and napa cabbage and it was great.

Customer service: I usually end up taking my order to go since I live so close and the seating can sometimes be a problem. They are always friendly and remember my name when I come in. 
The one time I did eat there, I was with two friends and we were slightly dissapointed with one of the waitresses. She just had a bad attitude and gave snarky comments under her breathe. I totally understand if you ate having a bad day but she was downright rude. The other waitress made up for this girls bad attitude.

All in all- great place, great food, fast service
author: Whitney S.

description:
P-catch is great!

I love the chicken teriyaki bowl (not a huge fish person). 

There's not a ton of seating, but service is fast so you won't wait long.

Only downside is how expensive it is...
author: Julie V.

description:
I have only been to Pacific Catch once.

The seating is definitely limited, and the wait can be overwhelming; however,   their food is delectable and I say it is worth it.  I could not help but devour their fish and chips with a side of sweet potato fries and slaw/ salad.  I love the tartar sauce and that went along with the fish.  Overall, the dish was flavorful.  

To be honest, I had a problem with the sweet potato fries because they were not "fresh".  I would have liked it to be. 

In conclusion, I do recommend Pacific Catch.  I am determined to return and taste everything else on the menu.  :)
author: H. C.

description: A great place for a fresh, quick meal.  The staff is friendly and efficient. The food was all very good... We had the shrimp ceviche, Hawaiian poke, and teriyaki rice bowl with skirt steak.  I would recommend all of these.  The only negative is that the space is quite small and it was a bit cramped/uncomfortable... But for food this good, I would endure a little discomfort.
author: Amy H.

description:
Love this place! My husband and I always get the Baja Shrimp Ceviche to start with- delicious! I always order the Salmon Hawaiian Teriyaki Pan-Asian Rice bowl. The salmon is solid. Their sweet potato fries great. 

Sometimes a bit of a wait because the place is so small. Service is friendly and efficient. 

I've been here with family and everyone left very happy. You can't really go wrong.
author: Julia S.

description: Great place for a reasonably priced, tasty, healthy lunch or dinner. Most recently, I had their Ahi Salad. Portion was fairly generous and not too heavily weighted towards the lettuce. Sweet potato fries are also great (particularly the sweet chili sauce you get with them).
author: Matthew J.

description:
I've been here a few times, and every time it's been excellent. Even when they're crowded, I am always seated promptly and the service is great. Every meal I've had (both lunches and suppers, and different entrees each time) has been great. 

Most recently I got the "Sushi-Grade Ahi" salad, which was probably my favorite dish I've had here so far. Very rare ahi on a bed of fresh greens and with a wasabi-soy dressing. Mmm. Can't go wrong with that combination!

Definitely get the sweet potato fries when you eat here.
author: James B.

description:
great spot for a mellow lunch post workout.

the space is small, but they really make the most of it.  servers are attentive and friendly.  i had the rice bowl with grilled chicken, it was super yummy and my friend had the poki bowl, he liked it.  i think next time i would ask for the sauce on the side, rice felt a little less healthy soaked in that teriyaki sauce.  :P

$15 is a little steep for a rice bowl imo, but we ARE in the marina afer all...
author: Josie M.

description:
Great spot to pick up a quick meal, with good service and tasty food!

I def recommend the fried oysters! I am not even a fan of fried ANYTHING, but these little ones were delicious! The breading is light and crispy and the tarter sauce is a perfect match!

My boyfriend had the rib bowl - the ribs were great and had a nice flavor. 

I had the fish special with an avocado cilantro sauce and sweet potato fries, it was also tasty.

There is nothing fancy schmancy about this place, but the service and food make it worth a visit!
author: Kelly B.

description:
I'll admit that I came to this place because of its presence in an iPhone ad a few years ago.

I had a seared ahi tuna sandwich and sweet potato fries. This was a delicious lunch that made me wish I had this kind of place down the street from my apartment.

The eating area is fairly small. I sat at the bar and received good service.
author: Patrick V.

description:
Mmmn! PC does not disappoint! I'd eat the poke bowl from here every day! 

Salmon bowl is consistently good, with the best veggies: bok choy, shiitakes, and asparagus....hmm, might have to come back tomorrow.

Also, tried this coconut shrimp soup with blue ginger, I was ready to lick the bowl (it was overpriced for soup, but it was the daily special).
author: Sara S.

description:
I loved my experience here - the food was great and sitting at the bar it was like watching 2 magicians work--the teamwork between the 2 chefs was awesome and awe inspiring - -I recently ate the corte madera location--fancier- ate at the bar/chef stand - -whatever you call it--hated corte madera experience in comparison to this place...

The only reason not 5 stars -- expected a little more food for my money-- I ordered the shrimp and sweet potato fries as suggested by others--great tasting but seemed a little pricey for what I got-- the dessert was incredible--dulce de leche spring roll - -with vanilla ice cream - -awesome!!
author: Bonny D.

description:
UPDATE!!!

Ambiance: 0/1 Same as before...tables are way too tight together, making even a casual meal a bit awkward.

Service: 2/2 My GOD. I have been here a couple of times since my last review, and service has absolutely improved. The servers were unpretentious, prompt, nice, did not rush me, and kept us updated on the status of our food. Super kudos to our server with the purple ( I think) short hair and cool earring, she was by far one of the best servers I have ever had. I wish she was my server every time. 

Food: 2/2 Lemonade is amazing. Shrimp Ceviche is still amazing. Tacos are better than many places in the mission...and that's just downright sad for the Mission, but great news for this place. Salads are the same, don't expect the best quality fish but for the price you can't beat it.  

Thank you for updating your service.
author: Anna T.

description:
Very good place with a wide variety of foods, not just seafood. My husband actually picked this place for a group of us to go to after Cal Academy of Sciences, it's very close so perfect. The funny thing is, he HATES seafood and he still recommended it. Which makes it amazing! Ha. He had tacos (steak and shrimp, both VERY good) and I had sushi (my fav, couldn't pass it up.) We also shared the ceviche trio before and it was SO good. The ahi tuna ceviche was the BEST with the shrimp following a close 2nd. 

If you like tequila order a silver cosmo. It's not on the menu but it's made w/silver tequila, agave syrup & lime juice. Simply perfect. For non-alcoholic get the sparkling agave lemonade. For dessert get the dulce du leche spring rolls.
author: Colleen M.

description: Shrimp tacos were delicious, chicken very good and mahi mahi just ok. Service and atmosphere very good as well. I will be back.
author: Damir S.

description: If you're looking for a simple healthy meal on  a week night, this place delivers.  It's no thrills, no great atmosphere but great food.  I've always had a good experience here with the salads, bowls and once in a while allow myself the sweet potato fries which are sooo good.  The service is friendly, fast and for the price point this place is great.  It's a bit crowded and small compared to its counterpart by UCSF but it's always busy.  If we're in the mood for simple and healthy and a meal without production this is always on our list of contenders.
author: Inga W.

description:
Been here a few times to enjoy the fusion yet simple and no-fuss menu.  
On my most recent visit, came for a weeknight girlfriend-catchup din and were lucky to immediately get a table for two.  We both had the Seared Ahi Wasabi Bowl, each a glass of wine, and shared a basket of sweet potato fries.  The Pan-Asian bowl I had was great with fresh ingredients that come together for a clean and well-blend of flavors.
Sweet potato fries were crispy and perfectly mildly seasoned (not sugary like some others).
Both dishes were of decent portion.  
Price came out to ~$20/person.  But lucky for us we got to take advantage of Scoutmob offer!
Service is prompt and friendly, making for a pleasant experience.
Great location, but its small space and difficult parking around the area makes it difficult to be a reliable go-to.

Take-Away: Getting a table is a gamble at this tightly set-up location.  Come at off-hours for better chances or consider take-out as well.
author: Carol K.

description: I really wish this place would be more careful with the saucing. Too salty/overpowering. I sometimes enjoy their wasabi bowls with sauce on the side. Beware that the wasabi bowl is too much food for one person (rice).
author: Sarah L.

description: Great food, fresh seafood and great people watching.  Very nice people.  Perfect lunch stop.
author: Brent K.

description:
