I looooove Pacific Catch...it's one of the few places that has delicious food with large portions and feels healthy.  Whether or not it's actually healthy...well, let's just say that overly full feeling I get after every meal can't be a good sign.  I've got my tried and tested meal of sweet potato fries, poke tuna wasabi bowl, and a nice porter...I'm sure the rest of the food is good but I can't get myself to try something else and waste one of my PC trips.  

As far as location goes, the food is equally good at both the Inner Sunset and Marina location but I definitely recommend the Marina location...it's got the longer wait but it doesn't feel like fill-in-the-name-of-a-chain-restaurant-like-Elephant-Bar.  In any case, for great seafood, excellent beers, and good service, I highly recommend taking a trip down to PC!
author: Rosers M.

description:
Coming from San Diego, I visited this spot last thursday for lunch.  I found out about this place from the initial iPhone commercial that was featured last year.  I've been wanting to try out this place and since I was in the city with no busy schedule, I decided to stop in and finally try it out.

Upon going in there, I noticed that it was a small place, fitting maybe around 20 people inside.  I could imagine how busy this place would get.  I got there around 3 pm, which was way after the lunch rush so I was able to get seated with no problem.  The place was decorated nicely and it was in a nice location from what I saw.  

I asked our waiter what their signatures were and he recommended the mahi mahi and the dry rub trout.  My cousin and I were both pretty hungry so we decided to get one of each and split the fish so that we can get a taste of both.  

I tried the trout and was surprised by how fresh it tasted.  Being in SF, I guess they get fresh seafood daily.  The trout was smothered with a dry rub that exentuated the taste.  Also included were fresh vegetables and the great tasting sweet potato fries.  I also tasted the mahi mahi that was complimented with a green tomatillo sauce.  My goodness, that tasted so good.  It really went well with the mahi mahi.  

Overall, I really recommend this place to anyone looking for great seafood.  I looked on the wall and it was voted best seafood in the city of San Francisco in 2006.  The prices are pretty competitve and ranging anywhere from $10-$20.  The specials that I purchased were $18, which  were the upscale platters.  I'm definitely going to hit this place up again next time I visit the Bay.
author: Christian M.

description: We came here for happy hour and had a great experience. The place is a bit small but the atmosphere is really nice and so are the wait staff! The steak and salmon tacos were really great and the calamari and sweet potato fries were excellent!!
author: Kate A.

description:
Yum. Seriously.

I was in need of a balanced, fresh meal to keep me calm during game four of the world series. Fortunately for me, the wasabi bowl with salmon hit the spot - they ask how you like your fish cooked, and it comes with avocado, ginger and seaweed salad. Seriously, I was a happy girl  (despite having to watch the game next door in a far too trendy marina bar (CIRCA)). The best part is that I have lunch for tomorrow too! I wish there was one closer to me :)
author: Sarah T.

description:
Fast fish with fusion flair.

Fastest fresh fish found in San Francisco.  Frankly, finding faster fresh fish frustrates feeble Franciscans.

Sweet potatoes fries too!
author: Matthew F.

description:
Wow the service here blew me away.. by far the best I have experience in a very long time. 
We came here Saturday mid afternoon and all the patio and the inside tables were taken so we decided to sit at the bar. Our waiter was very friendly . He made sure we all got exactly what we wanted and were satisfied with out order..our drinks were filled as soon as they were finished.. i asked one of the sauce's to be substituted for another and as soon as i was done with it they refilled it for me. 

I never felt rushed or pressured to order .. some of the dished I had questions about were explained to me and customized to my liking. 
The kitchen staff and the chef cooked and prepared our food right in front of us.. 

the restaurant was clean and the food tasted very fresh. 

BTW the calamari was amazing with their spicy sauce .. probably the best Ive had

If you are worried about parking don't be.. there was plenty of parking on the street even on a busy Saturday afternoon.

Also those of your who are trying to eat healthy this place is good for that.. although my mahi mahi was fried it wasn't  too fried it was just enough and was more on the healthy side.. they do have a great variety of salads which are very healthy.

will definitely return again when im in the neighborhood.
author: Alecia R.

description: Great place for a quick but nice lunch. They have a great menu selection, everything from veggie to meaty. Drink selection is diverse also... My boyfriend liked it and I loved the service :)
author: Stella B.

description:
Very relaxed atmosphere, friendly service, delicious fresh seafood, at good prices. I like this place.

It's not "Wow!", but it's "A nice place to for a fun and casual meal with friends".
author: Jonny P.

description: Food was almost average. If you get a drink keep it in the bottle not a glass. Glass comes with leftover food inside. I asked the server if he saw the rice and seaweed floating in the glass he said no. Really? Then brought 2 more with the same thing again floating inside. WOW!  Seems to be the theme in San Francisco its just dirty get use to it or don't come here. Looks like we will be going rural on our future trips.
author: JK X.

description:
Tiny, tiny place... hole-in-the-wall status. Came here with two friends, got some sake and some real good fish. The lack of the 5th star is mainly due to lack of selection of drink, and the claustrophobic effect of the place. The food, however, is pretty darn good. Portions could be a bit bigger, but that's just because I'm a big guy d:

The staff is very nice, and they will converse with you, as well. Despite the place being quite busy, they appear to enjoy being socially active with their customers, which is pretty cool to me; I'm from NY, where no everyone and their mothers are too busy to talk to you.

If you're in the area, and looking for some oceanic grub, definitely check this place out!
author: Vincent D.

description: I liked it even more tonight. Had the deconstructed California Roll salad - TONS of fresh crab. My mom swore it was impossible for them to give so much crab for the price! Also, the salmon sandwich was very good. You'll have to wait for a table. But, definitely worth it. Fresh local ingredients, GREAT!
author: Andrew K.

description: Food was amazing, but more than that our server Jeffrey was incredible. I went with two screaming babies and instead of trying to rush us out, he gave us free dessert and was extremely kind and patient. Jeffrey is the reason we will be back. He was the best server we've had in San Francisco.
author: Paul M.

description:
Can you say yummmmm....delicious Spicy Ahi sandwich, and sweet potato fries with a delicious dipping sauce.   Very friendly staff....

You have to check it out!
author: Amanda S.

description:
Not as impressed as the other Pacific Catch location on Lincoln. To my surprise, this place is really really small. It has a lot of bar stools by the kitchen, and several cozy tables for 2 only. I felt a little squished sitting at the table since you can hear everyone's conversations. eh

2ndly, they got my order wrong. Not too impressed. I got this piece of grilled salmon. It was dry, uneventful, small. I said to the chef, i didn't order this I wanted the poke. I looked at my bill it was there was an extra $7 charge for a "side" of poke. annoyed. 

service was kinda blah. You know that feeling when you don't want to ask the server for anything else because you can get the "uhhh stop asking me already" vibe. Thats how i felt. Didn't exactly feel the same vibe from the other spot. No free appetizers either. Portions were smaller. hrmm... ya not impressed. won't be back.
author: Juan C.

description:
I love this place, and a big shout out to the amazing GM, Christine who always takes such good care of me. The highlight of the restaurant is definitely the seafood rice bowls. It's healthy, filling and delicious! The restaurant also has the best tasting brown rice I've had. They recently came out with some menu additions. The Korean bowls are so good especially if you get it with sticky ribs. The Vietnamese sandwich sadly is mediocre. You would do better going to an authentic Vietnamese place.

If you live in the Marina, Pacific Catch is the perfect neighborhood restaurant.

~A
author: Alex C.

description:
Wow, it was like God made the fluffiest flatbread made from clouds of the heavens and then He took the freshest, happiest, fattest tuna of the sea and sprinkled it with vibrant greens, uplifting ginger and the most refreshing wasabi mayo one could only dream of, delicately pieced them together into a sandwich that I find myself drooling at the very memory of.

Best sweet potato fries I've ever had, small and crispy and the wasabi mayo and sweet chili sauce were a perfect compliment of flavors. The house salad was unique and delicious down to the last edamame bean and best of all, not drowned in dressing.

Do not miss this place. Plus Tacolicious is right next door too. Win-win-win!
author: Kenneth and Katie A.

description:
BIG. PORTIONS. OH DEAR.

I came here for dinner (my first meal of the day actually) so I was really hungry. I ordered a Wasabi rice bowl with poke and added an extra piece of unagi because I really hungry.

I underestimated it greatly. I thought I could easily finish this rice bowl of tuna, unagi, and assorted Japanese vegetables, but two things stopped me:

1. Poke Tuna pieces are not small diced cubes. THEY ARE MONSTROUS LOIN BLOCKS.

2. Extra unagi piece doesn't mean a flimsy slice. IT'S THE WHOLE UNAGI STEAK.

While I wouldn't say the food is wowz spectacular, it's still 4 stars in my book for the value. Everything tasted great for a casual meal. The seafood is most definitely fresh. I also had fried oysters and fried calamari as appetizers and they didn't disappoint. I'd come back for sure!

Plus points for playing a really random playlist of 80's favs and Hawaiian music.
author: Charles L.

description: My new favourite SF restaurant! So I ate here for the first time last week and have been back twice since! I am addicted to their fish tacos, prawn ones being my favourite. They are full of flavour and have lots of really great textures mixed in, recommend it!
author: Courtney L.

description:
There are so many things I want to say about Pacific Catch but the main thing that comes to mind is DELICIOUS.  If I could eat here everyday, I would.  

They have a pretty extensive and tasty looking menu but I only order one thing when I eat here.  The Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl.  This bowl of delicious forever changed my interest in trying new things on their menu.  There are a fair amount of ingredients in the Wasabi Bowl but I really only care about 3.  1. the tuna (I don't know what it's marinated in it, but it's amazing) 2. the seaweed salad 3. the incredible sauce that coats the rice.

My boyfriend and I tell everyone to eat here and we have yet to hear of any complaints (my parents, who live out of town, tell their friends about it).  We just got back from eating there tonight.  If that delicious Wasabi Bowl was presented to me right now I'd eat it, even though I'm stuffed.
author: Danielle R.

description: Poke bowl was soooo so good! Super small place, we had 4 people and luckily we came after the lunch crowd and before the dinner crowd otherwise we wouldn't have had a place to sit. Only complaint is that they completely screwed up my boyfriend order and he said he'd eat it anyways since we had all gotten our food, and they didn't even comp it... a little unprofessional but whatever.
author: Karen S.

description: Love Love Love the wasabi bowl - seared ahi. Sooo good!
author: Cindy C.

description: Was craving for poke after the trip in Kauai.  And guess what? This place had just the right food for me!  Got the poke rice bowl and it was very tasty.  Never had something similar to this before.  Wasabi was mixed in the brown rice and it added a nice kick to the food!!!  A nice find, for sure!   Thanks Yelp!!!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Delicious. Been coming here for years and everyone I take here becomes an instant fan. 

Minus 1.5 stars for their take out. It is rarely accurate and isn't the same product as if you dine in. I highly recommend that you dine in versus take out.

Also important to note: The 9th street location in the Inner Sunset has a fully stoked bar with great bartenders, awesome happy hour specials, t.v.'s broadcasting sports games, and a bigger menu selection including pretty delicious sushi.
author: J F.

description: Good quality food at a reasonable price. My son took me here once when I was in town and I got the mahi mahi sandwich. It was very good and filling as well. Wouldn't mind going back again on my next trip!  The teriyaki bowl is also delicious!
author: Tami G.

description:
Absolutely try the poke bowl, half rice bowl half salad. (not on the menu, you have to request it.)  It's the best.  So much amazing raw tuna for a great deal.

I also love their happy hour tacos and sweet potato fries!  Delicious.
author: Gloria J.

description:
We had mixed thoughts on this place... 
Yes the food was good, 
yes the atmosphere was nice, 
yes the wait staff was friendly, 
But the service unbelievably slow!

It would be a great place to meet friends, and have a bite to eat while you are there, socializing.  But I would never go back there for just a dinner.
author: C J.

description: I went here for the first time last week and was very impressed. There was a bit of a wait but it was totally worth it. I had the mahi mahi bowl and the fish was perfectly cooked. The bowl had great flavor. I especially loved the lemongrass ice tea! The staff is very friendly too. Definitely a adelicious spot!
author: Lisa I.

description:
Sweet Jesus! Reasonably priced gourmet salads with fresh grilled fish? I am prett-y thrilled with my decision to stop in here.

Loving their ahi tuna salad, grilled salmon salad w/crispy croutons, seaweed salad, miso soup, and pretty much everything I've ever tried. The fish rocks and IMO is reasonably priced for what you get. It's cheaper than Blue Barn and has better ingredients. 

I'd never eat IN here only because it's teensy and so popular that it's always crowded. But I am their #1 take-out fan. Yay for this place that makes healthy eating an option (grilled fish, veggies) but also has awesome "bad for you" food like sweet potato fries and fish & chips when you want to be gluttonous.
author: Britt M.

description: love this place. it's near my gym and although it's not super fancy, it has a lot of style and the food is excellent. Portions are actually quite generous and there are a lot of good things on the menu (ahi poke rice bowl yum!). Quick healthy big portions, friendly staff. my only complaint is that the place is so small!
author: Georgia D.

description: My $15 Seared Ahi Salad was mediocre at best. I generally go to Blue Barn for a good salad but decided to give Pacific Catch a try. Was happy about the fact I could order online and noticed the ingredients were somewhat similar. Next time I will just stick with the Spicy Tuna salad from Blue Barn if I am looking for an overpriced seafood salad.
author: Meghan P.

description:
I LOVE this place! The sweet potato fries are amazing and I highly recommend the spicy seared ahi sandwich. The ahi was cooked perfectly and the pickled ginger really added a zing of flavor. However, my only complaint is that is was not spicy at all!! My solution- add some Sriracha that you will find on your table along with Chalula (hot sauce) and other condiments. 

The waiter was VERY nice and I was very happy with the overall service. Food only took about 10 minutes to be ready, which was good. I love that they have outdoor seating, but it is a bit cramped. In general, it is a pretty small place so it does get crowded.

Overall, they have a great menu and service is excellent. Definitely going back! Extra star because I got a lemonade on the house last time I went in :)
author: Andrea K.

description:
The Wasabi Ahi Tuna sandwich is the BOMBWICH!  

I wish the seating situation was better...it's pretty tight in there and I normally just do take out.  I think the sweet potato fries would taste a lot better if  I could eat them right away instead of letting them get all soggy on the way home, but that is a small sacrifice considering the awesomeness of the Wasabi Ahi Tuna BOMBWICH!
author: Ken V.

description: Solid place for some healthy take out. Very reliable service.
author: Tina U.

description: Um... Ok if you like soggy fries... I've heard the Salmon Sandwich is good but i have yet to try. I've been very unimpressed with this spot.
author: Alison M.

description:
This place is amazing!!!  It's tucked in on the very aesthetic Chestnut Street in the Marina district and it's for a quick bite to go or to sit down and enjoy a fresh and delicious meal.  They have everything from small tacos to larger entree plates that are large enough for two.  My favorite by far has got to be the Poke Wasabi Bowl!  It has an amazing mix of flavors and I am never hungry after attempting to finish one of these.

The service has been consistently wonderful every time I dine here and while the staff can sometimes appear to be very busy, they always make time to attend to you in a friendly and timely manner.

This place gets two thumbs up and I would highly recommend it to anyone stopping into the Marina area.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Delish, A new favorite everyday place.

Ordered the ceviche and the Spicy Ahi Sandwhich with fries. Will be back to duplicate this meal within the next week I'm sure.
author: Lindsay G.

description:
A local favorite, Pacific Catch is a fantastic place for a fun, healthy bite in a down home nook along Chestnut.

The dishes are hearty, fresh and will leave you perfectly content. It's not hard to recognize why so many love this place.

I'm surprised I haven't reviewed it yet, but my recent trip there this past Saturday night reminded me just how much I enjoy coming out here.

The Wasabi Bowls are always a hit, filled with wakame salad, avocado, fresh fish, and served on a cozy bed of rice. It's always difficult to carry a conversation once the food arrives at your table, because priority one becomes: Devour.

The sandwiches are always a hit, with a wide array of tastes to stomp your craving. 

Take out is always reliable and the service is one big smile. I'm sure I have plenty of future visits ahead of me, so keep that chair warm.
author: Mike K.

description: This small restaurant on the fashionable Marina Chestnut Street has long been a favorite and never disappointed. The sweet potato fries are the best ever. Just amazing!
author: Parvarti S.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Pacific Catch!  I've tried the Irving location a couple times but decided to try this location with two of my girlfriends for our monthly dinner.  The place is small. Really small. We got there at 8 and waiting maybe 20 minutes before the bar opened up...but decided to wait for one of the 4 tables instead.  

Once we got situated, we ordered right away. Literally, within 5 minutes, our appetizers came out.  It pays to be prepared I guess!  Everything we ordered was superb.
- Hawaiian Poke
- Shrimp Ceviche
- Spicy Tuna Ahi Taco w/ sweet potato fries
- Unagi Wasabi Bowl

Okay, so the ceviche was a little sour and...thick...but it went really well with the tacos.  So we used it as "sauce" instead.  I could go without it next time.  But I definitely recommend the poke, the ahi taco and the wasabi bowl.  It is loaded with so much stuff and is so flavorful.  I was expecting it to just be our "filler upper" of the evening but it was so good I'm pretty sure I more than my share.  

The service was great.  They were very nice about allowing us to wait for a table and checked up on us throughout our whole dinner.  Oh, and totally affordable!  Good food, good price.  This may very well become my spot!
author: Helen V.

description: Amazing selection of fresh seafood and salads. I really appreciate that each salad is bursting with flavor but it's not because they overpowered the dish with salad dressing. Ahi tuna salad with seaweed salad is my favorite. I come here as often as I can!
author: Karin Z.

description:
I just had the best taco ever.
Mahi Mahi.
Multiple sauces.
Fresh and perfectly seasoned.
I also had great service and solid sweet potato fries.
The service was frantic but attentive and I got to sit outside in the sun and chow down. What more could a girl want?
author: Shira G.

description:
stopped by here on the way back from sonoma. it was the perfect way to end the day. service was fast, but the staff was very friendly and welcoming.

we started with the ribs, sweet potato fries and Hawaiian poke for apps. the poke was deliciously flavorful, as were the ribs. and you can't go wrong with sweet potato fries (which come with a tasty wasabi mayo that has just a little bit of kick)

I had the ahi tuna salad (cooked rare) with their wasabi-ginger dressing. So good, and could serve as two meals if you're not super hungry. My friend had the same ingredients in the rice bowl version, which was also tasty and had the added texture of brown rice.

Overall, definitely a spot I would return to next time i'm in San Fran for a chance to try all the other dishes on the menu!
author: Punam P.

description:
I like this place! It's a tiny hole-in-the-wall and it's really easy to miss if you're driving on Chestnut, but I definitely recommend it to others and I want to go back.

Yes, finding parking is hard, but we luckily found a spot right across the street at the 30-minute meters. Parking Enforcement was out on that Saturday, but so long as you're vigilant you'll be fine in terms of parking.

I tried the Ahi Tuna Taco and it was amazingggg. There was a great sauce in there, and the tuna was fresh, and it was jam packed with great stuff that made for an explosion of flavors in my mouth. Plus, it wasn't tooo spicy and had the perfect amount of kick. I also tried the fish and chips (with sweet potato fries) and while I'm not big on fish and chips.. I LOVED this fish and chips! Highly recommended.

Service was super quick - we got our order within 5 minutes of ordering. There's not a lot of seating though, so we waited 10-15 minutes during lunch on a Saturday to sit. But it was well worth the wait.
author: Marjorie V.

description:
This place has really good food and the service is excellent.  The one thing I wish that could be improved is the actual location.  It's a deep cavern of a rectangle and it really seems to lack the intimacy to really feel comfortable here.

I love their sweet potato fries, and hadn't had it in a long time so I gorged myself on it.  I also had their unfiltered sake for the first time.  It's very sweet and creamy, it was great with the spicy sauces provided with the sweet potato fries.  The portions are generous so don't be intimidated.

Kudos out to the bartender/waitress also.  It probably would have only been a three star experience if it were not for her excellent service skills.  She made my claustrophobia subside.
author: Wilson K.

description:
A restaurant like this could definitely fill more seats! The quality of the Ahi Poke, and spicy calamari is superb.

The wait was a little long to sit, and we saw several people come through ordering take-out, but well worth it.

It was very relaxing, and the wait staff, especially our waitress Amy, were very helpful and offered helpful insight on our selections and made great conversation.

I will definitely return.
author: Richard F.

description:
A real find. This place is very affordable (delicious dinner for around $15-20/person), has a cute location, and very fresh seafood. Beware though, they can get very full, you might have to wait a while for a table. They have amazing sauces - so pretty much everything is delicious. 

Some standout items:
* Wasabi bowl with Ahi Poke Tuna. Everything you need in one dish. It has rice (you can ask for brown), seaweed salad, avocado, ahi tuna, and a very yummy sauce. 
* Artichoke -- Great appetizer. I don't know how to describe the sauce that comes with it other than heaven. 
* Sweet potato fries - I'm a sucker for these, so I'll pretty much always love them, but the sauce with them is very tasty.
author: Megan B.

description: Ok, mixed reviews for this place.  The poke was great!  As good as any in Hawaii.  In keeping with the Hawaiian theme, I had opakapaka for dinner, which came with roasted brussels sprouts and rice pilaf.  The fish itself was delicious...the brussels sprouts were not, nor was the rice.  The sprouts had absolutely no flavor, just the burnt outsides being the evidence that it was somewhat cooked.  The rice was stone cold and had a very musty, moldy flavor.  The service was outstanding...very personable and helpful waiter.  Too many eateries in this area to warrant a trip back to this place.
author: Rob D.

description: Love this place!! Tacos are amazing especially shrimp and steak. And my favorite part, the tacos come with fries! So good!! Can't go wrong with the salmon sandwich or any of the bowls. Love this place! The service is also amazing. I only wish it was bigger inside.
author: Sue-sue M.

description:
A nice joint in the Marina to grab delicious fish tacos, but it's tiny inside with only a few tables in front. Be prepared to wait if you don't want to sit at the bar.

I had the Ahi, Mahi Mahi, and Tilapia fish tacos with sweet potato fries. Mmm...everything was pretty good. A bit expensive as the tacos are kinda small and they're $4.50 each a la carte. The dipping sauces (sweet chili, wasabi mayo) were both pretty good.
author: Kenny J.

description:
I always walk by this place and never paid much attention to it, even though there is always people streaming out the door. Finally my friend (her idea) and I decide to try the place and I am so glad that we did. I have a new favorite! 
The Ceviche we had was out of this world! I loved how spicy it was. Ceviche is usually not very spicy but this was perfect! It was the prefect blend of limey-ness, avocado, shrimp and spice. 
The Cabo shrimp taco's were also fab. I love pineapple salsa. I ordered the sweet potato fries to go with the taco's and was glad that I did. Best sweet potato fries ever! 
I will come back to this joint over and over. Can't wait!
author: Kelley D.

description:
[Green Zebra Coupon: Free starter with purchase of two entrees]

Three is not the magic number.

I should probably have known better when we walked in and saw only six two-person tables and a bar. The wait took forever but, since we weren't in a rush, it actually became a pleasant experience.

The waiters were all really nice to us while we stood there, brought us waters and held one of the tables so that when the one next to it opened we'd be able to push them together. When we finally sat down they gave us a free choice of appetizer (which was what the Green Zebra coupon was for but now we can just save that for next time).

Overall a pretty good experience. The food wasn't much over par but the general vibe and never-empty water glasses made up for it.

I really do mean it, though, this is not a good place for groups of three or more.
author: Elena C.

description: For the money, best seafood in town. Get the ahi tuna wasabi bowl. Or get ANY of the fish tacos. The wait can be long though. This place is fantastic for take-out (just call your order in ahead of time). Priced very reasonably too!
author: Kevin H.

description:
One of our go to place in the Marina area.  Parking may be a problematic at times but it's all worth it.   Great and delicious food that doesn't burn your budget. 

Here's the thing, me and my wife ate here one afternoon and guess who was eating on the next table? Dr. Doogie Howser MD himself, Neil Patrick Harris.  He was actually intrigued with my ahi poke wasabi bowl and politely asked me what it is.  Me and my wife took pictures with him afterwards.  Great experience.

Oh did I mention it is in the Marina area?  Big ups!
author: Desi D.

description:
Either sit at the bartop, or take it to-go. You will hate eating here if you grab a table. It's that setup where people from different tables share the same booth seating. You could start talking about explosive diarrhea or something and get everyone around you to move or leave, but who's really gonna take it that far? Exactly. 

OTHER than that, this place is amazing. I've never had a bad meal from here, and you can't go wrong with the sweet fries. Just take this back home for maximum dopeness.
author: Tom G.

description: Best happy hour specials ever!  I had like 4 delicous tacos  Ceviche is really good too.
author: Jenn D.

description:
If Subway's Jared ate the Ahi Poke Bowl here everyday, he would fit into a size 0, faster. 

With that being said, the Ahi Poke Bowl here is PHENOMENAL!
The fish is fresh, flavor is on point, and the portions are big enough to feed two! It's full of healthy sprouts, avocados, edamame beans, seaweed, veggies, and you can even substitute white rice for brown rice! I could eat this healthy concoction everyday and not feel guilty.

The Tom Kha soup was also flavorful. Spicy, tangy, with hints of lemongrass and coconut milk. The shrimp and mushrooms in the soup were fresh and plump. Delish! 

They also give you a free side dish of edamame beans and Goldfish pretzels while you wait for you order.

I gave it four stars because the fried oysters were good, but not great, and it smelled like body odor in the booth area where I was seated. 

Overall, this place has an upscale vibe with a casual dress code. No need for dress all fancy schamcy here. A great place to take a date or folks from out of town.
author: J C.

description: My food felt worth 5 stars. I greatly loved the sweet potato fries. They were really tasty, friend also concurred with the tasty rating. Also had the wasabi ahi burger. Was a little leary at the start because wasabi can be potent stuff, but the balance of the wasabi, avocado, aioli and fish were spot on.Normally, rare fish anything that isn't sushi raises a red flag, decided to give it a whirl and was not disappointed. Counter seating area was a fun little bonus.
author: Lily K.

description:
Awesome sweet potato fries! perfect blend of soft and crispy.

great salads with fresh fish! the salmon salad is awesome!

rice bowls are great too! brown rice with chicken or ahi tuna. YUM. full meal, unique bold flavors, consistently tastes the same (which i really appreciate!)

this place rocks!
author: Jessica Y.

description:
My friend recently moved to the area and we decided to grab an awesome seafood dinner. After searching yelp for a good place, we decided to go here. 

The location is perfect, though it is a tad too small. The servers were really nice and welcoming and definitely worked hard to seat our somewhat huge party. Our waiter, Jeffrey, convinced one of my friends to order their baja shrimp ceviche (with a special homemade white sauce -- I forgot what it was). It was absolutely delicious! It had a very nice spicy kick at the end the creaminess of the sauce was a nice touch. 

After my group and I ordered, Jeffrey gave us a round of free lemonades! So more TIP for him. haha. I ordered the BBQ Salmon (I don't know what bread they used but i LOVED it! it was like focaccia-ish or something), my friends ordered: the spicy mahi-mahi sandwich (which he said was divine because he devoured it instantly), the thai coconut shrimp, traditional baja taco platter, and the fried oysters. I was not a fan of sweet potato fries (I never liked them as a kid) so I opted to have a side dish of the spicy fries. The spicy fries basically is just curly fries covered in tons of spices... VERY GOOD!

My sandwich was very very scrumptious! The softness of the salmon and the sauce tasted very well with the bread. I loved that there were greens in my sandwich, which gave a bit of a crisp to it. My friends all confessed that their dishes were just as wonderful. One day I'll be able to try them all! 

The service was definitely good despite the large crowd. I would come here again! :)
author: Faye F.

description:
GROUPON review: showed up after playing sports so I was hungry and looking to grab some food to go. The shop is VERY NARROW AND SEATING IS LIMITED. Everything about it reminded me of a seafood version of Asqew Grill which is a GOOD thing.

It's a true niche for people who like seafood but don't want to shell out big bucks to enjoy it. Seafood in this economy means moderate price point at above average quality. Pacific Catch delivers.

SIDENOTES: 2 minor dings (1) place is small in seating and gets cramped, (2) ginger iced tea was sour and bitter, very minor
author: Nelson C.

description: Very good seafood. Tacos is their specailty, but everything from rice bowls to salads, to fried fish is good here. And they have Sweet Potato Fries!
author: David W.

description: My husband and I went here last night and this is one of san Francisco's best kept secrets! The environment is clean, friendly and it's amazing watching the chefs cook right in front of you. We got the fish and chips and clam chowder some of the best we've had, but honestly everything coming out looked to die for! Cannot wait to go back!
author: Mary S.

description:
This location is perhaps a tenth of the size of the Sunset location but the food and service still deliver. I brought a friend who had never eaten here before and he loved it! On my recommendation, he had the ahi poke wasabi bowl with sushi rice (I got mine with brown rice). He really enoyed his food. The poke wasabi bowl is so damn good. 

As a starter we tried the crispy oysters. They were delicious and surprisingly not too heavy. The oysters were perfectly fried so that the oysters still retained their wonderful briny flavor and tenderness. 

I love Pacific Catch.
author: Jenny K.

description:
I love this place! Whenever I come to visit friends at the Marina, I always eat here. It's the only place in the Marina that makes me forget that I'm surrounded by trust fund douche-bags.

It's the only place in the Marina that I feel has a policy against sticks. That's right, prior to entering this establishment, people kindly remove the sticks that go up their asses when they walk around the Marina. This provides for a very pleasant impromptu conversation that could blossom with the couple in the neighboring table.

This brings up the reason why I only gave them fours stars, I don't like that I'm only inches away from another table and it's clearly very cramped in there. However, I can't blame them all too much for this because the food is delicious. If I didn't live in the south bay right now, I'd probably be going to this restaurant at least weekly.

I recommend all of their salads and their fish and chips. They also have sweet potato fries.....delish!
author: Rylan C.

description:
I ADORE their FISH TACOS and SWEET POTATO FRIES!

My favorites are the: traditional fish taco and crispy shrimp tacos served with fresh guacamole and coconut sauce.   The steak taco with delicate onion rings is yummy.  PC is consistently good!  I can eat here every day!

The cozy Chestnut location has a nice open kitchen & ambiance, while the larger 9th Street location is great for large parties.
author: Lis A.

description:
Sometimes a girl must watch her figure. I have lately been watching it take a downturn so I'm attempting to keep that going. 

Enter Poki Tuna Bowl. This is low-fat tastiness to the max!! Fer reals...it's totally awesome! OMG!!! I just like, totally want to have one every week! 

Brown rice, wakame salad (fave!) and the tuna was pretty decent, too. 

I win in the game of LIFE: Skinny Bitch version!!!!
author: Jay H.

description:
So I finally went to Pacific Catch.
I had no expectations, the four star here at Yelp means absolutely nothing to me since I have no clue who has a good taste here, I have been disappointed almost every time.
So I went.
Honestly this place is overpriced and even though the server was nice he forgot how I wanted my food plus the chef gave me his special, something unidentified, not eatable
The Salad was too small and not enough fish, the famous poke did not really impress me.
I have not alot more to say, would maybe come back if I was in the neighbourhood but nothing I would ever plan.

So sure try it, but if this is the best Ahi tuna you have had, you still have some Kung fu to learn!
author: cecilia k.

description: The food here is healthy and well-prepared. The tuna poke salads with miso dressing are delicious and generous in size. The mahi-mahi fish tacos are also good, but only if you eat them immediately (when they're still piping hot). What really stands out is the customer service. I received a cold meal and Corey immediately took it back, had it re-prepared, and took 50% off our bill. He and Aimee are both courteous, responsive, and friendly. Their customer service was unrivaled. I want to give this 3.5 for decent food, but 5 for service!
author: B L.

description:
I have been here mutiple times and gotten a variety of dishes and everything is always consistently good.  The tacos, the salads, the tofu sandwich...all yummy.  And they have sweet potato fries!!!!   
All their flavors go together well and it's rare for me to find a restuarant where I  have liked everything I've ordered.

The restaurant is pretty tiny but I've always been seated pretty quickly.  It's not a fancy shmancy place so I wouldn't bring like a date here as the tables are squashed together...more like a casual grab a bite to eat place.
author: C A.

description:
How have I never been here before?!  My friend picked me up from the office and took me to the Marina for lunch (yes, I ran over my 1 hour lunch break, but the food was SO worth it!)  

My friend and I shared 2 sandwiches: wasabi ahi and the spicy ahi both with a side of sweet potato fries.  I have to say that the spicy ahi was a bit disappointing - it was really good fish, but it lacked a lot of flavor.  BUT this could be because I had the wasabi ahi sandwich first and that was bursting with flavor!  It had avocado, pickled ginger, and the fish was cooked at the perfect consistency.  I put hot sauce on it and it tasted like a spicy tuna roll (but in sandwich form!)

The sweet potato fries and cole slaw (which come with the sandwiches) were amazing.  

In a nutshell: HO.LY Mahi Mahi - this is a MUST come!!  I would maybe stay away from the lemongrass iced tea...that was meh, but I'll definitely be back!
author: Alvina W.

description:
I'd tried to come here before with a friend but the wait was ridiculous as the seating area is absolutely miniscule...

After happy hour next door at Laiola, I'd planned to make another attempt at dinner here--on a monday rather than friday, so had hoped there wouldn't be as bad a wait...

Bad news, still was a long wait, and pretty cold outside so not ideal for waiting around outside for tables to open--we debated sitting outside wrapped in hooded jackets but were still freezing, so eventually grabbed 2 stools at the bar.

Now for the good...the Hawaiian poke (ahi tuna with wonton crisps) was great! and after making myself at home, I must say that $8.50 is a quite reasonable price (although the wonton crisps obviously filled space..).

We got the pacific catch of the day fish and chips which came with fries, and the ahi tuna wasabi bowl (although now i wish i'd done the ahi poke bowl), which was $12.95 and came with avocado, etc over a bed of rice--great with the soy sauce and spirichi (however you spell it) sauce I love so much! Very filling, albeit mostly rice...

I'd say the prices were quite reasonable, although that said the wasabi bowl was mostly rice, and the seating is definitely the biggest issue.  Nonetheless, a great location, quick service once seated, but definitely DEFINITELY crowded! I'll still be back as i love seafood, and DONT CARE that this is a chain! Actually I'd like to try the other locations which I hear have more seating...
author: Danielle J.

description: Hawaiian poke was good, albeit a tad bit salty!
author: Wilson W.

description: I wish I had an option to not give a star at all.  I ate dinner here on a Sunday night with my sister after having just picked her up from the airport.  We shared two rice bowls and the coconut shrimp appetizer.  My sister went home and called me violently sick about 2 hours after dinner.  I became sick about 4 hours after dinner.  Classic food poisoning symptoms.  I spoke with the GM on Monday and she said she would speak with her boss and get back to me the following day.  On Wednesday after not hearing from her, I called again.  She offered to provide us with gift certificates ... I told her that all I wanted was for her to refund the money to my card.  It took 4 phone calls and two weeks for the refund to come and they excluded our beverages in the refund.  What a disappointment and such a shame.  I live just a few blocks from Pacific Catch and will never return.
author: Jacqueline G.

description: Pretty decent food.  It's a very consistent quality that you can bet on.  A little on the pricey side the rice bowls will knock your socks off, I just prefer them without the grilled pineapple.
author: Alyssa M.

description: My husband and I decided to catch a late lunch here.  We were crusin the Marina District and just ran into this place.  I am not a huge fan of fish, but I thought what the hell, I'll try something different.  Much to my surprise the menu represented a fish and chips restaurant fused with Asian cuisine.  I ordered the Salmon fish and chips (sweet potato fries...MY FAVORITE), my husband ordered the tacos, and we shared the calamari.  Much to my surprise the salmon was VERY good, the calamari was well seasoned, the tacos were also good.  This place has tons of different sauces to add different flavors to your meal.  Customer service was very friendly.  Parking can be hard.  Prices were reasonable.  Will eat here again!!!
author: Andrea B.

description:
I had a couple of relatives in town this last weekend who were staying in SF's Marina area.  When visiting them, they wanted to have a good lunch that was healthier than most (dieters) but still good food.  We decided to try Pacific Catch since I had seen this place but still hadn't had the opportunity to try it.  

When you first walk in, you get hit with the smells of miso soup (I wish I had tried it but I ordered something else)...delicious!  However, the place is kind of small.  Large groups would not work here.  As it was, we were 4 people group and we had to comine tables to sit.  But the staff there was very nice and accomodating in helping us get settled. 

I wound up ordering the teriyaki rice bowl with the mahi mahi.  It was really good but I think if I get it again, I would ask for the pineapple salsa on the side.  Not because it was bad but it was a bit overwhelming on the rice.  I like my rice plain and it wound up being too sweet.  My aunt had the BBQ salmon sandwich and it was really good (I had a bite).  It almost had a the taste of a burger.

All in all an excellent place to visitif your in the Marina area.  We'll defintely be coming back!
author: Jessica H.

description: Coming from Hawaii, I have been craving poke ever since I left the islands in January. My solution to fix this problem was to eat at Pacific Catch. I had the Hawaiian poke bowl that comes with poke, seaweed salad, crushed nori, sprouts, and ginger. YUM! However, I wish they served it with regular rice instead of sushi rice. I didn't care for their sushi rice at all. I felt that it had too much vinegar and when a large amount of rice was combined with the fish, it masked the taste of the poke.  The poke was good, which helped to satisfy my craving. I also had the sweet potato fries that were nice and crisp but not hot.
author: Anna K.

description:
Maybe it was because we were all starving after our trip to the Academy of Sciences but we stumbled and fell in love with this place thanks to my gps!  We were all craving seafood after walking around the academy..ironic i know...so we came here and found a small place w/ a line forming.  All good signs so far.

As we sat down we were greeted by friendly staff who weren't pushing us to get a quick order in but actually gave us time and came back to us when we were ready to order.  Decor inside was kinda casual eclectic.  We were concerned that it seemed like it was Californian/Asian/Mexican fusion of some sort but was happily surprised with the selection:

Appetizers: Ahi poke and shrimp ceviche.  Both were well seasoned and tasted so fresh.  The contrast in flavors were just magical

Entrees: fish and chips and bbq salmon salad.
Amazingly the fish and chips weren't so greasy.  It was so lightly breaded with its own spices served along side sweet potato "chips".  That's right sweet potato fries folks.  The aioli and chili sauce they served with it was also amazing.  Flavors were different which gave a different twist to this classic.  As for my salmon salad it was HUGE.  The salad was bigger than the fish and chips plate.  It also had a medly of flavors.  The fish had a chipotle bbq sauce on it which fit perfectly with the citrusy taste of the dressing that was on the salad.  Very refreshing.

Overall, this gem we found was amazing.  Left us satisfied without feeling all gross and guilty. :)
author: Kim D.

description:
Because we went to Pacific Catch with no expectations, we left pretty happy with it. We would give it 4 stars at the price we paid (we had a 50% off deal) and 3.5 if we had had to pay full price.

Gabs ordered the fish special of the day. It had a miso glaze, Japanese rice, and mushrooms. The sauce was excellent, but the fish was a bit dry.

Mike ordered two tacos: shrimp and chicken. The shrimp was delicious--perfect crunch and spice, and the chicken was good but a bit disappointing as a follow-up. The fries that came with the basket (spicy fries) were some of the best we've had.

All in all, atmosphere was charming, and it looked like one of the more interesting places to eat on Union St. It was a good experience but not compelling enough for us to go back.
author: Gabriella H.

description: Absolutely loved it. Went with a friend who lives in the area. Food was fantastic. Am craving a chance to return to SF just to eat here.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
I've had my yelp account for over a month now and have never written a review. After the horrible treatment that I received at Pacific Catch tonight, I was compelled to write my first review, even if it's a negative one. 

For the first time in my life, I felt like I was being treated differently and did not get the same caliber of service because of my skin color. The following are incidences where I felt disrespected:

1) We were disrespected from the moment we stepped through the door. There was a line so we were looking for a waiting list because the host was too busy to greet me. Right when I found the list and picked it up, the host finally acknowledged me and rudely pulled the list out of my hand with a, "I'll take that..." 

2) There were three people in front of us on the waiting list, and we were told that the wait would be 35 minutes. We decided to stick around anyway because of the rave from yelp. A few minutes later, another couple walked in and asked for a table. The host told them that it would take 10 minutes. Guess what. That couple was white. 

3) We waited patiently and then finally got seated. After a minute of sitting there without a menu, without water, and without acknowledgment from the waiters. Another couple got seated right next to us and they got their menus instantly while we were still waiting on ours.  Guess what. That couple was white. 

4) We finally got our menus. By the time the waiter came to take our orders, the couple next to us was getting their food. We each ordered the taco platter, and it took them forever to bring out our dishes. 

I am not the kind of person to complain about racism and prejudices, but it was so blatant at Pacific Catch that I had to share the story. I have to admit, the food was good. But the service was horrible if you're not white or with a white companion.
author: Uyen N.

description:
Casual place and good fish.  I wonder why there aren't more places like this?  A bit crowded, but we got here at 6 o'clock and just beat the line.  The dining area is really tight and not for the claustrophobic.  Lots of take-out traffic.

The escolar special was really good, but the portion was a bit small.  The Thai coconut shrimp was good, especially with the wasabi sauce that the waiter brought over.  The beer selection is pretty good, too.
author: Collin W.

description:
Likes: Hawaiian poke wasabi rice bowl, sweet potato fries, fried dulce de leche spring rolls, edamame, and great service!

Dislikes: had to wait a bit for seating (but they were really nice about it and made it up with great service.)
author: Karen M.

description:
I like Pacific Catch's wasabi bowl with seared ahi and/or poke.  Most of the bowl is just rice, but unlike Japanese chirashi bowls, the wasabi bowl is drizzled with enough sauce to make the entire thing flavorful.

The food comes out fresh and fast.  Seating at this location is limited, so I prefer to save my PC cravings for when I'm running errands solo in the Marina and can just get my lunch to-go.
author: S L.

description:
The sweet potato fries are AMAZING!! Yummy.

The fish taco I found mediocre - I got the fried fish and it wasn't even crunchy. It was like 4 bucks and it was like 2 bite tiny. I'd avoid those next time. (minus 1 star for those)

The location is tiny. Friendly and quick service.
author: Chili B.

description: Great food! Can't say the same of the wait. My faves: Spicey Ahi sandwich and fried salmon and sweet potato fries.
author: Stephen Y.

description: After a long day of biking and playing tourist, I had worked up quite the appetite and this place just happened to be right in front of me, so in I went. GOOD CHOICE ME! Super delicious, super friendly and lots of locals avoiding the wait for a table by getting take-out. Too bad I don't live close enough to make it my new go to for fish tacos... Until we meet again Pacific Catch!
author: B B.

description:
I hadn't tried Pacific Catch until a friend taunted with me with the statement: "Pacific Catch is better than Tacolicious." Being a huge fan of Tacolicious, I found this outrageous and the competitor in me demanded action. 

We started with warm edamame and Pacificos. I had the Grilled Mahi Mahi tacos, which were fresh and just the right amount of acidity. My friend had the Ahi Tuna Rice Bowl, of which I was allowed one bite, and then declared, "I'm ordering this next time."

Relaxed atmosphere with a fun wait staff. Probably not best for parties over five.
author: May E.

description:
Just happened upon this place and that was a good thing. Great atmosphere, waiter and excellent fish. I had a "catch of the day" which was a perfectly cooked fillet, without any unnecessary coatings.

My wife had her usual small plate, a shrimp taco, that was excellent. 

We both had a nice cocktail, hers being an unusual wasabi bloody mary.

The people around us were all happy about their food.

We were surprised at the modest bill. I looked it over, thinking they left something off. Maybe that was due to the $1.50 ice cream ball dessert!

This is a place that does it right and it is recommend. San Francisco is full of fine fish places and there is a lot of competition, but if you are in this area give it a try.

Note that the restaurant is a clean and modern place, not funky or full of old-world charm. Just so you know.

BTW, there is parking, a small lot next door. I think you have to be lucky and don't try it in a gigantic vehicle.
author: Carlos B.

description:
Pacific Catch: Great restaurant, even if the name is about as boring as it could get.

First, the best item on the money is not caught in the pacific. When you get there, order a plate of sweet potato fries. They come with a side of tartar sauce and a side of sweet and sour, and it's just about the best thing ever.

We were a little worried about wait, since we were going for lunch on a Sunday, but there was a table outside with a heater, so we braved the wind and that wasn't bad at all. I grabbed an Ahi Poke bowl, and my girl grabbed a chicken teriyaki bowl. Very good bowl food (reminds me of an Asian themed-Wahoos bowl). 

I loved the seaweed salad, loved the ahi poke, and will definitely go back next time I'm in the area. Great lunch place, but it did run me and the girlfriend about 37 bucks for Sunday lunch...
author: Devin K.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE! 

The sweet potato fries are so tasty and I always get the Hawaiian Poke bowl. The staff is extremely nice and I have always been able to substitute the rice with lettuce on every occasion I've requested it. For light bites, I get the Wakame Seaweed Salad and/or Hawaiian Poke with the airy wonton crisps. Yummy!

I definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves seafood and I always take my out-of-town friends here. They've always gone back on their own, during return trips to SF. Bon Appetit! :)
author: Cris M.

description: I love this place!! The food is fresh, interesting, and priced well. I had the ceviche with shrimp to start. It is so yummy with the avocado wasabi sauce. I also had the wasabi bowl with ahi poke and grilled salmon and brown rice. Clean eating at its best!
author: Jess B.

description:
Very tiny place but our wait time was well managed by staff and worth it.
I loved the ahi-tuna wasabi bowl I ordered. The ahi was completely tasty but what made it memorable was how balanced the flavours of the rest of the bowl were. The sushi style rice was really really good, the seaweed salad crisp and potent ginger yummy. Also there was a sauce I can't remember the name of  that was a perfect compliment. 

I also loved the beer selection- it's been a long time since I've seen Tiger beer on a menu.. I had a Kona something that was really good for a pale clean ale, and another fellow diner had a dark dark brew that had a hint of coconut to it- it was also terrific and went well with the sweet tater fries.

The salads, teriyaki bowls, and fish and chips looked like winners as well
author: Sara K.

description: Used to be a great deal.  Prices have gone up significantly and serving size is down.  Still, the bowls are tasty...
author: Neo M.

description: My wife and I went September 16, to have an early dinner before the Foo Fighters! I'm a pretty tough sell on restaurants in general, (definitely give them the benefit of the doubt outta  the gate), Right when we walked in the Manager, Mark, was going to take us to the best seat in the house since it was our first visit. We really appreciated that but the bar area was really more our speed and really comfortable. Very personable, easy to talk to and even brought us over a few pieces of tuna and showed us on the menu what they were prior to ordering, (quickly climbing my ladder!) drinks and service were excellent all through the evening , bartender had a great mustache , for all you single ladies out there, and actually really nice too. Our server was always there, not in your face, just like he knew when we needed something and took care of us , ( I'm at the top of the ladder!). I told Mark shortly before we left, I was only disappointed in one thing...( He truly looked bummed) that they don't have a Pacific Catch in the east bay, Concord, where we live! That magnetic smile was back, looking forward to our next visit, Thanks to ALL the staff,perfect evening. Dinner was fantastic, I had the Ribeye, my wife had the Ahi Rice bowl
author: Kent S.

description:
Went here with friends and their 2-year-old.  Salads are fantastic, and the crispy shrimp tacos rock (rock is the verb).  Might not've expected sweet potato fries with tacos and fish, but they work.

Very accommodating to children and their pension for small side dishes of condiments and such.

Great spot.  Will be back for more tacos...
author: .caroline. ..

description:
Sometime, they give you exactly what you want.  I want to try everything on the menu. 

MUST TRY: THE SWEET POTATO FRIES.  

I had the Crispy Cabo Shrimp Soft Tacos with Sweet Potato Fries served with a side of jalapeño tartar and Thai sweet-chili sauce.  Perfect.  

Amazing food.  Amazing prices.  Can't wait to go back.  The food was so good that I almost forgot I was in the Marina.
author: Sandy C.

description: The place is much smaller than the other location.  But their sweet potato fries are a must.  The artichoke is excellent as well.  Their special ahi taco was not as great though because you cannot taste the ahi tuna.  We also ordered their poke salad which is great but it tasted like any other sashimi salad.
author: Crystal L.

description: Great option for a casual lunch or dinner. Restaurant is pretty small, so it gets crowded during busy meal times. I had the chicken sandwich and sweet potato fries, which very delicious !!
author: Scoot S.

description:
YES! YES! YES!!!

Preface:
My gf and I had a dinner date and instead of going to the typical spots we go to, we decided to seek out "sweet potato fries." Quick Google search and Pacific Catch is the first place on the list. Benefits, it's within walking distance from work. 

MISSION: Get sweet potato fries, something fried, and something sweet.
MISSION STATUS: Successfully completed.

It's a small place but you can tell the food it worth it. It was packed! My friend and I sat at the bar and our waiter was kick ass. He was friendly, polite and fast. I appreciate a place where you can see the kitchen staff work their butt off to get you your food. Makes you appreciate their efforts and your food a bit more. 

Our server gave us the skinny on what was good on the menu and helped us divvy up our meals. We ordered two entrees to share...Fish & chips & tacos. How fresh was the sea food?? SO FRESH.  He even had our entrees split in half so we each had our own portion. Very cool! Between the two of us, it was the perfect amount to share. 

As full as we were, we had dessert....Dulce de Leche. 
BOMB!! This was when I knew I'd forever be a huge fan of PC. 

The food was excellent. Dessert was even better. The staff was kick ass and down to earth. It's not the most inexpensive place but hey, we are in San Francisco. A great place for food and awesome date place. Don't forget to get the sweet potato fries & the spicy fries. 

Hell yes to Pacific Catch!
author: Dorothea G.

description:
Packed.  Eclectic.  Hearty.

Feeling Mexican?  Go to Pacific Catch!  
Feeling Japanese? Go to Pacific Catch!  
Feeling British!?  Go to Pacific Catch!

Whether it's fish tacos, ahi tuna rice bowls, or plain fish n' chips, make sure you top it off with the sweet potater fries!!!  yum yum!  So savory sweet and speckled salty, it's the perfect comfort food packed with vitamin A!

The wait here can get to be ridiculously long, so definitely order to go as in door seating is pretty cramped as well.  And make sure to get the sweet potato fries mate!

Know Before You Go:
1. The sweet potato fries.  Please.
2. Please order to-go.  This place doesn't need another body in it's small location.
author: Jane L.

description:
THIS PLACE IS GREAT. great food, great service, absolutely reasonable prices. california salmon sandwich is delicious.

i went there on a friday night at around 630, and it filled up really quickly. they have take-out as well, but if you want to eat in the restaurant (which is pretty small), you should probably call ahead.
author: Jane H.

description: Food and service were fine. The only problem is the manager on duty looked really disheveled and unprofessional. I saw him putting his fingers in his mouth and touching his face while using a cash register.  I kid you not.
author: Mark H.

description: Consistently good food with speedy service if you can find a seat in this small local
author: David B.

description: Great food and very reasonable.  The crispy fish tacos were the bomb.  If I lived here i'd go regularly.  The tomotilo/avacado salsa is great.
author: Pete M.

description: I love the Japanese wasabi Pan-Asian rice bowl with Hawaiian poke, grilled salmon, or seared ahi, and the island tacos: traditional Baja, mahi mahi, or barbecue salmon.
author: Sharman G.

description: Great place if you want some seafood without the white table cloth.
author: Kyle M.

description:
As an ongoing celebration of the good news and new life, we stopped by here yesterday after work. 
This place is always packed..for a reason! The food is great! We had crispy oysters (Too fried for my taste but very good), grilled mahi mahi (perfect), fish and chips...chips as in yam fries with 2 sauces... All the food was amazing and i will def. be back here! 
Other people in the group had the 'japanese bowls' that comes w/ brown rice option with either salmon, chicken, shrimp..etc. and shitake mushrooms and bok choy! i will be making this at home for sure!

Cute little place, nice atmosphere, on a nice day the window to the outside is open and there are tables to sit outside and you can always get a take out as i have seen few people do.

It is Cinco de Mayo today and i suggest go and get a taco if you're around there, it will not disappoint!
oh so yum!!

=)
author: C A.

description: It took a bit longer than expected for the food to arrive but it was worth it. The Ahi salad tasted great and I should never ordered the sweet potato fries, too delicious to stop eating! Waiter is super cute :-)
author: Daveen L.

description: Love the food here - only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because  sometimes the waiters mess up the order - forget to give sauce on the side or they bring fries so late you no longer want them. However, their fish tacos and sweet potato fries are the bomb!
author: Ann W.

description:
4 stars because i HATE that the tables are so small you drag your privates accross the table next to you to get in and out.  
But the food is excellent.  Poke bowl, fish and chips, sweet potato fries..yummm....
author: Susan Z.

description:
Love that hole in the wall!
Casual for the Marina, 1$ sign and healthy solution for dinner.  I take out when it's packed.
author: Damien J.

description: Really good food... really!  All sorts of fish, fish tacos, poke, bowls - large menu, and very creatively prepared.  Pretty cramped inside, but very nice, tastefully decorated, and clean.  A real treat and I can't wait to come back.
author: Mark W.

description:
My hand smells fishy. 

Fishy and limeony.

In a good way. 

No, not a 'Happy Ending' good way.  

But, a "good gawd Pacific Catch's fish taco's are amazing!
... and messy" good way.

I would suggest that you remember to wash your hands before you leave or your fish taco lunch will haunt you the entire drive home, causing you to write a review thick with double entendres and limited in usefulness.
author: R M.

description:
Its incredible what your body craves when you aren't eating.  I was looking at the recent reviews on the front page of Yelp, and I saw one for Pacific Catch, and i just had my last meal there flash before my eyes, and my stomach started rumbling, and I don't know if i can make it another week without eating here.  I don't even eat here that often...but this might, no WILL be my first real meal back into the land of solid food.  I'm fucking hungry.

For me, Pacific Catch is considered guilt free.  I walked here the last time with a friend.  A solid 2 mile walk there involving some hills over into the Marina, and  a solid 2 back.  The calories burned walking were definitely made up for.  This place is small.  We sat at the bar, but you are lucky if you can get in right away.  I say its worth any wait. I'm not gonna even dock a star for waiting.

The fucking sweet potato fries.  Holy Shit.  DO NOT EVEN THINK ABOUT SHARING WITH ME.... I will bite your fucking fingers off.  If the tilapia happens to be their catch of the day, I recommend getting it either in fish and chips form or in a taco.  Everyone loves a  taco.  Soooo good.  And yes, these items are fried..but if you consider them guilt free, they taste that much sweeter.  

If you want to stay away from the fried...go with the House Salad and top it with their Rare Ahi...if you are into that kind of personal heaven.  I think my first meal back however will be....the Wasabi Rice Bowl with either the Poke or the Sushi Grade Ahi on top.  Makes my stomach convulse with hunger pain just thinking about it.  It will just be that much better i guess.  Who's coming with me?
author: Lauren F.

description:
If you're mostly about the food and like a healthyand tasty food  at a modest venue, come here!

This place was a pleasant surprise.  I got the poke salmon bowl and sweet potato fries on the side.  Everything was tasty, clean, and fresh!   I was more than satisfied, and didn't finish any of my food.  The portions are quite generous.  The fish is great, salad, rice...fries, there was nothing to complain about.  The only thing is that you might not be able to find seating sometimes, and their might be a wait...but that's probably because they have lots of people coming back for more =)  I certainly will be.
author: Nadiyah S.

description:
This place is TINY.

Damn you, Apple. Why did you ruin my best kept secret? Ever since your stupid commercial, I've hardly gotten a seat here. Good thing they opened one in the Inner Sunset.

Either way, when I eat here it's magic. Fish and chips, Wasabi Bowls...it's just all so fresh. Definitely go for the Sweet Potato Fries. You will NOT regret it. 

To top it off, the staff is so friendly and chill. I only have to take a star away for the fact that I have to sit inches away from other people whenever dining here. Not too much of a problem though, I like to smell my neighbor's food on his breath.
author: Ryan V.

description:
One of the many things I miss about vacationing in Hawaii is the inexpensive poke you can buy by the pound at any supermarket.  The large chunks of tuna are fresh and buttery, and marinaded with the perfect combination of soy sauce, mirin, sesame oil, chopped scallions, and other tasty ingredients.  I can eat this stuff by the spoonfuls, sans rice...sans anything.  And when I found out that Pacific Catch serves Hawaiian Poke, I knew I had to come here.  Even their picture on their website provoked my mouth to water.  And let me tell you, this dish did not disappoint.  It was exactly what I had hoped for.  This $8.50 bowl of ahi tuna cubes was extremely generous and came with crispy wonton wrappers.  Even better, this was a complimentary dish for us with the benefit of the SFExplore card discount (buy 2 entrees, get any appetizer for free).  This is definitely a must-have when you come to Pacific Catch.

Their other dishes, however, weren't as great as the poke.  The SO had the fish and chips, I had a 2-taco platter and our vegetarian friend had the teriyaki tofu rice bowl.  The fish and chips were not as outstanding as we thought it would be.  Nice and crispy, but kind of bland.  I chose the traditional Baja and grilled mahi-mahi tacos.  They were good too, but not as good as Taylor's!  Our friend really liked his teriyaki bowl, which he substituted white rice for brown rice.  It looked good and he said it was delicious.

The service was really friendly and helpful.  And even at 9:30 on a Friday night, there was still a line.  But the turnover is pretty quick.  And there's plenty of bar stools, which is perfect for a dinner-for-two, or even three.
author: Diane L.

description:
Real men (and women) play co-ed flag football. And this is the place these superior athletes go to nourish themselves after wowing all the fans (at least when the field is two blocks away).

The food here is quite good and reasonably priced. I had the Wasabi Ahi sandwich, and it had a near-perfect combination of flavorful fish, bread and extras. Everyone else at the table seemed to enjoy theirs, too - so much to that my tablemate couldn't finish the extra sweet potato fries, which I proceeded to pound.

The only negative is the seating. There's not very much of it, so you might have to wait a little while. And when you do sit, it can be a bit cramped.

So if you're one of those creaky old guys in my league and need space to stretch out and tape ice bags to yourself, this isn't the place to you. Get lost and let me enjoy my sandwich!
author: Trey C.

description:
I ordered the ahi poke wasabi bowl. Great healthy food if you are dieting.  The salad got kind of soggy at the end tho, it was drenched in a lot of sauce.  You have to try the sweet potato fries with the dipping sauce, so yummy.

Everything is fresh which i enjoyed, the place is pretty small tho. I would go back.
author: kate b.

description:
Something seems fishy about this place. I can't put my finger on it... or at least not without jumping behind the counter (this place has a counter).

Everyone loves their sweet potato fries. Everyone. Even Jesus, and they weren't even invented yet (he could go through time). They're not exclusive to this place, and are by no means In-N-Out fresh. They're from a bag... You can find these at restaurant suppliers. Just Google around.

The Salmon Fish and Chips is (or "are," depending on how you is reading that) good. I still prefer Halibut, but the PC version has a nice Asian flair. My girlfriend likes the fish tacos.

I would come here more often if parking wasn't such a kick in the nuts.
author: Keane L.

description:
2007 Update: Went to Pacific Catch today to become re-aquainted with their mahi mahi & sweet potato fries and they pretty much blew. What happened here? The special was tilapia so I ordered a taco and it was basically like eating a mcchicken ranch wrap, ie, breaded meat covered in cream. Yuck. I might return for some sweet potato fries & green tea if I'm around but the sandwich sucked - a tiny piece of fish overwhelmed by "aoili" and a slither of avocado. Not what it used to be. 

Original review, 2005:
I will put up with the feelings of inadequacy that arise from being the only person with dark hair and clothing for blocks and blocks in order to have Pacific Catch's perfect, perfect, perfect mahi mahi sandwich and sweet potato fries. Oh yes, it is so worth it.
author: Maria D.

description:
Casual seafood at its best. Small and fresh.  If you can grab a table near the front window go for it, but don't stress if you end up at the bar...it's just as good (and the bar-stools have backs). The menu is great and most any (seafood loving) person will have at least a few options to choose from. I hear the fish tacos are great, but I went with the crab and avocado salad. When they say meal sized salad, they mean it, and  PC doesn't skimp on the delicious crab atop the greens. The poke tuna was great as well. 

Salads run about $9-12 and you can treat yourself to a glass of wine starting a $6. With prices like this for dinner, it's a perfect date or casual spot for friends who don't want to spend loads of $$$ on fresh seafood.
author: Theresa T.

description:
Interesting...catch! We were looking for a food happy hour in yuppieland and found this place had one. Their happy hour featured a la carte tacos for $3 each - I know, $3 per taco! Then again, maybe because it's SF, or maybe these were giant tacos.

What was I thinking, this is not the suburbs, this is the City! So after that expensive overture of happy hour tacos - oh they didn't taste much so definitely not worth $3 each - we happily gorged on their appetizer, Hawaiian Poke, sashimi tuna with sesame-soy and wonton crisps which was excellent. 

Not sure if we got more - bottomline, I was full, I was smiling, but my wallet was still hungry.
author: Paolo D.

description:
I've never actually eatin in this place, just take-out, but I did date a girl who used to work here and we got half off on everything. Now that I think of it, what was I thinking of when I broke up with her?????

Silly me.

The Ahi Tuna Poke bowl is out of control.  I think I could eat it everyday for the rest of my life. mmmmm Tuna
author: Adam L.

description: Awesome food! I was bummed I didn't get the fish tacos, I went for chicken, but good thing my cousin did so I know how awesome they are! Next time!
author: Lindsey M.

description:
Dear Pacific Catch,

I am holding your fifth star hostage until you open a location in SOMA - the 30 minute drive/parking search/attempt to avoid hitting drunk Marina-ers is not conducive to my appetite. Additionally, SOMA-ers need some sweet potato fries/ahi poke wasabi bowl lovin', too.

Sincerely yours,
Adrienne
author: Adrienne C.

description: Great food, great location, nice ambiance.   A little tight on space (expected in the Marina district).   Highly recommended
author: Paul S.

description:
Girls Day Out (Part 3)

Last week, my friends and I headed over to The Marina on a nice, sunny, but windy day.  We found parking just a block away and the wait at Pacific Catch was only 10 minutes, but we were actually seated after waiting 7 minutes.  Our table was the first one by the door, should really just sit two, but a chair was added and was a bit in the way for people going in and out of the restaurant.  After having to move my chair in a few times, we decided to move to the bar/counter.   

I love F I S H (and seafood in general).  I eat FISH raw, pan fried, grilled, seared, deep fried, and baked.  I had the Ahi Poke (Hawaiian Style Sashimi) Wasabi Bowl.  Great, big portion topped with avocado, wakame salad, sprouts, thinly sliced cucumber, pickled ginger, sesame seed, shredded nori and a wasabi-soy sauce.  All over a big bowl of seasoned sushi rice.  It was a perfect lunch (paired with Cricket Cola made with green tea), there was nothing fishy about it.  I can eat FISH with RICE any day of the week and any time of day, that's how much I really love it :-)!

I picked at my friends plate and tried some deep fried oysters (tasty, with a good, light batter) and sweet potato fries (crispy and not too greasy).  Would go back to Pacific Catch to try some of their other dishes that caught my eye while looking over the menu before making my decision including Fish and Chips, Thai Coconut Shrimp and a side order of Grilled Corn with chili-lime butter.  I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.  

Must go back... must go back now :-)!
author: Celeste M.

description:
156 reviews already?!  umm... here's my review:  ditto.

(i don't generally go out of my way to eat seafood.  i go back to this place.  the poke is dandy and they love putting avocados in everything.  i like eating avocados in everything.  it works out well.  friendly staff, too.)
author: ben y.

description: Great seafood place with a bit of Asian flare.  BBQ Salmon Sandwich and the Fish 'n Chips are two of the best dishes.  Place is tiny so go a bit earlier or later or grab takeout.  Also have some good Hawaiian beers (Coconut Porter is pretty awesome).
author: Steve K.

description:
The Hawaiian Poke, Sweet Potato Fries and the Artichoke were all outstanding! It was cool to sit at the "bar" and watch the cooks!  Will definitely go back there.

Went back there the following Friday night, since there were some other items I wanted to try.  It was a lot busier, three cooks instead of 2 & 3 waitresses instead of 2.  Service was really bad - we sat at the bar again, but it took them at least 10 minutes before taking our order!  This time around, I had the Wasabi bowl with Hawaiian Poke (the poke must be laced with something..cuz it's GOOD!) and the lemongrass, ginger iced tea.  I wasn't sure if the iced tea was suppose to be sweetened, but I didn't see any sugar around and didn't want to ask for any.

I will need to rate one less star...after my 2nd experience.  Food is still GREAT - service, so-so.
author: Lise T.

description: Parking is hard to find but once you have managed to find it you will come into a heavenly retreat of delicious food.  Yes, the tables are a tad close together, however, any little thing that comes up is trumped by the deliciousness of this place!  Serious, the bbq salmon tacos are pure bliss! The waitress (who I believe covers all the tables) is helpful and friendly.  Highly Recommended!
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
There is a slight possibility that I'm obsessed with PacCatch.  The wasabi bowl,  specifically, is everything that makes my life worth living all thrown together into one fantastic package.  I usually go with the brown rice (once it hits your lips, it feels so... healthy) and ahi.  Then they throw in some seaweed salad, cucumber, avocado, and this CRAZY good wasabi soy sauce.  It's pretty much all of my favorite foods all smashed together. I never order the sweet potato fries because I will eat ALL of them if I do, but I always encourage whoever I'm eating  with to get them so I can steal some.  They  really are AMAZING.

Minus one  star because, as others have said, the place truly is tiny.  I always get take out because it's so much easier.  It's not too far from the marina, so you could easily walk down and sit by the water and munch.
author: Caitlin D.

description:
I'm from Southern California and I still crave the spicy ahi sandwich I ordered from here during my last trip up north.  The fish was fresh and the chipotle mayo complimented it really well.  I tried some sweet potato fries and thought they were good, but I actually preferred the spicy fries, being a lover of spicy food myself.  The server recommended the Cricket Cola to drink, a combination of cola and green tea, and I thoroughly enjoyed its unique taste.  It also comes in diet, for anyone watching their caloric intake.

My waitress was incredibly nice--one of my friends insisted she looked like a female version of Colin Firth--and she didn't seem to mind the weird looks we gave her in order to fight for or against this claim.  My only complaint was that one of the other waiters gave us a hard time when the last member of our party hadn't shown up yet, even though they had seated us knowing full well that our party wasn't complete.  Overall though, the service was good.

The next time I go up to San Francisco, I will definitely be eating here again.
author: VyVy N.

description:
4.5
KILLER.  KILLER. KILLER. WHOA MAMA...KILLER.
Yes it's packed...but it's for a reason...
I love this place.  I would take of a star for slow service, and/or price...but this niche place makes it so worth it for me.  Besides, you are in the marina...and if you have to wait...you can stroll....stroll over to Kara's cupcakes or any other place if you wish...

My "can I get some Yelp" pal and I shared an order of Hawaiian Poke-kinda tasted like tuna tartar...and it was so yummy. I was eating it even after my meal.   $7.95
For dinner, I went with tacos AGAIN.  Geez...but these were fish tacos.  
I had two tacos with sweet potato fries. $9.95.
