1 taco-traditional baja-crispy catch of day served with jalapeno crema and some avocado salsa.
1 taco-cabo shrimp-crispy shrimp with pico de gallo and  lime crema. The shrimp taco was seasoned so well, and I will admit was my absolute favorite.  I loved it...loved it loved it!  
Normally, I eat all my "chips" first.  This time, and as a testament to the good food, I ate my tacos and left a bunch of the fries.  Did I tell you, they were really good...
Shoulda had a beer, but I was trying to be thrifty.  Check out my pics...makes my mouth water even now. 
I had to get redeemed from my capitola fish and chip experience, and SF blew it out of the water.  Thank you Pacific Catch, you have taken a small space,worked with it,and made it HOT SPOT...please come to San Jose!



If any entrepreneurial person is reading this...please come to San Jose.  I need a place like this in the south bay!!!  

Oh yeah...and my pal ordered a salmon teriyaki bowl with brown rice.  It was massive and $11.95.  You could feed a family with that thing..
I loved loved loved it...and can't wait to go back.
They serve sammies, soups, salads, and fish and chips.  Truly and awesome place that was right my tummy alley!
author: Flor D.

description:
came here after the night life at around 1030pm. place was still open and packed! i heard it was really good, but i thought it was just OK. maybe it was because i wasn't even hungry to begin with. but birthday boy wanted to eat, so what birthday boy wants birthday boy gets.  

i shared the fish taco & steak taco. I liked the steak taco and i thought the taste of the fish taco was off.  it was definitely not worth the price we paid for (i think $12?) the sashimi bowl looked DELICIOUS!!! and huge. i didn't bother trying it tho. probably would not come back.
author: Natalia H.

description:
I feel like I'm being generous with my rating, but given our situation, coming in at almost closing time, I can be a bit more understanding of them running out of ingredients to make a sandwich; it was the case of missing bread in the Marina.  I had to switch my order, and they were good about substituting items for me, such as tofu for fish, but I have a feeling they'd be willing to substitute items on the menu whether or not they ran out of anything.   There are a few veggie options.

The food is tasty; the portions are small for what you pay for.  Granted, they have carved themselves a niche in the Marina with their Hawaiian-Asian cuisine.  So, although I don't see myself making a return trip any time soon, they do seem to have a loyal following.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
Mmm, tuna poke bowl and fish tacos in the Marina. Not bad. 

I will have to come here again and try other foods of the sea.
author: Kay N.

description:
Gotta love this place.  

The menu is pretty solid and covers the major Cali/Mex seafood favs.  I usually stick with their fish or chicken tacos with sweet potato fries.  After several attempts to find equal caliber sweet potato fries at other restaurants (and tried making them at home), I failed.  You must order these puppies.  Even if you aren't a fan of fries (what's the matter with you?), these are excellent.

Super busy at all times, but obviously well worth the wait.  The staff has always been cool, despite the chaos, too.  Come with some patience and expect to hang out for a few minutes outside before getting your name on the list, but once you are on the list you're good. They'll track you down when your table is ready.
author: Brett L.

description:
Casual and friendly service. The place is small and cozy. You have to fight for a table, but it's definitely worth it. The fish is fresh.

Come early before the lunch rush, or wait until the lunch rush is over. Dont even think about getting a seat if you come at 12:00 sharp. 

I love the Poke Rice Bowl. The fries are great, eat them with the citrus aioli.
author: benjamin c.

description:
Healthy fast food (if you dont have to wait to forever for a seat).
The place is small and cramped which sort of sucks, but my salad was tasty, the fish was fresh and the service was friendly.  Prices are ok for the quality of food you get.  I think I will be ordering lunch to go from here regularly.
author: Nilu r.

description: Pacific Catch is my favorite place ever for semi fast food style meals. Super fresh and yummy. Not to mention best sweet potato fries anywhere. My go-to is the ahi tuna bowl but the sandwiches, salads and fish tacos are also really good.
author: Lindsay B.

description:
Not much left to be desired here.  Great food, great menu, great service, great prices.  Been here so many times and never been disappointed.

Always a treat and my go-to when in the hood
author: Sun Y.

description:
My present favorite healthy fast food place.  My dirty secret, which I probably shouldn't share on Yelp, is that I've never quite outgrown my kindergartener's dislike of fish.  However, as I've gotten older, my palate has shifted to more grown-ups tastes, and so now while I still tend to eschew cooked fish, I LOVE me some raw fish, particularly ahi.  Not only that, but every time I eat ahi, I feel like I'm on the Perricone diet and s&^t, and maybe I should just eat only blueberries and ahi all the time, and, like, I'm going to wake up the next morning and look 10 years younger while a portrait of me grows older in the garage.  But I digress.  

Not only does Pacific Catch have some fantastic ahi at fantastic prices, they have my other semi-healthy favorite, sweet potato fries.  And man, those sweet potato fries are good...crusty and tasty and mmmmmm.  Honestly, everything on the menu looks mouth-watering, including shrimp and mango tacos, a grilled artichoke appetizer, and the less healthy alternative of fries and any fried article of seafood you can imagine.  Oh, and the creamy wasabi dressing that comes with some of the salads is to die for.

The space is small and there can be a wait, so impatient bastards like me may want to stick with take-out.  However, the staff alone at Pacific Catch is worth five stars.  Just an extremely cool, low-key group of people that manage to keep it real and keep things moving, but without hustling you out the door.  I think any business owner would be extremely fortunate to have such an outstanding and hardworking staff.

My only real criticism would be the way that the ahi is cubed...the edges can be a bit ragged, and the pieces a little large and hard to chew due to the slight marbling.  Of course, this could also be due to my tendency to eat like a seagull, which is to say, light on the chewing and high on the gulping.

I look forward to sampling all the tasty (and extremely affordable) treats at Pacific Catch in the future.
author: Tanya N.

description:
I've been to this one and the one on 9th and Lincoln... granted I know I'll get seated much quicker at 9th and Lincoln.. but for some reason.. I like the feel from the small "whole in the wall" from the chestnut location... anyhoo- my favorite is by far the hawaiian poke wasabi bowl with a side of sweet potato fries. you don't need ANYTHING ELSE... :) I've tried the seared ahi one.. and It just doesn't have any flavor... the Hawaiian poke (raw tuna marinaded in soy and sesame and onions) is much more flavorful. 

Tried the salmon "fish and chips"-- didn't like it.
author: Kristina L.

description:
I need to bump this review up to a 5!!!

Came here yesterday with my Mom. I had been wanting to share this place with someone after my husband and I had a fantastic meal here last month.

Fantastic service and the food is still amazing. We got here about 4pm yesterday so it wasn't very crowded. We hadn't eaten all day so we were starving. We placed our order and waited....and waited...and waited.

I thought it was strange since the last time we were here all of our food came out within 10 minutes. After about 20 or so minutes, I got concerned. My Mom could see the kitchen from her seat and said "I think they forgot our order". I told her that it was impossible...it was pretty quiet at that time. Low and behold a nice gentleman (not sure if he is the manager or not) came up and apologized but that our food was just now getting started but that he would like to buy our lunch for us. Then our waitress right behind him said that she was really sorry, it was her fault that our order did not go in. 

I REALLY appreciated their honesty and appreciated even more the free meal. These guys really know what customer service is about and I will be coming back over and over again! The food once again was fantastic and my Mom loved it too! Yeah!
author: Monica L.

description:
Now, it is refreshing to know that stumbling on a good place with superior food can happen from time to time even to such gourmet-food-whereabouts ignorant like myself...  who forgot to seek an advice of locals before venturing into the area...

I thought my mouth would melt with a sensory spectrum of pleasure ... the salmon was swimming in what appeared a bit unappetizing looking green sauce of sorts, bringing all the wrong associations ... but which tasted so delicious I may be going back just for that ...

well one star goes off - for the service ... and judging by some other reviews ... I may consider myself lucky ...?
author: Rob R.

description:
I tried this place for the first time today for lunch and it was great! The baja tacos were spectacular and the calamari was oh so yummy (wish the portion was bigger). 

The waiter was very friendly too. 

Can't wait to go back!

A couple weeks later - I went again and it was just as good!! The cabo tacos are absolutely delicious!
author: Marla Y.

description: We had the ceviche, tortilla soup, a chicken bowl with brown rice and this taco thing that had a slice of jicama for the taco shell. OMG to die for .... This had to be the best place we ate. Can not say enough good about this place... Great food great service.... Just a great place to eat. This is the first place we ate and it set the standard and didn't get beat! We had clam chowder and corn and crab bisque at Boudin and it was good but not as good.
author: Desiree L.

description:
Dining here can go either way. Been once before and had a neutral experience. This time around, our server was a little flighty. He brought us our appetizer plates way before it was served and disappeared for longer than he should have, which left my dad a little pissy. I peeped him consistently serving a group outside that was seated after us- pouring wine, following up, possibly because they would have "tipped better" but who knows, maybe I'm just assuming.

The Food. This time I came with my parents, who aren't very daring when it comes to raw fish so I didn't order the poke I was eying and played it safe with the calamari for appetizer, which was okay. For our entrees, my parents got the Teriyaki bowl and I got trout + sweet potato fries. My parent's food was pretty good. Mine was okay, but tasted great when I ate my leftovers the next day, which I thought was cool because leftovers can be fun too.

Because of the wishy washy service we experienced in the beginning of our meal I would have given a lower rating but towards the end of our meal the head chef/manager came out to our section and asked us how we were doing. We were pondering dessert and he suggested the dulce de leche spring rolls, and later he personally delivered them to our table.

He called them "deep fried love," and I must say, no other way to describe them. Talking big for the power of this dessert, but it TOTALLY redeemed our meal, so thanks for that. *pic of the dessert uploaded to my profile photos*

I'm hoping the next time I eat here I'm swayed to feel more strongly about it.
author: Geralyn Y.

description:
Mmmmmm yummy! This place is so tasty. Their seafood is such high quality. I've had a lot of fried oysters in my life, and none as fresh and taste as good as Pacific Catch's. They're small but def fresh, good oysters. Their fried fish tacos are soo tasty as well, with a really good sauce over it.

I love their rice bowls. I usually get the poke, which is fresh tuna sashimi tossed in a dressing. Their rice bowls are great because its rice with a little soy sauce topped with all sorts of goodies: cucumbers, seaweed salad, avocado, and something of your choice (such as the poke, grilled fish, teriyaki style stuff, etc.). You can also choose between brown and white rice.

For the sides, I really like the spicy fries and their grilled corn. The fries are good with their tartar jalapeno sauce and their grilled corn has this good butter on it; I'm not sure what's in the butter but it's good.

My only complaint is like many others: this place is small and hard to get a spot to eat.
author: Christine L.

description:
this place has such delicious, FRESH food!

I usually get the fish tacos, but have tried numerous other menu items and have never been disappointed. The ingredients are always fresh and the meal always filling and flavorful.

The staff here are super friendly as well, and very attentive (on my first visit there I fell in love with their avocado salsa, and the waitress kept refilling my ramekin whenever she noticed it was empty... then on my second visit 2 weeks later, she brought an extra side with my order without me even having to ask her!)

their sauces and salsas are extremely creative, and all delicious. I advise trying more than one!
author: Sam S.

description:
I crave the poke wasabi bowl if I haven't had it in a while. It's a mix of many of my favorite things, all over one big bowl of rice: poke marinated ahi tuna, seaweed salad, avocado, cucumber, and ginger. Yum! 

It's really is a big bowl, so when I go with a girlfriend, we'll usually ask them to split it for us into two smaller bowls (at no extra charge). We'll then get a basket of sweet potato fries, and possibly the artichoke also. Other dishes are good too, but I haven't been able to find anything like the ahi poke bowl anywhere else. Be warned that there's almost always a wait, even at odd times like 4pm!
author: jenn h.

description:
I will never pass up an opportunity to go to Pacific Catch. I don't care if I have to stand and wait over an hour for seats to open up (and trust me, it's been done before--many times). Very cozy (read: small). Not recommended for large groups, but just perfect for you & a special someone.

I've yet to try anything on the menu that I don't like. By default, I usually go for the ahi tuna salad or the poke bowl, but the sandwiches are great too. The portions are huge--esp for the salads and rice bowls. I rarely finish it all up because it's just too much food (in a very good way). Ate up nearly every last leaf in my salad today though because I was starving. Now I'm sure I won't be needing my afternoon snack. 

All 3 of my servers were very nice today. I appreciated them coming over to check on me even though the place was packed with people who needed their undivided attention. One complaint is that no one refilled up our waters or sodas. At $2.50/soda, I'd hope I get at least one refill. Easily fixable and perhaps I could've been a bit more proactive about waving someone down. 

5 stars for consistent goodness and a satisfied tummy.
author: Rona J.

description: Goddamn Marina P.C. .... you're so pretty and I want to hate you, but you just smell and taste so good!  I really wish I could stay away, but you make me feel so nice when I'm with you. Even with your diva attitude hanging all over the outside patio, it was so worth it to come here after that 1st bite.
author: Mark B.

description:
YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMYYYYYYYYYYYYY
One of my absolute FAV take out spot!s Pacific Catch isn't always quick thats why I get it to go. The best is their Ahi Tuna Rice bowls. The bowl is the best because its refreshing but also filling. AMAZING. ORGASMIC. I don't even know..... I'm giving myself a craving just writing this review.  They always give me TONS of ginger though soo a little less ginger and a lot more nori....mmmmmmmmmmmm
author: Sarah S.

description:
I went to Pacific Catch last night. Yes, the place is small. Yes, the wait is long (about 20 - 30 minutes on a Monday around 9pm). Yes, parking is a bitch. Staff is friendly and fast. Prices are very affordable. 

My partner and I had the shrimp ceviche and it was very good. I ordered a taco platter: 1 pineapple shrimp, 1 bbq salmon and 1 spicy mahi mahi and a small salad with miso dressing. I loved the pineapple shrimp and the bbq salmon, but I was not impressed by the spicy mahi mahi, not enough flavor (no fireworks!) the salad was pretty yummy too. My partner ordered the mahi mahi sandwich with a side of sweet potato fries, we loved it! 

Not a good place for a first date or a celebration, more for a Sunday night or during the week low key dinner.
author: Anabelle B.

description:
It's a toss up between Pacific Catch and the Plant for my favorite Chestnut Street establishment.  For fresh and flavorful seafood, I default directly to Pacific Catch.  It's small inside, but if you live in the neighborhood it makes super easy take out.  Or go at lunch.  You'll probably have better luck finding a table.

I had a very interesting halibut ceviche with strawberries here over the summer.  My recent favorite is the chipotle mahi mahi salad.  WOW.  It's my favorite "detox" lunch!  The bbq salmon sandwich is also not to be missed.  And the fish tacos?  Also amazing.  As you can see, it's pretty difficult to go wrong here.  The staff is friendly and fast... this place operates like a well-oiled machine.  You can always expect the best - every time!
author: Lindsay M.

description:
It's seriously taken so long to get to this place because it's always so packed. SCREW YOU iPhone for featuring this joint on a commercial thereby jamming its doorways. I've got to say I wished I made it here earlier. Why? Dude! The mouth-watering, fresh, juicy, succulent fish of course!

I had the Wasabi Rice Bowl with Ahi Poke. The bowl comes with wakame salad, sliced avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, pickled ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori, and a soy-wasabi sauce served over a choice of sushi rice or brown rice. I've got to say it was sizable quality eats, fresh tasting fish, and all for only $11.95. 

My buddy had the Chipotle Mahi Mahi Salad. The salad came with grilled mahi mahi with a spicy BBQ glaze, corn salsa, baby tomatoes, red onions, lime crema, tomatillo-avocado dressing & tortilla strips. And all that for $10.95!

My Ahi Poke bowl was fresh and flavorful from the tuna to the avacado. And I damn near had a foodgasm when I ripped off a piece of my buddy's mahi mahi. Finally I find a place that serves up some fresh seafood at reasonable prices. Damn you iPhone for delaying me on getting in this joint.
author: Al L.

description:
In the past, I've been deterred from coming to Pacific Catch because from the outside, it looks like they have very little seating in there.  So, I've opted to eat at one of the other restaurants next door.

Well, today my friend Vard convinced us to try this place out because EastSide West wasnt offering a full menu.  Thank you Vard, because our meal here was quite impressive.  I'll definitely be coming back.  And, they have more seating than I suspected. 

We had the special- spice rubbed white fish (forget the name...Opo? Opa?), and for being a light and healthy dish it was really tasty.  The veggies that came on the side were surprisingly flavorful, and they substituted brown rice for sweet potato fries.  I bet those fries are f'ing good though.  We also split the California Crab and Avocado Salad, which basically tasted like a california roll in a salad.  All in all, lots of healthy options but not typically bland and flavorless like one might expect.  There were also numerous other items on the menu that looked appealing to me, and all at pretty reasonable prices.  Also, after telling our waiter that we were going to spit the two dishes, he separated them for us.  I appreciated that.

Our waiter was really friendly and helpful, but not overbearing.  My only gripe is that it was really cold in there.  I'll be back.
author: Genevieve M.

description:
After a few pre-dinner drinks in the marina we were getting hungry, and rather than spend money we could use to buy booze later in the evening, we opted for this tiny place.  The seating is tight, enough that ten of us had to be split into a table of four and a a table of six, i think we had all the table seating at that point.  everyone else was sitting at the bar facing the kitchen that runs to the back of the restaurant.  by the time i sat down, people were already snacking on 

Warm Edamame $3.50
With coarse sea salt

which i have to say, is the best way to have edamame, with huge chunks of salt that melt beutifully in your mouth.  this was followed by

Hawaiian Poke $7.95
Cubes of sushi-grade ahi tuna mixed with red onions, sesame-soy
marinade & spicy island seasoning, served with house---made wonton crisps for scooping

Don't be afraid to get your fingers a little oily as you dive tongue first into this huge bowl of fish.  great quality and size for the price.

following that for dinner...

Ahi Tuna (Sushi-grade), Grilled Rare  Wasabi Bowl $10.95
It comes topped with wakame salad, sliced avocado, daikon sprouts,
cucumber, pickled ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori & soy-wasabi sauce served over a heaping bowl of seasoned sushi rice.  the amount of ginger could have accompanied an order of sushi for 15 people, but luckily it was all bunched together, not mixed in to the bowl.  the ahi was tasty, still pink in the middle and seared reasonably well.  a good amount of food for the price, and the quality was there to back it up.

I was also able to taste small portions of 

Grilled Mahi Mahi Teriyaki Bowl $10.95
Served with asparagus, glazed shiitake mushrooms, pineapple salsa, grilled bok choy, sesame seeds & house-made sake-teriyaki sauce served over seasoned sushi rice.  the fish so nice they named it twice was a bit overcooked i believe, but the veggies and sauce with the dish were quite palatable.

What I liked better than that, and almost as good as my wasabi bowl was

Thai Coconut Shrimp $10.95
Skewered shrimp, dipped in coconut milk batter, coconut flakes &
5-spice, with sweet potato fries.  Yummy shrimp and my hand got smacked away a few times for stealing too many fries.  so tasty!

There is only one bathroom in the back of the restaurant and beware staff suddenly coming out a door from the upstairs.

Overall, good food, great price for the marina, if i ever for some reason find myself stuck drinking back in the marina again, you can be sure i'll be feasting at Pacific Catch before i go dance on the tables at the matrix or throw up on my best friend at the bus stop.
author: shawn g.

description:
I love it here so much that I make it a point to take as many of my friends here as possible so that they may all experience the wonderful-ness of Pacific Catch.

Just GO! It's delicious.

Get a hot sandwich. Oh and the Thai iced tea is BOTTOMLESS aka refillable!
author: Diana Lyn Z.

description:
This place is great!!!  Food is always fresh and delicious and my favorite is the salmon sandwich with avocado and a side of yam fries!  I also like that it is an open kitchen and you can see what's going on and how your food is being prepared.  No dirty little secrets here!

The location is quite small and cramped, but once you get seated, you are good to go.
author: Whitney Q.

description:
Mahi-Mahi Teriyaki rice bowl, check. Sweet potato fries, check.

The fish Tacos are for next time, and are equally as satisfying. 

The ahi tuna wasabi bowl can be best described as a deconstructed sushi roll. Good, but it doesn't beat the Mahi-Mahi.

The place is small, but its part of the charm. I prefer to sit at the tables rather then the counter. Something about watching seafood fry doesn't seem very appealing.
author: Trina H.

description:
Edit: I decided to change this to five stars. Now that I've been in 10 plus times and have yet to leave feeling anything but completely satisfied, I think they deserve five stars. Plus they have (or had) this nice promotion going on where you can buy up to $100 in gift cards and get a free $20 added to it. 

Yum. I've walked by it a million times and finally stopped in yesterday for a quick lunch. I had the two taco platter (one regular baja fish taco, one spicy grilled shrimp taco) and a small side salad. GOOD. Friend has had tacos here several times, so went with a salad with a (large) piece of salmon on top. Delicious as well. The miso dressing they make in house is amazing. We didn't order any, but the sweet potato fries looked and smelled amazing. Maybe next time.

Inside space is pretty tight and not the most comfortable, especially when you hit the lunch or dinner time crowd. I would suggest sitting at the bar - more comfortable than having everyone waiting for a table staring at you while you eat. PC is definitely on my short list for take-out though.
author: Beth M.

description:
I am a simple man with simple tastes.
For the most part I do not go to seafood places because that is one of the few things that I am good at cooking but I was on Chestnut and as I stated before I am trying to eat better (no cupcake pizza sandwichesmixed with cheese fries).
So I am looking for chicken or fish on a bed of vegetables. Their salmon salad was perfect. 
Friendly service.
author: Marcus R.

description: Awesome fish, wasabi rice bowl, tacos, fish and chips and their salads are all delicious.  Service is always super nice and their cocktails are tasty as well.  Have come here several times and the food is always excellent.  This location is super tiny with only a few tables and a bar but their sister restaurant on 9th is much bigger if you have a larger party or don't want to wait.
author: Smigor r.

description:
My first experience with sweet potato fries  in SF was at Pacific Catch..
They make them spicy too, which I love..
I also had the Ahi Poke bowl with brown rice and Fish Tacos..
Those are delicious!!
As for seating, the inside of the restaurant is pretty small. Make sure to come during non peak hours for a guarantee table, otherwise order it To Go because they get pack real quick.
author: Niki N.

description:
Simple, casual seafood in the Marina.  

Each table comes set up with chopsticks, forks, knives and napkins, as well as condiments.  The theme is seafood, which comes to you via tacos, appetizers, fish and chips,  fried fish, rice bowls, salads, hot and cold sandwiches, and sides.  Also offers fresh grilled sides and deserts.  

This is not a formal place, you sit down, order, and your order comes out in a few minutes.  Service is always good and I've never had anything here that I didn't like.  

My favorite: the Hawaiian Poke: ahi tuna cubes with onions, sesame soy marinade, spicy island dressing, and fried won ton crisps.  YUMMY.  Also love the fish and chips offering of Tokyo Salmon which is like fish and chips with fried salmon, and sweet potato fries as the chips served with 3 really good dipping sauces.  Another favorite dish is any of the tacos.  Not authentic by any means, but good nevertheless.  

Casual dining, not too expensive, good service and great food.  Really there is nothing to complain about.
author: Denise B.

description:
5 stars for the Ahi Tuna Wasabi Bowl! I always make a point to fast before I eat here, because there is so much food packed in that rice bowl. And oddly, the sweet potato fries are a perfect side. 

Not a fan of their service though. The servers always seem to be in a bad mood until they give you your check.  

And I just learned today that Pacific Catch is actually part of Chevy's. Yes, the happy-happy-birthday Mexican restaurant with the crack-addicting chips and salsa. Does that make Pacific Catch any less appealing than before? Nope.
author: Karen L.

description:
I've been to both Pacific Catches.  This is the first one I went to and I recall it being very delicious.  I had the fish tacos.  YUM!  And at that time I didn't really like the sweet potato fries.  I now am in love with them.

It's a tiny-ass place though, so if you are thinking of going for dinner think early-bird special, even if you aren't of that age.
author: Susan C.

description:
Ahi Poke, sweet potato fries, grilled artichoke.  AWESOME!  Oh so dericious.  And at a great price.  It's one of my standards for comparing price for quality food and happiness.  Of course, nothing compares to In-N-Out Burger on that scale.

It's usually crowded.  Don't bring a group, just bring a friend.  Have great food and watch the Marina folk pass by.
author: Rob R.

description:
I'm reserving the right to upgrade this to a 4-star later, but for now it sits at the humble 3-star. After quite some tribulations I ended up here to eat alone. This place is a mix of sea-food styles, mostly japanese, traditional (fish & chips), and mexican. They serve fish almost exclusively, but you have your choice of styles. You can get your fish sashimi or sushi style, or you can get fish & chips, or fish tacos, and more!
Check out their website, for their menu online.

Anyway I had the fish & chips, which were pretty good. The batter is light and the fish is fried relatively lightly so that they are still "soft". In my experience fish & chips is usually fried until the batter is stiff and you sorta have a plank of fish. At Pacific Catch its still soft and requires more effort to hold.
The most interesting thing was the choice of fries (normal, sweet potato, or something else that i forgot :(. Sweet Potato fries are AWESOME!
Beyond the fish and the fries there was some jalapeno tartar sauce which wasnt as good as regular tartar sauce to me (but I like tartar sauce, and most people dont really). The other dipping sauce was some syruppy semi sugary stuff that was a nice alternative, but I would ahve preferred malted vinegar. Finally there was a small dish of some cole slaw, that wasnt bad but nothing special.

All in all, based on my fish & chips, i'd give this place a passing grade. worth going to, but nothing to go out of your way for. They get points for having interesting styles and combinations, but with some things you just cant do as well as the original. Traditional style fish & chips beats this any day.
author: Josh S.

description:
It is with great sadness that I grant a single star to this former favorite.  I must say we'll never go back.  We'll miss the food, but not the attitude.

My wife and our 6 year-old daughter and I were in need of lunch recently.  Of course, this popular Marina hot spot was packed, as usual.  We spent several crowded moments being elbowed by passing patrons and staff alike - less stressful for my wife and me than our young daughter - but the host or hostess never came to get our names.  They passed by several times, scowling at us for being in the way, it seemed, though we were following the same procedure we always follow when dining at this former favorite.

As we stood, waiting, I pointed out three non-adjacent seats at the counter.  We moved towards them and asked a nice couple if they would mind sliding over one seat so we could all sit together.  We sat down and everything was great - a smiling staff member behind the counter (thank God for her!) got us menus and asked if we'd like a drink.

But just about then an unidentified staff member with attitude brusquely informed us we'd violated company policy by asking another customer to move, and that we were, essentially, very bad, rude and clueless people.  The latter conferred via attitude, not words, of course.

We apologized, assuring the staff member that the other couple was fine, a statement they quickly corroborated.  We apologized once more and promised never to break this new rule ever again.  

A few minutes later we were approached by another unidentified staff member, who had clearly attended the same charm school.  In no uncertain terms we were informed that our seats were needed for people on the waiting list.  You must understand that, during prior visits, we had taken seats at the counter without putting our names on the list, and had no way of knowing the policy had changed.

We left feeling saddened by the loss of an old favorite, but instantly agreeing we'd never go back.  Never was there a smile.  Never was there an apology.  In every case, the communication insinuated we were ill-mannered buffoons to assume we could take the action we did.  Huh, I thought we were just a family trying to get some lunch.  That's how we felt at Chez Maman, when we went there instead.  See my review for Chez Maman on Union Street.
author: Dave C.

description: Loved it! My husband and I had the baja taco, the shrimp taco, the spicy fries, and one of the rice bowls.  Everything was really good.  The service was friendly and timely.  The fountain diet coke was really good and only $2 with refills (which is cheap and hard to find in SF).  We will eat here again!
author: Christy L.

description: Love this place.  The Asian bowl with poke is my go to.  It is packed with tasty raw fish and is at a very reasonable price.
author: Yana K.

description:
update 8-16-06

I have been meaning to give Pacific Catch another try ... once I stop working long days and manage to get there.  After my first review the manager contacted me and informed me that he spoke with his staff about the importance of customer service.  I really appreciated that he took the time to contact me and that he valued my experience.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I work in the Marina and am always on the lookout for great lunch spots.  Pacific Catch is a bit of a trek from my work but I decided to try it since a good friend raved about the food.

I'll admit the food is pretty good ... I had the mahi mahi taco platter ... but the service is ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE.  

I walked in and no one greeted me.  I waited several minutes for someone to seat me (2 waitresses looked up and saw me) but it was like I was invisible.  I finally asked the girl behind the counter if I should seat myself.  She gave me a confused look and long-winded answer, and in the meantime, a handful of people walked in and took all the available seats.  Then another girl behind the counter turned around and looked at all the tables and blurted out, "There aren't any seats, you'll have to wait."  She didn't offer to take down my name or even speak politely.  So ... I said I'd place the order to go.  

My food was ready in about 5 minutes, yet I sat and watched it sit on the counter for 10 minutes.  The 2 waitresses were busy talking to each other and counting how much money they'd made for the day.  I watched them look up at the food on the counter several times and 1 even glanced at me a number of times to see if I was looking, but neither of them made a move to bag and hand me the food.  

They finally finished counting the money ... 1 waitress went to take a table's order ... the other ... without washing her hands first ... poured my iced tea and touched all over the tip of the straw, stuck the straw in the drink, then handed it to me.  I thought at any moment she'd hand me my food and I'd be on my way, and I'd toss the straw on my way out ... but she went to the back of the restaurant and never came back.  

I waited another 5 or so minutes and still no one paid any attention to my food getting cold on the counter.  

I asked one of the other waiters to check on it and he said he would but ... the waitress overheard and asked me what I had ordered.  (*I must point out that I was the only person who had placed a to-go order the entire time I was there, and, I was the only person not sitting at a table, waiting for food).  

The food on the counter was indeed mine and the waitress started to bag it.  I let her know that I'd been watching it sit there for over 15 minutes and instead of apologizing she proceeded to argue with me and tell me I was wrong.  

The mahi mahi tasted good but the tacos were barely warm.  The fries were soggy and cold, and my tea was watered down.

I certainly won't be going back or recommending such treatment to any of my friends or coworkers.
author: Miss Purr fec t.

description:
This place is a really great place to grab a healthy, delicious, filling meal without breaking your wallet (or your scale)!

Their ahi tuna tastes really fresh and is cooked perfectly (almost raw, just seared lightly on outside). I would recommend the Ahi Tuna Bowl (rice, seaweed salad, avocadoes, cucumbers and soy-wasabi sauce), or the Ahi Tuna Salad (similar but just salad--no rice).

The sweet potato fries were pretty yummy and come with both a sweet and sour thai sauce and a creamy ranch style sauce.

Miso soup is house made! Not your usual MSG-tasting powder soup, and is pretty good. 

It's a very casual place and pretty small (appears to be about 5 or less small tables).  Parking in the Marina sucks ass and the metered parking is like 2$/hr, but hey all good things come with a price!
author: amy k.

description: Came here on a soggy day in the city and was surprised by how delish the food here was! Everything was just spectacular! The place is a very causal and tasty dining spot. There was nothing on the menu that didn't sound delicious!!!!
author: Lisa R.

description: this location is smaller than the others but probably my favorite (original location i think).  the menu is a little smaller, but they have all the staples.  poke is great but the shrimp ceviche is the one to get.  i always get a rice bowl, but everything is great.  i love that they have brown rice and they really do cook it right.  fish tacos and sandwiches are great here too.  fish is always cooked perfectly.  one of my favorite sf restaurants.
author: Robert K.

description:
P-Catch is a great, somewhat healthy choice if you are live in the Marina.  Their ahi tuna salad ans ahi tuna bowl are both pretty filling and tasty.  

I HEART sweet potato fries, and they have some AWESOME ones here...with great sauces...ahhh..sauces...who doesn't love sauces?

Its cramped and you're better off ordering to go if you're just plain hungry and not looking to socialize with the typical popped-collar on my Abercrombie polo shirt -Marina crowd.
author: Annie C.

description:
One of my favorite casual dining joints in the city!  Been there since it first opened years ago and so I definitely have a soft spot for it no matter what. When I think of SF, Pacific Catch is one of the first things that come to mind - not sure why. 

It's become more of a take-out place for me than dining these days since I moved away from the area. Ahi Poke Wasabi Bowl, Hawaiian Poke and Spicy Fries are my favorites (although it seems the tuna chunks get bigger and bigger and sauce stronger and stronger, which makes me wonder - is this really top grade sushi?)

Limited parking and seating are what will likely get people. And with the new Apple Store on Chestnut, I don't think parking will get any better.
author: buggy b.

description:
I'd never heard of poke before. I don't even know how to pronounce it (poke? pokey? pokay?). But damn it's tasty. Raw tuna and onions marinated in some kind of soy-ginger sauce. The ahi poke wasabi bowl is delicious and huge - I've never been able to finish the whole thing. Rice, wasabi sauce, avocado, cucumbers, seaweed, ginger, and of course, the poke. 

The tuna sandwich is a solid option for a smaller meal, although I usually succumb to also getting the sweet potato fries, which pretty much kills the "smaller meal" idea. 

The staff is super friendly, and they even pronounce my name correctly (usually) when I get takeout.
author: Ranjit S.

description:
Been to Pacific Catch twice, once in the Marina one and the other over on 9th & Lincoln..both times have been great experiences.  The food prices are affordable, the service is friendly, and the tuna poke is delicious! The portions generous as well! 

The Marina one is, shall we say, cozy. and the wait will be long unless you happen to get lucky..but it's well worth it.  The sauces that are served with the dishes have a very distinct flavor and definitely start a party in your mouth.  The sweet potato fries are soooo yummy and you don't feel guilty eating them!  I had the salmon before and it came very fresh and tender.  you can't go wrong with any of the wasabi rice bowls. oh yummers. 

this is a definite place to keep on going back to!
author: Lulu C.

description:
Pacific Catch is awesome.  I ate there twice in a row this week.  I had the baja tacos one night and the ahi sandwich the next.  Both were wonderful.  

The place is super casual and inviting, if rather shoved during peak hours.  There isn't much seating, so get ready to cosy up to your neighbors.  You also may have to wait.  But the wait is well worth it.  Great quality fish, great everything.
author: Paul L.

description:
4.5 to 5 stars 

I wish we had one of these back East. I walked by the Sunset branch but ate at the Chestnut one, which tends to be a lot cozier--very small--than their sister restaurant. I came in on a weekday afternoon and had a wonderful lunch. I ordered the ahi tuna salad with a few modifications. It was absolutely delicious and the tuna was seared perfectly and portions were very generous. I couldn't believe that my salad was less than $13 and service was very good. It's a tiny place with bar stools and a few tables but don't let that deter you from eating here. This was one of the best meals I had in SF. 4.5 stars
author: Juju J.

description:
Wanted to find a good local place with fresh seafood at reasonable prices. Yelpers, you have come through with flying colors once again! After all, SF is where it all began, right?! Food roundup:

- Tacos: Got traditional baja which is fried fish. Really crispy and tasty. The other taco was mahi mahi, cooked perfectly. They came with an option for sweet potato fries which are not greasy and perfectly salted. Although the sauces are probably for the fries, they also really enhance the tacos. You get a sweet chili and wasabi ranchish sauce.
- Ahi Tuna wasabi bowl: I would definitely come back (from Southern Cali) for this! Huge bowl of sushi rice topped with cucumbers, seaweed salad, pea shoots, avocado, and seared ahi. The soy wasabi sauce brings everything all together, yummy goodness! Kind of reminds of the tuna don at Fukada in Irvine. You get full without a really heavy feeling.

Lowdown: Great local place, combine a fancy japanese seafood joint with Wahoo's and you've got Pacific Catch. Place is small so come during off peak times or be prepared to wait. The wasabi bowls are a must order, they deserve the raves as they are allll that.
author: Jackie P.

description:
Have been here twice - and both times, have left knowing that I would have to come back.  I highly recommend the raw Ahi Tuna wasabi bowl and the sweet potato fries!  mmm SO DELICIOUS!  
The place is rather small with only a few tables, so it is definitely not good for big groups.  You may have to wait, but the service is fast so it shouldn't be too long to get a table.  Had a great time and will be back!
author: Karen T.

description: Solid 4 star establishment.  I've been here a couple of times for lunch and the food was always fresh, the service was nice, and the food was enjoyable. : )
author: K. R.

description:
Sweet potato fries....a must. There have been several times when a basket of these are my dinner because they are so good!

I'm also addicted to the Crab wasabi bowl and have recruited several addicts to the club. Try the salmon or crab wasabi bowl, the fish tacos and of course, the sweet potato fries.

And the people are super friendly and accomodating, especially considering it's a very small space that always has people waiting for a table or to-go order.
author: Nisha A.

description: This place was an unexpected choice for dinner. My friend got a 50% coupon from scout mob and wanted to try it out. We ordered and shared the ahi wasabi sandwich, the poki appetizer, and saucy roll. The food was not greasy and very tasty. Overall, I would pay FULL price for what we had and that's RARE for a restaurant that needs discounting.  I would come again.
author: Kelly C.

description:
The idea of this place is more facisnating than the actual execution. Korean bbq steak was ok. Although the steak was good, the kimchi and salad were disguisting.

Teriyaki steak bowl. It sounded good: artichokes, pinapple salsa, bok choy. But it ended up tasting like a glorified teriyaki bowl from Yoshinoya. WAY too much teriyaki sauce.

Good try Pacific Catch, but no success.
author: Jones T.

description: This place is tinnnnnyyyyy!!!  Only like, 7 tables max in the whole place. That being said, the staff are all very efficient and turnover is quite fast.  I came here with family and we all enjoyed our meals.  They had the salmon bowls and the fish burger, I had the ahi poke salad which was delicious!  Lots of tasty marinated ahi in there, and it all was very fresh.
author: Alison S.

description:
Got a note from the Manager after my last review, they said they would take care of the problem & provided me with another location...very cool of them.

Went back, didn't see any buggies...and the food was yummy...as usual.
author: Christine W.

description:
I was looking for a reasonable and casual seafood place and this place served the bill. Dinner was tasty and larger portions.
It is really small (I mean a really small) but we were seated within a reasonable time (frankly we waited a fairly short time). If quiet ambiance is what you are looking for and lots of elbow room, this wouldn't be your place. 
With that being said, it is a quaint cozy loud-fun cafe style atmosphere.
Would eat here again~
author: Gabrielle D.

description:
So I went to try this place on a visit to the San Francisco area, and as other people on yelp have said, the food is really great! We started off with the ceviche, which wasn't the best I've ever had, but was worth the money (7.50). For our entrees, my boyfriend ordered the fish and chips and I ordered the ahi poke wasabi bowl. 

Fish and chips - delicious! Cooked perfectly, tasted fresh, lightly battered, and the sauces it came with were delicious (i believe a tartar and a sweet and sour?). Oh! And the order comes with their sweet potato fries, which are definitely pretty awesome. You can get different portions at different prices; we got four pieces altogether and the price was 12.95. 

Poke bowl - also very good! It was a little more than I could finish, so I felt the portions were fairly generous. The poke was set on a bed of rice with what tasted like a wasabi soy sauce? Seaweed salad, avocado slices, some shredded lettuce, and seaweed accompany the fish. You might want to mix up the rice as some of it is just drenched in the sauce while the rest is just plain. Price was decent, 12.95 also. 

The only reason I gave four stars instead of five was the service. We were there on new years day, so of course I felt bad for the servers who had to work the holiday. However, our server didn't check on us once, throughout the entire meal. Most of the time, he was lounging around a couple feet in front of us at the cash register. He didn't bring the drinks or the food to our table, never asked how anything tasted, and after I stacked up our dishes, we still had to ask him for the check even though, again, he was standing right in front of us. I'm not saying ALL service there is bad, as the other servers there (who dropped off our food and drinks) seemed fairly pleasant and nice. 

so. four stars it is. decent atmosphere, GREAT food, ehh on service. 

ps: it is a very VERY tight squeeze, so if you have more than four people, good luck getting in!
author: Christine L.

description:
This is a great restaurant...probably one out of the maybe two restaurants I would consider schlepping it to the marina for (the other would be the Pita Pit, woot woot!) 

I was on a fish taco rampage a few months ago, and Pacific Catch was one of the places I hit up. Their fish tacos were tasty, but aside from that, they just had such a great-looking menu...I mean, I had gone there purposefully for fish tacos, but I had to keep myself from ordering all this other stuff! We got a free bowl of edamame, too, because our server made a mistake. Heehee. 

It was very crowded and cramped in there, was the only problem. When we got seated, our table was so close to the next table that I seriously thought that I might stick my ass in the other people's face when I sat down. Once I was seated, it was all good. 

They also do take out, and I saw a lot of folks picking up to-go orders. That might be the best choice with a place like this, if you actually live in or near the marina. Anyhow, I love fish and seafood, and latino-asian-fusion-y kinda stuff, of and if you do too, you'll love Pacific Catch!
author: Shannon R.

description:
Ok, this restaurant (literally a hole in the wall) is the reason I moved to San Francisco in the first place.  Thank the lord we lived down the street from it because I could not have survived without those sweet potato fries, grilled artichokes, or amazing fish tacos. This place is worth the wait. Absolutely frickin' DELICIOUS.

We now live in San Diego and this place is tops on my list of restaurants for our upcoming visit.
author: Love Z.

description:
For some reason, the name was very deceiving to me. I heard about awesome fish tacos but thought it was mexican themed. Today when walking down Chestnut, I actually spent the time to check out the menu and I saw the sri racha bottles up front, so I knew it had an asian theme.

I ordered the house salad with grilled salmon. The salad came in a huge bowl with edamame, shitake mushrooms, of course lettuce, cucumber slices, tomatoes and a very large and fresh piece of salmon.  He had two baja tacos with sweet potato fries. Yum yum! I loved the fries and just for that, I'd defn go back.  The place is small, so I can imagine that it fills up quick.
author: Natalie S.

description:
SWEET POTATO FRIES! Try the BBQ Salmon Sandwich. I really don't like the taste of chipotle, but it's really subtle in their barbeque sauce. So it doesn't mess with the salmon.

The Sweet Potato Fries are an extra $1.95, when you get a sandwich. And they're a must. Get them!

It's nice and casual here. Food is served in baskets and condiments & napkins are right in front of you if you need them. The place is so small though. It's only about 10ft wide. But I like that it's small. Keeps the larger groups out. When I'm in the Marina, I gotta eat here. Doesn't matter what time of day it is. Call it lunch, linner, lupper or dinner. 

The Crispy Oyster & Chips Basket is good too!
author: Michael R.

description:
Where else can you get sweet potato fries and an ahi poke salad?  I come to Pacific Catch when I'm craving something fast and fresh.  Their specials of the day are usually really good, my favorite is the grilled octopus sandwich, with a side of sweet potato fries.  

Cons: Parking.  It's nearly impossible to find a spot on a Sunday afternoon.
author: Jen L.

description:
I rarely venture into the Marina for fear of the Marina stepford wives in training... but I would brave the fembots to eat here... A great little fish/seafood place, unpretentious and affordable!  I had a Baja Fresh Special which they substituted the trout for mahi mahi and it was fabulous... the best fish plate I've had in the city and for only $16.95! I had 2 grilled filets of mahi mahi, grilled peppers/squash, corn on the cob and the most delicious sweet potato fries ever.... OMG those fries are SOOOO good... Also I liked the fact that I could see my food being cooked at the bar.. that fry cook is a pro !!! seasoning, grilling and deep frying away...

Service was prompt and friendly without being overbearing... and the waitress suggested a nice glass of white with my meal...

I'll have to come back to try the calmari... it looked delicious..
author: Doris M.

description:
What did one bee say to the other bee?

Wasabi.

As in the tangy sweet and salty soy wasabi vinaigrette splashed 'wasabi bowls".  Cmon now, you cant beat this:

Wasabi Bowls
Topped with wakame salad, sliced avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, pickled ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori & soy-wasabi sauce served over a heaping bowl of seasoned sushi rice *

Choose One:

   1. Ahi Tuna (Sushi-grade), Grilled Rare - $10.95
   2. Ahi Poke (Hawaiian Style Sashimi) - $10.95
   3. Grilled Fresh Salmon - $10.95
   4. California Crab Salad - $12.95
   5. BBQ Unagi (Eel) - $12.95

I've taken a liking to the ahi poke combo where it's raw and I believe lightly tumbled in a teri-marinade.  

I mean, holy shittake, Batman, it's fantastic.

The baja tacos aren't anything to write home to mom about, but they are fried.  And I loved fried.  A little OD on the mayo sauce, but eh, it's doable.

The Sushi-Grade Ahi is also good, chiming in at $9.95.
Grilled rare & served with avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, pickled ginger, carrots, baby tomatoes, toasted sesame seeds & soy-wasabi vinaigrette (substitute Hawaiian poke for $1.00)

Both of these items are so good, that I haven't even really ventured out into the other dimensions of the menu.  

The place is small with maybe tables to seat 10?  You might have to share a table.  They also have a long bar that faces the line cooks.  They also have a few tables outside, weather permitting.  I'd expect this place to be usually packed, so be ready.   Maybe give them a buzz to get the lowdown before you go.

Sayonara.
author: Isaac L.

description:
This place really is teeny, so either go early or late. The menu and prices are nice and the service was speedy. Reminds me of a fast food diner, but instead of greasy breakfast foods, there's seafood. 

As most of the reviews already noted, the sweet potato fries are the bomb-diggity-fresh. Normally I'm not a huge fan of sweet potatos, but I guess whenever you fry something, its greatness increases tenfold. The menu seemed to have a bunch of things that looked and sounded great, but were a little disappointing in the taste department. Their ingredients seem to be fresh and of decent quality, but the cooks' need to overcook everything really ruins the texture/taste. The ahi tuna sammich is tasty, but it would have been severely dry had the sauce not lubricated things nicely. Would return if I were in the mood for tasty fries and decently priced seafood.
author: Raymond C.

description:
Pretty darn good.

We had the fish and chips, miso soup with clams and fish tacos. Everything tasted fresh and was well cooked. I will definitely be back to try some of the other offerings. The service was sort of mediocre and seemed to be just going through the paces till the end of the shift - if you know what I mean.
author: Alan N.

description:
Im normally not a big fan of chain, fast food places but Pacific Catch is definitely one of the outliers.  The food here is made really well and more importantly its fresh.  Lets be real, the food they make here is not hard and most of the time you can do it at home.  Its growth driver is that most of us are lazy and just too tired to actually get the fresh ingredients and throw it together in a bowl.  

All good, because we are defnitely willing to pay for it.  Wasabi Bowl and sweet potato fries is all I need when I come here.  Definitely give this place a try if you havent before.  Its a pleasant surprirse.
author: Charles C.

description:
I do agree with the rest of the Yelp* community that PC (which is Pacific Catch for those, who like me, hate typing and try to do as little of it as possible) is bad for groups. Irregardive, myself and four of my drinking buddies decided to visit on a Saturday night.  The wait for five along the counter was thirty minutes, but they let us drink beer while standing in the crowded entranceway.  

I had the four piece catch of the day with an order of miso soup.  I didn't bother asking which fish was lucky enough to find its way to my plate, as it was of the delicious variety.     

I will go back, if only for an order of those sweet potato fries.
author: JR A.

description:
PC--How do I love thee?  From the fab waitstaff to the lickety-split take-out, you get it right.  I crave your sweet potato fries, even if they are frozen from Sysco (yeah, you learn a lot sitting at the bar.)  Yummy, yummy salmon tacos.

1/2 star docked for small space and 1/2 star docked for skimpy grilled veggie portions.  

But, I'll be back twice this week, like I always am. Thanks for helping me get my weekly fish fix.  

HOT TIP:  DO NOT EVEN THINK OF TAKING MORE THAN ONE FRIEND HERE.  It's always crazy busy jam packed, and there is really only one table for 3 or more.  But...worth it.  Try to finagle bar seats.  Or take out.  Ummmmm...take out.  Love ya, PC.  Love ya!
author: alli h.

description:
You cannot go wrong here- everything's so fresh and the "Chalkboard Specials" are to die for. Salmon Baja style is fantastic, with a tomatillo-avocado sauce and sweet potato fries. Yum!

Tonight I had a margarita which I thought was pretty random when I ordered it...but it was outstanding! My family is addicted to this place. Even the takeout is fantastic.
author: Kristin G.

description:
If you love top quality Fish then Pacific Catch is your spot, i live in So Cal and any chance i get to go north this place is a mandatory stop, it's as important as calling or visiting grandma in boca any time i get within 1000 miles of FL.. 

I took a menu with me and am looking for a chef to recreate this stiff for me at home i may even invest in a chef who would be capable of replicating this in So Cal.. then take it world wide and live happily ever after. 

This place has earned my 5 star rating!
author: Mark s.

description:
OMG the lime and avocado shrimp ceviche is sooooo good! I ate it until I couldn't handle it anymore. Happy Hour is great here, I think it starts at 9 p.m.  

Service wasn't so hot though; our waiter just disappeared and we never saw him again. After waiting 20 min, we asked the bartender to get him. It was then that he informed us that he was actually  our server. hmmmmmmm....

yeah.  But food and beer was pretty tasty.
author: Courtney M.

description: We stopped by here for a quick bite for lunch. The place is very small and tight. The service was excellent and quick. We ordered the spicy mahi mahi sandwich and the wasabi bowl ahi tuna. Yummy!! The food was excellent and balanced in taste and proportions. I would definitely be returning here very soon
author: Ernie P.

description:
got the tuna tartare bowl. I think my boyfriend got some sort of fish sandwich- which I did not like. there wasn't much fish in there, and the sauce was over powering.  

The place is tiny but we sat near the entrance in front of the big open window and did not feel claustrophobic.  The service was good, and the sweet potatoe fries are great!  Corn on the cob too- sweet, and though the spiced butter was enough to put 5 pounds on you, it was very tasty!

Cheap dinner out for a pretty hearty meal!
author: Hannah W.

description: This is a very unique place with sweet potato fries, tacos and wasabi bowls!! Of course I tried them all and love them all. Especially I'm crazy about their bowls. Wish this place is little bigger, you have to kind of eat and go, can't stay and relax.
author: Yoko S.

description: I really liked this place.  It seemed...Japanese-Mexican fusion?  Very tasty since I like both.  Fresh fish and sweet potato fries make a yummy combo.  I would like to go back.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
On the whole the meal was decent.  We did get free sweet potato fries due to checking in on Four Square.  We had a couple of drinks and a rock-n-roll roll to start off with as well.  Our entrees consisted of an Ahi Tuna salad and a miso-type salmon dish.  Both were about average and on par with some other places as far as price is concerned.

The atmosphere was clean and had a light feel about.  I would have given this place a solid three stars but for our lousy, yes, I said lousy server Tyson.  He had such a miserable disposition that I could hardly believe that he is in this business.  I said immediately to my date that this guy seemed to have a bad attitude.  She thought I might be too quick to judge.  However, by the time our drinks arrived she totally agreed with me and we just were in awe at how long his poor disposition persisted.  He had poor eye contact, was quite rude, didn't write our order down and made errors, Although he did correct his mistakes, he never apologized for them.  Why Tyson acted in this manner, I have no idea.  I tipped 10%, which I think was still too generous given that I felt like the whole meal was a waste of money.  I can cook and make most anything a restaurant can make.  I don't go to a restaurant and spend good money just for the food.  The server represents the business.  In this case this server put Pacific Catch in a poor enough light that this will be my first and last visit here. 
There are just too many options in this city to return to a place with average food combined with bad service.  Good luck Tyson, because I think you're in the wrong business.
author: Scott A.

description:
UPDATE: i actually had to up it 4 stars cuz i'm still thinking about the sweet potato fries...and my *'s is all about FOOD, screw ambiance!

*******************************
it's rare i get to go out to the city mid-week so i  was happy to come check out this place with a few of my yelpin buddies! just wish i had more time to walk around the area before dinner. it's a teeny tiny space (good for take out or if you live right across the street). 

5 stars for the sweet potato fries and the two dips that it came with (thai chili and ginger-wasabi aioli) and the patient waiter as we intensely interregated him on the menu. i got the 2 taco meal (one baja taco and a special shrimp taco recommended by the waiter). i enjoyed my baja not so much the shrimp but it's been years since i've had a fish taco so give me a break! i miss fins in san diego though :(. overall 3 stars due to the small space and thus making us wait. i should have worn my "grumpy" sweatshirt.
author: Jane Y.

description:
I am sorry so many of my reviews are four stars but I just can't help it.

So I went for a nice run along the water from the marina to the golden gate bridge and I was ready for a nice big hearty but healthy meal... enter Pacific Catch.  

This place hit the spot.  I order a Ahi Tuna rice bowl.  Wow!  The rice was great, I love white rice!  The tuna was great, I wish there was more.  It was also served with avocado and a bunch of other things.  I was filled up and satisfied!

The sweet potato fries were great as well.

The only downside is the place is small so there is agood chance you won't be super comfortable while eating your great meal.  I sat at the bar which means I watched the cooks prepare the food- I am not into that.

Anyway I would recommend this place to pretty much everyone who is in the mood for seafood but wants something hearty and doesn't want to spend a fortune.  The entrees are priced $10-$13
author: Peter H.

description:
This place doesn't need another review to let yelpers know how good it is, so it's more for me to remember my visit to SF. 
The fish and chips was absolutely amazing. Sweet potato fries were a good difference to ordinary fries. The salmon did not have batter around it, but was fried to a nice crisp. 
For dessert I had the mochi fondue. Although it was just mochi ice cream you dip in warm fudge, it was still good, but not for 5.50!
I can see why it is always crowded here.
author: Jeanie C.

description:
When this place is on, I give it 5 stars. When it's off, I give it 1 star. This averages out to a solid 3 stars in my book. 

I've never had a bad meal AT Pacific Catch. When you dine-in, the food is always outstanding. My favorite item is their bowls - poke and teriyaki chicken are absolutely to die for. 

My issue is the takeout, which I would love to order regularly if it were consistent. In the handful of times I've had the take out, I've experienced:
-One excellent order
-One order where one out of two items was left out completely (the manager gave a gift card, but this was still a pain in the ass)
-Several orders where some condiment I asked to be left off was put on (and sometimes doubled)
-One order where the Poke wasn't edible. It was chewy and smelled bad. Had to toss the whole dish

My advice: dine in. Sadly, I'd order this weekly or more if the takeout were reliable, but it's just not.
author: Amy H.

description:
Pacific Catch is the place to go to pacify your need for a easy, healthy, lite lunch or dinner.  The catch?  Its small and the tables are tight and  crowded.  Eating at the bar is a better choice.  

My family is in Hawaii and this is exactly the kind of place I have always thought there should be more of there.  And everywhere for that matter.  Basically a quick and tasty fish bar.  When I miss home I just roll around in the sand, gargle some salt water and head to the marina.  As a wise man once (just now) said:  If you cant swim with the fishies you can at least eat them in a taco or a poke bowl.
author: Brad C.

description:
I say, do not judge a restaurant by its size. In fact, I've had more amazing meals at hole-in-the-walls than in fancy well-known food chains. 

At Pacific Catch, ignore the fact that you're sitting shoulder-to-shoulder with your neighbors. The food is awesome and you can't go wrong with the items on their menu. I am especially fond of the sweet potato fries. (Who doesn't love sweet potato fries?) 

If you can't handle the tight squeeze, take out is another option. Call in your order in advance and you can be in and out of there in a quickness. 

This is a testament to the fact that small is good. At least, for restaurants. Maybe not so much for other things...
author: eileen b.

description:
I love Pacific Catch. No, I don't just love Pacific Catch - I LURVE it. 

I usually go to the one in the Marina during work - this location is tiny and crowded  which is a pain but I've tried many items on the menu from the fried oysters to the fish and chips to the wasabi ahi to the salmon sandwich and not one of them has been less than delicious. 

The baja fish tacos are very flavorful with great texture and the sweet potato fries with sweet/spicy thai sauce are totally addictive.
author: N J.

description:
Great value and very fresh taste for the price.  I had a 2-taco dinner (one fried and one grilled mahi mahi - recommended as their top two faves) and loved it.  Comes with delicious sweet potato fries, and an assortment of little dipping sauces (lime crema for the tacos, wasabi aioli for the fries, sweet chili for whatever).  Asked for no avocado salsa, and they gladly gave me the pineapple and corn salsas on the side.  

The place is pretty small, but they do table service which was a nice surprise.  Creative, varied menu for all palates and appetites...and all ingredients are fresh and tasty.  I'll be back.
author: Louis M.

description:
Meh!  The fish and chicken tacos were uneventful.  The Tortillas were store-bought (what can you expect, it is the Marina after all).

The crab salad was good (one extra star for really good crab portions ), but it didn't shake by bon bon.  

And man, is it cramped here.  I now know the life stories of the 4 couples who sat next to us.
author: Clarice V.

description:
This place is great because you have the option to have a healthy and tasty meal or a greasy and healthy meal.  I had the fish and chips the first time I came here and it was tasty!  What's even better is the sweet potato fries.  I'm surprised more restaurants don't have this because it's really good, especially with their garlic aioli dipping sauce.  

The next time I came I had a rice bowl with ahi tuna and extra tuna poke with 1/2 brown rice and 1/2 white rice.  Now that's healthy!  The extra tuna was worth the extra $5!  Also, get the diet cricket, not the regular cricket...green tea coke.  The diet doesn't have the weird aftertaste cuz it's made with Splenda and it tastes better too!!
author: Jonathan T.

description:
Really delicious salads with very fresh fish...  They make the fusion thing work well.  Everyone's right about the sweet potato fries and their salads with seared tuna.  

When to go...? Well, this place is no longer a secret, so call your order in and go and get it, or plan to wait a 20-30 minutes for a table for two.  It's pretty small, so don't bother going with a big group.  Staff is friendly, but harried with all the volume that they do.
author: Jim M.

description:
It is one of my favorite place for lunch & dinner.
I love the sweet potatoes fries and hot sandwiches. I have taken a lot of my friends and clients to this restaurant. You must check it out for yourself.
Enjoy ...
author: Kim L.

description:
This tops the list as one of the worst restaurants I have ever been to. My boyfriend and I came on a Friday afternoon for lunch. The inside was cute, but it was freezing (not really a big deal). I ordered the grilled mahi mahi tacos and my boyfriend ordered the coconut shrimp and fish & chips. Our waitress came out with a mahi mahi sandwich, but she quickly brought it back in because I wanted the tacos. When I finally received the tacos, I took a bite, and immediately discovered that the rub on the mahi mahi was kind of yucky... Oh well... I just continued eating, but then I noticed that they left out the avocado, instead of chipotle Crema, they gave me a little drizzle of sour cream AND they never gave me a side of black beans. At this point, I was annoyed and I didn't want it anymore, so I told my boyfriend to try it. He took a couple bites and hated it. So I told her what had been left out and that I didn't like the taco, so she asked me if I wanted a side of avocado.... NO I DON'T!!! ( I didn't yell, I was nice). So she tried giving me the old mahi mahi sandwich ( oh yeah! I want an old soggy sandwich... what a smart girl!) I obviously said no. She asked me if I wanted something else, so I ordered the fried calamari. She asked if my boyfriend wanted the other taco I had left, but he din't, so she took it back with my new order. Then out came the calamari and it was okay ( you can't really mess that up). It would have been better if wasn't swimming in oil, though! EW! 

After we had finished eating, she came over with the check and didn't say a word..... she had the nerve to charge me for half of my other meal when it didn't even come to me complete!! Instead of complaining, we figured her tip could cover the sneaky little half charge she added on to our check.

All was not bad... I tried my boyfriends coconut shrimp and hey were delicious, but not enough to come back to this crappy place.
author: Lauren D.

description: Great sweet potato fries, good little restaraunt. I had this spicy salmon sandwhich that made me not feel so guilty about the fries I ordered. This is a great spot for people watching too.
author: Michael C.

description:
I almost don't want to write a great review since it gets so crowded.
They make the best of the tiny space.

If you love seafood, especially fish, you'll gobble up everything on the menu.

I haven't tried anything I disliked here.
Tops:
    - Sweet Potato Fries (with sweeet chili sauce)
    - Wasabi Ahi Sandwich (seared tuna with amazing wasabi aioli)
    - Coconut Shrimp
    - Hawaiian Poke (super duper ahi in a flavorful sesame soy marinade)
author: Bamboo T.

description:
As a pescatarian (whenever the heck i feel like it) I love fish anyway you serve it. Here at Pacific Catch they have a pretty broad range of fish dishes. I always go with one of the wasabi bowls, its good Cali-Japanese food that you can feel good about eating. The portions are generous and you always leave feeling full. However I dont really recomend the poki, I eat a lot of raw ahi and find it a bit too saucy and with too much stringy cartalidge left attached. 

I like the style of food and would have given Pacific Catch more stars if it wasnt for the fact that every time ive eaten here I left with an upset stomach. Maybe I should change it up with the wasabi bowls.
author: Tom V.

description:
Pac Catch is a sure win for anyone looking for a tasty & interesting meal. Whether you're getting tacos, rice bowls, sandwiches, or the specials, you're going to get a fresh, tropical interpretation.  This means sweet fruit garnishes, spicy sauces, and flavors from Hawaii, Thailand, and of course the Pacific rim.

My fiance and I are regulars there; we dine there almost once a week, if not more often.  The staff is super friendly and polite, and shockingly patient, despite the tight quarters and somewhat frenzied jobs they have.

The downside to this place is there is limited room, so you will likely have to wait a while to get a seat, even at unlikely times.

But the food comes out quickly, and sitting at the counter is still pretty comfortable.

Best picks: the Wasabi Bowl with Poke-- these bowls have an amazing, flavorable dressing that is truly addicting.   Also get some sweet potato fries, these are a staple at Pac Catch.

If you like seafood, pan-Asian cuisine, or tangy/zesty flavors, Pacific Catch is a must-try experience.
author: David A.

description: Had a great Ahi sandwich with sweet potato fries.  The service was friendly and the food was just what I wanted so I will be back for sure.
author: Scott G.

description:
We walked into the Pacific Catch at roughly 5:15PM on the 24th of October and got seated at a window table next to Lincolnway. We were able to get drinks right away by the bartender, who was doing double duty as our server. 

My wife at the Ahi Tuna rice bowl and I had the special. Needless to say, the Pacific Catch lived up to their reputation. Our food was excellent and we really had no complaints at all. 

I recommend this fine establishment to anyone hankering for some seafood prepared with just a tad little different twist. Nothing to radical, just little different things to make it all original as well as tasty.
author: Wayne B.

description: Great seafood! I shared the king crab soup and California roll salad with my mom, the crab was so delicious! It was so fresh! I would definitely go back :) also on last side note the salad portions were pretty big, so I would share or come really hungry!
author: Chelsea H.

description:
I'd give the place 2 1/2 stars, but since I can't, I'm rounding down.  Keep in mind that my review is based on food that I PICKED UP, however given that they advertise heavy to call and pick up food, I expected a lot more from this hyped joint.  This is from a meal I picked up two nights ago.

For starters, they completely botched the order.  I ordered the mahi mahi bowl (which is served over rice) and the salmon salad.  They put the salmon in the rice bowl, and vice versa.  The salmon was very good.  My girlfriend and I enjoyed it very much.  The mahi mahi wasn't very good.  For a white fish, it tasted very fishy.  We threw most of it away.  Not to mention I expected smaller cut pieces, not big slabs of mahi.  This is more personal preference.  The salad itself was so-so, the rice bowl pretty tasty.  I liked how they offered an option of brown rice instead of white.

We also ordered the shrimp ceviche.  This would have been so much better if they offered tuna (or another fish) instead of shrimp.  If you really like shrimp, you'll really like the ceviche.

When I came in, I added an order of miso soup - which they charged me  for.  Low and behold, when I got home THEY FORGOT TO ADD THE SOUP.  And every time I tried calling them to inform them of their faux pas, they would just say, "Fresh Catch Please Hold" without even giving me a chance to say anything.

It could be a far more enjoyable experience to dine-in, not sure.  However the experience picking up food was pretty lousy.  Doubt I'll go back.
author: Cyrus S.

description:
My bro Mike tells me as I'm walking out the door to pick up some stuff and some dinner, "Pacific Catch may just have the best food in SF." 

Wow. Them's strong words. I punched his order into my phone, loaded up google maps and started walking to "the Marina" to run our errands.

About 8 blocks later I stopped in at Pacific Catch to place the order. The place looked clean, warm and inviting. The waiter that greeted me at the door was totally friendly, as were the cooks standing behind the counter beyond. I gave them our order - two Ahi Dinner Salads with extra fish, and a basket of Sweet 'Tater Fries, and relayed Mike's praise. "We love our regulars!" the waiter proclaims. I believe it. They let me know that the order should be ready by the time I'm done shopping around, and call goodbye as I walk out the door.

About ten minutes or so later I've got stuff from Walgreens and the Apple Store in hand. I stop back in and grab our food which smells awesome. Then I head back the 8 or so blocks to Mike's apt.

We hook up my computer to his sound system and get set to watch "28 Weeks Later" and "Shaft" (the original, not the remake) and "I [heart] Huckabees." I pull out the fries and the dinner salads which have now had a bit of time to cool.

Regardless of the fries not being as great as they would be had we eaten them immediately instead of after an 8 block walk and 10 minutes of setting ourselves up to watch some vids, they were still kick ass and we devoured them all. Then we dig into our salads. Mike says, "Hmm... this isn't as good as it usually is" and I'm shocked because it's like the BEST SHIT I'VE EATEN IN I DON'T KNOW HOW LONG. Seriously. The tuna is KILLER. The salad dressing is tangy and awesome. There's strips of avocado on the salad, and tomatoes. The lettuce and veggies are crunchy and fresh.

Seriously -- try to eat it sooner than we did if it's your first time and you're unsure. But even after letting our dinners sit and our fries get cool, everything was still awesome.

And the original Shaft is so much better than the remake. "Close it yourself, Shitty!"
author: Will L.

description:
Pacific Catch is the first place in San Francisco that I've burned out on;  it took about three months of eating there about twice a week.

While on the way to catch the 22 line back down to the ghetto from an awesome web conference at the Palace of Fine Arts, I smelled something super delicious. It smelled so good, in fact, that even though I was standing at the bus stop and the 22 was pulling up, I ran away to find which restaurant was putting out all that deliciousness.

I followed my nose to Pacific Catch and proceeded to order their Hawaiian poke, grilled mahi-mahi fish tacos and sweet potato fries. I LOVED EVERYTHING! Even as a former 5-year resident of San Diego. I went back a few more times that week and tried all sorts of things. The Hawaiian poke is so far my favorite.. it's my girlfriend's favorite too, preferring it even to poke found in Hawaii. Their fried fish tacos aren't as good as the grilled ones, in my opinion. But everything else I've ordered has been superb.

It's a tradition with my cohort at USF to go and drink/eat after finals. Pacific Catch was the first place I recommended (even though I must've been out of my mind -- its small size is no good for large groups). Everyone loved their food and another classmate of mine got addicted and joined me quite a few more times at PC. His favorite is the salmon teriyaki rice bowl.
