When my friend's parents from Louisiana came to see the sights in SF, they asked me to take them eat out. Knowing they loved seafood, I took them to Pacific Catch and they raaaaved about it.

I'd give PC 5 stars but the service has been spotty. Twice now they have forgotten to place my order (though each time they ended up not charging me for my delicious meal) and once I was made to wait for no apparent reason. After 10 minutes of standing there, starving, they finally seated my friend and I at a table we'd been eyeing the entire time. My classmate who used to eat there with me on a weekly basis was treated so terribly once that he vowed never to go back :(
author: Chrissy Q.

description:
Imagine Giada De Laurentiis with a hairdo like this: http://www.philhendrieshow.com/storage/Bopwl.jpg. -- that's how big Pacific Catch's rice bowls are. 

There are two different types of bowls: Wasabi, which is like a disassembled sushi roll, and Teriyaki, which is exactly like it sounds. I've gotten the Ahi Tuna Wasabi Bowl a number of times, but I've learned my lesson. I get about halfway through the bowl, and I bonk like it's mile 23 at the SFM. Don't get me wrong, the bowls are delicious and a great value, but I'm not big on taking home raw fish as leftovers, so I've avoided them since that revelation.

Instead, I usually opt for the salad or the Spicy Ahi Tuna sandwich and a side of Sweet Potato Fries. It's hard to go wrong with what you love, and i love TUNA (I feel a rant coming on) and sweet potatoes. The seafood here is quality, so you can be assured that whatever you order will be fresh. The ceviche is good. The last time I went, Ahi Tuna Tacos were a special. NOM. 

*WARNING: Tuna tangent ahead*
--------------------------------------------------
Tuna. I LOVE tuna. And I'm not talking about Bumblebee or Starkist (I actually do live off these cat-food-like-tuna-packets for lunch though - http://www.amazon.com/StarKist-Chunk-Light-2-6000-Ounce-Pouches/dp/B00374QXAC/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&s=grocery&qid=1283872281&sr=8-2). If I could fish with my bare hands like a bear, I would be scooping up tuna out of the ocean and taking bites out of the poor fish like it was a piece of chicken. Dave Chappelle would be on a boat in the distance like an ocean biologist with binoculars and an encyclopedia flipped to Asian Predispositions, saying, http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wJ4B7G8Rw3Q#t=138. Unfortunately, my bare hands are far from bear hands -- oh the irony. I guess having opposable thumbs has its advantages... or do they? http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kEI6lH1QDSk. Don't be surprised if you see me with bear paw transplants in the future (when we have the technology).
--------------------------------------------------

This place is very small, so you might accidently elbow a person or three. Having a party over 4 will definitely have you waiting for a table. However, it's a great place to have lunch with a friend to satisfy your seafood craving.
author: Len L.

description: Sometimes I just need a poke wasabi bowl. It's full of goodness: fresh poke, ripe avocado, tangy seaweed salad, crunchy veggies, perfectly cooked brown rice, and that dressing. And it's all served in a huge bowl. I have sampled most of the bowls on the menu- all of them are delicious and made with super fresh seafood and veggies. The service is as good as the food- totally nice servers who manage to stay calm and friendly in the crowded quarters.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I went here after eating too much during a fabulous bridal shower weekend in Healdsburg.  We wanted something that was light and healthy.  Pacific Catch was a perfect complement.

I ordered a Wasabi-bowl (don?) with Tuna Poke with brown rice.  I couldn't believe that they actually put fresh Mekabu seaweed on it as well!  So good for your health.  While the tuna was not top-notch (given the price, it is reasonable), it was marinated very nicely in the Poke.  I've never really seen "don-mono" places in the bay area so this was quite refreshing.

We also had sweet potato fries, which were crisp and yummy.

Great place for a casual & healthy lunch when your tummy needs a rest from all that red meat...
author: Yu T.

description:
Best fish tacos outside of San Diego. 

Did that "catch" your attention? Ok, stupid joke...BUT their fish is fresh everyday, and really have never had a bad meal there yet. Their sweet potato fries are so good. Their coconut encrusted shrimp is so good. Their wasabi bowls are so good. Their sandwiches are so good. 

Ok, so I've had almost everything on the menu, but the stand out. THE reason that you should visit Pacific Catch, is for their fish tacos. I have eaten so many nasty, smelly, over fried, strangly seasoned fish tacos, but Pacific Catch's are as good if not better than Rubio's - which has them down pat. 

Love this place, gets crowded during the normal Chestnut lunch rush, but sit at the bar, don't be afraid. Take out is also very efficient - when they say 10 minutes, they mean it.
author: Jenny R.

description:
Overall Good Food, Small amount of seating,  Good service.
I want to give it 4 stars but I can't. If I could give it 3.5 I would.

A couple of friends and I went over to check out what the fuss was about Pacific Catch this past Saturday night.  We waited about 20mins. The waitress was kind enough to ask us what drinks we would like while we waited.

We got to sit at the counter. The place is small. This used to be a "Pasta Pomodoro." There's more counter seating than table seating. The wait will be longer if you try for a table.

The service was pretty good - very attentive but the place is just too small.

We ordered appetizers- fried oysters, thai coconut shrimps, sweet potato fries. All were very tasty. The catch of the day was Rock Cod. I had the Mahi Mahi taco and the Rock Cod Terriyaki Bowl. Both were good but not great. The tacos were good but it doesn't come close to some Fish Tacos I've had in San Diego. The Terriyaki bowl had the typical sauce that every place has.

Overall I would come back. Better yet I'll wait for the one on 9th Ave to open in Oct 2007.

ps- According to all those Apple iphone ads there was suppose to be Calamari. There wasn't any on the menu.
author: Bert T.

description:
Went here last night with a group, was immediately set which was nice. The food is pretty fast, though I wish the menu was more diverse and memorable. It's decent. 

Parking sucks since Lincoln and Irving can get crazy busy at times.
author: Irvin David U.

description:
I could eat here everyday.  Seriously.
The poke rice bowl is one of my favorite meals--the poke is always fresh and there is the perfect amount of sauce that coats the rice, making even the rice taste delicious.  It's big enough for two people to share (which also makes it pretty affordable).
Oh and those sweet potato fries with the wasabi aioli are out of this world.
They have a pretty decent daily lunch deal and stamp card (something like buy 9 get one free), but who can get here during the middle of the week for lunch--oh yeah all those Marina moms.
Anyways, the only draw back about this place is the size of the restaurant.  We like a few blocks away though so we almost always do take out so it's not a do or die fault for me.
author: M. C.

description: Great seafood of mix. In Marina, you couldn't find a better small joint.
author: Lovetea C.

description:
What a cool place for fast, fine food with consistency. Not too stuffy like the marina crowd gets labeled.. 

Food: rock star Mahi-sandy.. shrimp taco (happy hour) slam'n..! 
Wine: OK for $6 bucks: $3 happy hour Nevada's.. 
Server: Great.. 

If it's too small, check out their large version in the sunset..This locale is better and more hands-on..
author: Dutch B.

description:
Love this place, i pretty much always ask for the same.. Wasabi bowl with my fixings and it's always good, it makes me happy.
Have tried some other food there, it's good too but i always come back to the same, I'm totally a wasabi bowl person.
Servers are super nice, my favorite is Aimee.
author: Jessica M.

description: The only thing I want to catch are my dollars bills as they leave my wallet and get flushed down the toilet in the form of poo. Nothing worth mentioning at Pacific Catch except the calamari, although calamari is good pretty much anywhere you order it. My salmon was overcooked, dry, and unappetizing. Can I have a refund please? Or better yet, can I have a refund plus the 28 minutes I spent waiting to be seated?
author: Jenny T.

description:
I know everyone's raving about this place, and I gotta chime in. I did what the reviews said - I ordered the ahi tuna wasabi bowl. At first glance, I was kinda sad. The dish looked SO healthy, while my friend's 3 tacos looked so much more appetizing. But at first bite, I was sold. Whatever they put in that dressing mixed in with the brown rice, omg. SO good. I ordered a side of sweet potato fries as well. They were good...but I'd much rather eat more brown rice...

I'm coming back here again for my dinner before the SF Marathon. Carb-loading with a wasabi bowl! Yay!
author: Carol L.

description:
This is a cute (but VERY tiny) place to eat when you want something casual and tasty.  I first thought this was a fish and chips place (they do have that) but it turned out quite "asian".  Liked their ahi poke over either salad or rice (portion was large).  Not the biggest fan of their tacos though - some had too much sauce (except the Cajun Shrimp).  Not the cheapest place to eat too - you think it would be caused it's so tiny.  Two tacos with sweet potatoes fries run about about $12.00.  Fish is fresh though. Warning - no reservation so there's always a wait but it's worth it. 

Service is great though.  Recommend sitting at the bar so that you can see the cooks do their thang... it's fun!
author: Lily W.

description:
This was a great place to eat. Very yummy indeed. We went to the one near Golden Gate Park on Sat for lunch. It wasn't crowded. Our server was great too! 

We had the sweet potato fries, spicy tuna roll. I had the washington sturgeon daily special and my bf had the salmon. It was delicious, very affordable, and everything came right on time.
author: Christine A.

description:
grilled artichoke was freakin' awesome!
sweet potato fries were very tasty and nice and crisp, some places make them kind of mushy which really sucks but these rocked.
Some seating and I've always had to wait to sit down, but I always ended up sitting at the bar.
author: Chris B.

description: Finally gave the place a try and it sucked.  Worst calamari ever, service was crap and my main meal lacked almost any protein.
author: J R.

description:
Mahi Mahi tacos were pretty average, not a lot of unique flavor.

Cramped quarters make it tough to dine in, but reasonable prices and a friendly staff.

Would consider it for a quick bite, but not too much else.  Great sweet potato fries.
author: jeremy S.

description: The food was great. We got an app of sweet potato fries and they were perfectly cooked, crispy but not burned. I ordered the wasabi bowl with seared ahi tuna loved it. I didn't want to stop eating once I was full.  Husband got a salad of some sort and didn't really like it.  The bite I had was ok but I liked my dish more. Minus one star for the service though. Everyone was frantically running around since the place was busy but no one seemed to have one particular job. We had one person seat us, she took our order a few minutes later, another brought our food out, a third person filled our waters once and that was the end of service. We finished eating and about ten minutes later a fourth person cleared our plates. At this point I had no idea who our server was so we waited another ten minutes before asking the girl at the register if we could get our ticket.
author: Hana Z.

description: Get the taco combo - it comes with your choice of 3 different flavors.  I got fried fish, grilled fish and shrimp.  The shrimp one was the best and it came with sweet potato fries.  We also got the seared ahi sandwich with Asian slaw and fish and chips.  You'll love this place if you like fish.  Seating kind of sucks though - it's tight
author: Mimi D.

description:
You can't beat the Wasabi tuna dishes here.. the fresh, affordable plates are nice causal pacific-Japanese fusion creations.  The lines are horrendous given the tiny, nonexistent dining area... but I suppose the best places like to keep the traffic per square foot insanely high.  During the summer they keep the windows open and create a nice breezy draft. 

Try calling in your order for take out... that probably solves part of the problem.
author: Jenny C.

description:
We discovered this place a while back on a trip to San Francisco when we were staying in Cow Hollow. It is indeed a hole-in-the-wall place with limited seating. Judging by the copious amount of take-out orders that walked out the door while we were waiting patiently for our table, I had a feeling that the food would be good.  

The owner was very friendly, It's hard to describe just what kind of food they serve being part Asian and part Hawaiian. All I can say is that it was so tasty that we returned several times during our 10 day stay!

It didn't surprise me to see there restaurant advertised on a cell-phone commercial recently but it did make me hungry for some of their excellent ciao. Kudos.
author: Mackenzie B.

description: My boyfriend and I came here for lunch once. We order the mixed seafood basket (calamari, coconut  battered shrimp, fried oysters), sweet potato fries and shrimp/fish tacos. It was a nice experience. Can't wait to come back for their rice bowls w/ sashimi.
author: linh d.

description:
A girlfriend of mine took me here when I visited her and I was hooked.  It's a very small restaurant, almost cramped, but food is solid.  

A ton of salad choices, with a great selection of vegetables, like edamame, sprouts, and ginger.  Unusual right? that's what I thought. We started off with the sweet potato fries and they were tasty.  I liked that they weren't overly greasy and you could actually taste the sweet potato. 

For my entree I went with the House special which had shittake mushrooms, edamame, sprouts, cucumber, and miso dressing.  I topped it off with Salmon and it was delicious.  I could taste the freshness of the salmon and all the flavors of the different vegetables were great.  The dressing was light enough so that it didn't kill the taste of fresh veggies but had enough flavor to compliment the salmon.  

My friend ordered the Fish and Chips, I tried a piece of the fish and it was good. The breading was nice and light and didn't overpower the fish.  

 I would have given them a 5, but the place is very claustrophobic.   The tables are uncomfortably close to each other .  But aside from that, the menu is fresh, original, and the food is tasty.  It has the comforts and good food of a sit-down joint with the hustle and bustle of a fast-food spot.  I will definitely head back any time I'm in the Marina district of the city.
author: Dorothy F.

description:
I have yet to try something that disappoints. 

What I've tried so far and loved:
* Thai Coconut Shrimp skewers
* Sushi-Grade Ahi salad
* California Salmon sandwich
* Traditional Baja and Grilled Mahi Mahi fish tacos
* "Signature" sweet potato fries

The marina location is small; like you're sitting at the bar, but don't know how you even got up in your bar chair small. This could use some improvement. All of the wait staff were friendly and helpful.
author: Megan L.

description: I am not the best person to review this restaurant because I can not eat seafood. But I have had to go there a few times because that was where the group was going. What I had was decent, but I wish they had more non-seafood options.
author: Rob S.

description:
While visiting from Los Angeles, we stumbled upon this place and very floored at the deliciousness of the fish and the variety on the menu. 

Service 
- done with a smile and quick for a busy Sunday afternoon. 

Food 
- Sweet potato fries - make them spicy and they'll make your day. 
- Shrimp Ceviche - delicious. A little spicy and a lot of lime and avocado. 
- Thai Coconut Shrimp - Not a darned thing wrong with these. 
- Wasabi Ahi Sandwich - A perfect cut of seared ahi. Delicious and filling.
- The Japanese Wasabi Bowl with Hawaiian Poke - I would eat this every day of my life. Order it, mix it all up, and enjoy. You're gonna love it. 

Price
- Incredibly well-priced. 

The only drawback is the chain-restaurant type appearance of the menu. But trust me, this is a real find and a delicious place to eat.
author: Hal M.

description: They have great fish tacos, wasabi tuna bowls & sweet potato fries!!!!!!
author: Melissa G.

description:
Parking is going to be quite irritating, but I think the endless circling around the few blocks will be way worth it for the food.  
I highly, HIGHLY recommend the wasabi bowls if you fancy fusion japanese/american cuisine.  I had the ahi-poke wasabi bowl with the brown rice substitute and the wasabi-soy sauce on the side. It came with a large portion of ahi-poke cubed sashimi garnished with sesame seeds, seasoned seaweed, and some other delicious sides.   

For an appetizer, I would recommend the yam/sweet-potato-fries.  They were the perfect blend of sweet and savory fried to an almost perfect consistency.
author: Megan L.

description: Stumbled across this place while looking for a seafood restaurant in the area. Based on reviews, it looked like a good bet. It was busy, but our wait was only ~30 minutes. The dining space is super small and the tables are very close together - can't image a group larger than 4 trying to have dinner here. I did notice that they do a very brisk take-out business. Husband had the fish & chips and I had the teriyaki bowl w/ salmon. Husband loved his dish, but mine was meh. The flavors didn't "sing" and the pineapple on top of the teriyaki salmon made everything way too sweet. I pushed the pineapple to the side and ate the salmon and veggies. A bit underwhelmed, but maybe I didn't order the right thing? Still, with so many other options in the neighborhood, I don't see a return trip to this place.
author: Eme L.

description:
Great service and food.  Place is a bit small, but we had a group of 4 and got seats at the bar right away on a sunday night.    Tacos were all tasty, wasabi bowl delicious.
Our server Amy was awesome as well.  We had a mistake on our order and she got in the new order without arguing about why it got messed up.   I'll definitely be back for more at some point.
author: Ben D.

description:
Everything here is pretty good.  The poke though was a little too chewy for my taste.  You would think they would use a better piece of fish.  
All their rice bowls are winners.  Try any wasabi bowl, you won't be disappointed.
author: Jon Z.

description: The food at Pacific Catch is consistent and good, but I have to give it 3-stars because it's just not a good value. If the prices dropped by about $2 I'd eat here more often, but I'll probably only be back for Happy Hour.
author: Emily C.

description:
My wife and I wandered here on a Friday night.  Able to find a table.  Crammed seating so you can definitely hear everyone else's conversation.  Felt more like higher-end take out food due to the high frequency of individuals picking up orders.  Felt like in a way like high-end fast-food.  Quick delivery, served in paper lined tray for the fish tacos.  The fish tacos are a bit on the spicy end and they overdue it on the salsa which truly drowns out the taste of the fish.  

The rice bowls are a good serving size and a good amount of fish.  

Would come back, but would probably try during happy hour.
author: Dan W.

description:
Oh Dear Lord, if I could afford to eat here for lunch everyday, , , I would.

 Though there are many enticing options on the menu, I'm a huge, , , and I mean HUGE fan of the . . . . . .

 . . . . . . Sushi-grade Ahi Salad - 

 - Grilled rare & served with avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts,
pickled ginger, tomatoes, toasted sesame seeds & soy-wasabi
vinaigrette. It's absolutely scrumptious! I was always tempted to try something different but just didn't have it in me, creature of habit I guess. 

 Anyhoo, I brought an 'out of town' friend there for lunch a while back. I wasn't very hungry so I decided this was the perfect opportunity to try something different , , , the fish tacos which were fine, but nothing in comparison to my favorite salad in the whole wide world! I am happy to say that I feel better now having branched out a bit but I now know where my loyalty lies. It's one of those "this is why I come here" type of scenarios.

P.S. Service is always friendly and welcoming. The place is VERY small so keep that in mind too.
author: alexa c.

description:
I love this place.
I had it for the first time ever after my fellow yepper Samantha S. could not stop talking about it. It was fast, so freaking good. I seriously havent stopped thinking about it for the last couple days. I had a couple friend try some bites, since I got it today, and they were out the door going to get there own.
author: Nancy B.

description:
Three words: "sweet potato fries"

Or I guess it could be: "amazing tofu sandwich"

Or possibly: "really great service"

At any rate, my boyfriend loves to trick me into going to seafood places by getting their menu online ahead of time and reading to me about a really great sounding vegetarian salad or sandwich. And it totally works. He gets his fish and I get my tofu and, in this case, we both get a new favorite place. We'll definitely be back...like once a week.
author: Emily F.

description:
My new favorite restaurant.  On this sunny day in the Marina, we came here for lunch.  It was early, so we got seated right away.  There's a big menu on the wall and they gave us our own menus as well.  After scanning the menu, I wanted EVERYTHING.  But of course, that wasn't doable.  So, we settled for the following:

He had - The BBQ Mahi Mahi Salad, the Shitake Miso Soup and the lemongrass ginger iced tea.  I had a bite of it and it was very good.  The salad wasn't overly drenched with dressing and the sweet corn was a great addition to the combo.  The Shitake Miso Soup was amazing.  It came with soft tofu and chopped pieces of asparagus.  The flavor was perfect, not too salty.  And it didn't taste like the kind some restaurants make from a powder package.

I had - The Grilled Mahi Mahi sandwich with sweet potato fries, along with the lemongrass ginger iced tea.  My sandwich was spectacular.  The combination of aioli sauce with the sandwich was perfection.  My sweet potato fries came with a spicy sweet and sour sauce and YES, Keane is right in his review...even Jesus loves these fries!!

We shared - the Ahi Poke for an appetizer and it brought back memories of Hawaii for me.  Since we sat at the bar, there was a bottle of Sriracha in front of us.  I had a few drops and it made the Poke taste EVEN BETTER, if that's at all possible.  We both scarfed it down in no time.  

At the end of our meal, I told Adolfo that I want to come back and try everything else on the menu!!!  The service was great as well!
author: Selene K.

description: Wow my food was so good i had to jump on here to say something. MOST FRESH AHI SALAD AND GREENS EVER. I don't like fish all that much but all the stuff here is so scrumptious. this might be my first five stay ever!
author: Artemis R.

description:
I heard about Pacific Catch around a month ago, and have been there 4 times since. Unlike most of the other reviews, however, I am not a big fan of the wasabi rice bowls...I think the dressing/sauce or whatever you call it makes the rice soggy and leaves a sour aftertaste reminiscent of those post-drinking bile-vomiting glory days. Yes, we've all been there...

So, why 4-stars? Their fried items are OFF THE HEEZY! The fried oysters are FAT, SUCCULENT, and BEAUTIFULLY BATTERED. Dunk that baby in the tartare sauce for some serious oral pleasure...Their "catch of the day" fish n' chips items are also great because while it's deep-fried, isn't dripping in oil.

Overall, just a great place to have a beer, down a few shots of their murky (unfiltered) nigori sake, and exchange a few glaces with Jennifer...the attractive hapa waitress (even more reason to go).

Enjoy!
author: Andrew L.

description:
Was so sad to leave SF because of Pacific Catch. Their rice/salad bowls are amazing. Their poke always delicious. I've never had a bad experience here and if I could would eat there at least 1x a week. Sweet potato fries are amazing too! The prices are great for what you get and there's rarely a wait. If you're in Marin, you hit the one in Larkspur!

Of course not everyone has the same love affair I have with PC, but I even made a point to get it for my last decent lunch before Burning Man last year.
author: Jessie H.

description:
Food that's nutritious AND delicious?  And affordable?  And convenient?  Is it even possible here in the city?

Yes.  Yes, it is.  Say 'hello' to one of my favorite casual dining spots in THE WORLD -- Pacific Catch, where I can order a Wasabi Bowl with fish and brown rice for under $15!  

I always bring friends from out of town here if they're looking to experience the best of SF on a budget.  No one has ever been disappointed, and they ALWAYS tell me later how much they miss the food for it is truly crave-worthy!  

And they even put Sriracha on all the tables.  Thank you for invading my deepest desires, Pacific Catch.
author: Julie N.

description:
I'm almost mad at myself that it took me so long to try this place. Finally fish tacos worth eating. I've been disappointed so many times by half-hearted tries by restaurants who think replacing meat with fried fish makes a fish taco. I can taste that the chefs at Pacific Catch actually put time and thought into crafting several perfectly balanced fish and shrimp taco recipies. I love these tacos. 
The perfection of their tacos trickled down to their sweet potato fries. I'm not generally a fan of sweet potato fries, but these are better than most types of fries, idaho, curly, or whatever.
I just hope my obsession with their tacos allows me a chance to try their other dishes, all of which look to be just as good.
author: Jay M.

description:
All around, this is a great place to eat now that summer is approaching. After checking out the HOW WEIRD festival, my friend suggested we try their poke bowl. Parking here is a bit of a hassle, so dont come here already hungry and cranky because a line WILL await you once you get to the restaurant. The size is reminiscent of Japanese restaurants you will find in Tokyo, only with a Socal twist to the interior look. There are about 4 tables that each seat 2-3 ppl. and a bar that sits around 8. We decided to sit at the bar where we could see our dinner being prepared. Very awesome selection of food, of course you'll have to start off w/ the sweet potatoe fries w/ wasabi mayo and sweet n sour sauces to dip them. SOOO GOOD! The poke bowl was huge with large chunks of poke to the point I was thinking how will I finish? Great value as well. $11 for a bowl.. and their service was attentive and friendly. I give these girls props for multitasking and taking on the phone-in orders while not forgetting to add the 1/2 sprite to my lemonade. She remembered each time I asked for a refill, now thats service! 

PS. Dont have your suppressed clausterphobia issues come up here.
author: Thomas L.

description:
This place rocks! The only thing that would make this place better is a larger space to accommodate more diners and shorten the wait. My friend and I ate at the bar bc we simply didn't want to wait any longer for a table. I think I would come here every week if I could!  Overall, the service wasn't that great but its a pretty casual place and they're really busy. Our waiter was awesome. He was totally passionate about the food here and knew how to make our mouths water. I was salivating even before I knew what I wanted to order. He did however disappear for the rest of the meal. Oh well. 

I ordered the wasabi bowl with the poke, which sent me into immediate bliss. It had a little bit of everything I wanted! Tuna, avocado, cucumber, seaweed salad, daikon sprouts, lettuce and brown rice. The flavors were great! Mmm... Delish!   We also had the calamari special, which I found out later was completely overpriced. Whoops! The tiny basket of calamari was very yummy but definitely not worth $9. Will stick to the sweet potato fries next time. The grilled asparagus was also great. Overall, I just really loved how fresh and reasonably priced everything was (with the exception of the calamari of course). I walked out feeling full and happy.
author: Lauren Y.

description:
Love their sweet potato fries! If you're a merchant, it's definitely a bargain to eat here. They used to hand out fliers advertising lunch specials for local merchants. I don't know if they still do that. I love their California salmon sandwich. It's huge! I have never been able to finish it in one sitting. I don't feel that their tacos are anything special because the avocado cream sauce kind of overpowers everything else. 

This location is pretty small compared to the other one. I prefer sitting at the bar rather than the front because there's more traffic up front. I like to get take out when I'm working because they're pretty fast at that.
author: Maggie L.

description:
I LOVE the BBQ shrimp tacos.
They are the Tacos that I've ever had.
I want to eat there every day.
Seriously, it's THAT GOOD
author: Scott K.

description:
I WANT to hate this place.  I NEED to hate this place.  Every inch of my body wants to secretly bomb this place.  But I don't.  In fact, I kinda dig it.  Who am I kidding, I love it!  There I said it.  Go ahead, judge me.

I love it because it deserves it.  Despite the fact that it's in the heart of the Marina and full of Marina-ites who jam themselves in the 2X4 restaurant, this place rocks it out.  

The food is awesome.  I mean, I could eat ahi poke for every friggin' meal and never get sick of it.  I love the ginger dressing they use, I love how they season their rice and that you can order brown rice if you'd like to.  I love that they have a plethera of fried shit that I don't even think about ordering because their healthy shit is like a sinful little treat on a bed of naughty greens soaked in that bitchin' ginger dressing.  

mama wants to spank her meal every time she orders it.
author: Justine H.

description:
I'm a sweet potato fries fanatic. Ever since my first encounter, I've been on a search for THE best out there. My bf and I came here, AFTER having lunch (and a side of sweet potato fries) at Hank's Eats. Our first choice would have been to try Pearl's, but that was closed on Sunday. Unfortunately for us.

Let's just say Hank's Eats' version of sweet potato fries are dry, and frail looking, like shriveled grape, in string cheese form. Yelp it, they look exactly as you'd see them. I was NOT enthused. SO began my journey to Pacific Catch. 

We started on the corner of Post and Polk, and headed in the direction of the Marina - having been there multiple weekend nights for late-night pizza, I knew exactly where to go. Shouldn't be too hard to find... a half hour goes by, and I've driven from the Fillmore area back towards Golden Gate. Apparently I haven't been to Post St enough times, because I didn't realize it was one street over from Lombard! 

Half hour later, and sweet potato fries in hand, I was ready to go home. Idiot of a woman parks her car on a one way (one-lane) street, going the WRONG direction, so I cave in and have the fries in the car. TOTALLY WORTH IT. I don't dig the wasabi like sauce, OR the eggroll dipping sauce they've given me with the order. The fries themselves (FRESH) are excellent, not so much after a half hour drive home.

Sweet potatoe fries here ARE excellent.
author: Angela C.

description:
We started off with he Crispy Fresh Oyster Basket ($8.95). YUM! The oysters are deep fried in canola oil and you can't even taste the oil! I had the Sushi-Grade Ahi Salad ($9.95). It is like a never ending bowl! There is avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, pickled ginger carrots and tomatoes with a WONDERFUL soy-wasabi vinaigrette dressing.....Co Workers had Thai Coconut Shrimp ($10.95) which was good but a little over done and the ahi Tuna Wasabi bowl ($10.95). The Tuna was very tender and delicious. BUT the main focus was on the very yummy sweet potato fries. They go quick and are worth ordering multiple baskets.

I would rate it 5 stars BUT the place is small.....very very small and you feel like everyone is sitting at the same table or even on your lap!
author: Jeannine V.

description:
Healthy hole in the wall. Don't expect to find parking or a table and seriously... don't bring a date here unless you guys have been dating for a long time as it's not romantic. 

Order the salad with tuna poke. It's like sushi without all the rice! comes with ginger, seaweed salad, avocado, and more. 
The salmon sandwich is great. If you feel like being healthy, this is a great place to get takeout. If you can, I would call ahead to pick up and double park for a quick in and out. Avoid the organic place around the corner "Lettus" which sucks.
author: Noel H.

description:
How come there is no pacific catch in la?? if the owners of pacific catch read this review.. can you please contact me so we can open one up in la?

great food.. fresh fish..cute cozy location..
I was walking by and despite having dinner reservations in 3 hours I decided to grap a quick bite to eat here.. because it looked sooo good.  
I thought I could have a few bites.. but I ended up cleaning my bowl..
author: Nasim R.

description:
My boyfriend and I come to Pacific Catch often and I highly recommend it as a great option for yummy asian fusion style seafood. In fact, when my exhusband was driving through SF this past weekend, I routed him there. And we get along and everything...it's not like I was trying to poison him. =) 

Back to the food...I usually get the spicy ahi sandwich with sweet potato fries, the salmon wasabi bowl, or the crispy shrimp tacos. I highly recommend all of these items. I've also had the coconut shrimp app...also very good. 

The only thing I will complain about is the wait for when dining in as the place is prohibitively small but it seems to me that the portions and quality are not as high when you do take out. The cost is also rather expensive, as I pay almost $30 for two meals (entrees only). But all in all it is so tasty, that I will happily keep coming here and telling others to go as well.
author: marisa g.

description:
Great place to grab a quick bite or get to go. Fresh food- great fish or seafood tacos, big salads with real crab, ahi poke and the sweet potato fries are good too!

They need to move to a bigger space though- really cramped in there.
author: Paige B.

description:
This place is awesome! I have been multiple times... had a sandwich once, its was solid... not great. But the fish tacos are grade A... I'm talk Bruce lee shit! 

Most fish taco's are pretty plain, no bells or whistle... Pacific Catch makes exactly the opposite. A gourmet fish taco you could say. I have had 4-5 of the 6-7 choices on the menu, all have been great. 

The sweet potato fries are also ((((VERY))) good... you can also get them to spice'm up a bit with a paprika-based seasoning, but i would say go standard for your first visit and then experiment. I have also heard that the salads are very good, I keep saying I will try one the next time I go, but when I get there I HAVE to get the tacos. One of these days.....

This is one of my favorite spots in the Marina, I would highly recommend it to anyone.
author: Blake W.

description:
So here's a little story;
After a night of hookah and some mild drinking a bunch of silly billies think- hey nice weather, lets go to OB.
We get there and since every fire pit is taken, we decide to make friends. Lucky for my Spanish speaking friends we made some cute amigos. Unlucky for me all I can say is "hello", "how are you", "wheres the bathroom" and a ton of bad, naughty words as well as the song "Feliz Navidad"... I digress.
We made some friends who told us about this joint.. SO GLAD they did. A man named Hubert? Who I think is the Sous Chef at the other restaurant was extremely nice. 

I started my delicious adventure off with an extremely fresh Wakame Seaweed Salad. I have had seaweed salad before, but this has made me a believer! It's one of the best I've had and I would really recommend it if you're looking for something new. Then I had the grilled Mahi Mahi. SOO unbelievably good. You have no idea. And as for drinks, I was super happy they served Long Board, and a friend of mine had some sake. Great experience and would LOVE to come here again!
author: Amanda S.

description: Pacific Catch is a great little restaurant with fresh food in the Marina that isn't too expensive. I probably come in once every 2 weeks for their hawaiian poke app (salty chips and fresh tuna, mmm) and two taco platter with sweet potato fries. Be careful, I found their spice-rubbed mahi mahi taco too spicy for me, but I'm pretty sensitive to anything hot. Friend had the teriyaki rice bowl with salmon - delicious and seemed pretty healthy!
author: Christine H.

description:
We couldn't have been more lucky...found the place... AND scored a table inside at our first crack! And for a place this size..."Who'd-a-thunkit" 

Okay so again, we heard about Pacific Catch, thru friends; who like all of us here on Yelp, love to travel and try the good grinds where ever they may hide. You know about those places, they try not to get discovered, especially by you. But not today, not by no means, no how! 

It's 10:30-ish, and  we're staying at the Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf, and decide that we'll walk (yeah said walk) to the Marina district for lunch at Pacific Catch, and y'all know that a map is a piece of paper that is "FLAT!!!" Not like the inevitable hills that San Fran is known for. ( NO SH--!) 
But I gotta say the self induced walking tour did wonders for our appetite, and it was a nice scenic stroll to boot, and as luck would have it ....see top. 

I'd say it's a wee bit small, but the staff made up for it, really friendly and connecting. Shoots.... We'll have two Sierra Nevada's please!!( It's gotta be 12:00 somewhere) 
Ice cold beer after a good walk, not bad eh? Bev (that's my partner in crime) had the Thai Coconut Shrimp for her app. and I had the Hawaiian Poke. Both were very tasty and matched perfectly with our brews. 
For her entree, she chose the meal sized Ahi Salad, and gotta say again great choice, Jus love them Daikon Sprouts. So refreshing, with all those different flavors exploding in your mouth,and yes... good with ice cold beer. I had the Poke Wasabi Bowl, and when it came, I was in awe... That's a lotta food. You know, there's something about seasoned raw fish, along with tasty veggies, (and don't forget the Daikon Sprouts) all on a giant bed of HOT rice. ( and gotta be hot, the hotter the better) and the poke sauce jus dripping down thru the veggies, down into the rice, and making it all nice nice. Oh hell you know what I mean. And that!!!... my friends goes great with "ICE COLD BEER! ' And for the price, totally reasonable, I'm a happy camper now. 
Even the walk back was good. 

Went up towards the Bay, and took the customary picture of us with The Golden Gate Bridge in the background ( don't you just luv-it!) took the trail up and thru Fort Mason Park, and down to the cove, around to the ship museum, back to Jefferson, straight to Sheraton. Ahhh, made it! 

Whew! I'm tired .... but wait ...look there... I see a siesta with our name on it, now how lucky is that. "TWO" scores in one day...unbelievable! But before I go (yaawwnnn!!!), check out Pacific Catch, it's worth the walk.

nye-nye
author: Joe K.

description:
Superb! This is one of my favorite places for a fun, casual dinner.

I have to admit that I fell so much in love with the wasabi rice bowls (brown rice with ahi, poke or salmon) that I have never tried anything else. They are enormous, healthy and delicious. The sweet potato fries are not to be missed either. 

There can be a line because it is such a small space, but it moves fairly quickly and you can always put your name in and take a stroll down Chestnut St.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Be aware......this place is always packed!

This place is one of my SF staples.  I have never had a meal from here that didn't hit the spot!  The best fish tacos I've ever had!  Did I mention their sweet potato french fries?  Too die for!  I usually order my food to go and drive 2 minutes to the Marina Greens or back to the house; therefore, I don't have to wait to indulge in one of my favorite comfort meals.
author: Marie E.

description: OK, all you Weight Watchers out there.  You can't go wrong with the entree Salmon Salad....a nice portion of grilled salmon (you don't have to eat the high calorie skins) sitting atop a huge bowl of fresh, crispy mixed greens, some asparagus tips, some baby tomatoes, all lightly dressed with citrus-miso dressing.  With a hot genmai tea, you've stayed well within your points for the day.  For those of you not watching your points, try the Dungeness crab/bacon/corn/red pepper chowder.  The tastes blend and stand out at the same time.  So pretty to look at, too.  My husband loved the spicy fries with his mahi mahi tacos.  Kudos to Corey for checking in with us and letting us know about foursquare!
author: Liana T.

description: Amazing. I used to live a couple blocks from this place, so I've tried most of the dishes and taken many friends and family here for lunch. The food never disappoints.  I was reminded of this last weekend when I ordered a poke bowl from the Pacific Catch booth at outside lands and we made it disappear in seconds.  Whatever you get, throw in a side order of sweet potato fries.  2-3 years ago, this place was where my obsession with these orange sticks began.
author: Michael J.

description: Great food, good value, really nice waitstaff.  What more could you ask for?  I don't like sweet potatoes, so I didn't have the sweet potato fries...but I did have the grilled corn which was delicious.  I got the ahi tuna wasabi bowl which was a huge portion of food...for only $10.95.  So good.  I only wish it was closer to me...
author: Wendy L.

description: I love this place.  Its nothing fancy and if you want to eat there be prepared to wait as the venue is incredibly small.  Having said that - it is worth the wait.   Their food is great and although sweet potatoe fries sound weird, they are yummy.   Haven't had anything there that I didn't like.
author: Madhuri K.

description: The sweet potato fries were killer! And I absolutely loved the grilled salmon sandwich. Really cute chill place for lunch on a sunny day. The only downside was there was kind of a long wait (30-40 minutes).  It was fine though, we just hopped over next door to Circa and grabbed a glass of wine.
author: Debbie C.

description: Very yummy food but the tables are pretty crammed together... everything on the menu was very tempting and I definitely need to go back sometime. We shared the fried clams which I'm sure were super unhealthy but extra good. I then opted for an ahi salad which was big with lots of ingredients and delicious! I definitely plan to go back for another casual dining experience...
author: Meghan P.

description:
Was really between 3 or 4 stars (this whole 5 star thing is so limiting to me, bring on the half stars please Yelp!)...although quite small, thought the location and atmosphere was nice, especially on a nice sunny day in the Marina. Came in during happy hour which had a nice $3 and $6 menu for starters.
Ordered:
Sweet Potato Fries- these were surprisingly very delicious and a must-order! I would give this 5 stars, the included white sauce had wasabi undertones that I loved..
Hawaiian Poke Bowl- a nice mix of ahi poke, wakame salad, avocado, sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori & soy-wasabi sauce...I really wanted to love this in that I'm a huge fan of ahi poke, but I felt the ahi was not as 'melt in your mouth' fresh as it could have been and was left a bit disappointed
My friends went Korean BBQ marinated skirt steak bowl and the California Salmon Sandwich and they were very pleased with their dishes, so I will definitely come back and test the menu with those options or even try the poke again (could have just been a bad day)  
Service was great, friendly and attentive!
author: Mahsa K.

description: Went here while visiting family...food here was delicious.  Tried the following appetizers: hawaiian poke, sweet potato fries and thai coconut shrimp.  Thought all of the appetizers were great...especially liked the poke and sweet potato fries.  For my entree, I ordered the hawaiian poke wasabi bowl...this made my meal.  The poke was fresh and they gave a good quantity of the poke.  I liked that the wasabi wasn't overpowering...they were also quick with getting our orders out and the service I thought was satisfactory.  I'd definitely go here again.
author: Charles L.

description:
When I want fast food, but healthy, and fresh...I love their poke here. They do it pretty good and they give you plenty for a reasonable price.  Also the sweet potato fries are bomb-ee!!
Enjoy!
author: Miss B.

description:
I've had the pleasure, and it is a true pleasure, of lunching at Pacific Catch a couple of times in my business travels. The service has always been quick and friendly and the food fresh and tasty. 

The grilled artichoke makes a good starter and is reasonable priced. For main courses, I've sampled several varieties of their Island Tacos and have NEVER been disappointed. Best of all, their sweet potato fries are among the best I've ever had...lightly salted and served with wasabi aioli and sweet chili dipping sauces. 

It is clear to me that this is a restaurant with some serious depth in their menu and I know that I have just scratched the surface. I will probably return next time I'm in the area for another round!
author: Dave W.

description:
Perfect when you want something satisfying but not heavy. Grab a Pacifico, order the Shrimp Ceviche and watch the people go by on Chestnut Street. The ceviche is delicious with lots of shrimp for an affordable $7.50. 

Fish & Chips ($11-15), Mahi Mahi Chipotle Salad ($11) and the shrimp tacos (plate of 2 for $10) are also recommended. Prices are reasonable and although it's less of a scene, I think the food is much tastier than the similar fare down the street at Mamacitas (and about half the price). It's a little cramped and crowded, but Pacific Catch also does a brisk take-out business. 

And, it holds a special place in my heart as the only place where I have willingly eaten avocado. Yes, I was born in California and I don't like avocado... but marinated in the deliciousness of the ceviche, it didn't taste half bad!
author: Erin M.

description: I just moved to the neighborhood and everyone told me to check out Pacific Catch.  It did not disappoint!  The Hawaiian Poke appetizer is a must-have although I wish they cut the pieces a little smaller because it was hard to eat on the crackers.  I had the fish tacos and love that you can mix and match them to try a few different kinds.  My friend had the ahi tuna rice bowl, which also looked fantastic and very healthy.  The only drawback is that the place is tiny!  There are 6 tables inside and 3 outside.  So, this is not the place to enjoy a leisurely dinner.  You can see people waiting for the in-demand tables so we felt a bit rushed to get out of there.  I'd definitely go back.
author: Shawna M.

description:
Bummer I didn't discover this place until after I moved out of the neighborhood, because the food here was fantastic. 

To start we split the fried calamari, which was fresh and crispy, and served with an intensely spiced chipotle sauced on the side.  Also included with the calamari were a couple deep fried lemons and tomatoes...nice little surprise that ended up being my favorite (and unexpected) part of the dish. 

Next I had the spicy ahi sandwich, which was grilled rare and came with chipotle mayo and avocado on a toasted ciabattaish roll. Came with sweet potato fries and a couple more dipping sauces (wasabi mayo and citrus aioli), all different and very tasty. The boy tried the grilled salmon salad with asparagus and mushrooms, which was also very good.  
 
It was a bit surprising that with 3 servers and about 5 tables, the service was slow and disorganized, although the food definitely made up for it. I also heard a much bigger Pacific Catch was opening soon in the Sunset, which will be a nice alternative to the tiny diner-like space of the current PC in the Marina.
author: Kelly R.

description:
This place doesn't need another review, but I don't care.  I'm gonna do it anyway.

Everytime I come back, it makes me happy.  When I go with friends I usually urge them to order the sweet potato fries and the wasabi bowl with unagi.  

Oh, and the unlimited thai teas.  I think I always give myself the goal of drinking three.  Anymore than that and I wouldn't be able to eat my meal, and that would be sad.

Plus, the portions are pretty large (at least for me) and I can make two meals out of one trip.  Yes, leftover Pacific Catch is just as good as fresh off the griddle (grill? stove? oven?  whatever) Pacific Catch.  But yes, be prepared for a long wait.

A final plus - I'm still fairly new to SF, and when I take my visiting friends here they think I have the best taste.  Har.  Sure fooled them.
author: Shay F.

description:
Too bad I live in Daly City because this place is PERFECT for a healthy meal.  I love the Wasabi bowl with Ahi Tuna and order it with half-brown rice and half-salad.  Also, they are reasonably priced considering the freshness of the food and the portion size.

I could not have said it better than Jamie V. in that you "won't feel like a chub after you mow it down..." Words of a true wise woman!!
author: Karen B.

description: Great food! Try their seared ahi and their pacific catch mix& match!!! Delicious :)
author: Eni R.

description:
I love the unique fresh flavors of the meals here at Pacific Catch. They offer fish rice bowls to fish tacos a variety of fresh fish meals.

The Poke Appetizer is scrumptious as well as the Spicy Mahi Mahi Sandwich. Yum Yum! Sure the seating is a lil tight, but with foods that fresh and delicious...who cares!?!
author: Susie O.

description: Yum. Fish tacos!! The special Ahi taco was much better than the Baja taco. The sweet potato fries were great. Only negative: had to ask for another IPA rather than being offered one.
author: O'Brien J.

description:
Have been here twice - and both times, have left knowing that I would have to come back.  I highly recommend the raw Ahi Tuna wasabi bowl and the sweet potato fries!  mmm SO DELICIOUS!  
The place is rather small with only a few tables, so it is definitely not good for big groups.  You may have to wait, but the service is fast so it shouldn't be too long to get a table.  Had a great time and  I will be back!
author: John G.

description: Thank god this place is so close to where I live. I order take out all the time from there when I'm too lazy to eat in. I get cravings for their sweet potato fries weekly and the sweet sauce that they pair with them make it heavenly. Their bbq salmon sandwich is my go to item on the menu its such a great mixture of flavors I can't even think about it. I enjoy everything except the rice bowls, not a fan.
author: Sadie L.

description:
Had I written this review 3 months ago I probably would have given it a 4. Thing is, this is one of those places that gets less enjoyable with subsequent visits. 

I like their poke wasabe bowl, but I'm almost over it. I doubt I'll go back any time soon. Service is good, food is well prepared and fresh, just kinda boring, though.

A little pricey for what you get, also.
author: Jason R.

description: I don't know that this place really needs another review... but if it hadn't been for their free advertisement on the iPhone commercial, I wouldn't have ever heard about Pacific Catch.  Cute tiny place, nice food, friendly service, even though it was a little slow at times, which doesn't help when the place is so small and there's a long line waiting out the door.
author: Jasmine L.

description:
I cannot wait until they open the one on 9th closer to my home.

I tend to always order the same thing and it never fails me. The California Crab Rice Bowl is like an orgasmic exposion of crab and avocado in my pants.  I love it more then sushi.  I love it more then my favorite Wham! song ('Everything She Wants!'), which is what I listened to on the bus ride home after going COMPLETELY out of my way to pick up some crab bowl for dinner.

P.S. The Sweet Potato Fries are ok too.
author: Jen I.

description: Went with my family and our dog, and ate outside. The food was fabulous and the service was excellent. Wife and I had salads with grilled salmon that was both tasty and quite filling (OK, so we also split sweet potato fries).  Our server brought out a deep dish filled with water for our pooch. This is not the first time we've been there, and we've always had good food and service. Also, it's extremely family-friendly.
author: Bill W.

description: Don't get me wrong -- the food here is delicious. But there's just something about horrible service that ruins even the best of meals. Pacific Catch is in my neighborhood, so I go there quite often. I keep thinking that maybe one day I'll get decent service, but every time I'm left sitting there with an empty glass and an uneasy feeling from the attitude I was just served up by my waitress.
author: Melissa A.

description:
Good Wasabi Bowls. My friend had the Unagi and I had the seared fish. 
The poke could be better, but still pretty good. Happy hour drinks are priced good, but I wouldn't come during the regular dinner time.
author: De F.

description:
Tiny restaurant with big taste! After a long afternoon of St. Patty's engagements, I was excited about some food! Along with three other friends, we plopped into Pacific Catch for a quick meal. Luckily we were able to grab seats at the bar and didn't have to wait.
The service was fair -they ran out of brown rice so we had to alter our orders but everything still came rather quickly. I had the tacos -crispy shrimp and mahi mahi, with a side of sweet potato fries. Everything was perfectly delicious. 
I noticed some people were on dates -NOT a date place. Super casual.
author: Rada I.

description:
My girlfriend and I worked up a sweat at Crunch and decided we deserved a deep fried reward at Pacific Catch. We each tucked into a four piece fish and chip plate. And it was goooood. The sweet potato fries are more delicious than the fries at Taylor's Refresher. No lies.

The service was nice but a little if-y sometimes. It looked pretty stressful behind the counter but it would have been nice to have a consistently full glass of water to sip from.
author: Jacquee P.

description:
I've been here once, and it's alright. Nothing to rave about, nothing to hate. I appreciate the variety on the menu, but part of my ambivilence might be because I was looking for something heartier to eat that night. No compliants, though - it was good food and definitely got me full. But the bar for food in SF is so freakin' high, I couldn't justify giving it 4 stars when other places do better.

If you're a local and want variety, it's worth checking out. I'll return again sometime.
author: Gregg G.

description:
I crave their sweet patatoe fries!! 

It's a small place, always packed during peak hours of course! So there's always a wait. But if you're lucky on a nice sunny day, there's 2 tables outside.
author: Judi K.

description:
Featured in Apple's new iPhone commercial.... mmmm, did somebody say Calamari?
http://www.apple.com/iphone/ads/ad2/
author: Jason R.

description:
YUM....my cousin and I split the spicy mahi mahi sandwich and sweet potato fries.  It wa the perfect size for a small lunch.  Although it was so good, that next time I think I will order a whole one to myself.

I usually do not order fish, but this sandwich was GREAT.  Also would have never wanted to order sweet potato fries, but they are seriously to die for.  I can't wait to go back and get more.

They were really nice about us splitting the meal....the even brought it out in two baskets already split.

Seating can be an issue at this place, but we went before the dinner rush and just waited about 5 minutes for a table to open up outside.

I will definitely come back here sometime...mmmm!
author: Neety P.

description:
My roomie and I catch a bus on weekdays, just to eat their Wasabi ball with seard Ahi or poke with brown rice. I think its sooo goood.
That sauce that they have is yummY!

Its a good week nights dinner.
author: Mika G.

description: Yum yum yum. The place is very tiny but food is great. two had fish and chips,hot, crispy and with malt vinegar, one had salad and one had Opah absolutely no complaints from anyone. Price was Excellant for SF plus all items are from sustainable farms. Would most definitely return next time in SF. We had a dog with us so sat outside. They turned the overhead heat on for us and we were more than comfortable. We showered up before opening and as we had 2 disabled people with us they allowed us to be seated immediately and brought us water. This place is very busy, but staff is attentive without hovering or rushing you.Oh and the  swett potato fries which i normally dont like had the perfect amount of crisp and seasoning, grilled veggies and sauces are to die for.
author: Hubbahubba V.

description:
Can't go wrong with this place, food is served fast but tastes like all the care in the world was put into making it. A bottle of sake and a wasabi bowl with fresh tuna is $20 and you will be more than full. 

This would be a great cheap date place without looking like you are trying to save some cash.
author: lars H.

description:
chuck only gave it 4 stars. what gives chuck "E" b.? your salad was delicious even with the low calorie dressing. 
great happy hour.
author: Jean-Marc R.

description: This is the kind of place I would religiously patron if I was a resident of San Francisco.  The Ceviche is a delicious limey avocado cocktail and the rice bowls are precious to the palate. Small but perfect beer selection.
author: ashley o.

description: This place is great. My roommate had been raving about it for months and we finally went for my birthday. The sweet potato fries were amazing, as was the Japanese Rice Bowl with 1/2 brown rice and 1/2 greens with tofu. Yum! The hype was true!
author: Jan S.

description: I don't make it to SF very often, but when I get a chance I like to stop by Pacific Catch. I love their Ahi Poke Salad (think deconstructed sushi roll without the rice) which is awesome.  The place isn't huge so come off hours (we were there on a Friday for lunch) and there isn't a problem finding a place.  Friendly, helpful service adds to the overall experience.  Everything we got was really fresh and tasty, so if you are in the neighborhood, or looking for somewhere to stop in for some seafood, go to Pacific Catch.
author: Jeff R.

description: I absolutely love Pacific Catch!  Their food is incredible and their staff is great.  My favorites are the ahi poke, grilled artichoke, and sweet potatoe fries.  I also love the ahi wasabi bowl with brown rice and their shrimp tacos.  We recently tried a salmon sandwich that is my boyfriend's favorite by far.  I love coming here because the staff make you feel welcome and they always give great recommendations.  It's delicious food for a great price!
author: Arica V.

description:
A regular stop during my weekly rotation of dinner spots in my neighborhoodd.  Good, fresh fish, friendly service.  The wasabi or terriyaki bowls are my staples, but the fish tacos and fish and chips (w/the sweet potato fries) are also good.

I'd eat here more often, but probably wouldn't bode well for my mercury levels.
author: Simon N.

description:
Over-priced, undercooked rice, mediocre fish (especially raw), uncomfortable dining space.  Sweet potatoe fries are good, but not worth going for.  

This place seems to get a lot of hype.  Every time I've been the rice has been undercooked (no sushi rice should not be served al dente!) and
author: Evan A.

description:
Type of food: Hawaiian fusion (er... I guess that's sort of redundant)

Favorite dish: Poki Wasabi Bowl (hold the ginger)

Positives:
If you like ahi tuna, this place has delicious plates that they make with Ahi. There are two great dishes, their Wasabi Ahi Tuna Bowl, which is basically rice on the bottom, with seared ahi tuna sliced on top, ginger, wakame salad, cucumber, and sprouts. Fantastic. The Wasabi Poki Bowl is chopped Tuna Sashimi (cubbed actually) that's marinated in some sort of light wasabi, soy sauce, ginger (actually i have no idea, i'm making this up) sauce but it's by far my favorite dish there.

Their sweet potato fries are BETTER than Taylor's. That's right. I said it.

Their wakame salad is good too. Hey, it's wakame salad, if you can't get that right... And it's hard to really tell FANTASTIC wakame salad from just OK ones. But it works, I like it, and I get it all the time.

I'm not a huge fan of fish/shrimp tacos but I do like theirs. I'm not a good enough judge of fish tacos to tell you if its better than other places, but I think they're pretty good. But I'd rather have the wasabi bowls to be honest.

Negatives
Crowded. Expect a 15-20 minute wait. The place is tiny, and there's not a lot of room to wait, except outside. Also, there's not a ton of leg room when you do eat inside. But it seems like us Friscans are all about the total package. When it comes to a place like this, screw the ambiance, I'm there for tasty food. Ambiance snobbery all you want, but man, I'd eat here anyday. 

BTW, one last negative. You can order too much food. Yes, it's tasty.

Finally, don't get the chicken. Dry, tough, not very tasty. Stick with the thing they do best, the fish. 

Service

Decent. I mean, you don't go there for the service. Or the ambiance. You go there for the food. The service isn't horrible, but its busy so can be hard to get attention sometimes. But then again, its small, so theres only so many places they can run!!!

Summary
Delicious, it's why its crowded. Go for the fish dishes, stay away from the chicken, and be prepared for major food comage.
author: Seiji N.

description:
I always get the Poke Japanese Rice Bowl.  It's amazing.  The fact that they offer brown rice really makes me happy.  After the meal I am completely stuffed, but in a good way.  I feel like I had an interesting healthy meal.  
The sweet potato fries rock.
author: sara b.

description:
Having  heard SO much about this Marina catch...I made my way there for an early dinner, and I am so not disappointed!  On the contrary I had an awesome fried fish sandwich..called the "pacific catch sand which" which is not on the menu but worth asking for.

The fries were excellent and the Sapporo was ice cold...ting*
author: Catrinel A.

description:
I am big fan of the bowls.  Not the ones w/ the funky pineapple chutney, yet the other ones leaning more to the Japanese side.  The food is pretty good yet if you do not go at an "off hour" you will for sure be waiting for a table or freeze eating outside.  I must say the sweet potato fries and artichokes are quiet good.  I am an artichoke freak so it makes me very pleased that they have grilled artichokes.
It is good for a quick neighborhood bite.
author: Nicole F.

description:
I love eating at pacific catch. The salads are great and i will occasionally get an order of the fish and chips.

My only beef is with the number of seats and the wait!!!! Do your self a favor....call in your order instead and eat at home!
author: Alden H.

description:
This review is solely based on the Hawaiian Poke Salad as a take-away item at the Marina location. I am not really a fan of the rice bowls or waiting for a table in the smaller marina restaurant. The Inner Sunset location is much better for actually eating at the restaurant.

For me the Hawaiian Poke salad is my go to option. It  is served with avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, pickled ginger, carrots, baby tomatoes, toasted sesame seeds & soy-wasabi vinaigrette. I would also recommend getting the dressing on the side.
author: Raymond M.

description:
I love this place.  It's always a pretty good comprimise between people.
Anyone can get something tasty here.
It's a little too small of a venue, so I hope they expand their businesses all over the place to accommodate the growing need for healthy restaurants on the cheap.
author: Josepe M.

description: I tried this place on the recommendation of a motel in the district. I made it clear we didn't need anything up-scale--just good food. If I lived there it could be my favorite. Great menu, neighborhood ambiance, friendly and funky. Cooks are serious about food prepared and served well.
author: Dennis O.

description: LOVE their Poke wasabi bowl. It is so huge and filled with freshness. Poke, seaweed, rice, veggies, etc. SOOOO good. Fast and friendly service and reasonably priced! Will be back to get some poke! :)
author: Mel P.

description: My husband and I tried out Pacific Catch for the first time yesterday.  It was great.  I normally do not like Asian Fusion, but this place made it work.  Everything was very fresh and flavorful.  I had the crab sandwich with sweet potato fries and my husband had the Mahi Mahi salad.  We also shared a calamari.    Thumbs up!
author: Tynisa S.

description: Good, simple fish dishes at a reasonable price with friendly service.
author: Peter J.

description:
everybody raves about the sweet potato fries, which i'll agree is pretty dam good.  next time i'll order just that...

but my grilled salmon on rice with artichoke was just ok.  the salmon wasn't very tasty, kinda overcooked too.  dont think its worth the $19 bucks.
author: Ethan L.

description:
Not so bad, but not so great either. I find it hard to believe, as apparently both Yelp and Urban Spoon do, that this is the best seafood to be had in San Francisco.

We started with an Ahi Poke appetizer. It was pretty good, but there were a few cuts of fish that frankly had no business being in there -- end pieces, etc. It just wasn't carefully prepared. 

The special of the day came with either salmon or spearfish. I asked the (very friendly) waitress which she liked, and she said she had only had the salmon. Fair enough, but what did the chef think? She went back and asked and the chef admitted that he also hadn't tried the spearfish. In fact, he hadn't been asked to cook it yet. Huh? Kinda strange.

So I got the salmon, and I'll say it was pretty good. Well cooked and seasoned but nothing to write home about. Other friends at the table had fish tacos, and those weren't anything terribly special either.

So, in the end, I felt like this was a pretty okay place to eat fish but I guess not the barrels-and-harpoons-in-the-water style eatery we might have expected.

-Dave
author: Dave P.

description: The poke is amazing.  Great food all around and the bill won't break your bank account.
author: Pete S.

description:
Wasabi bowls are excellent. Sweet potato fries are insane. Get them.

The place is small, so be prepared to wait.
author: jason e.

description:
HOLY SWEET POTATO FRIES- It is pretty darn good here.

I went with a couple friends and they had the happy hour tacos, sweet potato fries, and ceviche while I had the wasabi bowl with hawaiian poke. 

The bowl was good- but not incredibly special. I've had my fair share of hawaiian poke and tuna so this wasn't "to die for" like I had read. My friends, however,  tried my bowl and they REALLY liked it. 

I tried their tacos and LOVED them, especially the mahi mahi taco and the ahi tuna taco. 

Ceviche was pretty good too (but nothing compared to Fresca ceviche).

BUT the fries, those sweet potato fries are surely memorable. Fries are my FAVORITE food of all time. And these were awesome!! Not too crispy, not too soft. Perfect. Nice texture, nice taste, nice seasoning. Well done! 

All in all, very fresh, definitely yummy.
author: katie n.

description:
After I posted my 'meh' review, the manager of Pacific Catch sent a very nice message apologizing and asking for another chance.  I was impressed by the effort, and hope the places cleans up its act.

Having been in the restaurant business for a number of years, I know one bad experience does not necessarily represent the daily offering, so you might want to give it a try.  I'm skipping it tho, just left too bad a ... taste in my mouth, as the saying goes.

Props to the manager for the effort.
author: jack c.

description:
There are very little times in my life after a meal where I am speechless.  Sure there is the occasional binge at say something like Thanksgiving dinner where you eat until you have to cork your mouth shut to keep it all in...those are acceptable days of over endulgement.  Then there are the days where you just feel like you want to spend a little extra big bollah dollah to have a big bollah lunch at work.  That is exactly what mentality I had walking into Pacific Catch and that is exactly what led me to the biggest foodgasm I'd ever had in my young adult life.

I work on Chestnut street so I am within walking distance to this place (Woot, shop at Red Dot! Woot!) Anyways, It was kind of a crazy day, I was stressing big time about some shit that really didnt need to be stressed about, but I just needed to get the hell out for a second.  My friend Amy and I went down the street to try a little Pacific Catch.  I'd never been there before only because their little take out menu gave my wallet a stroke...I could always just go to Taco Bell and get a meal deal and be done with it, but like I said I wanted a little treat and the coconut shrimp sounded right up my alley. 

One minor complaint is that I  think that they should expand their location on Chestnut Street. When you walk in there is a mix of people who have orders to be picked up and people who are waiting to be seated all pressed up against the wall and flowing out onto the street, granted I went there during their lunch rush so I guess that was my fault...I just felt like I was sitting on top of the people who were at tables eating like " Hey guys, how's it goin? That looks good..".  My friend and I took a seat at the bar and our waitress came up to us immediately.  She was a manager there and I swear to God she was the sweetest lady, she looked like she owned the place the way she took care of us.  Extremely sweet.

I ordered the Coconut Shrimp and the catch of the day which was Rock Cod if I remember correctly along with a bottomless Thai Iced Tea....HELL YEAH...I said BOTTOMLESS.  For those of you who like Thai Iced Tea but hate the $2.50 a glass shit out there...PC will hook you right up.  My friend got a salad with salmon on it or something, I dont even remember, I was too engulfed in my plate.

The second I popped that coconut shrimp in my mouth it was like someone turned on a water fountain.  Swear to god my mouth got wet for that shrimp. They popped and were sweet and crunchy and..ugh, holy hell...I might need to hit them back up today...The Rock Cod was exquisite and my Thai Iced Tea kept flowing to wash everything down.  All in all I spent upwards of $40 on lunch.  I just graduated college guys...I don't have that kind of money to spend and you know it was top ramen for the rest of the week for this one splurge, but listen to me...it was SOOOOO WORTH IT!!!!

Little Tid Bit: The awesome manager lady forgot to bring some brown rice or something for my friend and immediately grabbed it for her and took it off the check...just because she forgot it.  I dont know guys...I think that its really hard to find a place in the city where you can get a crazy awesome meal and have the staff treat you like you're the shit even if you don't own a house in the Marina...or a little yippy dog for that matter.  They made me feel like I was extra special, they made the food quickly and it was THE MOST delicious seafood I had ever had the chance to experience.  If you skip going to this place because of the price or how far out it is then you are really hurting your taste buds more than I think you could possibly ever know.  I couldn't have had better food from the ocean if I stuck my head in there myself.  Christ it was tasty.

By the way, if you can't get out to the Marina there is another location in the Avenues on 9th and Lincoln.  I haven't tried it there yet but you bet your ass I'm saving up for that, lol.  Good Eating to you all!!
author: Sarah L.

description: One of my fav places in SF for lunch.  Great food, great prices, and really fun area to hang out afterwards- Chestnut street.  It's a tie between their Poke salad bowl and the Seared Ahi Tuna sandwich with the wasabi spread.  The sweet potato fries are a must.  Everything is pretty much grilled fresh to order and it' all happens in front of you.
author: Thao T.

description:
I'd say my only gripe would be parking,  but I guess that is a whole other topic.

Well worth the effort of parking and on a nice day the wait isn't all bad either.  The people watching is quite plesant as you wait for your table.  I think that the head server/manager person who manages the wait times is a "time optimist" as my wife likes to say.  So the wait was the wait . . .  the question is, is the food worth it?  

I had a Wasabi bowl, and it was pretty darn tasty.  The portion was pretty substantial.  The rice is very tasty and the "wasabi dressing" was not super hot, which for me was good,  if you like atomic level heat, they provide ample extra wasabi for you masochists.

The menu looked pretty good, they have the standard fried fare, and then they have the asian fusion stuff.  Stick to the asian fusion stuff and you are bound to score points.  

Can't go wrong here.  This may become a standard stop for me.
author: C M.

description:
Good quality, nice menu selection and healthy fare.  There are so many options I sometimes have a difficulty time picking what I want to eat.  The food is fantastic, great quality and always fresh.

The only bone I have is their prices.  Some items are reasonably priced then a fish taco ($4 for 1!) comes along and if you saw how small the taco was, you would be pretty disappointed.  You don't get a lot for $15 so I can't eat there nearly as much as some other places, but for the once a week craving, it def. hits the spot.
author: Eli Z.

description:
Yessir... Coconut shrimp and fish tacos...  I've heard good things about the wasabi/teriyaki bowls too!

This place has great/quick food... It's also pretty cheap!

I'd say the only thing that keeps it from getting 5 stars is that if you sit at the end of the bar you've gotta watch dishes being washed and that's not even close to appetizing...

The wait can be a little long so bring something to read or be prepared to do some window shopping on Chestnut...
author: Alexander T.

description:
OMG, Pacific Catch has spawned a new branch in Inner Sunset, Sweet! The Marina location = long wait time & cramped space, so try the new location instead or come to this one on off hours!

So my British childhood had left me with a life-long love affair with fish and chips, and I love that PC can deliver on the classics and add their own modern twists like Sweet Potato Fries (addictive) and various dipping sauces. 

The menu is diverse, from seafood tacos to Asian-Hawaiian flavors, so I am definately coming back to make my way through that menu. Did someone say Poke? Awesome!

The Host/waiters have always been super friendly and gracious. They've even brought me samples when I wasn't sure about something. That's slick!  I {HEART} PC! =o)
author: Venatius P.

description:
Everything has been said already, but my ten observations.

1.  The fish tacos are good. 
2.  The best fish taco I've had there is the salmon one, mainly due to the bbq sauce or whatever sauce it is that they used on it. 
3.  I'm guessing that other dishes using the same salmon are just as good.
4.  This location is quite small.
5.  Because it is quite small it is usually hard to just walk into.
6. There isn't a good place to wait inside
7. It is often somewhat cold outside.
8. Because it is often cold outside I usually don't wait for a table.
9. This doesn't mean the food isn't good, because it is.
10. I guess I only have nine observations.
author: Brett J.

description:
I have a wealthy friend from LA who has no $ spending-inhibitions when it comes to good food, especially seafood, and thus is quite picky.  After my first few visits to Pacific Catch (where the poke, sandwiches, rice bowls, salads, and sweet potato fries were all tried and received rave reviews from my taste buds) I knew I had to bring this LA friend here.  It took one visit and he is hooked.  

The deal: when he comes to SF I treat him to lunch at Pacific Catch, when I go to LA he treats me to a lavish sushi / seafood dinner.  It's that good!

Note: be flexible as the wait can be long
author: Morgen N.

description: One of the few places I've been to in the Bay Area that isn't overrated and overpriced. THANK GOODNESS. We came here twice in three days and I can't wait to come back. The first time we had the ahi poke and it was AMAZING and  the fish and chips (cooked perfectly). Then we came back and had sweet potato fries, fish tacos, and an ahi poke wasabi bowl during happy hour. Divine. And the prices are actually reasonable. It's a great place with great food. A little cramped, but the food is worth it.
author: Claire K.

description: very disappointed in this place. my co workers swear by them so i went in today and ordered the fish and chips which was $11 for two pieces of fish to only find out it wasnt two whole pieces they were like lil chicken strips or something and a half order of fries . My fish was also very greasy and soggy . sorry pacific catch but i will never eat there again
author: Ms F.

description: Pretty small place, but great fresh tuna!
author: Phil S.

description: This place is crowded and the music is loud, so I choose to go  by myself ...once a week for lunch and order the same thing each week that is gluten free...the salmon is ALWAYS perfectly grilled and delicious!  And I appreciate their frequent diner card.
author: Kay H.

description: Good beer, best sweet potato fries EVER and for a fish place, there are a few vegetarian options [like an asparagus/ mushroom sushi roll or tofu teriyaki bowl]. It was a little pricey but well worth it! We paid around $60 for 3 rolls, chicken taco platter, sweet potato fries and edamame. Everyone seemed to enjoy their meals and we had some pretty decent tangerine beer. The portions are also pretty decent sized as well and the service wasn't too bad. When we first got there it was crowded and we were rushed [going to nightlife at the Academy of Sciences afterwards] so we sat at the bar.
