Service was pretty slow there in the beginning but once they took our drink orders it was pretty quick. We were in and out within an hour and a half, I'd say. Maybe less. I'll definitely be back here [especially for those sweet potato fries!]
author: Andrea N.

description: Tiny location with fairly good ahi poke and Hawaiian-style sushi and poke. I've definitely had better but this is good for what it is in the city.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Ok, this first paragraph is just to rate my WORST experience I had there last...which was enough to stop me from eating there ever again thanks to dumb workers.  I used to like eating at this place cause the food deserves 4 stars and it was conveniently located and it was the few places I can enjoy with my friend's no salt diet.  They most often suck at following directions; lucky for them that the food is quite good that we put up with their lack of capability for following directions like leaving the sauce on the side, which is only followed 50% of the time if that.  I'd give them 1 star for service based on my very last experience there.  I went in to pick up my order and there's 2-3 people ahead of me.  The first took probably 5 minutes to get taken care of.  The second....her order wasn't ready, so the dumb employee(s) decided to stand there and wait for the order to be done instead of trying to ring up the next customer (I could have sworn there was another person in front of me, but don't remember that incident, so I'll just fast forward to me)...so there's another woman behind me who are equally impatient as I am because we KNOW our food are ready and we're STARVING!  We kept poking our head out of the line to show that we're in a hurry to pay and take out food, so instead of helping ME (the one next in line since I can't remember the third person ahead of me...), she rung up the woman behind me instead.  Now I had a connection with the woman behind me in that we're both ready to get our asses out the door, but for her to have the fucking nerves to go get her shit before me....You're a rude f@$%ing B!@#h!!!  No wonder people have so many negative opinions of Marina people (especially of the women)!  You make me feel ashamed to be so happy and proud to live in the Marina for the convenience of my life.  Seriously, I wanted to kick your ass...I can understand that sometimes, servicing to the community when things get crazy busy can be difficult and confusing, but when a customer pointed out to you that she was in line before the person, you [as a good customer service provider should A. apologize for the mistake of helping the other customer first, or B. (the better way) tell that customer that you're sorry for the inconvenience, but you should really help the client in line before her]!  I used to work for Starbucks!  I understand the stress level we can have at times, but you came to the job, it didn't come to you!  Do your job properly for Christ's sake!  

I know that was a crazy rant...I was all over the place, but I'm sure most of you have experienced such poor customer service at one place or another.  I probably don't even make sense, but oh well!  When I'm frustrated about something, it's hard to make sense cause I can't stop rambling...

Anyway, here's my conclusion for the place from last experience I'll ever have there:
1 star for service
4 stars for food

For the overall experiences I had there:
2.5 stars for customer service
4 stars for food

Advice to owner or manager:
Higher employees who take pride in whatever they do and have common sense.  Ring up people who's food are ready and they're ready to pay, not make them wait because the first person in line's food isn't ready.  Also, ring up the next person in line, not the bitchiest person in line.

Sorry about my ranting!
author: My Loan J.

description:
A delicious and refreshingly unpretentious place to eat some tasty fish.

This place is pretty tiny, so during a rush if you have a large group you will have to wait a bit. There were only 2 of us, so the wait was not bad, 10 minutes maybe, and the staff was really friendly and attentive in the meantime. 

I had a miso soup to start, it was a bit sweet which i liked, and warm, perfect for a cold day. We split a basket of sweet potato fries, perfect, not greasy, and with just the right amount of salt.

We then both had the sushi grade ahi salad. The fish was a good sized piece, fresh and tasty, and the dressing was a really good miso one, not oily, I liked it a lot. 

We didn't have desert although I was interested in the mochi ice cream fondue and will be back for it.

Overall, there wasn't anything I didn't like, but I will need another, more leisurely visit (we ate in kind of a hurry) in order to bump it to 5 stars.
author: Tatyana D.

description:
Is there anything better than being called sweetie the moment you walk into a place? Well, there probably is, but this isn't that type of establishment. The servers here really know how to make you feel at home. 

I went for the Salmon sandwich and sweet potato fries (if you skip these you might as well not have eaten here). Great aioli and fresh, soft bread. I'll need to branch out soon but so far, this is the only thing I want when I walk in.
author: James N.

description: This spot is amazing.  I went here with a friend after finding out that the sushi spot we were going to hit around the corner was closed on Mondays.  I had the Japanese Wasabi bowl with poke which was unbelievably good and he had an Ahi sandwich.  The service was great and the company and food were amazing.  All in all, a wonderful night.  Thank you.
author: Pat A.

description:
Was visiting from out of town and decided to hit this place for a Friday dinner. First off this place wasn't at all what I expected it to look like, but we sat at the bar and the food was amazing! I had the Ahi Tuna Salad and my buddy had the Shrimp Taco on special and the Tuna sandwich 

High recommended.
author: Chon N.

description:
Enough said about this place.. everyone has their fav memu items and agrees on the affordability factor.  Ok I'll digress... I have the take-out menu in front of me and my favorite menu item has got to be the Grilled Mahi Mahi Wasabi Bowl.  Even in this bowl concept ala Yoshinoya Beef Bowl, KFC mashed potato bowl (I think), the bowl items appear to have been artistically arranged by the same sushi artist down the street at Acewasabi - it's pretty.  

If you happen to order out, call ahead.  Else, during the busy hours, you're stuck going through order remorse looking at what others are getting.
author: adam l.

description:
One of my favorite places to lunch on Chestnut St when you're craving it, they have a great chicken sandwich and unagi bowl rice dish.  Unfortunately, they have such a small space that it's practically always crowded during the times you're most hungry.  Luckily, if you go a bit earlier around 11, you can always get a seat within 5-15 minutes.  

It's pretty much hit or miss on service depending on whom you get, but I've found that if you have a larger group the food can take a little bit longer.  My friends love the sweet potato fries (although I get sick of it after you eat a couple), and their Thai ice tea is so-so.  They once gave me one that didn't taste right. 

Overall, if you can get seated here during lunch, definitely get their chicken sandwich, it's delicious!  Their salads are also very filling.  I would recommend checking out their Corte Madera location since it's 3 times the size, they have a little bit more dishes, and they give salted goldfish crackers with edamame for free!  But if you're in the neighborhood and it's empty, I would try to go in and have lunch.
author: SF Diner A.

description:
Fish Tacos. Seriously

Usually I'm adventurous when I go to restaurant more than once. But not here. I'm sure there are many amazing entrees, and I've poached a few terrific bites from friends, but I can't bring myself to get anything but the three fish tacos in a basket. One grilled, one deep fried, and one shrimp. They come covered in an amazing tomatillo sauce and a lime-cream, on soft corn tortillas, on top of sweet potato fries with a sweet chili dipping sauce. Unbelievable. Top it off with Pacifico and a lime and sit outside on a warm day... oh it's heaven.

Oh, it's tiny and cramped, but it's worth it.
author: Cameron S.

description:
Yummmmmmaaay!! Yummy. Yum. 

Besides the fact that it gets a bit crowded, I love this place! So fresh and delicious and healthy. Great after a long walk along Chrissy Field.
author: Courtney R.

description:
I had my first experience here a few weeks back and it was delicious.  I had walked by so many times without even noticing it (it is quite tiny), but went there for dinner with some friends who had been many times before.
We sat at the counter (table space is limited) and I ordered the special: a salmon plate with brown rice, roasted red peppers, and a grilled artichoke.  I wasn't disappointed.  The fish was fresh and the side dishes were a nice compliment.  I also enjoyed a glass of wine and watched the flurry of people around me.
It was a hopping spot for take out orders too, which is something I will consider in the future.
I'd return and order a dish off their regular menu.
author: Liz U.

description:
After eating here, I felt like a million bucks.  

I took a few out of town friends to Pacific Catch after they flew in from the east coast because they wanted something fresh, light and Californian.  I immediately thought, Pacific Catch!

My friends were in town for my big 3-0.  The waiter caught wind of the fact that it was my b-day weekend.  Not only did he make a huge fuss over me by wishing me happy b-day and telling all the other folks that work there that it was my birthday, he gave me a free mochi dessert with a lit candle.  And, best of ALL, he actually believed me when I told him I was turning 21.  Well, at the very least, he was a great actor. 

After eating at Pacific Catch, I felt happy that the food was so good, that my friends were so pleased with their fare, and that the waiter and staff were so sweet.  Most of all, I was flattered that they cared enough to lie to me.  I love me my Pacific Catch.
author: R. K.

description:
Love this place!  I'm always looking for something healthy, quick and under $20 bucks.  Not fancy, just a cheap night out when I don't feel like cooking. 
I like the rice bowls, particularly the unagi and poke. I love the selection of veggies/seaweed and wasabi sauce.
I've been there with friends who like the fish tacos and sweet potato fries, but I gotta say, not a fan of deep fried sweet potatoes.  Now that it's so crowded and always a line, I tend to go to the one in Marin which has an enormous room and rarely a long wait.  
I wasn't happy when they opened the 2nd location in Marin thinking that it would be the beginning of the end. Not so...same good food, same inexpensive prices.
author: Elaine D.

description:
Whenever I feel guilty about what I have been eating lately and my lack of motivation to go to the gym, I tend to develop this craving for pacific catch.  Not to say that it is health food, but something about their wasabi bowl with seared tuna makes me feel good about myself!  Like I am making a positive change to eating well!  Fish is good, no?

Anyways.....

I love this place.  Best things on the menu...wasabi bowls, fish tacos and sweet potatoe fries (did I mention not everything is healthy).  

Downside...the place is TINY!  Takeout is the best option.  However, if you do plan on eating there, the servers always seem to have a smile on their face.  They have even offered us a beer while waiting for a table.  Personal favoriate place to sit is the bar so you can watch them cook up the fishies!
author: Jen S.

description:
I had the pleasure of eating lunch here today with Freddy M.  Seriously, I am a bit spoiled in this town.  It was packed for lunch, very busy in fact, but the food and service were excellent,.  

We started with the fried oysters (a bit heavy in the fried breading but delicious) and I had the wasabi bowl with tuna.  Yum. Not much else to say except I would come here for lunch again and again (if someone else were paying).
author: Jill D.

description:
Pacific Catch is my favorite casual dining spot in the city. I'm a big fan of the wasabi ahi tuna sandwich and the sweet potato fries seem to have a religious following (full disclosure: I'm a believer). 

The staff are extremely friendly, especially considering the tight working space they are dealing with at the location on Chestnut. (I recently visited the PC in the Sunset and it's much more spacious).
author: Dylan S.

description:
Food/Quality:
There was nothing special about the food here, and I don't understand the great reviews. I have had better fish and the only thing I really enjoyed were the sweet potato fries. 

Service:
The service was friendly and my boyfriend and I received our food fairly quickly.

Atmosphere:
The place was crowded and tiny! I don't like to experience my dinner practically sitting on the people next to me and while waiting I was dreading where we would be sitting. Luckily, we ended up at a spot at the small bar area, which wasn't as bad. 

Value:
The prices were affordable, but the food, along with the cramped eating area just doesn't justify the price or returning to this place.
author: Cynthia D.

description:
All you need to know about this place is the Ahi Poke bowl is amazing! To be honest I'm not even sure how good the rest of the menu is since that's all I get. One of my buddies tried something else and it didn't stack up. 

I did have to deduct one star for the usual wait due to the limited seating. It seems like the place is always packed so just plan on waiting a minimum of 20 minutes.
author: Mark B.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Tuesday.  Unfortunately, couldn't get a table.  We waited at the bar and had appetizers and drinks.  Oddly enough, the waitress said that if a wait developed for tables, we would not be allowed to move to a table from the bar.  I wasn't sure I understood/liked this policy, but we did eventually get a table.

The food is pretty good - I had the ahi wasabi bowl, which came on a bed of brown rice and was topped with lightly seared ahi tuna, seaweed salad and other delectables.  I asked for 1/2 salad 1/2 rice, but the proportions were more like 1/4 salad 3/4 rice.  Ok....

Service wasn't great.  Friendly, but somewhat inattentive and inefficient.  Seems like it wouldn't be too hard to provide good service in a place that's the size of a postage stamp, but it just wasn't there.  Would probably not go back to this location, but would try the one on 9th and Lincoln.
author: Martine D.
Lauryn S.

description: I usually order their Japanese wasabi bowl with Hawaiian poke or Korean BBQ bowl with sticky ribs, but when I saw the crab melt on their seasonal menu, I took a chance.  Boy, I was glad I did.  The crab melt was stuffed with real crab meat, amazingly flavorful and buttery, yet not drenched in butter/oil like many other places.  The sourdough bread was perfectly toasted, not burned.  The sweet potato fries that came with it were wonderful and crispy.  I can't wait to get it again!
author: May L.

description: Got the steak tacos to go once when I was late for a flight - ate in the back of the car.  it was damn good. I don't remember that much about it, I remember they served fries (weird) and the tacos had some crispy onions in it. But I do know that I want to have it again the next time I'm in SF...
author: Adam D.

description:
Gotta say this place is definitely doing something right. I have not had a meal at Pac Catch that I did not enjoy. I had a friend visiting from Boston, (a former resident of the Marina), and she really wanted to go to PC for lunch. Well we did and I ordered the white fish with roasted veggies. We started with the Poke. Everything was delicious from start to finish. The Poke was super fresh. My veggies were sliced very thin (but not too thin) and grilled just right. The fish was the perfect consistency of thick and a bit flaky. Finally the fries... You really have to try the Sweet Potato fries for yourself because I could talk about them all day, but you still wouldn't get it until you have had your own... 
We arrived at lunch time, and we were still seated right away. Our waiter had a great attitude and on top of everything. 
I don't make it to this place often, but I am always glad when get there.
author: Miguel V.

description: The food is great - best Ahi Poke bowl! Service - hit or miss.
author: Antonia N.

description:
O M G ...  i love pacific catch.  whenever i'm in the area and i crave eating wasabi bowls that are generously filled with shit tons of delicious poke tuna (all the time), i come here.  (note:  this place is tiny and always crowded, so if you're looking for a shorter wait, the huge sunset location is probably better).  

my coworkers took me here when i first moved to san francisco.  they told me, "it's a fish place... so they have sashimi bowls, sandwiches, and fish tacos."  i was initially horrified:  how can any place that makes both fish tacos and wasabi bowls possibly be any good at both?  

answer:  i still don't know, because the wasabi bowls are so good that i haven't even tried most of the other menu items.  they'll substitute half of your rice with half salad if you're trying to cut on the carbs a little bit.  the sweet potato fries are the best i've had.  AND i love cricket cola.  

one day i'll try the fish tacos and fish sandwiches if i can ever get away from the huge servings of tuna.  one day.
author: Michelle N.

description: MMMMMMMmmmmmm. Fish Tacos and sweet potato fries...... I highly recommend getting the taco platter trio, especially if your indecisive, it gives you that third option that can make all the difference. I usually get 1 bbq salmon, 1 mahi mahi, and 1 shrimp. And yes, don't forget to get the sweet potato fries because their sweet chili dipping sauce is delicious!
author: Andria N.

description: Went here for the fish and chips which everyone raved about. The service was great. But when the food arrived, the sweet potato fries were cold and the fish was a little dark brown/ over fried. It would have been much better had the food been made with more attention to detail. But hey, it's fish and chips.
author: Desiree P.

description:
The sandwiches here are better than the other location! The service though is MUCH slower and slightly bitchier ... (I'd be slow and bitchy too if I had to work in such a small place!) 

I like their salads, tacos, and rice bowls! Their food is OK, just nothing I'd crave on death row... 

They get 3 stars because it is almost impossible to eat here without waiting forever! and honestly, the food + service is soooo not worth the wait! Especially when your elbow can touch the table next to you!
author: Maddy S.

description: love this place! I have eaten here twice this week and I love their ahi poke ricebowl. I get it with half brown rice and half mixed greens. The portion is huge and the food is fresh and yummy.  Its about $14 for the item and is well worth it, so next time ur in the marina stop by and eat here.  The sandwiches looked great also.
author: Alexis R.

description:
best Poke in the Bay area.  

ono grindz!
author: eshwar k.

description: Yummy, very fresh and flavorful.  I had the poke wasabi bowl.  Looks small but lots in there.  Couldn't finish it and took some home.  We came here after the Girls Night Out Shecky's event.  Parking is hard to find around this neighborhood.  Had to circle quite a few times.  Got to the restaurant at ~7:30pm on a THU night.  Place is super tiny.  There were 4 of us.  We probably waited ~20min for a table.  Wish they could expand.  The food is so good.  We also split the sweet potatoe fries.  The dipping sauce that it comes with is so tasty.  The large was an okay size for the four of us to split the fries.    It's a very casual place.  Price is ok.  A little high.  I've come to expect that in SF.    I will definately be back to try more of the menu.
author: Julie G.

description: Pacific Catch is consistently great- It's my favorite seafood spot in the city and I can afford to come here often, major plus! The fish is always fresh and delicious, the salads have interesting vegetables and come with a unique tasty dressing.  I also love the fries, the regular ones... I've never been a sweet potato fan and the seasoned fries are a little too salty.  The waitstaff has always been pleasant and very efficient, which I appreciate.
author: Liz Y.

description:
Called in one evening for 4 orders to go. . . . was asked if utensils were needed. . answer: Yes! . . . . . . 
The Japanese Wasabi Ahi Poke Rice Bowl was delicious.  As was the Fresh Grilled Salmon Salad my friend had. . . however, even though the order was printed up with utensils to be included. . none were to be found - and the 2 ice teas ordered were also missing. . . The Sweet Potato Fries was very very addictive. . . in fact, the missing items will not deter me from visiting this establishment again. . . . staff was friendly and helpful. . . .

January 13, 2008 - cannot say enough about this place.  Everything that I have ordered was excellent.  Fried Oysters w/sweet potato fries, fish and chips (sweet potato fries) - Chicken Teriyaki Bowls are enormous as are their salads.
author: Kea C.

description:
Good quick eats.  Baja fish tacos and Poke Wasabi bowl are good.  Prices are reasonable.  

Everybody is always friendly except for the one waitress who is always there and takes her job for granted.  4 stars if it wasn't for her.
author: Jacob J.

description:
Damn you, iPhone.
Your commecials featuring Pacific Catch have gotten under my skin.  I had the craving, and nothing was going to get between me and an Ahi Poke Wasabi bowl.  Not bad parking, not long lines, not skinny rich Marina denizens with $300 jeans and yellow convertables.  Nothing. 
Normally I consider anything north of California street to be another city, but a friend turned me on to this place when we had weekly lunches in the Presidio.  The wasabi bowl is perfect picnic food - healthy, portable, and perfectly balanced with vegetables and ginger and fish and everything.  But when I called to make a take out order, I had to dial back 4 times before I got a live person.  The place was packed, and the staff were swamped.
"Oh," I thought to myself, "if only there were another branch of Pacific Catch, larger, closer to my house, and not in the Marina!"

I should have asked for world peace and a winning lottery ticket too, because my wish came true. 
Looks like the Canvas Cafe at the corner of 9th and Lincoln is closed, and they're opening a Pacific Catch there.  

You're all welcome.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I heard that their thai ice tea have free refills!  

If you're willing to wait for a bit around dinner time, the food is worth the wait, fresh and cheap!  I always get their salads.  Their sandwiches are yummy and our meal is not complete with sweet potato fries!  MMMMMM!  This is one of the few reasons I'll venture into the marina (eck!).
author: Abby E.

description:
Ads do work.

I would never have heard of this restaurant had it not been featured in the iphone commercial. 

we had lunch at pacific catch at the marina after our trip to the aquarium. 
The place is tiny!!! ridiculously small. I will not get over how small that restaurant is and how busy they get. We were waiting about half an hour before they were able to seat us. Since my daughter was with us, we needed a table so we can have her seated in a high chair. 

We ordered cabo calamari, miso soup for my daughter (one of her favorites), the special of the day for me which was trout with spicey rub, grilled zuchinni, yellow squash, and corn with sweet potato fries and avocado-tomatillo salsa, husband had the tilapia fish and chips. 

We probably made a mistake with our entrée. Everyone around us was ordering poke salads and teriyaki bowls--this is what they were famous for. but we thought our food was good.

I am now addicted to sweet potato fries. It's sweet, and salty and retains its crispiness better than a regular French fry. 

I don't want to go back to the marina location because of how ridiculously small the space was. They have another branch at 9th and Lincoln with a much bigger space and a more extensive menu.
author: Almira C.

description: I am so impressed with the food and staff here. Because it is tiny, we had to wait 45 mins for a table, but the staff was so genuinely apologetic that they gave us free appetizers and dessert!
author: Sarah B.

description: I'm fair enough to admit that maybe I just ordered the wrong thing, however, I went with the predominant suggestions from the reviews (crispy oyster and the ahi poke wasabi bowl).  It was flat out not good, but I'm also of the belief that oysters shouldn't be chewed and I took a risk getting the crispy oysters.  They made me a little sick to my stomach before I even got the wasabi bowl and my partner felt the same way. The ahi in the wasabi bowl was really tough and really fishy, so I didn't even finish the meal.  No interest in trying this one again.
author: Jason C.

description: The fish is amazing and I'm not a fish lover. If u go late afternoon or evening Jeffery is one of the best waiters I've ever come across. He's kind, attentive and overall just great at his job. If I ever open a restaurant I'm stealing him away!! Great food great service!!!
author: Audrey Q.

description: One of my favorite spots on chestnus street. My favorite would have to be their fish and chips. The batter is really well done and they have the perfect crisp to them. Their sweet potatoes fries are amazing (this coming from a guy who doesn't like sweet potatoes normally) especially with their sweet red dipping sauce. Another great dish to try is their ahi tuna bowl. Really great dish with seared ahi tuna, rice, and greens. Not too heavy and you feel pretty refeshed afterwards.
author: Ajay K.

description: I definitely like the 9th and Lincoln way location better. I didn't realize that this location was smaller, and more different. The menu here is more limited and there are verrry few seats here. The food was just so-so, and I would definitely stick with the location I mentioned above.
author: Anita C.

description: Great service but even better food! I highly recommend ordering the Ahi Tuna Bowl and Tuna Poke appetizer.  The other dish we ordered, Deep Fried Oysters, was "edible" (A little biased since I'm not a huge fan of deep fried food) - I do have to admit though, there was no "oily" after taste like the after taste you get from KFC Chicken.
author: Mark T.

description: First rate place.  I've been here about 3 times on visits to town and I like it better each time.  Good food, decent prices, fast service from a friendly staff.  I like to sit at the bar to watch the amazing show going on in the very cramped kitchen.  Part of what makes it fun is that it's a crew that works so well together and in a good happy spirit.  No one stands idle when there's work to be done and everyone chips in with whatever is needed.  Just a pleasure to watch.  Not to mention the stunning beauty of the hostess/waitress who was on this last time we were there (Nikki? - not sure that's the right name)  We've had various bowls, tacos and sandwiches and loved them all.  We'll be back.
author: David W.

description: We were in the neighborhood and stopped in for a delicious dinner. The food was excellent and the service was very friendly. I'm taking off a star only because it's tiny inside and most of the seating is at the bar, which is a little uncomfortable but no big deal (just wouldn't be ideal for a large group). The sweet potato fries were fantastic (I don't normally like fries of any kind)! Check it out!
author: Lauren W.

description: Great salads here. Pretty fair prices too. Definitely recommend it!
author: Joshua S.

description: Went there for lunch on a Friday and only had to wait a few minutes before being seated.  Asked to have the basket o' fries split between spicy fried and sweet potato so I could try both...sweet potato won out.  Had the house salad with ahi poke on top...delish.  Service was great and upbeat, food was good and fresh.  Next time, I'll try the fish tacos or fish n' chips.  I can't wait to go back.
author: Teresa M.

description:
All I have to say is... when you type in "seafood" on your yuppy iphone... Pacific Catch is NOT the first restaraunt to pop up. That probably indicates that 1) someone at Apple is love with this restaraunt and offered to give them free advertising or 2) Pacific Catch paid a whole crap of money to get their name attached w/ the monstrosity that is Apple Inc.  

With that said... I'm in love with the poke wasabi bowl, spicy ahi sandwich, and sweet potato fries. I'm such a huge hypocrite. =) I don't really want to say much more b/c the 253 people who commented before me probably said it all. So read the other reviews you lazy ass.
author: Diana L.

description:
Mmmm, Yummy is the only way that I can describe this place.  I have been on several occasions and have done a good job of changing up my order to sample something new each time.

So I have to say my two favorites are the spicy Mahi, Mahi sandwich, with the sweat potato fries and chili sauce, and the always tasty poki bowl!  The food is always fresh and the staff is very friendly.

My only complaint is that this place needs more space!  It's a small location and it gets crowded very fast.  You could go with take out but it's not the same.  The sweat potato fries tend to get soggy pretty fast when boxed up.  You need to eat them when there still fresh in there basket.
author: Chuy C.

description:
i got the ahi poke but added shitake mushrooms to the mix!

They have an extensive menu, cool place to bring a cool girl to..

their lemongrass ginger ice tea is a good add, especially after a yoga class.

i prefer to sit at the bar and never had to wait more than 5 minutes...

people are very friendly and the kitchen is clean.
author: Dino K.

description:
Really a good place to get a California/Asian fusion menu. Being that it is only a few blocks from my apartment, it has become a great stand by for fresh tasty food fast. The foot print is a bit small and if you get there during peak time it can be a bit of a wait. The outdoor seating is awesome during sunny days, but the heater doesn't seem to cover the tables below during colder days. Sweet potato fries are a must and something about getting a bowl of Miso soup with a sandwich is novel and works. 

A+ for the BBQ Salmon sandy.
author: Patrick C.

description: Sweet potato French fries!!!! Love everything on the menu! My fave goes to the coconut shrimp taco! Woot there it is! Minus one star because I would prefer flour tortillas instead of corn. Love me some Pacific Catch!
author: Sue K.

description: I really enjoy everything I eat at Pacific Catch.  I tend to gravitate towards the tacos because they have an awesome selection and because they come with sweet potato fries.  Mmmmmmmmm.  Tacos are $11 for two+fries or $14 for an additional taco.  Their sweet potato fries are served with sweet chili cause and a wasabi aioli that complement each other amazingly.  I've also sampled some of their salads and am most found of the California roll salad (all salads $12).  It comes with a ton of crab and avocado on top of organic greens covered in a tangy Asian dressing.  And saving best for last, they serve a fried Dulce de Leche "spring rolls" ($7) for dessert.  Honestly, these are soooo amazing!  They are warm and gooey and perfect with the big scoop of vanilla ice served in the middle!  Enjoy!
author: Cersei T.

description: Mmm, love pacific catch. If you actually want to sit there, you'll probably need to wait for a table since the place is SMALL. But, they also do to go orders, which you can call in ahead of time. I highly recommend the ahi tuna salad. So good. (Sweet potato fries are also good!)
author: Caitlin B.

description: very good tatse fushio japanese food , i love all menu ! will be back for sure
author: Opal S.

description:
I found this place to be quite tasty.  I'm not a big salad and health conscious type of person.  But if you are a recommend this place.

I had the ahi pokey and sweet potato fries (loved it!!!).  And I felt good after.

But, the size of the place and the service sucked.  I had to practically yell and wave the waitress down to get a refill.  And the people next to me were so close, I felt like we were in each other's conversation.
author: Grace R.

description:
Had a great lunch there yesterday with a girlfriend.  Best thing about the place is their unbelievably delicious sweet potato fries (we shared a $3.95 basket, and they are very generous with the portion).  I had their grilled fresh salmon with honey chipotle BBQ glaze, sliced tomato, red onion & citrus aioli, and it is a fabulous deal at about $8!!!  (Plus it comes with a very lightly dressed but flavorful coleslaw).  

Great value!

And I love that they now serve takeout!  I have every intention of calling in a picnic lunch, swinging by to pick it up, and then heading for the beach or the park!  LOVE IT!
author: Lana C.

description:
The Good: sweet potato fries, the sandwiches, easy to meet new people because you're practically sitting in each others' laps; walk to Exploratorium, walk to Fort Mason, bike to Chrissy.

The Bad: not for wait-haters, not for the claustrophobes, can get noisy, wait staff can be a bit absent-minded, parking: challenging.

The Abstract: great informal business chatteria, casual first dateria.
author: Andy M.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants. Great variety especially if you want to eat healthier / lighter but have friends who want heavier / fried dishes. I usually get the big salad bowls with poke tuna or ahi tuna. Sooo fresh and healthy tasting with avocado, greens, tuna, carrots, etc. 

Sweet potato fries are to die for!

Seating is tricky, usually have to wait in line. But staring at the other clients who are lingering sometimes helps. :) Parking in the Marina is horrendous. Luckily Pacific Catch opened a 2nd location in Sunset at the old Canvas Cafe location - much bigger and equally good food!
author: Debbie L.

description:
I know, I know--5 stars?  In the Marina?  Who am I, and what have I done with Wes M?

Granted, the 5th star is mostly due to fortuitous circumstances--for starters, I didn't pay for my meal here.  My cousin eats here every time she visits SF and had given me a gift certificate for Christmas.  Now I was tempted to go to the much more convenient branch in the Sunset, but I decided to stay true to her intentions and try this one--and it paid off, because they're as different as night and day.  While the Sunset PC is one of the largest restaurants in the city, this is one of the smallest, and as such is much more charming.  Furthermore, our 5 PM rainy Sunday arrival allowed us to nab one of the 3 window tables without a wait.  Which pretty much leaves the food--and it was all fantastic, from the crispy oyster appetizer to the succulent trout (the daily special) to the mix-it-yourself cornucopia of the wasabi bowl (I already tried the fries back in the Sunset, but they're delicious too).  And these guys sure do know their aioli.

All in all, with restaurants like this, you might make a Marina believer out of me yet.  Or we could just trade Pacific Catches, that would work best for me.  Come on, don't you guys want all those extra tables?
author: Wes M.

description: The seared ahi salad is great.  So are the sweet potato fries - and I haven't had the happy hour but it looks awesome.  Nice wait staff too.
author: Allison C.

description: This place is one super tasty spot that fills up real quick and has some of the best prices in town for the quality of food you get! Aside from their sweet potato fries, which is a big hit, they have this super delicious wasabi mayo and sashimi grade tuna sandwich, which is actually still raw!!! Yum!!!, is on warm fresh bread and has a nice blend of mixed variety greens that combine into a warm happy bite! The fried oysters are really good too! I can't say enough about how great this place is, just make sure you are willing to wait and don't mind how packed it is, because this restaurant is a Marina secret that's not well kept!
author: Matthew R.

description: I've been up to the bay about 3 times in the past year and I always have to eat at Pacific Catch...because i CRAVE their Ahi Poke rice bowl!!! Soooo good! It's basically a deconstructed sushi roll: sticky rice topped with poke, seaweed salad, pickled ginger, soy sauce, and shredded nori. Sweet potato fries are delicious as well. This location is small so there can be a wait...I dont recommend for any groups larger than 4.
author: Liza P.

description:
This place is ALWAYS consistent.  We go here whenever we want a low key evening with affordable food. The sweet potatoe fries and aioli dipping sauce are amazing.  

TAKE OUT - another huge positive about this place. It's so easy to call in with your order, then swing by 20 minutes later to pick it up, without having to jostle with other diners. 

The mochi balls are a perfect dessert as well!
author: Katie B.

description: Good place to eat and easy for take out.  The food is very healthy!  I usually get the salmon bowl which is amazing!!  The service is quick and portions are good size!
author: Hillary B.

description:
My new favorite place. Went there for the first time at about 7pm on a Tuesday. Sat down and started to enjoy EVERYTHING. Grilled artichoke was great, and the sweet potato garlic fries are wonderful!!!
I had the ahi wasabi sandwich- fresh tuna, super soft bread, great avocado, and the ginger/wasabi sauce was fantastic. My girlfriend had an ahi salad, which was huge, and pretty good- but the rice bowls seem to be a much better dish.  Cool, quaint little place with some seriously good bites.  Service was wonderful-from a good looking blonde girl, and the ambiance was nice too. Going back very soon! Totally try this place!
author: Jeffrey S.

description: This is my go-to place when I want something light and fresh but not bland (and where I won't be starving 30 minutes after the meal). I always get the Chipotle Mahi Mahi salad even though I always attempt to order something else. I've tasted the Poke bowl and the fish tacos and everything is fresh and tasty. Service is always friendly at this super small location.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: I am simply obsessed with this place. I have never had a meal that I wasnt in love with! From the amazing rice bowls to the bomb fish tacos (my personal fav). I love a seafood place that has asian flair and yet serves sweet potato fries-couldnt ask for a more delicious combo.
author: Shea S.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city -- casual neighborhood eatery with healthy seafood choices! Their food is great quality and consistently delicious. My favorite items are the California Salmon sandwich and sweet potato fries.
author: VadaPav B.

description: This place is pricey, but good. Their drinks aren't that good though. It didn't taste like I would imagine it to be and the alcohol was not strong at all. The sweet potatoe fries are good. I ordered the catfish I think. I forgot. But it was good and spacious. I came during lunch time, so there was no wait.
author: Abby A.

description:
3 words: Ahi Poki Bowl.
3 more words: with brown rice.
Creative, fresh food.  I moved out of the Marina almost 3 years ago and still make strategic appointments on Chestnut St just to get my Poki Bowl fix.
Kudos to the staff for remaining pleasant while working in such close quarters.  It ain't easy, people!
Chances are there won't be a table available when you arrive but it's worth the wait.
author: Lea G.

description: Clean and inviting seafood restaurant on Lincoln. The wall paintings are tasteful and true to the resto's theme. It is also kid-friendly, which is a huge plus for us.
author: Thea T.

description: The Best sea food "Mexican/Asian fusion" in the San Francisco. If you love seafood Go... From Maui tacos with their secret green sauce too yummy choice of teriyaki bowls. Don't forget to try their grilled asparagus with garlic sauce. Out of this world great.. You've got to experience the greatness.
author: Bryan A.

description: 5 stars!!! OMG, this food is so good! we sat outside, and were offered by staff a FREE app (it was cold, but they DO have heaters) we chose the hawaiian poke w/ chips, it was AMAZING. I love this place, price is right, staff is friendly, food is delish.  There is a reason it is always so packed!
author: Jess L.

description: What am I missing here? Everyone's review is either 4 or 5 stars but honestly, the best thing on their menu are the sweet potato fries...and the last time I checked, sweet potato fries are not seafood. Maybe everyone is just drowning their seafood in Sriracha sauce? Mahi mahi tacos...mreh. Thai coconut shrimp...way too fried. I can't figure out what this place wants to be. Pan-asian seafood? American seafood? Tables are way too close together--my neighbor's dinner was sitting on my table the entire time. Maybe I'd go back...but it would really have to be for happy hour when I have the benefit of a few drinks and a smaller bill.
author: Alisa A.

description: The ceviche was delicious and the Hawaiian Poke bowl was not bad either. The taco was ok but a bit expensive for such a small portion.  Some friends ordered the sweet potato fries which was pretty good. I wasn't too crazy about the pineapple fried rice, a bit too mushy.  Nice place to dine, a bit pricy for some items but service was friendly.
author: Day Z.

description: We came here on a Sunday night at about 7:30 and we got the last open table.  It is a tiny place and a bit crowded but the food makes up for it.  We both got the same things and absolutely loved our meal.  We got the poke rice bowl with brown rice.  Everything about it was fantastic.  The veggies were crisp, the fish was fresh tasting and well marinated, and the sauce was so yummy.  The portion size was great.  My husband ate just about everything and I left a little rice.  For about $15 for a bowl, it was well worth it!  Fresh, delicious, and great portion size.  This is going to be a must do next time I'm in SF.
author: Natalie B.

description: I really like this place! One of the few places where I get the same thing frequentlt-- the poke bowl -- but every once in a while I get something else.  I could go here every week.
author: Dan F.

description: This place is out and out bad ass. I found out about them at the Yelp holiday party and knew that I had to check this joint out for myself. I figured the place was gonna be pretty pricey based on the food that I ate at the holiday party but was pleasantly surprised when I find out that pretty much everything was under 10 bucks. I went with a friend and we had the Ahi Tuna Poke w/ wonton chips which was off the fucking hook, Thai Coconut shrimp (a little hard to eat because the breading kept coming off the shrimp but still bomb), and the rock cod fish & chips (also hella good, sweet potato chips were off the hinges). I definitely plan on comng back to this place and trying everything on the menu.
author: Tommy P.

description:
only two stars cause of great company. i know i normally dont eat much, but if i dont TOUCH my meal, thats says alot. seriously i mustve had  A bite. i might not know much, but you cant pass off bad seafood to me. im a mutha freaken seafood nazi. i talk smack to my buddy whos one of the largest seafood distributors on the west coast for continually supporting (read selling) unsustainable farm raised shrimp from thailand and malaysia and net raised tuna from spain....

sorry for the rant..... damn granola college education 

i LOVED the sweet potato fries. i might go back for that, but thats about it. my ahi was really really really bad grade. not only that but cooked improperly. its called SEARING people. wtfs up with dirty glasses? 

i always try be fair. if a place is great, i always go back on a slow night, say a tuesday night to see if it was bad. we went to pc on a tuesday night and it was packed. perhaps it was an off night. im sure ill give it another chance, just so my rating can be fair.
author: Euge L.

description: My cold is starting to fade but not completely gone yet so I wanted to go somewhere relatively healthy for lunch today.  Grilled fish at Pacific Catch?  Sign me up!  I had two tacos-one grilled mahi, one grilled shrimp, served with a tasty side salad.  The shrimp taco was excellent-grilled to perfection and topped with a corn salsa.  The mahi was good but not as stellar as the shrimp.  The menu looked outstanding-I'll definitely be back to try some of their entree salads and rice bowls.
author: phil h.

description: good for a quick, casual bite.  always go for the same thing - veggie bowl with poke or wasabi bowl with poke + sweet potato fries.  can't go wrong.
author: Anna V.

description: Maybe it's just that everywhere on Chestnut gets ridiculously crowded, but this is yet another place of utter chaos.  It is very small so there is no room to wait if you are waiting for food to go or for a table.  Loud, crowded, small space, I might as well be at a bar on Saturday night.  But, it's a great catch.  I got the Fresh Salmon Salad (suggested by yelpers) and it was tasty.  I didn't finish it because it was a heafty portion and it cost $10.  Not sure if that's a deal or expensive.  You decide.  I'd definite get food from there again, but I think I'd order ahead of time on the phone or perhaps go for a weekday lunch.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: Pacific Catch is perfect take-out when your roommate, boyfriend, and sister are all out of town and nobody wants to pig out with you. The California Crab salad and the Ahi (or Poke) salad are both amazing and healthy enough that you won't feel like a chub after you mow it down. You can substitute brown rice for white rice too, but that might be getting a little aggressively healthy.
author: Jamie G.

description:
I've never had a bad meal at Pacific Catch.  Whether its one of their great draft beers and appetizers at the bar or a full meal, I've never been disappointed.

The sweet potato fries are great, and I'm always torn between their entrees or rice bowls.  The fried rice with pineapple is one of my favorites.
author: brendan i.

description: It's in the Marina and it's owned by Chevy's.  OMG, you should, like, totally go here!  That is, if you like your fries to taste like they've been soaked in maple syrup.  And having to practically sit on the lap of the dude sitting at the table next to you.  I felt like when I got up to leave, he should have at least asked for my number or something.  Oh yeah and it was so cramped that some guy's butt cheeks touched my friend's glass of lemonade.  She still drank it cuz that's how she rolls.
author: Jen S.

description: Wasabi bowls are great.  Big fan of the ahi tuna one.  Wouldn't eat the bowls while they are cold (I ordered for pick up and it was not very good 30 minutes after they made it).
author: Paul C.

description: This place is the best! Don't be mislead by the size of the restaurant, their food is amazing.  I totally recommend the wasabi bowl. And for sandwich lovers, they got one of the best Chipotle Chicken sandwich, it is just great. Their price is really fair and they have very hospitable customer service.
author: Food L.

description:
I went for dinner last night but was treated rude at the front door by the queeny waiter so i decided to go next door.

i'm sorry it was so busy that you couldn't even acknowledge me for 5 minutes and that when you finally did you were snappy but i am a good customer of your other location which is much cooler anyway.

i'm still giving you guys a star because your tuna poke bowl kicks ass but your waiter needs an attitude adjustment.
author: thad b.

description: I got to admit this place has nice, new, fresh, and tasty creations. I really enjoyed the Hawaiian Poke for a starter and my entrée (Mahi Mahi) was great. The only thing that kept me from giving this place a five star is the sushi. The salmon was the sushi was paper thin and I really can't taste much, but the avocado....
author: A L.

description: I tried this restaurant for the first time a couple of weeks ago. A couple of friends wanted fish and chips, the chips being the delicious sweet potato fries. So, of course we headed towards the Marina having our heart set on fish and chips. We had to wait awhile for a table of 5, I didn't realize how small the restaurant was.  While we were all waiting, of course you have to check out what everyone is eating. Well..... everyone was having either the salad or rice bowl and damn....... that looked so good. So, I had a thought and had to concoct a plan. I figured if I get my bf to order something that I also wanted, then it's a done deal. I get two entrees! So, I ordered the Ahi Poke Wasabi Rice Bowl, but with the brown rice. Ok, ok, I know what you're thinking, brown rice? With Poke? It was damn good. The Poke was fresh and tasty. The Wasabi was not the burn your nose while you eat spicy. The bowl was so good . My mouth is watering as I am typing this. The only reason I am not giving this place 5 stars, is because of the service. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't terrible, but it wasn't great. Mind you it was a busy weekend, but the waitress did not once come over to refill my drink, we had to ask for it. I will be back, not sure if I will try anything else, since the bowl was so good.
author: carebear l.

description:
I go to the Pacific Catch on 9th at Lincoln in the Sunset. I love the food! I'm giving a low score this time around because we've noticed that the food quality doesn't seem to be consistent when we order take out. Twice our BBQ Eel Wasabi bowls have been poorly cooked and skimpy serving of eel. Also the Rock & Roll that I got today was doused in sauce.
The dine-in experience is always great, the take out experience is so-so.
author: Natalia M.

description:
I came here for a late lunch around 2:30 and there was a short wait... 15 minutes I believe it was.  I was pretty surprised at this hour but since we were ravenous we waited patiently outside and perused the menu.
We ordered the following:
Poke Appetizer-tuna was fresh but the flavors were too sweet for us.  Also the pieces of fish could have been cut smaller.  My mom really enjoyed the chips that accompanied it but left most of the tuna behind. 
California Salmon Sandwich-very tasty albeit very greasy.  I would eliminate the excess butter on the bun.
Spicy Tuna Sandwich-very good and rare just like I enjoy it but not very spicy.  It was a good thing they had a bottle of sriracha sauce on the table, that certainly helped.  This bun too was very greasy and would have been better had they eliminated the butter on the bun.   
Our service was ok and we'll come by again to try some other items on the menu.
author: Lizete S.

description: Wow, this place is good! I must admit, I didn't have the highest expectations when I first went in, but I was very pleasantly surprised. The fish is fresh, and it is definitely delicious! Very healthy too. To cap it off, the service was excellent as well, and very friendly. You can't pass up the sweet potato fries either - super addicting. It's fun sitting at the bar, as you can watch your meal being made before your eyes.
author: Jon N.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here on a Wednesday night hoping to grab an affordable, tasty dinner.  The food is very good, but not amazing.  It definitely is overpriced for what they offer.  I got the poke wasabi rice bowl and he got the 3 fish taco platters.  There was a good amount of poke but too much rice, but should have been priced more like $10.  Those two dishes and two iced teas ended up costing $40 (including tax and tip).  This would maybe be acceptable if it was a nicer restaurant - the decor is more of a "neighborhood come in for a quick delicious bite" not a "drop $40 on a weeknight dinner that doesn't even include a beer."

tacos - we had bbq salmon (very tasty), traditional baja (my fav), mahi mahi (good).

poke wasabi bowl - had cilantro (my fault I HATE cilantro).
author: Katie S.

description: I am a serious expert on french fries. Once given a taste test between mcdonald's, jack in the box, and carl's I could easily tell which is which while blindfolded. I know the name "Pacific Catch" implies that fish is what you are supposed to order. Don't be fooled. The sweet potato fries are the most amazing fries I have ever had - at least of the skinny variety. The fish is great too, but its not what keeps me going back.
author: Stacy H.

description:
"big bowl of orgasm, for one please"

Hot damn, PC knows how to glam up brown rice. I used to scream, pull my hair, bite my hand and repeatedly stomp the ground (yes I know, very autistic characteristics, we're looking into it) when my mother set down a bowl of brown rice on the table. And now here I am, all growns up like Mikey, ordering brown rice on my own. Moms is so proud. I've been here twice before and ordered the fish tacos, which were really tasty and fresh. But the last time I came, I jealously watched my friend Janet devour a steaming wasabi bowl, dripping puddle of drool onto my untouched plate. I vowed that the next time I visited PC I would treat myself to one of those famous wasabi bowls. And today, ladies and gentlemen, was that day.
Two cups of brown rice (a little excessive for one person if you ask me) topped with all sorts of fun greens and tuna poke. Good god damn it was good! hey hey boo boo, better than the average rice bowl.
author: Sammy S.

description: our favorite restaurant on chestnut! seared ahi wasabi bowl (order with half lettuce and half rice - it's the best!) is to die for. they also participate in the punchh program so after your 7th visit, you get $10 off...yes please!
author: Teresa B.

description: There are days I strive for health and I eat the ahi poke bowl, yum! There are also days I crave some grease and I order the sweet potato fries, double yum!! Fish tacos are tasty and the wasabi sauce provides an extra kick! i had to knock a star because the place is so small and it's always packed! If you ask for mochi ball off the kids menu they totally will give it to you. I can't resist temptation sometimes! For a quick bite from the sea you can't go wrong here.
author: Jen B.

description: The only downside to going to Pacific Catch is that you have to go into the deep of the Marina and deal with shallow Marina punks and drunk frat boys and girls that look exactly the same.  But, worth it when you get that delicious poke bowl-- fresh tuna poke, lots of goodies.  The space is tiny and you'll probably have to wait for a while.   Another option is ordering take out.
author: Caroline I.

description: My favourite restaurant in the city.  Great staff , good food, good price.
author: TANIS B.

description:
Haven't had a bad meal here before.  Still LOVE their ahi sandwiches (with the ginger on the side) and their ahi salad bowls are pretty fab too.

Not a huge fan of the sweet potato fries, but I must be the only person who doesn;t like it.
author: Fi G.

description: Fat people dont get fat by eating fish.  But for the price you pay for the quality of fish, you may see more obese fish eaters out there.  The ahi poke was freaking amazing and the sweet potato fries sounded crappy for a fatty like me but they were surprisingly really good.  When you pop 10 fries in your mouth at once its bliss.  The salmon here didnt even taste like salmon.  The flavor was not fishy at all and it didnt even have a salmon "flavor."  I am hoping it was salmon otherwise the chickens they are cooking have mutant KFC grade.  If you like the idea of Japanese fish and chips cooked by someone not from Japan or England you will love Pac Catch.
author: Fatty A.

description: Much, much better that I expected.  Actually, pretty close to "damn good."  I thought it was a bit chain-y to have good food, but not so, friends, not so.  (And I actually don't even think it's a chain).  Nice staff, small bar for the singletons, and great food.  Get the wasabi bowl, which includes lots of different things in small portions.  Good for people like me, who like to be entertained while we eat.
author: Pammy C.

description: I love their rice bowls. It's like a deconstructed sushi roll (tried the Ahi Poke), with a good sized portion of fish, seaweed, ginger, etc, all on top of brown rice. Very tasty and definitely would get this again. The tacos were good, but more importantly the sweet potato fries served with them were so good I'd come back just for those. Nice to have this down the street from the house should a craving for fish and fries hit again.
author: Abby Z.

description: This place rules.  Ive eaten here about a thousand times.  Sunday..beer..sweet potato fries..salmon and rice.fish tacos.are you out of your mind.! Eat here..you will be so happy.
author: Michelle K.

description: pacific catch is probably as mediocre as it gets. nothing they serve is absolutely amazing, but theres nothing (that i've tried so far) that's really terrible either. the prices are pretty average. no, i take that back, theyre slightly pricey for the kind of food that they serve. it's the kind of place you go to when you want to sit down and have dinner with a couple friends without having to splurge. they have happy hour on the bar side after 10 PM so you can get some of the appetizers for pretty cheap. its the sort of of place i'd go to a couple times a year, more because of the surroundings and not so much the food or service.
author: Linh P.

description: Excellent place for lunch.  I get the rice bowls that comes with poki (spicy tuna...yummy...) and it has seaweed salad and avocadoes and ginger and brown (or white, if you prefer) rice and it's all for 11$.  Can you believe it?  There's so much food, you could even split it with someone.
author: Tangerine L.

description: I'm a huge fan of the ahi or poke wasabi bowls!  Its pretty much a bowl of rice, with ahi or poke, seaweed, ginger, cucumber, avocado, and that delicious wasabi sauce.  I usually get an extra side of the sauce cause it's that good.  I've had their fish tacos which are pretty tasty and their sweet potato fries are awesome!
author: Lauren M.

description: This place has carved out a niche market and has enjoyed great popularity.  Its basically fast food japanese style in a sandwich shop setting.  Lots of fresh fish choices served in a variety of ways including atop rice, as a sandwich or salad.  I had the seared ahi salad which was very fresh and quite good.  They have a counter bar you can sit at.  Two complaints: it was a bit hot and congested and the server had a bit of an attitude. Overall, though, a great concept delivered quite successfully.
author: Rick H.

description: What is there not to like about this fresh fish place to eat? well, perhaps the size, but just pull up to the bar and order some of the best fish tacos you can get in the city. But beware: when you do sit at the bar you will be smelling like some of the fish they're cooking...
author: Chris D.

description: Yes, I have an addiction for Asian-fusion cuisine. I think I've to declare it before you keep on reading. This said, this place is awesome. Tiny, true, a pain to park, true, but the food is excellent. We had a rice bowl with Ahi poke (mouth melting) and a seared Ahi salad. The complexity of the dish relies on the different ingredients, wisely organized to match the neighboring one. So, pea shoots near the fish and slightly separated from the seaweed julienne etc etc. Ok...I know, this is crazy,  right? Do they really do it on purpose? Well, I think so and even not considering this, the quality of the dish itself is stunning. A Sierra, a glass of Viognier and for 38$ we left wonderfully satisfied. I definitely love the Japan oriented food here.
author: Dario B.

description:
Pacific Catch makes me want to become a better reviewer. Arriving at this quaint chain when there's no line of athletic Marina health enthusiasts and their dogs out of the door is a miracle in timing. This visit, I am paying particular note, but just as I am reaching for the most eloquent of adjectives, the happiest metaphor, my crab wasabi bowl arrives and I, forgetting all noble intentions get stuck in. Chopsticks, be damned, their rice bowls are a genius concept and I find myself "just in the neighbourhood" every week.  Anyone with a love of seafood, a respect for the healthier side of life or just looking for somewhere to sit down (giving myself away, am I?) on Chestnut Street has to be a lifelong fan. Imagine all the contents of the most scrumptious crab roll laid out in a bowl, with nutty, crunchy brown rice and balsamic vinegarette I would leave my husband for. Or perhaps he would leave me, as I return home guilty with all the evidence of an orgy in my mouth.
 
I've sampled the coleslaw with a generous lashing of sesame seeds, and sweet potato fries - both of which I already wrote home about. 

It's charmingly cramped, with super nice servers and open windows that require no dressing. The beers are frosty and sereved fast. It's the Marina in all its glory. Especially on that annual warm, sunny day. 

Three words: Got to go.
author: Killing Me Softly ..

description: Perfect ahi tuna bowl
author: Mark W.

description: Great fresh seafood. Love the fish and chips or cabo shrimp tacos. Sweet potato fries! yum. Tried both locations and never disappointed. Both great neighborhoods to visit.
author: A L.

description: This place is so yummy and healthy! I always get the Grilled Salmon salad and boy is it satisfying.  Everytime I have come for dinner or lunch, I've always been seated immediately and I always receive the best possible service from all the employees.  Food orders come quick and with a smile.  It's really great!
author: Michelle F.

description: This place is butts-to-nuts packed every time I go there but I really love the food! My fav is the Wasabi Ahi Sandwich and I crave it on a regular basis. The little slaw salad that comes with is so good I have tried to replicate it at home. The prices are cheap compared to most eateries in the Marina and the staff is always pleasant. In such a small space you'd think they'd want to scratch your eyes out for asking for a fork. They never have.
author: Julie O.

description:
soooooooooo happy to have had dinner here. cute/cozy and delicious. i wish i lived nearby so i could eat here more often! 

i'm craving those shrimp tacos and sweet potatoe fries right now....go ahead and go now and eat some for me too. :)
author: Donna K.

description: Not a bad place to have a cheap meal if you absolutely HAVE to be in the Marina District for some reason.  The sweet potato fries are fantastic; unfortunately, sometimes it's a crap shoot as far as availability.  The place is small, so avoid getting the back corner table (good luck getting in and out if you do).  Otherwise, a good value and a good meal.
author: Casey R.

description: Wasabi bowls are a great bang for the buck (something you don't find too often in the Marina)- poke and ahi bowls are personal faves!  Take out is an excellent alternative to trying to get a seat in this tiny restaurant and the food is just as scrumptious.  Fish is totally fresh and tasty.  Highly recommend Pacific Catch!
author: Erin L.

description: It's trendy seafood not good seafood but its not exactly terrible either.
author: Wakako U.

description: I had the ahi poke wasabi bowl and boy was it good!  Cubes of raw tuna, shaved cucumber, seaweed salad, and other stuff all over a copious amount of sushi rice.     And had a side of sweet potato fries which came with 3, count-em, 3 dipping sauces.  This place is literally a hole in the wall on Chestnut but the food and the great service has put this place on the ever growing list of Herb's Must Eat's.    I should start on a "Herb's Must Eat" list now..
author: Herb C.

description:
The driving instructions from their website were quite sufficient. However, knowing San Francisco very well, I knew it wasn't the quickest route. Once there, locating the restaurant was simple, but parking was difficult. After circling for 10 minutes, I found a spot and walked over.

The restaurant was very crowded. People were overflowing to the sidewalk, either waiting for a table or their to-go orders. From the outside, Pacific Catch was very eye-catching. They had a big sign and nice, vibrant color combinations. Inside, the restaurant kept a simple, yet thoughtful fish theme. Paintings of fish and the sea decorated the walls. In the front were the few tables that people were fighting over. They also had a bar area with stools that were all occupied. I was able to point out 4 people working there.

Once I entered, I could see why it was so loud over the phone. It was really too crowded and busy to expect anyone to greet me. I found the pick-up area, and waited for 3 minutes until someone asked me if I were picking up food or wanted to order. After telling them I was just picking up, the waiter proceeded to ring up 3 orders before attending to me. The manager came to me and asked if I were being helped before the waiter came back to me with the total cost of my order. Once I paid, the food was already bagged and ready to go. The waiter thanked me for waiting and did not say good bye as he began ringing up the next customer.

I ordered the sweet potato fries and wasabi poke bowl. The fries were excellent. They were battered perfectly, and weren't too oily. In fact, they were still nice and crunchy when I arrived home close to 20 minutes after. They provided 3 dipping sauces, chili sauce, ginger mayo, and jalapeno sauce. All of the sauces tasted good, not too salty or creamy. I was disappointed that the jalapeno sauce wasn't spicy at all. In fact, none of the sauces had any "kick" to them at all. The wasabi poke bowl was quite delicious. Although it had too much rice for my liking, everything else was well portioned. The poke pieces weren't cubed too big, perfect for a single bite. The pickled ginger cut the fish taste between bites, and the seaweed salad was not too salty. The only issue I had with the poke bowl was that the wasabi was barely noticeable. I had to double check the receipt to make sure I was given the right order. If you put wasabi in the name of the dish, I think it should be very apparent from the first bite. Overall, it's definitely a must, if only once to see if you like it.
author: Axel G.

description: Wasabi Ahi = yum.  Sweet potato fries were very tasty.  Service = fail.  It's a tiny place that's very busy, I get it.  Completely forgetting to bring our miso soup, bad.  Not checking on the table, bad.  Not refilling water, bad.  Absolutely zero regard, apology, or effort to correct miso soup debacle after pointing it out, bad.
author: Parker W.

description: My husband and I never tire of Pacific Catch for consistently great, easy meal.  The crab wasabi bowl with brown rice is my favorite--kind of like a giant california roll in a bowl.  Servers are always nice and easygoing.  Nothing beats their hot sweet potato fries!
author: marissa t.

description: This is always my first stop when I travel to San Francisco. Neither fancy nor a culinary revelation, it's simply divine soul food done very well in an informal atmosphere.  If I ever find myself in one of those dramatic old B&W movies - where they ask you want you want for your last meal? - Pacific Catch's fish tacos, sweet potato fries and asparagus with wasabi aioli just might be what I would order.  And then, I would simply surrender to fate.
author: Linda M.

description:
I came to this place w/ my g/f for lunch one day while we were walking around the Marina.  As a native to San Francisco I love to go through neighborhoods that I grew up and and see what's new.  As we walked along Chestnut we came across Pacific Catch.  I looked inside and noticed the place was pretty spic and span.  I liked the decor also and thought to myself why not.  

We went inside and were kindly greeted and seated right away.  Our server then brought us water and menus.  My g/f ordered the Ahi salad and I ordered a mahi mahi sandwich.  I took one bite of my sandwich and it was bliss!  My g/f tried her salad was in love.  You can taste how fresh the fish is there, I truly recommend this place if you're a fan of fish.  The price isn't so bad either, I'd say it's pretty average for the neighborhood.
author: Anthony T.

description: I hate the Marina as much as the next fatty with half a brain, but the mahi mahi and island shrimp taco platter with sweet potato fries are well worth the feeling of wanting to rip my skin off.  The service has always been great, by the way.
author: Wayne B.

description: I've never eaten here because it's too claustrophobic inside, but I order their takeout regularly. Their rice bowls are aight BUT their California Crab and Avocado salad is the BEST. It's huge and just so good!
author: Dee I.

description: A friend suggested this place and after the first time, I probably went back about 3 or 4 times within the same month! I mostly just came back for the hawaiian poke starter and sweet potato fries. Yumm...Im getting hungry thinking about the sweet, crispy little fries. Everything else I tried has been  decent. The fish tacos are okay, but I didnt find anything special about them. The wasabi bowls were a bit too much for me. It's like eating a sushi in a bowl, which was good at first, but a bit too much rice for me in the end. If you have room for dessert, the fried dulce de leche spring rolls was GOOD. Basically a version of deep fried ice cream with caramel. However, what has really stopped me from going back lately is the wait. The place is really small and can get really packed quickly at different times of the day. But you can always order take out, which they do a lot of!
author: Kim C.

description: My boyfriend and I love this place.  It's great for a quick, healthy bite to eat that won't take a huge toll on your wallet.  We love their tacos all of which are good but the shrimp ones are the best!  We also have had the ahi tuna and poke bowls and salads, yummy.  They make a pretty decent miso soup as well and we always get the edamame.  There is usually a line for this place at peak dining hours but it moves pretty quickly.  Parking is rough because it's the Marina.
author: Carly P.

description: I know it may seem like I give alot of high stars but I go to good places for food.  This place is another favorite of mine.  It took me over a year before I gave it a shot and now it is one of my favorite places in the Marina Area.  The Wasabi bowls are so good.  Every fish is great and fresh.  The Crab in the Wasabi bowl is very good also and the catch of the day is great too.  The crazy fries they have are very solid and tasty.  Forget what they are called.  I eat alot of food and the Wasabi Bowls fill me up.  Good place to go if you are looking for some solid Fish.
author: Harry E.

description: I am addicted to the seared ahi salad. Pacific Catch makes it easy to eat healthier (as long as you remember to get the dressing on the side).  Yes, it gets crowded. Yes, sometimes you have to wait. YES, you can preorder your meal, then just waltz in and get it to go.
author: Pamela B.

description:
do you know how many times i passed by this place and i was like "ugh! this place seems so red lobster/in&out...PASS!" why i thought that when i saw the outside i dont know. but it obviously is a testament to the phrase "dont just a book by its cover". i freaking loooooooove this place.

my friend suggested this place and i was like eh fine whatever ill try it out. and thank you yelp for the recommendations!!!!!!

wait was long. they said 10 minutes but it was more like 30 and we were super cramped. but its a small place and i think the food definitely makes up for it. our server was super nice. he looked hella busy but he was good.

the shrimp tacos were bomb! neither the sauce or the batter over the shrimp was over powering. the sweet potato fries were AWESOME! and in one of the meals (i think it was with the fries) there was a wasabi dip.

the quarters a tight cramped but its damn well worth it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: A. V.

description: Amazing Asian Fusion food. I had this rice bowl where the place sashimi on the top..topped off with seaweed. Seating is limited.
author: Prescott T.

description: Five stars for this find. I had the Crab Salad Wasabi Rice Bowl, which exceeded expectations for delicious flavor and nutrition without any detectable side-effects of excessive salt or fat content overload. The redhead made sure everything ran smoothly boosting the atmosphere from upscale utilitarian, matching the decor, to classy.
author: F. B.

description: A fun, simple seafood restaurant in the Marina, better for a casual dinner or lunch than a full out meal. Their fish tacos are fantastic, try either the mahi mahi or the bbq salmon. I'd also recommend any version of their teriaki bowl entree, and the tune poke appetizer has never disappointed.
author: Nish N.

description: A rare place to find food that's both very healthy and very delicious! I LOVE the poke there, actually, there hasn't been a single thing I didn't LOVE eating there! It's a small place, so if you haven't been, be patient if they're backed up..The food is great!   Reasonably priced as well (my friend & I spent about $40).  Definately try their Fish w/ Sweet Potato fries.  YUM
author: Gio G.

description: Yum. I love their cole slaw, and I am from the Midwest, so I am a picky-ass cole slaw eatter. Not too much mayo, can't be runny, must have some flavor. I usually order it as a side no matter what I get as a main course. The tacos are very fresh and the staff has nice manners. Don't be afraid of the compactness inside, cause you can get that meal to go too.
author: Amanda C.

description: I came across Pacific catch over 7 years ago when I was living in the Marina and I just loved the food. Simple, healthy, clean and affordable. I am excited that the concept has taken off--new restaurants in SF and Marin. I particularly like the meal sized salads with fresh fish. It is a filling combination of vegetables with a Japanese/fusion slant. Customer service is reasonable.
author: Holly M.

description:
so i'm already plotting to come back here. it was so yummy. i had the crispy oyster basket complete with the famous sweet potato fries and two really good dipping sauces. for $12, it was enough for lunch and dinner that day. i also stole a few bites of my friends ahi poke rice bowl. i'll probably get that next time. the fish and chips and the tacos looked really good too. plan for next time: bring more people and steal food off of all their plates. 

only down side to this place is that it's tiny and hard to get a seat. we lucked out and got three seats at the counter (the best seat if you like watching them cook your food). i'm not sure if it's easier to get a seat at lunch or dinner, but expect that there will be a wait. totally worth it though!
author: Kitty H.

description:
where else can i get a fish taco, wakame salad & sweet potato fries..at the same time??  was here for lunch on a lovely sunday afternoon and enjoyed every last bite.  there's something very san diegan about pacific catch & i like how they put their menu together.  

the baja fish taco was scrumptious with the fish fried, cabbage and a very tangy sauce.  the sweet potato fries were shoestring style & served with 2 tasty sauces..sweet chili & something that resembled wasabi aioli.  the wakame was also tasty and a good offset to my otherwise fried feast.

would i go again:  if i lived anywhere near the marina i'd be a regular for sure!
author: Niki M.

description: Parking stinks, but it's worth the circling around for 30 minutes. Their ahi poke bowl makes my mouth water just thinking about it. Prices very good and portions are large. The place is pretty tiny though so don't plan on coming with a big group.
author: Linda L.

description:
It's weird that I would rate the two restaurant so differently but that's because they are very different.

I came here on a chance discovery when I was scouring *gasp* citysearch.  It actually found me one of my now favorite restaurants.  Coming here recently, I was amazed to find it uncrowded on a sunny Saturday at noon.  We sat down quickly and knew exactly what to order.  I got the ahi tuna sandwich and my fiancee ordered the ahi poke salad.  Of course we ordered a BASKET of sweet potato fries.  A side of sweet potato fries is not enough for a hungry couple.

The serving sizes here are always big and you get a great deal for your buck.  I give this place 5 stars compared to the new place because the prices are lower here.  I also like the vibe on an afternoon.  I'll keep coming here whenever I'm in the area.  It's so good.
author: Scott L.

description: am I the only one disturbed by the lurid, neon pink hue of the ahi?  The food here's solid, and feels healthy, but the color of the fish alone sends my stomach into an unhealthy downward spiral.  Sweet potato fries, however, rock.  Also, despite the implied promise of the recent iPhone commercial, there isn't any calamari (or octopus) here to be found...great marketing, but a pretty ironic oversight....
author: Kosuke I.

description: Had the shrimp ceviche and ahi poke - both were delish! Will go back to try other menu items!
author: ReviewNu T.

description: Woooow...they have the most fresh fish i have tasted in a long time!  if u like a casual place with good fish n chips n good aioli sauce then go down n check them out.....their fresh "true cod" is delish...  for u unagi lovers, they have a unagi wasabi bowl which is also good!
author: Mee-stique K.

description: This is a good value for money gem, compared to the higher prices of most its neighbors, and for the money, you can get a very nice balanced meal. I particularly like their teriyaki bowls, with some nice fish, bunch of vegetables and rice. My fav take-out spot of the moment.
author: Bruce C.

description:
d.e.l.i.c.i.o.u.s.  
you must order the Wasabi Poke bowl!!  and sweet potato fries if you wanna splurge.  this tiny little fresh fish place in the marina is my most favorite eatery in the entire city.  super quick and soo tasty.  perfect for a healthy dinner to-go.  the bowls are huge...filled with rice, fresh veggies, and fish/meat/tofu.  love it!
author: Kelsey C.

description: If you feel like being cramped in a place that is meant to only hold about 5 people, wait 20 minutes for an appetizer, get completely over-charged for food that is mediocre at best, and wait 15-30 minutes before you get your check you will love Pacific Catch.
author: Jacob B.

description:
There is shitload of reviews already, so I am not going to try to re-invent the wheel here.

Just make sure you have layered your clothing, it gets hot as hell in there and order the sweet potato fries.  Besides that, have at it,  great food!
author: Pete C.

description: The only reason I didn't give five stars is because it is a little bit cramped.  All the seafood here blows away the overpriced places you find on embarcadero.
