Fish tacos were amazing, as well as the rice bowls and modestly priced beer and sake.  We ended up ordering the fried ice-cream spring rolls for dessert and might come back just for that.  Even though the place looked busy, service was very prompt and friendly.  Definitely plan to come back soon.
author: Shane G.

description: ONE WORD: DIRRRTTTTTYYYYYYYYYY place! i had the ahi poke salad and it was just ok...they keep using the same old oil when they fried their fries & etc.....will never go back!!!!!
author: Nelle A.

description: Very nice food in an informal but hectic atmosphere. Big salads with a great wasabi-spiced dressing. Great sandwiches. The tacos are OK. And the rice bowls look good but I haven't tried them yet. The bad parts are the lack of seating and the difficulty of getting to your seat squeezing in between the tight tables, the slow service, and the huge crowds standing outside waiting for either a seat or takeout. Oh, the beers they have suck.
author: Cris L.

description: I've been here a couple of times, my gf and her friend love it... it was alright for me... and IIRC they do not have calamari...
author: Andrew N.

description: Others have said enough. I'll agree and say that this place is the bomb. I got the poke appetizer, which is perfect if you're feeling like something light but still want your dose of sashimi. with the rice bowls, my two buddies paid a few bucks extra and added another flavor of fish. i had fun watching those two guys stuff their face while I sipped on my 'cricket' (try it, it's like a better version of coke).
author: Anderson L.

description: For fresh, affordable, healthy food on the go, this place can't be beat. Haven't had one bad thing there, from the fish tacos to the sweet potato fries, although the best thing on the menu is the Ahi Tuna Poke Wasabi Bowl. SOOO good! Call in your order or get there early - this place gets PACKED!
author: Sarah R.

description: I like this place, but eating here sucks because of the cramped quarters and long wait.  Advice: phone in your order and park by the Wells Fargo if you're driving to pick it up.
author: Ryan P.

description: I miss this place more than any other when I lived in San Fran... You won't be disappointed!
author: Just H.

description: Up until now, I was semi disappointed with the salads here at Pacific Catch.  I love the bowls, I love the combos, but I hated the skimpiness of the goodies.  Bottom line, too much filler, not enough substance.  I used to get my ahi salad and have just mounds of lettuce....Last night, ventured there, got the salad, debated if it was that or something else, but went for the salad.  And to my pleasant surprise there wasn't so much packed lettuce, but more toppings.  I was very happy.  It's always so packed there, and the food is consistently good.  We also had the taco platter, with the BBQ salmon taco and shrimp taco.  The BBQ salmon was wonderful, great flavor and nicely broiled on the grill.  I think my next meal there will be BBQ salmon salad.
author: ERICA E.

description:
Update: Avoid the Chestnut location, this place is a POS. There's a new, HUGE location in the Inner Sunset on 9th. It's SOOO much better!!

=================
Terrible. I've gone here once before and had an average dining experience w/ the crab wasabi bowl. Nothing special, just decent filler for the tummy. 

BUT, today, we went for lunch and it was the most TERRIBLE dining experience I've had in awhile. So bad, I'm swearing off Pac Catch forever. Oh and we didn't leave a tip and we ALWAYS leave a tip. That's damn bad.

So we get there mid-afternoon, the place is bustling as expected for Sunday. We get seated after about 10 mins, no biggie. We order our meals and drinks as usual. The place is seriously tiny, it holds maybe 8 people at the counter and maybe 12 more at the small tables in the front. I don't understand why 3 supposedly competent servers can't handle this amount of people. My bf and I were seated next to the counter where the cooks put all the dishes to be served. So I see my dish sitting there for a good 15 minutes and then my bf's dish sitting there for at least 5 mins. I also witnessed 2 servers look at it, ask each other 'whose food is this?'..."i dunno"...then our pathetic little server man strolls over finally and looks at it, "oh it's table 12's"...That would be us.
They put the food on our table and whaddya know, they made the wrong thing for me. Of course. And instead of returning it right away and getting the new dish put through to the cooks, they put it back on the counter and walked away. My bf had his correct dish luckily, except it was supposed to be warm grilled mahi. Since it was sitting out so long on the counter, it wasn't warm. And it was soggy. 

After sitting another 5 minutes or so staring at my incorrect dish STILL sitting on the counter, my dumb waiter-guy finally saw it again and FINALLY asked the cooks to make the correct meal. So, I figure "ok, my dish is easy and nothing needs to be cooked, this shouldnt take more than a couple mins"...so I wait...and wait...increasingly getting more and more pissed off. A wasabi bowl is rice, seaweed, and cold crab salad! good lord. after about 15 more mins, I just get up and tell them to just cancel my portion of the meal. My bf was done eating and I hadn't gotten anything yet! WTF. The guy I told gave me this half-assed "sorry" and told our server the news, who then gave me the evil eye, which I gladly returned. 

We then asked for a box and never got it. So we asked another guy, who pulled them from a stack that was right next to us! UGH, I think I woulda been happier if I could have just served myself, at least I would have gotten everything a lot quicker. 

No tip for you a**holes!
author: Jen P.

description: From the looks of the reviews below....its all been said!  Great little place with a shockingly good menu and fantastic service!  Try the AHI Poke..ONO!
author: Derik P.

description: I've eaten here twice now and have no complaints. Its reasonably priced and the food is great. I really like when I can watch my food being made also. Today I ordered the lunch special which was the Poke Salad. It was huge and full of large cubes of delicious Ahi. In fact, its not often when I order raw fish and run out of stomach room before I run out of food on my plate. This was the case today. Last time I got the fish tacos and enjoyed them also.
author: Kimberly B.

description: A tiny place in the marina district that serves quality fresh seafood dishes for surprisingly low prices!  Their sandwiches are tasty with a good amount of fish.  I also liked their bowl thing, which kinda reminded me of the korean bi bim bap dish.  The food comes out fast too.
author: Shyam P.

description: Quality fresh ingredients, asian fusion, mochi fondue, and seafood...and you can walk out without having to get a second mortgage on the house?  I couldn't believe it myself when I first came here.  I probably come here about once every few weeks and I live in South Beach.  I haven't found a salad in the city that I like more than the salad bowl with ahi poke.  Where else can you get avocado, pickled ginger, sashimi grade hawaiian marinated ahi tuna in a salad?  Dream come true.  The Wasabi Ahi sandwich is perfect for a nice grab and go lunch at Chrissy Field.  The sweet potato fries are a must.  Fish and shrimp tacos are excellent.  And the staff is always really cool too.
author: Dave L.

description: Came here for the first time tonight and it was pretty good. Almost every table ordered the tuna poke so we had to try it. It came with a side of chips, tuna was good but a lil on the salty side. Then we ordered the House Special salad with chicken, it was tasty, flavorful and consists of all kinds of spring vegetable, edamame, sauteed mushrooms and sprouts. Good dining experience. Will be back to try the rice bowls next time.
author: Yan M.

description: Really nice environment with good food. Hawaiian Poke was delicious and so was the calamari. I was bummed because they were completely out of fries when we went, so we all had a total of like five salads. But the waitress was apologetic and nice about it, and overall service was good. The Mahi Mahi Sandwich was a little bit bland. The fish & chips a little overpriced. GET THE DULCE DE LECHE. That made the meal.
author: Amanda H.

description: I usually take my order to-go at this location because it's a small place so I wouldn't recommend going in a group, but they have delicious food. The fish tacos are my favorite and the sweet potato fries are absolutely delicious. The sauces that you can dip your  fries into make them that much better, although they're extremely good on their own. Pacific Catch hits the spot for me.
author: Jen Y.

description: It takes discipline to not come here every night... I live right by the place and so it's the perfect place for take out after a long work day and no plans for cooking. I get the Ahi Poke Wasabi Bowl every time and highly recommend this dish for your first visit. Every single person I've take here for the first time always comes back for more. Poke poke poke
author: Bernadette L.

description: Yes, I drive here on my lunch to pick up the Spicy Ahi Sandwich w sweet potato fries. That's because if I wait till later on in the day, they run out of bread. But when life throws a curve ball and i'm not able to make it here in time, I usually settle for a wasabi-rice bowl, brown rice of course! I don't mind taking my order to-go on sunny afternoons to enjoy by the water, but when the tiny restaurant space is packed and it's cold outside, what is a hungry girl to do?
author: Deanna T.

description: Love the food,  great fries,  no place to really sit but great food at a good value
author: Jonathan F.

description: Food poisoning alert! After my experience at this restaurant tonight, I'm starting to think that "catch of the day" means "catch of 5 days ago, left out on the counter to rot." My fiance and I got dinner here tonight and have spent the last few hours tag-teaming the toilet. Our dinners were delicious, but the pain that ensued just wasn't worth it.
author: Louis P.

description:
i heart pacific catch!! randomly happened on this place one night & have been going back ever since. a few highlights:

- take out is fast & fresh
- the wasabi bowls are the BEST THING EVER
- all of my out of town friends beg me to take them to pacific catch when they are visiting!
- sweet potato fries mmmm
- on my birthday, a group of 10 of us showed up (my friend planning the surprise dinner didnt know how tiny the place was). they cleared out the front & totally accomodated us. plus they served us free dessert!

i have never had a bad experience here. sure, it can get crazy busy & sometimes there are drunkards outside, but its a great place for a fast & fresh meal on the go!
author: Jessica B.

description:
Solidly good seafood. I had been there several times and was never disappointed with anything I ordered. This place is very a popular Marina staple, so expect things to be busy. 

The fish is fresh, the menu is fusion [Asian, Pacific Island, Latin America] and very well integrated. 

Now for the negatives. Yes, busy and yes crowded. Also, if you are averse to the uber-materialistic, trying too hard to be cool crowd, you may find some nights to be annoying. The Marina is lousy with these types. 

Personally, I think Pacific Catch is well worth  the sacrifice.

:)
author: Paula C.

description: Be prepared for a tight squeeze! The place is pretty small inside and the tables are pretty close together, but the food is well worth it! Their fish and chips is actually fish and sweet potato fries! Delicious!!
author: Vanessa W.

description: Good food, quick service and very health...nuff said.
author: Nick H.

description: The fish tacos, the sandwiches, the salads, and the wasabi bowls are great.  The sweet potato fries are out of this world fantastic.  Mind you, as others have posted, their location is small and seating limited which is why I frequently get my food to go.  WARNING - make sure to check your order before you leave, 80% of the time something is missing; usually the dipping sauces for the fries.
author: Jason R.

description: LOVE it! It's loud and crazy busy, but the wait is totally worth it. The sweet potato fries, MUST! And my favorite Crab and Avocado Salad is to die for. I can't break away. Take out is always an option, as it gets a bit claustrophobic in there. BBQ salmon taco is fantastic. The food is really unique as it's kind of like sushi-mex.. it really works.
author: Jennifer L.

description: The taco combo is spectacular!  You get your choice of two tacos with a salad or fries...for me I get the fried fish of the day, the chicken and some fries.  They are known for their sweet potato fries, however I stick to the regular fries.  Fantastic Arnold Palmers as well!  My advise is try this place!
author: ELIZABETH W.

description:
I really like the food at Pacific Catch. It's tasty and it's fresh. It's also close to my apartment which is great. Usually get the Poke Bowl. I've had nothing but good experiences here...until yesterday. Our waitress sucked (blonde curly hair in a pony tail...i think her name was Katie). We sat at the counter for 15 minutes before she even acknowledged our presence. We had to go get our own menus and then she finally waited on us because someone else sat down next to us. If they had stayed in their original seats, we might not have been waited on at all. I thought she was rude. The friend I was with had the same waitress the last time she was there and said the same thing...rude, unattentive, careless. I know it's not a hoity toity restaurant, but you could act like you gave a damn!

I would still recommend this place. I would just warn you to steer clear if she's working.
author: Erik B.

description: OMG!! hands down....my absolute favorite place to eat in SF. I love the tokyo salmon and the rice bowls. very crowded but totally worth the wait.
author: erica w.

description: I came here late night, past 9 pm on a Sunday evening and there were still a good number of people eating.  We were seated immediately at the counter.  The bowls and the fish and chips looked amazing.  My husband ordered the sticky ribs bowl which was a little too salty and saucy.  We saw how it (ribs) were made and were very surprised that the ribs were just thrown in the deep fryer.  We were thinking they were going to be grilled.  There was way too much "sticky" sauce on the ribs which made his bowl too salty.  I ordered the poke sampler which came with all three varieties.  I thought it was good but probably wouldn't order it again as a meal.  My sister got the special corn side which was just plain grilled corn and a side of the chipotle butter which was delicious.  There was parmesan, chipotle or some sort of pepper, butter, and some other seasonings in it.  Fattening but good!  And she also got a fish taco and the tortilla soup.  The soup wasn't that good.  I would come back and probably try the beef bowl, poke bowl, or the fish and chips.  Service was good and it was nice sitting at the counter and watching the chefs work in the tiny kitchen.
author: Bling L.

description:
3 Stars (3 1/2 if i base the rating on just my food)

I came here after a Martini Madness Mixer last June and had some drunk food....and since then i've been wanting to bring my girl, so today we finally came thru, but sober.  
Started off w/ Miso soup and green tea for my girl and Spicy Calamari for us to share.  Miso soup was cool, tasted like it has everywhere else, and her green tea was eh, but that's how i feel about all green tea...she said it was good though. 
I didn't forget about the calamari.....it just hadn't come out yet. 
My girl had the seared tuna salad (with "sushi grade tuna") and I had the Baja tacos w/ spicy fries and jalapeno crema (catch of the day was my favorite fish...tilapia).  My tacos were mmmmmm mmmmmm, so were the fries and the crema!  I'd definitely order it again.  Her salad was good too, except the tuna was poor quality......a little stringy, ok A LOT stringy.  I didn't want to take another bite after i chewed a wrong piece of tuna.  
They brought out the calamari afterwards because they had forgot, but no big deal.....it was real good and i liked the dipping sauce.  
Service was great and i'd definitely rather come here after getting drunk at the bars/clubs than go to fast food.  They even comped the calamari because of the mixup, which was nice but unnecessary....

Come here, but maybe think twice about the seared tuna salad
author: Ocee D.

description: this is a great place if you don't want anything upscale and are craving seafood.  i love their poke bowls here--super filling with fresh seafood.
author: Helen T.

description: This place is too tiny and in the Marina of all places, but that still didn't stop me from getting on the #22 for some sweet potato fries, a rice bowl or their tuna sandwich. One of the few food places in this area with any bite.
author: Amruta G.

description: Try the poke bowl  - for the price you can't go wrong. The sweet potato fries are also to die for. Get a side of artichokes if they have them too.  And if you can still fit anything else in your stomach order the dulce de leche egg rolls! Go hungry.
author: CarOline C.

description: oh yumminess = )  where do i begin?  the ahi tuna bowl with delicious tuna/wasabi/sticky white rice i dream of it.  i know sounds pathetic but oh so true.  also suggest the sweet potato fries & ceviche!  lovvvvve you pacific catch.  p.s. good service too!
author: Leila M.

description:
omg, i'm obsessed. although we had to wait forever to get a table, it was well worth the wait. their rice bowls are incredible. they have wasabi bowls and teriyaki bowls which both use sushi rice, covered in sauce, veggies and meat of choice. 

this place is great if you want a light meal (with leftovers) or be stuffed for a decent price.
author: selma s.

description: I have eaten here many times in the last 3 years and my last trip was disappointing. The salmon was a bit off, not exactly fresh, the music that was blaring was not exactly fresh either...left overs from the 70's...it was like trying to eat in a bowling alley, it just wasn't working for me. Hmmm are they getting a bit stale?...I think so....going somewhere else next time for some "fresh" fish.....
author: J B.

description:
I love this place!  It's simple and unpretentious food.  Staff is awesome and personable.

I love their chicken bbq sandwich, salmon bbq sandwich, tuna sandwich. love the coconut shrimp.

wish I could make that stuff!

It's also inexpensive and you get a good amount of food.
author: Tomas V.

description: The food is so good.  I love the sweet potatoes fries, the poke salad, and the chipotle chicken sandwich.   The location in the Marina is really small and cramped.  I am thrilled there is a location in the Marina.  However, if you want to sit down and enjoy your meal you should go to the one either in the Sunset or Corte Madera.
author: Annie S.

description: I LOVE the fish/shrimp/oyster plate. And I don't like oysters. So that's huge.
author: Kari G.

description: The best fish tacos I have ever eaten  -- the avocado-tomatillo sauce makes it!  The sweet potato fries are unusually good.  Please open a Pacific Catch down here in Orange County!!!
author: Andrea B.

description: Best place ever. But, you have to stumble upon it to really know its worth. Just by reading this review, you have already tainted the experience. But, when you go, which you will, don't miss out on the sweet potato fries. I would circle the globe..
author: C K.

description: I just tried their side grilled vegetables. So yummy and cheap too. They give you good protions here for what you pay for and I appreciate that.  So thank you Pacific Catch for making me want to eat my veggies!
author: Danielle K.

description:
This is a great place for a super casual dinner/lunch.  The diversity of the menu always has me in a daze for the first 10 mins I get there. Yes! I will take it all.  

I just love seafood and Pacific Catch has great, healthy, seafood in many wonderful itterations at a GREAT PRICE.
author: A T.

description: Love the Ahi Tuna Wasabi bowl with half rice, half salad!
author: Samantha D.

description: Fish tacos and poke are good, but I really only order the fish so that I don't look like a total cow eating just a basket of sweet potato fries with a beer.
author: Nat K.

description:
I have to retract portions of my previous post.  I went back to Pacific Catch, got seated right away, the fish tacos were out of this world, the service was good, and the server made a gratuitous substitution I totally should have been charged for.  I love this place.  I must of been really cranky the other night...

-----------------
I am so conflicted about this one...  if I was rating this on the food alone I would give it 5 starts.  The wasabi bowl is my perfect meal; your choice of seafood (I went with the California Crab) combined with seaweed, fresh cucumber, sliced pickled ginger, and daikon sprouts all on a bed of sticky rice... perfection.  However, there was a disconnect for me between the hole-in-the wall setting and the prices.  My bowl was $12 which I think is fair based on the quality of the food...  but having to stand outside on a cold windy street FOR FREAKING EVER to wait for a table...  being asked to MOVE after I was seated to accommodate a bigger party, the bad instant ice tea that never got refilled even once during the whole time I was seated, the fast food like service (as in no service beyond taking the order and delivering it to the table)...  I just don't know.  I can think of a dozen other places with $10 - $12 entrees where you can sit down for a civilized meal.  If I was into fish and chips or just wanted a fish taco and there wasn't a wait, this place would be a no brainer because the fish is really good.  And if I lived in the neighborhood it would be a nice take-out option.  So there it is.  By the way, I am not known for my patience.  If you don't mind waiting or chaotic tiny restaurants with crappy service, then you're going to love this place.
author: sarah k.

description: Cute little seafood restaurant on Chestnut. There are only six 2-person tables, and a few seats at the bar, so you can definitely expect a wait. It smells and feels like a sushi restaurant, and they have rice bowls (ahi poke = omfg yum!), but they also have tacos and... sweet potato fries! That alone means 2 stars in my book (see Hyatt, Sacramento review...) I had the mahi mahi taco and the shrimp taco, which were both tasty, but the corn tortilla didn't hold up through the meal. The sake was kinda milky and gross; maybe stick to beer or regular wine instead. I would definitely come back, if yet again, I am dragged to the craptastic Marina by my clueless friends. God bless 'em.
author: Valerie N.

description: this place is money!  losing points only for the usually wait/crowdedness.
author: Hammer Time H.

description: The real catch here would be our cute and friendly waiter, but I guess the poke wasabi bowl and sweet potato fries will do.
author: Yasmine G.

description: I love this place, its small, fun and intimate.  Great place for a first date.  The food is also very good.  I havent lived in the Marina for three years but I still get cravings!
author: Caleb R.

description: i had been wanting to eat at pacific catch for a looooooooong time and finally made it over there this week after a steamy yoga sesh at YTTP. the menu has a nice variety of fresh fish served in interesting ways - tacos, salads, sandwiches, rice bowls, fried, etc. i love me a good piece of fish so i was excited to dig in. i ordered the salmon salad and it was DELICIOUS. the fish was fresh, grilled, and seasoned to perfection. the salad had a nice balance of dressing to greens and a good amount of "stuff" (asparagus, avocado, cherry tomatoes, marinated shiitakes). there were also "salmon skin croutons" (deep fried salmon skin) which are pretty much like salmon bacon. YUM. my only complaint is that service was pretty slow and it's a bit tight in there. i had to stick my bootay in my neighbor's face to get up....
author: Rachael S.

description: I've been hearing pretty rave reviews of this place for over a year and just haven't made the trip to the Marina to check it out for myself.  I finally did, and boy was I glad!  Our server was hilarious and great, and the food was awesome for the price.  Not a ton of seating, and they don't take reservations, but if you have a small party, totally worth trying to weasel your way in.  Their happy hour menu looks great too so I should make a trip back for that!
author: Britta D.

description: Tiny little place with great fresh fish, reasonable prices and super friendly service. We wandered in on a Sunday night around 9:45 after being rejected by Mas Sake on Lombard. Our server was very helpful, steering us away from a terriyaki dish and recommending the ahi poke instead. One entree and a bowl of miso soup was plenty for two not super hungry people to share and I think the bill came out to just about $20. Not bad! They have take out so I definitely think I'll be back when I don't feel like cooking but don't want to eat something fast-foodish.
author: Lindsey S.

description: Tiny place, but the food is great. Those sweet potato fries! Service very lackadaisical mind you.
author: Stuart J.

description: Went back and got the fish and chips and edamame. Very yummy - and the chips were the wonderful sweet potato fries. Our server was amazing the first two thirds of the meal. He refilled my thai iced tea, which I had never seen happen. But then we waited for about half an hour after we were all finished before he even noticed us to bring us the check. A bit of a sour ending, but otherwise a great place!
author: Monika M.

description: The wasabi rice bowls, salad bowls, and sweet potato fries.  What more could you ask for?  I've heard the tacos are good too, but I just can't bring myself to order something different.  The bowl dishes are HUGE and delicious.  It's all prepared in an open kitchen (you can sit at the counter and watch them work).  Be prepared to wait for a table, or order takeout, they usually have an order ready in about 15 minutes.  Sadly, no delivery service.
author: Lindsay B.

description: I have a new favorite cheap eats restaurant.  Great value, fresh ingredients, acceptable service and BROWN RICE.  Love it.
author: T-Bone L.

description: This place would be great if the space were bigger.  The lines at this place really deter business so we ordered to go.  I had the poke salad and while the poke was fresh and there was lots of it, the tuna was a bit chewy.  Otherwise, pretty good salad.  Boyfriend had the wasabi bowl with salmon, which looked really yummy.  Will have to try next time.
author: Mitzi C.

description: Yay for sweet potato fries!  This restaurant can be pricey depending on what you order.  My favorite regular menu items are the poke wasabi bowl, fish and chips, and shrimp tacos.  If get sweet potato fries along with your meal, be sure to ask for the sweet thai dipping sauce.  Yum!  Complimentary goldfish crackers and edamame are a plus.
author: Sheryl L.

description: I always go here for good conversation.  Though it's usually not with the person I eat with.  The tables here are so close together that you are pretty much forced to eavesdrop on the daters sitting next to you.  (I say daters because it's the Marina and the folks next to you are inevitably on some sort of date/pre-hookup.)  I like that the food seems fresh and it's relatively cheap.  The waitstaff tends to be grumpy, but hey, how would you feel if you had to run around all day in a box no bigger than a janitor's closet?  I'll keep coming back for the food and "neighborly" conversation.
author: Dubs W.

description:
Love this place.  I love the toyko salmon, and the bowls.  Everything is very filling.  The dipping sauces are what make it for me, and the way it's cooked.  Nothing is overfried, and cooked just right in my opinion.  I like popping in after work, or even later in the evening and grabbing a satisfying bite to eat.  

If anything, the only con to this particular location of Pacific Catch is the lack of seating space.  No big deal, worth the wait.  :)
author: Peter C.

description: Totally an Asian fusion restaurant! At first, when I saw the place in Marin, I didn't feel like eating there. Being Asian myself.. eating fusion food?? totally no in my book! why would you if you can get an authentic ones?! But, today, GF brought me here for lunch and adviced me to order the Ahi Poke Wasabi Bowl ($11.95) and YUUUMMMMM!!! never thought that it would be so good and the portion is a lot! So, I had left over for dinner =)
author: Daisy S.

description: Loved this casual, fresh, interesting, relatively inexpensive place.  Not a perfect place for kids, but we managed (even at the counter with an 8 yr/old and 3 yr/old).  I live in the San Diego area and if I'm in SF, I'll go back.  Cute, helpful, quick, busy...
author: Sherpa M.

description: OH SNAP!!!! Sweet potato fries. You will order a side and then ask for teh basket. I don't know how they make them so good. SO light!!! So crispy!!! And that is just one of their sides. Their poke on anything is good. Really, they do fish really well. They also have these rices bowls that are out of this world. The sandwiches and tacos are great.  OK. everything there is great. I'm a big fan.
author: L A.

description: I love this place and would easily give it 5 stars but I got sick one time after eating here.  I still wouldn't hesitate to go back though - this was one of my staples when I lived a few blocks from the Chestnut location.  I would go at least once a week.  Prices are reasonable and quality is good.  Space is kind of limited at this location but you can get it to-go.
author: Michael N.

description: It's good food that's not bad for your body. Limited parking at this location although they recently opened up a public parking place next to it. Not the best place for a large group of people because it is a small location. Great for take-out, also well priced!
author: Valerie C.

description: i had no idea what i wanted to eat at this place.  the server was quite helpful and friendly, giving me a bowl of water for two thirsty dogs in my car.  Since i wasn't sure what i was in the mood for, i asked my server for a suggestion, and she recommended the spicy ahi sandwich, with sweet potato fries.  T'was good!  oh, why only 4 stars then?  the place was too small and the servers were too busy.  The diet coke tasted a little odd.  It's also a fight to find parking in this area, but it's not fair to knock them for that.
author: joseph k.

description: The tacos are to die for. I love good fresh fish and if you do to this is a place for you. Usually a wait but well worth it. The help is pleasant and considerate. The atmosphere is casual and fun. It's a bit too cramped for a romantic dinner. The Ahi poke bowl is a favorite!
author: Aaron D.

description: This place is always busy.  And it never disappoints.  There is a full menu, but if you are in the mood for something you don't see, or if you want to combine items from different dishes, all you have to do is ask.  If you are lucky enough to be served by Jeffrey--who is THE BEST, or Amy who rivals him, they are willing to help you decide on your order.  The food is always excellent---fishes, salads, tacos and sides; YUM.
author: Risa M.

description: Pacific Catch is always a nice and refreshing treat!  The Poki i fresh and so are the rest of their dishes...  Everytime I've been there with the lady, the menu had something new on it!  I nice place to eat!  Enjoy!
author: James H.

description: I walked into pacific catch for lunch and being in a vegetarian mood started to turn around when they said they could make me  something veggie.. a tofu sandwich with mango salsa and a seaweed salad... wow!! It was great!! I'll be back again  for sure!
author: elliemae r.

description: Delicious, fresh food, tasty sauces, and friendly service. Nice, cozy atmosphere.
author: Dan M.

description: Really 3.5 stars.  The food is good but feel rushed.  Typical for the area, good stuff but self absorbed staff.  I usually get a bite her after a run.  Makes me feel I'm eating healthy with brain food (but most likely high in calories).
author: Roc W.

description: Chamin Mills, (Marketing Manger @ Pacific Catch) was quick to respond to my review. She offered me a full refund, and sincerely apologized for my less-than-stellar experience. Based on this, I'd definitely be willing to give them another try.
author: Tulip F.

description: Another easy choice.  Sitting at the bar is great.  I like the salmon tacos with sweet potato fries.  So satisfying.  Sometimes I start with the poke.  Don't get take out.  It's soggy and messy once you get home.
author: Danielle B.

description: I never had anything other than seaweed salad, sweet potato fries and the crab and avocado salad. All of the above has always been outstanding. I tasted their wasabi bowl which was rather tasty, too.
author: Jana C.

description: I really wish there were more places like this in my neigborhood... sigh.. in a couple more years... it'll happen. This place is a BARGAIN for the quality of food you get. I had the seared tuna salad and it was so good. the tuna was fresh, not too much dressing drenching my lettuce, and the dressing was an interesting soy based flavor. (like the kind i get in japantown). Also LOVE the mahi mahi tacos... the poke bowl is also a total steal, and will fill you up right before your nights drinking festivities. better to get your order to go because tables are hard to get, and it gets very cold when they leave the door open at night.
author: Marina K.

description:
Updated to 3 stars:
I recently went to Pacific Catch and was sad to find out the prices have gone up :(  Unagi bowl + lg order of fries is now $21!! Don't remember it being that much....If you really want to eat the same w/o spending that much, go to a jap. market, buy a piece of frozen wrapped unagi for $5, heat it up over brown rice and buy some veggies to put in the bowl.  I've seen them cut open the same unagi that I get at the stores and put it on the grill.  Oh and the fries are usually soggy now too, not crispy and fresh :( :(
***********************
I have to admit I've only had one entree item there, which was the unagi over rice bowl.  I thought the price was pretty good for the gigantic bowl of food you get and it was very good.  But I keep going back for the sweet potatoes fries..I LOVE them!  Usually we just order the fries to go, because the wait and seating is ridiculous.  The rest of the menu seems overpriced though, especially the tacos
author: Emiko M.

description:
It has been a while since I've been by this place, but every time I go its great. My boyfriend and I always make sure to visit at least once during our visits, despite how short they may be, this place is worth it. We went for my 20th birthday last year and my boyfriend sat next to me rubbing in how great his Nigori was...so I would believe the sake to be great here from his delightful demeanor after our meal that evening. I normally order the fried oysters and the sweet potato fries, and thats a simply delicious combination. I believe the first time I went here, I had one of the teriyaki bowls with the salmon and I was sad I didn't get to eat all of it due to all my excitement in being back home that I left it in the fridge and forgot it. But it definitely wasn't a dish forgettable in taste. I wish the restaurant was a bit bigger, we would always show up and have a bit of a wait, but once again, well worth it. And the wait staff and cooks have never failed to be nicer than nice, so service is great as well!

I only knocked off one star due to the fact that I haven't been there in a year, so who knows, it may have changed...but I doubt it! :)
author: Ameerah A.

description:
i used to frequent this place but less so nowadays.  last time i was there i was kind of disappointed because i thought the quality had gone down a bit.  i usually get the seared ahi tuna meal sized salad. and my greens were soggy and i felt like there was something missing.

this last time i went there i decided to change it up and order a teriyaki bowl with shrimp.  all in all it was pretty good.  i dont think bok choy is for grilling.  it had kind of a weird taste to it.  one of my shrimp were bad i think.  it was kind of mushy.  and the cold asparagus and mushrooms didnt go well with the hot brown rice and hot shrimp.

other things ive tried here are the edamame, grilled artichoke, grilled corn, cola made from green tea.  all pretty good.  the wait is usually pretty long.  the counter seats are kind of too hot since youre sitting right in front of the fryer or the grill.  the marina location is a bit cramped and small. i do think it is a bit pricey for what i get ...

im losing my faith in this place.  we came to get take out.  how hard is it to get two dishes down.  he repeated it after me too.  ahi salad.  and i opened it and i got an ahi rice bowl.  idiot.
author: claudia y.

description: Good place to go for lunch.  The fish is always fresh.  The salads and rice bowl are super large.  I like to go off-peak, as it's really noisy when full.  I've only had one bad thing there - the grilled artichoke.  It could have benefited from being par-boiled before grilling.  It was tough and stringy.  The sweet potato fries have been hit and miss - once piping hot, superby crisp; the other, warm, soggy, ewwww.
author: darla s.

description:
fresh poke, tasty sweet potato fries, delicious seafood sandwiches!

and a bargain too!

a great place to come after strolling on chestnut!

note: it is small, and you might have to wait if you're there on a weekend.  if you're in a rush, though, their take-out is pretty quick!
author: Jill k.

description:
yum. yum. yum. 
ahi poke.  yum.
wasabi bowl.  yum yum.
but why oh why is it so dang cramped in there?
sit at the bar or take it home but go to pacific catch now.  you'll keep going back.  again and again.
author: Lija H.

description: This place rocks for a quick casual bite. For those of you that love seafood like I do, this place is a great way to go for cheap yummy lunch or dinner. They offer awesome fish tacos, cervezas, or ahi salads, japanese bowls, etc. And the portions are pretty big. They do takeout as well so grab some and go!
author: Anna S.

description: A GREAT lunch spot for a light tasty meal! I had the house salad with grilled tofu. It was really good with shiitake mushrooms, edamane, tomatoes and cucumber with a miso dressing. My bf had the taco platter with his pick of bbq salmon and mahi mahi. That also came with a small house salad. They tasted great too! I love how everything had a Asian fusion twist to it.. Everything was so fresh and delicious! And it's healthy too!
author: Denise L.

description: Food is tasty, service is mediocre. The wasabi bowl with grilled salmon was yummy.  It comes with wakame salad, lots of rice and way too much pickled ginger.   The front end cashier ignored me for a couple minutes while I patiently stood at the cash register, and finally took my order with fake niceness.
author: Vera D.

description: This place kicks ass for fun healthy, fish food.  I've been here at least 5 times and today it hit me what a great cozy joint this is - friendly and attentive service, I tried half wasabi bowl and half house salad with grilled salmon - it had just the right balance of some of my favorite flavors - miso, ginger, sesame, vinegar and soy... yum!  try the grilled artichoke with the wasabi aioli.  May be a wait as it's pretty small and very popular. Oh yeah, and free refills on soda.
author: Haru K.

description: Never been here, but 3 stars for the slick advertising coup with Apple's iPhone (http://www.apple.com/iphone/ads/). Makes me wanna check out the calamari! The question is: who paid whom?
author: Bryce S.

description: I read about this place in the Zagat and I just had to try it and it was the bomb!!! The Wasabi Bowls are huge and have too much rice in it, but it was tasty so i can't complain. You also need to get some Sweet Potato Fries on the side to munch on while you wait. I will be back here a lot more often.
author: Charm N.

description: Fresh seafood for a good price, and really tasty. The restaurant is small - so finding a seat may be tough at times, but its a great option to go or whenever you want something healthy and tasty. Great fish tacos!
author: Ossama A.

description: Perfect for a quick, somewhat healthy, bite to eat.  The sweet potato fries are great. I'm a big fan of shrimp tacos, and they do a good job - pinapple salsa - yum!
author: Angela T.

description: I came by here after reading rave reviews from Yelp :-)  The few things I wanted to point out: the place is much smaller than I thought - I went on a late Saturday afternoon (4-ish) and managed to snag a counter seat (very few tables inside or out); the poke wasabi bowl was great (and for my fellow non-wasabi lovers, the soy-wasabi dressing was not at all overbearing and was actually quite enjoyable); next time I would do what the guy next to me did - get a wasabi bowl but have them do half poke and half seared ahi; I couldn't finish my dish and it was surprisingly good the next day out of the fridge; and most importantly (kidding), my waiter...was a bit of a dish himself (wow, that was so cheesy...but true)!
author: Joyce L.

description: I'm into it.  I guess the best thing to say about this place is that they have a large variety of fish options for a decent price and the service is FAST and friendly.  If you are running late and don't want to have ANOTHER slice of pizza this is a nice place to go.  The Wasabi Ahi sandwich is really delicious.
author: Thadd L.

description: My favorite place for lunch in the neighborhood, period. Ahi salads and rice bowls are to die for. Good quality fish. Yummy sweet fries. Best of all - and the reason for 5 stars - it is one heck of an incredible *value*.
author: Sasha M.

description: one of my favorite take-out restaurants.  I love love love their poke wasabi bowl.  I wouldn't necessarily eat here, but when i want a fresh, (relatively) healthy takeout dinner, i get pacific catch.  sweet potatoes french fries are fantastic too...salty and sweet, with that great asian dipping sauce.  mmm...
author: Alyssa W.

description: I am not an expert on anything on the menu except for the ahi poke rice bowl.  It is excellent.  Oh, and sometimes I get the sweet fries, which are good too.  I once ordered a salmon sandwich ... once.  It was bland.
author: Jonathan M.

description: the food's pretty good, but this Pacific Catch is so small! I don't see any reason to go to this spot versus the Pacific Catch in the sunset, which is many many times larger.
author: Steve C.

description: If I could give this place six stars, I would. This is my favorite place to grab lunch or even dinner. I can't say I'm that adventurous here: I order the Tuna Poke bowl every single time. I think I ordered the Ahi Tuna sandwich one time. While it was great, nothing compares to a Poke Bowl. Big chunks of raw tuna soaked in a hawaiian poke sauce, avocado, sprouts, ginger, wasabi, seaweed salad, and all on top of a bed of rice drizzled in a wasabi sauce. With a little Sriracha squeezed on top of it all, its my favorite meal of all time. Hands down would be my last meal. The sweet potato fries are also great. I had my first experience with them here about three years ago and have been hooked since. There is also a Pacific Catch near Golden Gate Park on 9th and Lincoln. This is a much bigger, restaurant style place. I heavily recommend going to this location off of Chestnut in the Marina instead. It exemplifies everything that is great with San Francisco food. An amazing hole in the wall place that is always packed and full of life.
author: Daniel P.

description: I love this restaurant!  Addicting sweet potato fries, the ahi salad...so good!
author: Diane R.

description: Are you having a craving for fish tacos?  This is the place to chow down on yummy fish tacos with sweet potato fries!  Gets a little crowed and lunch time (plus it's small) so go plan to go early or for a late lunch.
author: Annabel G.

description: Cod never tasted so good.  This place does fish right.  It does have quite a loyal following.  Finding a seat can be tough.  I would love to see them expand.
author: Tim G.

description: This is one of those places you should go more often, but you easily forget that it is there.  It would help if they expanded a bit, becuase it is always packed.  The food is healthy comfort food.  You can't go wrong with any of the dishes.  I have always left a happy camper.
author: Lulu B.

description: Fish and chips (aka "Sweet Potato Fries") just awesome!  Don't know about the fish tacos (for the best fish tacos, go to South Beach Bar & Grill in Ocean Beach, San Diego, CA) but the food here is awesome!
author: Sam H.

description: Decent lunch spot, but a little too crowded, so To Go seems to be the best option. I got the Poke Bowl with a side of Sweet Potato Fries with both the sweet thai chili sauce and the white sauce. The Ahi Poke combined with the Avocado, Cucumber and seaweed is a nice combination with the Wasabi based sauce...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
my one complaint is that i couldn't buy a gallon of their dressing on the tasty lil' green salad with holy shitakes. mmmmmm. 

the ahi taco wasn't stocked with more than a sliver of fish, but it definitely was yummy. the lemongrass/ginger infused tea was refreshing (but contained no "tea", so no caffeine buzz if that's what you're looking for). 

overall-even though its over in the mall-ina...its worth it!
author: K. T.

description: Good food - it's a great place for takeout! I'd recommend not trying to dine in here - it's super small. The food is good for the 'i just got home from work and I want a reasonable meal' type situation. It's fast and good and I'd recommend the Spicy Ahi Sandwich, Sweet Potato fries, and any of the Bowls they have. All are good quick bits to eat.
author: Dan M.

description: PC is great...fresh and healthy!   we always go for the bowls.. poke or ahi.  with extra seaweed salad, hold the ginger.  the potato fries are delish !  i have also had the fish tacos and they are such a bargain and yummy.  We usually order take out as it is a tad cramped and squishy to dine in  there. i  have also been to the pacific catch motherload in marin many times and the menu is larger and the place itself is more expansive -  you can actually sit down and enjoy your meal without feeling like your neighbors know all your business. it is a formal restaurant with all the fixins...they even have an outdoor seating area with heat lamps and fire pit.  very cute.
author: Caroline S.

description:
Grilling fish fills the air with fragrant smokiness.  You smell limes, and hear sizzling.  You're at Pacific Catch.

If you take my advice and order the House Salad with Poke, you will be impressed.  This salad is only on the menu by inference and costs about $12.  it's full of generous chunks of Poke (which I like to save for last), edamame, shitake mushrooms, sprouts, and a delicious slightly creamy dressing.   There is even a clump of fresh ginger thrown in to refresh your palette between bites.   This salad is as fresh, nutritious, and hearty, and leaves you feeling energized and satisfied. 

People rave about the rice bowls, which are tasty, though I find them desirable only when I'm in the midst of a severe carbohydrate craving.

The fish tacos are very nice as well.  I like the two taco combo with a small house salad.
author: Matt M.

description:
be warned: it's very tempting to order waaay too much food here.  everything on the menu sounds great, and when you're standing next to the bar watching them pull out fresh slabs of fish, you'll feel your eyes grow bigger than your stomach.

the poke bowl is a great little meal in itself - a generous mound of tuna poke, seaweed salad, fresh avacado, and other veggies served over sushi rice. it's pretty big too...think dolsot bibimbap without the hot sizzle.

i'm not a fan of sweet potato fries, but even i gotta admit they're pretty darn good, with the 3 dipping sauces.  they're definitely better than the sweet potato fries at taylor's.

overall, definitely a place worth going back to.  probably not the best place for a date (i'm pretty sure the couple next to me was on their first date, i don't know if the guy liked being squeezed next to me at the bar, with my elbow stuck in his ribs.  yeah, it's cozy in there.) but certainly a great place to meet up with a friend or two, and catch up over a quick meal.
author: brian w.

description: You won't get a table here or there will be a long wait (the only reason I knocked a star off) but I love their rice salad bowls.  Yes it seems a bit pricey but I have never had a bad meal there so I figure I get what I pay for.  I wish they would open a location like they have up in Corte Madera here so it wouldn't be so difficult to get in the place.
author: Anna L.

description: Not for the small stomach that I highly recommend the Wasabi Rice Bowl with Hawaiian Poke. Very affordable. The place is small and crowds up quickly but they do offer a handy to-go service if being seated at the bar near the bathroom is of issue. Honorable mention goes to the delectable sweet potato fries. Mmmmm...
author: Megan W.

description: J and I were blessed so we didn't have to wait at all for two counter seats.  We sat ourselves down and got cracking on some good poke (meet's J's taste test and she's from Hawaii), some tasty gut busting tuna and salmon rice bowls, and those sweet potato fries!  YUM!  I need one in my neighborhood.  Plea to the owners or biz dev team, please open your third location in Inner Sunset!  I don't want to trek my ass to Marina and deal with the parking or the pretty people.
author: Pelle Y.

description: Great casual dining.  Simple fish and salads. Lunch is quick and easy here.  Sweet potato fries and fish tacos are good along with the tuna poke. If you're looking for an quick and easy place, I would recommend Pacific Catch.
author: Bernard M.

description: This place is fast, friendly and good. My friend suggested the teriyaki bowl and it was good. At first when I heard pacific catch, i thought we were going to some normal sea food place. but it's got this yummy japanese twist. very good. i would definitely suggest it. parking is a bit of a pain and if you dont get there early enough the line is out the door!
author: Jenn L.

description: The place is a great little spot for take out or to stop by for a quick bite. The food is really tasty! The sweet potatoe fries are a must try. The place is tiny, so I recomend going early or taking it out.
author: Alison W.

description: After hearing (and reading!) glowing reviews of this place, I had to check it out for myself. The coconut shrimp and sweet potato fries are delicious. I really like their menu, and will have to branch out a bit next time.
author: Matt N.

description: 3 words. Sweet. Potato. Fries!!!! If love were a fried food item, this is what it would be. At least for me it would be. I've only ordered 2 things here so far. The fries and the other item is the kid's chicken teri bowl. That was tasty and the kid gobbled it up. The chicken was sliced nice and thin. A bonus is that there wasn't a ton of sauce all over it, too.
author: cyndi L.

description:
We finally made it to Pacific Catch on a cold wet weekend evening. We decided to sit at the bar cos waiting for a table was going to take a long time. The food here was excellent and the service was impeccable too. Our bartender was attentive to our needs and was friendly. :) We had the mixed seafood basket. I loved the shrimp with the coconut flakes on it. It had a mild curry taste and it was so good with the sweet chilli sauce that it came with. Our meal sized ahi salad was wonderfully refreshing and tasty. We cant wait to come back for our next meal. Those two entres were so filling for us that we could not make it to dessert. Maybe next time!

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
Our 2nd visit to Pacific Catch was just as memorable. As before, 5 stars for their stellar customer service. I loved our friendly waitess from that evening :) and the casual cozy atmosphere at Pacific Catch was just great for catching up with family. We had the traditonal baja and grilled mahi mahi tacos and it was fabulous. But if I have to choose one that I like more, it's gotta be the mahi mahi one. We also had the grilled sturgeon and it was so fresh and firm. I loved the sides of the sweet potato fries, cant get enuf of it and dipping it in the spicy saracha sauce. This time, we made it to desserts, we had the Fried Dulce de leche "Spring Rolls" ooohhhh....heavenly, there seemed to be some kind of cake like texture inside the springroll and for desserts, warm and cold combinations are always a clear winner. Glad we did not opt for the mochi fondu cos we heard it was not super spectacular.

So my average rating shud be 4.5 stars now. But I dunno how to give the other 1/2 star! drats!
author: Topazskye L.

description: I don't care if this place is all the hell the way on the other side of town.  I will spend 30 minutes looking for parking.  I will wait another hour in line.   All this trouble ... just to eat at this place.  It's worth it!  Their sweet potato fries are a must.  I made the mistake of trying sweet potato fries at Blue Jay Cafe and it just wasn't the same, I had to go get the real thing.  I also absolutely love their hawaiian poke and sushi-grade ahi salad/rice bowls.  Again, I tried hawaiian poke at Hukilau and I had to come back here to get the real deal.
author: Jean A.

description: I ate here yesterday and really enjoyed it. A friend of mine took me here and I need to recommend this to as many people as I can. Everything I tried is wonderful. The place is small with only 3 tables inside, but we ate at the bar. I got the grilled salmon wasabi bowl and it was delicious. I got this with half rice and half salad, not 2 bowls of rice how some other people eat it. I also had edamame and they were wonderful, and poki and some oyters with sweet potatoes...Yum...everything was delicious. We did wait for about 20 minutes, it was so crowded, but in the end it was worth it! We had a gig at Bar None and stopped here to eat. We sat down at 8:30 and our gig was at 9, so we had to walk a couple of blocks to get there. We told the waiter and he brought the food super fast. They are so accommodating and friendly ! I absolutely love both the food and the staff!
author: Madalina C.

description: Always crowded.  I suggest To-Go.  Not exactly a place where I want to relax and enjoy my meal with a friend.  Too crowded, too stressful.  The food?  Not bad.  Faster than cooking the same meal yourself.  I recommend any of the bowls.  A meal in themselves.  WAIT a minute, I just remembered that once I ordered Wakame salad and part of it was still frozen... a little fishy to me!  Are you sure it's really that fresh?  Knocked down from 3 to 2 stars!
author: La A.

description: Came here again last night for takeout - the ahi poke bowl is outstanding! They were super fast too, even though they were really busy and there was quite a wait. I placed my order and was out of there in less than 5 minutes. The tuna was really fresh and the soy-wasabi sauce is sooo delicious - friendly staff too.
author: Kate S.

description: The Ahi Poke Wasabi Bowl....absolutely amazing.
author: Diego E.

description: Really good fish tacos and sweet potato fries (so yum, I probably could make them at home too). The poke is good too! I think there's a new location on 9th @ Lincoln Ave.  I think it's a pretty good deal and it's really fresh too!
author: Gina R.

description:
i love this place! 

the basket of fried oysters is delicious and definately my favorite! - YUMMM!!!

fish and chips are suppper good.  all of this comes with the sweet potatoe fries which are to die for! they serve them with this red sweet & sour sauce that is the best.  (its a different take on the fries and ketchup)

the ahi tuna is amazing.  super tasty and FRESH!  

their fish tacos (any of them) are very tasty as well.  portions are very good too.  i've seen of their salads too (bowls) are huge!  

throw all of this with a big bottle of beer and wow...call it a day

it's a very small place so large groups are a no no :(

it is pricey, but totally worth it  =)
author: Erika C.

description: healthy and fresh bowls got the Korean bbq Skirt Steak bowl it was really good and tasty  the ahi tuna bowls look really good got to try it next time im back in town a  nice little place with good food thanks yelp  another good eats
author: sushiatown s.

description: We tried 5 dishes for lunch, including a kids'; and they were all terrific. My personal favorite the Wasabi Ahi sandwich. I will be making sure to stop at this place anytime I am withing striking distance.
author: M P.

description: The best way to describe the food here is Fresh.  Even the fried food tastes so fresh and clean.  I really enjoyed the fried fish tacos and the sweet potato fries were fantactic with the dipping sauces on the side.  My BF got the chicken teriyaki rice bowl which was medocre and made me yearn for more...nextime we'll go with the tuna rice bowl.  We also started with the corn on the cob which was definately NOT worth the cost.  But the grand finale of Leche Rolls dessert made all my dreams come true.  We'll definately be back.
author: Melanie C.

description: I love you wasabi boll with huge portions of poke, I love you ceviche, I love you fish taco, and I love you ice cold beer.  I only go during off times to avoid the long lines because it gets pretty packed and tight in there.  But the staff is super efficient and friendly, and the prices are about right....because the portions are HUGE.
author: Em S.

description: Our family loved the food here. It was right after we went to the Exploratorium and we had a late lunch here. It's reasonably priced and the food was very good. My sister and I both had fish and chips. The food tasted great although the fish was a bit small. My mom had the grilled salmon sandwich and it was superb. The bread was soft and the sandwich was a good size. I've not a huge fan of salmon but I had a bite of the sandwich and it tasted really good. The service was also very friendly and fast.
author: Kevin K.

description: Great food, Good people. the tacos are great, the california salmon sandwich is one of my favorites, and the sweet potato fries are the perfect side.
author: Frederic B.

description: This place is delicious, fast, and cheap. I looove their sweet potato fries, which come with three sexy sauces (Thai, Creamy chipotle, and some other tangy thing). The Ahi Tuna Poke Salad also is amazing. Fried fish here is okay... Hm. One thing about this restaurant is that it is located in the Marina. I felt really weird eating here because everyone else was blond and blue eyed.. Kind of disconcerting seeing that it's in SAN FRANCISCO, too. Me, I am half Asian and I was there with another Hapa and Asian friend, so I felt really weird. Oh well. The service was still good!! The waitress even gave us extra wontons with our Poke Salad.
author: O K.

description:
I heart Ahi Poke...especially their Ahi Poke Bowl..yumm...and a side of their sweet potato fries...double yum...


however minus 1 star for minuscule seating area
and minus another star for a sometimes inattentive staff...

It would probably get more stars if I could just commit to the take out thing =)
author: Joy Y.

description: This place is a gem. The price and the atmosphere make it great for a casual date. I recommend the rice bowls (if you're a fan of wonderful raw fish), and about those fries everyone talks about: have them at the end of the meal because it's always easier to transition from Fresh to Fried than the other way around.
author: Matt C.

description:
stop in for lunch for a taco special and yam fries. in a perfect world, i could go everyday! i live in the marina, and take myself in to sit at the bar only about once a month, but i always leave happy and not stuffed to the brink of uncomfortable, as starchy lunches seem to leave me.

i say lunch because it is v.popular around dinner time and i like to be leisurely about my last meal of the day. they would greatly benefit from a second san francisco location... there's already one in marin.
author: Alexia P.

description: A friend of mine lives three blocks away and we went here when they first opened. I have been going ever since. I really like the sandwichs. My favorites are the BBQ Salmon and the Spicy Ahi. Of course I get the Sweet Potato fries. I've learned to watch for the slow times so I can get in.
author: Michael L.

description: This is my go to restaurant each time I come to the city. If you enjoy fresh fish I would recommend this establishment. I really enjoy the Ahi Poke there. What is Poke? It is a Hawaiian dish that consist of raw Ahi, Shoyu (soy sauce), sea salts, seaweed, and sesame seeds. They have it as an appetizer or as a salad. I recommend either one. I always enjoy eating here because you can't go wrong with any of the entrees.
author: Maka A.

description: Pacific Catch has the best fish and chips in the Marina! They pair it with crispy, yummy sweet potato fries! You can eat outside with your dog, at a table inside or at the bar when its busy. The staff is friendly, the food is fresh and the price is great! I have been going to Pacific Catch for a long time and I really like it-I'm glad they are close by! :) Yeah for dog friendly yummy inexpensive places in the Marina!
author: Alexia P.

description: Healthy, tastey and in way too much demand! Often get scared away by the crowd outside (there long before the apple ad, though that didnt help!). Had their brown rice bowls with fresh ahi, fish tacos, most of their sides...all yum. My fav sides...artichoke, edamame, sea weed salad. They need to open a bigger location...perferably in East Bay where I just moved! ;O)
author: T L.

description:
Delicious traditional Japanese bowls of fresh fish, rice, and pickled greens.  The sweet potato fries are to die for. 

The place can get really busy so service can be uneven, but the wait staff is nice, professional, and charming.

And the desserts - the "Mochi Fondu" dessert of ice cream in a candied rice wrapping is DELICIOUS.  Go order some right now.  YUM YUM!
author: Chris F.

description: I'll keep this short. A solid 4 stars (it would be 5 if they have more seating!) Definitely love the fish taco's, the coconut shrimp, and the ahi poke and of course the sweet potato fries. Fast, friendly and efficient service. Best bet is to call ahead (preferably on u're iPhone..say, after watching Pirates ?!..sorry i couldnt resist!) and place a to-go order. I aspire to try out the entire menu!
author: Pretesh D.

description: Another one of my favorites in the city! I've been to this place many times! Its a small place and sometimes the wait is long, but its still worth it. Any of the bowls there are just absolutely delicious!
author: John Z.

description: I can sum up my experience here in 2 words: F-ing awesome. The food was delicious and the place was full of life. We went for dinner on our last night in town (we visited from Chicago) and were so happy with it we returned the next afternoon for lunch (with luggage in tow) as we headed for the airport. Fish tacos were excellent. Tokyo Salmon (fish & chips done with salmon and sweet potato fries. Yummmm.) was amazing. Baja Calamari (lots of cilantro) was delicious. You really can't go wrong at this place! Extremely friendly and the sea food is fresh and only purchased from self sustaining fisheries. Definitely check this place out!
author: Ashley G.

description: This is my favorite place to eat in SF (favorite casual restaurant at least)... their poke bowl is amazing!
author: Jeff G.

description: I went here for lunch on a Saturday afternoon, while I was visiting from Toronto.  This place is quite small, so there was a long line-up.  However, the food was fresh and very delicious.  I liked the unique menu also. The ambiance was okay.  Hence, I cannot classify this as a romantic spot.  I give this place 5 stars because I really enjoyed the food and fast service.
author: Vinesha P.

description: Pacific Catch is awesome! The food is great and they probably have some of the freshest fish around.  I wish that the resturant was bigger though, it's a hold in the wall and really hard to get a seat especially in the evenings or at lunch.  I love the rice bowls and the salads and especially love not having the bill break the bank at the end of the meal.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: I like their menu options, including the rice bowls. I did not like any of their mixed drinks.... tried four..bizarre tastes and too sweet. I loved the ceviche and steak salad...very generous with their steak. Service was good, but a little slow. Forget about parking in the neighborhood...best to park down the street at the golden gate park.
author: Tricia M.

description: i LOVE THIS PLACE! on my first time, this really nice couple introduced us to the menu and made us some recommendations. The food was SO GOOD! I enjoy the freshness of it as they prepare it when you order it. The sweet potato fries are amazing! my GF's cajun fries were amazing too! I also like all the sauces they give you to dip your fries in. The workers are really friendly and have a lot of character. Thanks guys for the great meal! The only bad thing is that they need to open one in San Jose and San Luis Obispo!
author: Hao P.

description:
not bad! if you're in the mood for a sandwich/sushi experience, hi up pacific catch. the wasabi rice bowls are freaking awesome, and i highly recommend the seared ahi tuna sandwiches. GAME OVER! hahahah

its really small though, but in my opinion, this one is better than the other larger pac catch (i've had both)

the neighborhood is really cool too. a nice place to strike up a conversation with some good friends for lunch.
author: brian p.

description: Great ceviche, great poke, atmosphere is pretty sterile, overall tastey as hell.
author: Jared K.

description: despite walking past this place almost every day, it wasn't until i sampled some of the ahi bites from the Yelp Holiday part on Monday night that I finally decided to go in for lunch.  What the hell has taken me so long?  I mean this place has "me" written all over it.  Healthy, casual seafood.  They also have some pure vegetarian dishes on the menu as well. I decided on the salmon sandwich and salad (rather than the scrumptious looking sweet potato fries as I was trying to be good). The sandwich also came with a cole slaw...not your usual.   Very good.  I will definitely be back.  It is very small at this location so probably better to order take out.  Today was an unseasonably cold SF day...so prob better on a normal weather day I was freezing sitting by the door...but again today was not a normal day. Oh - I was surprised to be offered a refill on my lemongrass ice tea.  Very cool. Will definitely but this on my regular rotation of places.  glad i sampled at the Yelp event.
author: Angela N.

description: I like this place.  I stopped by last night after work to get some food to-go.  There was a line out the door and I almost decided to walk past it, but thankfully didn't because the line ended up going really fast.  Didn't have to wait more than a minute.  The server/cashier was friendly and efficient.  I ordered the chicken teriyaki bowl and house salad.  I waited outside no longer than 10 minutes when my food was brought out to me (very nice).  I got home and was pleasantly surprised.  The bowl was delicious with pineapple salsa on top and tons of chicken...not exactly enough teriyaki sauce (I had to add soy sauce) but still amazing.  It was also a huge portion and I could barely finish half.  For 19 bucks I definitely got my bang for my buck.  I'll be back
author: kiki W.

description: Great place, great food and good service but when it gets crowded its a pain... go when its empty...
author: David G.

description: Nothing terribly fancy here- Everything done well from each delicious and interesting sides to the FRESH Wasabi Bowls. The quality ingredients here speak for themselves without a "salt amplifier" or "special suace." Nope, just pure good food.
author: Coco M.

description: Best part about this place is the sweet potato fries. Everything else is just so so. The fish tacos sound really tasty, like Grilled Mahi Mahi or Tropical Shrimp, but they are pretty bland. The fish though is really fresh! If you are looking for some Asian fusion, try the Wasabi Ahi Poke Bowl. They give a lot of fish and it really fills you up. Watch out for the long waits to be seated Thursday - Sunday. On those days I suggest getting the food to go. This is by far the cheapest, best fish place in the Marina.
author: Jenny C.

description: The Ahi Tuna Wasabi Bowl is to die for.  You can't go wrong with it
author: Bob K.

description: I really like the food here but parking was a %^&$# and the place is tiny and usually crowded.. food alone gets 5 stars tho! Service was nice and fast.. they need to open more of these!
author: lizette c.

description: Prepare to wait because the food is great, they don't have many seats and people constantly order food to go. The sweet potatoe fries are amazing as are the wasabi bowls. Everything is very fresh, and prepared to perfection. Service has been really inconsistent lately. It takes quite awhile for the wait staff to take your order and don't always check on you later to refill drinks.
author: Sarah K.

description: I'm completely obsessed with the ahi tuna wasabi bowl.  It's beyond amazing.  Everything in the bowl is so fresh and delicious, and it's quite reasonably priced for what you get.  And the sweet potato fries are fantastic too.
author: Dale M.

description:
I went here today with a friend for a late lunch. The staff was friendly and got us a table ASAP. The food is delish. Especially the sweet potato fries. I had the ahi salad. Yummers! 

It is cramped in there, but you can order to go as well. Well worth it!
author: Andi M.

description: I have blissful dreams about wasabi bowls and coconut shrimp from pacific catch. The tuna poke is the best I have ever had. This place has consistently fresh seafood and great portion sizes for the price. Bottom line: GREAT, reasonably-priced seafood. GO.
author: Christina G.

description: I LOOOOOVE THIS PLACE.  If you're feeling fishy, this is the place to go and it's reasonably priced.  Yes the location is super small, but the food is soooo good and worth the wait.  I've never had to wait more than 15-20 min and who doesn't love people watching in the Marina, so many games to play: count the north faces, spot the juicy sweats, etc...  I am such a fan of fish tacos and usually go for the platter (2 tacos with sweet potato fries). My fave taco is the bbq salmon.  The bowls are also really good and filling.
author: Michelle B.

description:
one of my staples: wasabi tuna bowl and sweet potato fries.

really, honest to god, the best sweet potato fries ive ever had. how do they get them so deliciously crispy? and the sweet n sour sauce vs. the spicy aioli provide amazing dippin action.

only complaint - usually crazy busy and its small small small.
author: Matt H.

description: My favorite restaurant in the city. Best value for your money and consistently tasty fare. The rice bowls - especially the unagi and ahi poke options - are amazing. The sweet potato frieds make a great complement to any dinner. Come hungry.
author: Julie Z.

description: I've been here a couple of times with my brother who can not stay away from this place for more than a week at a time. The first time around, we were fortunate to get a seat... I am hungry at unusual times... so I'm estimating maybe 3pm-ish. The place is tiny. I'm guessing maybe 20 people can fit in the front area where tables are set and no more than 10 on the counter area. My estimates could be wrong but it is quite a small place. Anyway, I had a salmon sandwich with sweet potato fries. YUMMMMMM!!! Loved it!  They must put something in their sweet potato fries because I am now addicted to them. The second time, I ordered the poke and sweet potato fries. Double YUMMMMM!! The place was a lot busier than the first time I visited so I ordered to-go.
author: Michelle O.

description: Great fusion plates! Loved the Ahi Poke. Very fresh and clean taste. I found the rice bowl a little too spicy (Sprimp Ceviche too) but all in all still very welcoming. The service was spot on! Fast and very accommodating. You really can't go wrong with this place. Absolutely love the neighborhood too. Lots of life and local shops.
author: John T.

description: The best thing about Pacific Catch is the Poke.  I crave the Hawaiian Poke I found back in a tiny dive in Honolulu, and this comes the closest to any I've tried on the mainland.  The worst thing about Pacific Catch is the tiny seating area and the wait.  I have waited almost an hour before only to be sat at a "half bar" as in they cut the couterpiece in half and mounted it on the wall across from the bathroom and this is your seat.  I've also been seated at the full sized counter, which is no better - across from the hot grill and friers.  If you can get a table seat, go.  The fish is fresh and the sides are great.  My favorite is the poke wasabi bowl.
author: Leslie R.

description:
nice llittle place, (a bit tight), fresh and good food.
i had the mahi-mahi sandwich which is excellent, and tacos.
will come back for more.
author: Suki S.

description: I have only had great food here. I am in love with the sweet potato fries, they are amazing! try them with tarter sauce if you like that sort of thing:) The bbq salmon sandwich is my favorite along with the tokyo fish and chips (salmon and chips). Prices are reasonable for portion size and their salads are HUGE. I would not reccomend paying $2.75 for their lemongrass ginger ice tea..it's pretty similar to ice water with lemon, oh well. My only real discouragement is how extremely small this great place is! aghh...it's just not right..the food is definitly woth getting but take it to go and sit in the grass by the GG bridge (5 blocks or so away). I still think this place is worth it:)
author: Arielle C.

description: Fantastic food.  Friendly service.  Delicious green tea.  I always order the ahi poke salad bowl.  One of my favorite healthy meals in the city!  (Occasionally I splurge and order some awesome sweet potato fries...)
author: J O.

description: Had the Tokyo Salmon. Pretty solid, if not normal, fish and chip dish. Sweet potato fries are solid and the sauces are good. There's not much room to sit in there, luckily I got it to-go. Would definitely go again.
author: Mike C.

description: I went here often when it first opened and just went back this week after a long hiatus. It's just SO good and fresh! LOVE the sushi bowls and sweet potato fries. Odd combo for one menu, but it works for me!
author: Judy C.

description: Not too much more to say on this one!  I'm a fan of this place. They're special Cabo shrimp tacos are delicious.  I always stop in when I'm down in the Marina for work.  Fresh and consistant foodies!!!
author: Eric N.

description: Worth the wait at dinner time. The sweet potato fries and the Hawaiian poke salad are great, as are all other salads that I have tried. The seating area is small and the place has a very cozy feel. The food is very tasty and reasonably priced.
author: D K.

description: Hawaiian Poke Salad is amazing!! It will change your life.
author: Jatin S.

description: I was in the mood for quick, inexpensive seafood.  This place fit the bill.  Excellent food, service.........nothing fancy ......Just Plain Good  Try it!
author: Bobby M.

description:
The most amazing food ever! Great service! 

I highly highly suggest the sweet potato fries with the wasabi dressing.  Everything I've had there is so delicious.  The Unagi bowl, Ahi poke and the salmon salad.  This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants!
author: Kristen T.

description: great place if you want a lighter dinner.  gets quite busy, but worth sitting outside under the heat lamp.  the wasabi bowl is a great combination of veggies and protein (i recommend the ahi poke) with my fav, avocado.  it comes w/ a bit too much rice, but i have heard that you can order half salad, half rice.
author: Sarah Y.

description: I love this place.  My favorite is the spicy ahi tuna sandwich, sweet potatoe fries, and fresh catch (only when its rock cod).  When the fresh catch is tilapia I'll pass on that.  It's always clean and the staff are very polite, professional and have personality.
author: Brian T.

description: So disappointed in the "new" salmon bowl.  There's no more healthy seaweed and they've put fried onions and pineapple (sugar!) in it. Not healthy guys.  Go back to the old recipe.
author: M S.

description: Good food, not great quantities though. - Love the sauce that goes with the tacos. A good lunch spot, but it can be crowded, and the seating is packed in there. - Great for eavesdropping.
author: Jaymz D.

description: I'm addicted to this place...  everything on the menu is good.  Two negatives: 1) it's always packed; and 2) they run out of sandwich bread early on during the dinner the dinner rush so I can't get my spicy ahi sandwiches when I get home late from work - so I just get the tacos and the sweet potato(e) [shout out to Dan Quayle!] fries.
author: Patrick P.

description: The meals are yummy! The Poke salad is a favorite, and my son loves the salmon sandwich and sweet potato fries. Try getting Jeffrey as your waiter, he is absolutely uplifting and makes ones' dining experience all the more fun! The food is great, but lines can be awful depending on when you go. It is a good idea to call first. If you are thinking about take out,  don't, eating there is alot better. I got take out and our fries were cold and smashed in a tiny container. The lid on my miso soup container sank into my soup. Not what I was expecting because dining there with Jeffrey has always been great!
author: Mona L.

description:
incredible eats.

the fish has always been fresh, the sweet potatoe fries are to die for. a decent selection of import beers, try a tiger brew to compliment the spicy mahi mahi sandwhich.

a word of warning, the restaurant is very small. the few tables are squeezed very tightly together, and given it is the marina... it gets loud. is it all worth it? absolutely! try to get a table outside on a sunny day or just order for pick up and eat at the beach.

looking forward to the 9th & irving location to open up :)
author: Ryan T.

description:
Some of the food served at Pacific Catch would find itself right at home being served in nicer restaurant setting, at a higher price.  The value for the quality and flavor is just awesome!
