Perfect place to bring visitors for great food that's totally good for those with a budget.  The place was kinda tight, but I'm just going to assume that it was part of their pricing strategy.  

Recommended!
author: John C.

description: I'm totally addicted.  I eat here every week it seems.  The staff recognizes me now and often greets me by name.  Everyone who works there is pretty friendly.  The place is always busy and can get hectic at times.  Love love love the sweet potato fries.
author: C C.

description: I have been to Pacific Catch several times. It's a great place to stop for lunch off of Chestnut. The food is very fresh. Great seafood items to select from. Their Mahi Mahi is awesome as well as the sweet potato fries.  Seating is a little cramped but that is typical in SF. Good service every time I have been there. Highly recommend it!
author: Fillmore D.

description: It's ok. A cut above fast food. Fries were soggy too.
author: Ace. K. M.

description: Great food, attentive service, excellent value. Space is a litle crowded, but this is a favorite.
author: Jonathan S.

description: A great diverse Asian fusion restaurant in San Francisco! The atmosphere is chill and so are the people who work there... it's a good diverse crowd. Parking sucks ass... meaning, the parking lot isn't very accessible. So I'd suggest street parking. They have plenty of vegetarian options and their fish is so fresh! The only thing I'd complain about are the slightly more expensive prices.
author: Andi Nicole V.

description: Yay!  I am a fan!  My bf and I have walked by this place many times and it always looked crowded inside (people = good, usually).  We walked in right when they opened on a Saturday and were seated right away.  The hostess was friendly and the service throughout our meal was great.  I ordered the chipotle chicken sandwich with a side of sweet potato fries and my bf ordered three tacos--one fish, and two others with meat I can't remember.  The sandwich was really good--much better than I expected and my bf's tacos were really good too.  Clean, bright flavors in everything.  Will definitely be back if we're in the area.
author: Trinh N.

description: Gross!  I came here with my entire family after reading all of the great reviews.  I was/ we were sorely disappointed.  It looks like a midwestern chain (aka Chilies).....and the food was very mediocre. On top of that, my dad ended up being up all night ill.  Will never return and never suggest to anyone
author: Kristi s.

description: Why is it hard to find SEAfood in this city ? I love this little place- even though it's in a snooty neighborhood. Huge salads, tasty fish tacos, exotic appetizers... Get in early before it's smushed like sardines.
author: jen m.

description: Wether you are health conscious or not you'll find something yummy here. I love their grilled salmon salad the dressing is addicting. I have been to both locations and the customer service is better at the chestnut location.
author: lamia b.

description: This place is so delicious.  The best Asian Fushion food I've ever had!
author: deanne n.

description: I just want the whole world to know how much i love the wasabi brown rice bowl with the Ahi tuna.
author: Elia T.

description: Tried the spicy ahi sandwich with sweet potato fries as a side. Really good.
author: Jonathan C.

description: Had lunch at PC a few times and food is good but I have to complain: Service is slow. I sat at the bar today and watched the girl prepare my wasabi bowl. She put the rice when it was hot the bowl sat there for 10 mins while she worked on other plates and came back to finish mine. Of course by then the rice was as cold as Iceland in winter. I would've asked her to redo it but I had 15 mins of lunch time left. It seems to me those guys need to reorganize a little bit. Other than that food is tasty.
author: Baris S.

description: Yum-o! This place is small but mighty. Try the ahi wasabi poke bowl with brown rice. Way better than sushi! Also great to go.
author: Hilary F.

description:
Food was good, service was marginal, seating was sub par.  We sat at the bar, with a view of the dishwasher, right next to the bathroom.  My wife get a little mist.  Also, it got really hot by the fire.  

In addition to a beer and a glass of wine, we ordered water, which never arrived.

But, when we did see our server, she was nice enough.

I really liked the food.  I had baja fish tacos, and they were very good.  My wife had a salmon platter.  Now, I liked the salmon, but it was too dry for her.  It was grilled until burnt.

Anyway, food was good.  But the seating is very limited.  A good place to try when the Marinna isn't that busy.
author: SF C.

description: My friend introduced me to this place and now I come here once a week. The fish is soo fresh. It's a bit pricey but it's worth it.
author: Jean T.

description:
This place is The Truth.

The menu is incredible and I literally wanted to try everything on it.  I had an ahi tuna sandwich with avacoda, ginger,  and wasabi sauce with a side of sweet potato fries and some sort of asian/sesame cole slaw.  I also had a miso soup.  Everything was out of this world.  The tuna was as fresh as you can ask for, the fries were awesome especially with their sweet and spicy duckish like sauce and wasabi sauce.  The miso soup was also very good.

Although I only got 1 dish, I looked around the restaurant and saw what the people around me were eating.  The place is very small with only about 5 tables inside and 2 outside, so expect a legitimate wait if going with a group of more than 3 people.  The people to my right got some sort of tuna salad bowl with rice, seaweed salad, avocado and other really tasty looking items.  It looked incredible and the fish looked amazing.  

To my other side a couple was eating a chocolate fondu that looked incredible as well.  If you have some time in SF, YOU MUST EAT HERE!
author: Adam K.

description: They really need to post their nutritional info on their website - this is 2009 in California!!
author: Kay R.

description: mmmm delicious! comfortable and casual setting, reasonable prices, fast services, healthy, guilt free, and DELICIOUS food!
author: Renee S.

description: I've eaten plenty of times at both SF locations, and the food is the same in both, but atmosphere, space, and drinks are much better at the Inner Sunset location. Great, fresh food with plenty of healthy choices. I love the Poke Rice Bowl with Brown rice and fresh avacado, and the Seared Ahi (or sub in Poke) Meal-Sized Salad. The sweet potato fries with the two kinds of dip rule! Oh yeah, the fish tacos, where you can mix and match the main protein, are always a hit. At Lincoln, they have a good variety of drinks, and they make them from scratch with fresh fruit juices and agave sweetener. The drink won't get to you super quick, but it will be worth the wait. Try going during happy hour (4 to 6pm) for price breaks on appetizers -- out of which you can make a meal -- and drinks. They have a second drink-only happy hour that I believe starts at 10:00pm. The service is always friendly. I typically eat at the bar, and occasionally you can be ignored, but that's because they're busy making all those fresh drinks. A couple TVs in the bar area add some entertainment value. All in all, both locations are good, but the Lincoln location is head and shoulders better, in a non-dandruff sort of way.
author: Hurston P.

description: I really like this place. Every time I visit my sister in San Francisco it seems like we go here for the wasabi bowl (I usually get the poke). My goodness is it delicious, the fish is fresh and the seaweed salad and sauce are super tasty. I wish there was a restaurant in San Jose that served wasabi bowls like PC does!
author: Kat D.

description: I had dinner here with the wife yesterday.  I had the wasabi bowl ahi tuna and the spicy calamari for starters.  Both were awesome and prices are reasonable.  I would definitely come back here to try the other stuff.  The only drawback is the small place.  Be prepared to wait..
author: Jay B.

description: cozy restaurant, and the staff were very friendly. and the food.... is great! make sure to order the sweet potato fries and mahimahi teriyaki bowl!! recommended
author: Kenny K.

description: love this place its perfect. the make probably the best fried oyster i have ever had! and the best poke bowls enough to feed four hungry girls! i recommend the cabo calamri fried oysters sweet potato fries and there unagi poke bowl! yum! if you are going to go on a weekend for a popular night please call in advance and reserve a seat! but the place is fast with food and yumms! the first time for anybody i recommend going on a slow day so you can really taste the true flavor! good place to go after a long day of shopping or running errans.
author: Thaleda C.

description: if you go JUST for their ahi tacos and sweet potato fries it will have totally been worth the trip.  their salmon sandwich on their soft focaccia roll is really good too.  but DO NOT, DO NOT, DO NOT skip their sweet potato fries, and if they don't give you a side of aioli ask for it.  it's the perfect dip for these greasy delicacies.  yum!
author: Shanti G.

description: Love this place. When we lived in the Marina we would get takeout from here at least once a week. We have since moved to Rockridge on  the Oakland/Berkeley border. If any management from PC is reading this: PLEASE OPEN ANOTHER RESTAURANT  IN ROCKRIDGE. We miss your ahi poke, mahi mahi tacos, teriyaki bowls, and sweet potato fries....
author: coline d.

description:
if you're a wine snob like i am, check my next review... that is,  if you care to take a peek, no one's forcing ya...:D

***

I bet that this place has gotten MORE packed than usual after the whole Apple IPHONE commercial, but I'm glad to say it's a local eatery for meal..:D don't be jealous.. 

Quite decent to say the very least... 

I have to say, I'm Asian, and proud to be one ... but I never grew up with rice drenched with dressing... I love salad dressing (vinaigrette) but PC made my rice so sweet and ever so salty, I could not lift my spoon for a second scoop, so I handed my food back to the server, and requested my dressing to be put on the side, that way I can dip my sauce to my own desire...

after their 2nd attempt, I have to say, I managed to eat everything off my bowl, quite tasty, but indeed, too much rice ... everything was def fresh to one's satisfaction ... 

generous portions indeed! 

$11.95 for some super generous ahi poke! I give 4 stars...  Topped with wakame salad, sliced avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, pickled ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori & soy-wasabi sauce served over a heaping bowl of seasoned sushi rice.. you get a variety but below are the types of rice bowls you can get...

Ahi Tuna $11.95
Ahi Poke $11.95
Grilled Fresh Salmon $11.95
California Crab Salad $13.95
BBQ Unagi (Japanese Eel) $13.95

A fine selection, don't you think? and an additional $1 for brown rice!

He got the Spicy ahi sandwich $8.95 (w/avocado, tomato and dab of chipotle mayo. The chipotle mayo def had a great kick to the sandwich) w/a side of potato fries... I'd give 3.5 stars. It was aright ... Nothing too fancy.

Shared a yummy appetizer, Thai Coconut Shrimp - Skewered shrimp, dipped in coconut milk batter, coconut flakes & 5-spice, with sweet potato fries $10.95. It was def good but you only got 3, mebe if they gave us 4, then I'd give 5 stars, but whatever...  

Overall, the place is extremely tiny, so you may feel quite claustrophobic ... so prepare for that! Kinda had this wahoo's appeal ...
author: Jennifer S.

description: This is one of my favorite places to eat in the entire City - the seared ahi tuna salad is AMAZING, as is almost anything on the menu...try the grilled artichoke and you have to have the house lemongrass iced tea!!! The prices are pretty darn low, esp. for the high quality food served. It is always crowded (not surprisingly) and the vibe is casual - mainly locals inside. It's great!!! I would go more often, if I didn't live so far away...
author: sarah e.

description: the poke bowl seriously could not be a better deal.  the fish is really fresh, the flavors are clean and delicious, and all the side goodies like seaweed salad, avocados, cucumbers, ginger, etc. are given in huge amounts - just the way i like it!  obviously the yam fries are amazing and i highly recommend the lemongrass tea.
author: Jennifer D.

description: I was a fan until I got the worst food poisoning after eating there fish and chips. no more.
author: Danel M.

description: Mother F*ckin' delicious...can't say much more than that.
author: RJ J.

description: My family and I went out the exit of the Botanical Gardens and up the street found  a lot of restaurants that we didn't know were there.  Now, my sister and dad were whining about fish and chips since the early afternoon by the beach the (Cliff House?).  But finally gave in!  Glad I did, because they had more than just fish, they had chicken and things.  Got a meal sized chipotle chicken salad.  It was so good!  Normally I don't have a high intensity of hot things, but it was so good I didn't even care.  The inside was neat and clean and had pretty cool decorations and had comfortable seating, employees were dressed nice and clean.  But am knocking a star down because the bathrooms were by a weird place.  My dad and sister got fish and said it was really good, it wasn't greasy or oily like other fish and the fries were good.  The meal sized salad cost 12.50.  They do offer take out too.  It's a nice place to eat/ access if you're visiting the around the gardens.
author: Jacqueline R.

description: The Ahi Poke Wasabi bowl is amazing! With a side of sweet potato fries and a glass of white wine... Heaven! Cozy, clean, delicious, and has a great app happy hour too. One of my favs.
author: Sarah M.

description: The food was inexpensive and beautifully showcased.  The Hawaiian Poke was great.  Although the tuna was not the best I have had, the ingredients were very fresh and tasty.
author: Brooks O.

description: this place is great!!! the fish is always fresh and tasty.  my favorite is the taco platter.  two seafood tacos of your choice on a platter next to some delicious sweet potato fries. mmm... recently deciding to branch out and try something new on the menu, i decided to give the wasabi rice bowl a try.  another great choice!  the ahi poke is fresh, not fishy.  reminded me of all of my trips to hawaii.  any time i want to feel like i'm back on the island of aloha, i just pop over to pacific catch to order up a nice ahi poke wasabi rice bowl.
author: kristen c.

description: I really recommend the fried oysters. They are from the Oregon Coast and are really fresh! And there are so many oysters, it's such a great deal. They come with a jalapeno tartar sauce, and delicious sweet potato fries. I will need to go back soon.
author: Chris L.

description: Over-priced fast food...non-existent service, terribly cramped space.
author: Tonya M.

description:
god i love this place.  i really dig the ahi and salmon salads, huge with tons of greens and fix for good price.

only issue with place is always crowded and they opened another loco over on 9th street, skipping my hood altogether.  why will not open on fillmore street?
author: joel b.

description: Multiple times repeat customer, food is always great, and the staff is always really cool.  I wish their space was larger.
author: J C.

description: this is one of the best  I know..and wish i can find more like this around s.f...casual, trendy, yummy  food!!! Thanks to a great yelper (Mark W.)that brought me to many places including this and get to know how to be on yelp as well but now moved to another state..hope he can show me more places and try more places anywhere...always fun!!!!
author: cecille p.

description: When I think of healthy eating, Pacific Catch is one of those places that comes to mind.  I chose to eat at this place as a random event as I walked around the Marina. They use organic ingredients and the place reminds of a SoCal coastal joint.  I especially love the fish tacos.  Despite the cramped space,  it's a great place for being by yourself or with someone you want to get really close to.  This is a sure hit for SoCal ex-pats. The friendly staff provided service that was TOP NOTCH.  No "pretended" smiles here - very genuine and down to earth.
author: Raging R.

description: if i go here again i will turn into a piece of ahi tuna. no joke. i frequent pacific catch numerous times a month and not just because i am a wannabe yuppie. now do what i say as usual and you will have fun if you do not however, you are on your own. ok so come a little early since there will be a line almost any time of day. when they ask you to write in your name on the waiting list write "Beach" so that you can listen to them yell repeatedly "Beach partaaay!" or don't, if you think that's not funny. in which case you have bad taste in humor. anyway, order a cricket cola, a basket of sweet potatoe fries and a wasabi ahi tuna sandwich then thank me. i'm done.
author: alexi c.

description: Great food.  The Ahi Poke Wasabi Bowl remains my favorite.  The Thai Coconut Shrimp is also worth trying.
author: Mike C.

description: I come here every couple of weeks for take-out and sometimes dine-in. If you decide to eat there and its nice out try to get one of the outside tables, great people watching! I am obsessed with their fish tacos, my favorites are the salmon and the cabo shrimp tacos. The side salad is delish and includes mushrooms, cucumber, and edamame. Make sure to get an order of sweet potato fries to share, make sure you get the sweet red chili dipping sauce. The dressings they serve with the salads are great here too! My only complaint is that when i order take out they always seem to forget something ie. dipping sauce for fries, dressing, utensils. They staple the bag closed too so you can double check easily.
author: Sarah R.

description: everything here is so very freshhhh...try the catch of the day or the wasabi bowls...but before you eat your main course, order up some ceviche and a plate of sushi...you can not go wrong....by the way, parking is a *itch!
author: Xing L.

description: this location is tiny. it has maybe 3 tables inside and plenty of seating at the bar but if your in a group larger than three you might want to try a different location.also they dont carry alot of things on the menu at this location, like sushi and the steak tacos. ok place to go , marina is better location.
author: L V.

description: Fantastic! you definitely get what you pay for.  You might think that poke would be a bit suspect however you will not be dismayed.  the fish tacos are to die for and the ahi poke dish is a must have.  There is a line that goes out the door sometimes.  That is indicative of the quality of food you will get.  Great food for the price you pay!
author: Matt J.

description: I've had ahi poke at several places, the wasabi, ahi poke bowl here is good.   Also love the sweet potato fries and the aioli sauce it comes with.   However, I don't care for much else on the menu here.  My boyfriend had the different fish specials and he usually likes it.  the fish tacos are okay to me.  I like their bar seating area, which gives you an alternative to a long wait.
author: farmta s.

description: perfect spot to grab to take a break from shopping. order a basket for their sweet potatoe fries, hung out and have a beer!
author: Mika D.

description: mmm...i really like this place for healthy, fast eats.  i had the ahi tuna over greens, and they give you a hefty portion!!  the sandwichs and yam fries are yummy too!
author: Helen T.

description: went last minute and had about a 30-minute wait so we gave our # and walked around.   what a delightful surprise.   i wish i could remember the name of what i got because i'm still thinking about it!  it was a noodle dish with wasabi and salmon and avacado.   the fish was the best i've had.  avacados just ripe--and ridiculously low prices.  i had to be forced to not eat there every night of my stay in san fran.
author: Kathleen S.

description: this place is always crowded. great fast food. try the corn on the cob. rocks out with its guac out.
author: thomas c.

description: I used to work 2 blocks from this place so I am familiar with the food. But since I'm trying to record my dining whereabouts...here I go again. I already knew this place is the size of a closet, but who cares.  It's Christmas and it's the season to snuggle and eat right next to strangers in the city. My boyfriend and I just came in for a snack. We ordered 2 Sierra Nevadas and the Ahi Poke appetizer. Our server was a little chatty and only too excited about his first ever band performance and how he was still hung over from two days before. On top of that, he said playing loud made up for his lack of skill.  Oh great. All I hoped was that he was no where near the making of my food.  At first glance, the ahi looked wickedly good. Big huge marinated chunks of ahi with won ton strips topped with green onions. Looked good but only so-so. Surprising kind of plain.  I think that it needed more marinade, wasabe...something! Pacific Catch is usually a crowd pleaser, but came up slightly short today. Maybe next time.
author: Grace V.

description: hmm best fish tacos and ahi tuna salad!  love this place
author: George M.

description: Quiet possibly the best fish and chips I've had in years. We had the breaded oysters, battered cod and sweet potato fries....amazing! Cooked perfectly, the condiments tasted great and the fries were excellent. Overall a great experience. The artichoke appetizer was good too - the sauce that came with it was my fav. MMMMM - would def go back!
author: Busta B.

description: loved the grilled mahi-mahi teriyaki bowl!! asparagus, bok choy, & a refreshing pineapple salsa was such a great combination with the mahi & white rice. i've also had the fried sweet potatoe - like french fries & those were excellent too! sweet & salty! highly recommended!! we ate out front b/c it is a small little restaurant. otherwise cozy & great service.
author: Kay V.

description: wow. apparently everyone else loves this place too! i can't get enough of the wasabi bowls (poke is my favorite). their sweet potato fries are also to die for. reminded me of good old fuel n' fuddle in pittsburgh, and for a city that puts fries on everything from salads to sandwiches, i think that's a compliment. their tacos are also amazing. it even got rave reviews from my friend who happens to be a taco snob. a definite must, and absolutely worth the wait! i don't recommend sitting at the bar directly in front of the grill though. i nearly had a heat stroke the first and last time i sat there.
author: Karva S.

description: hands down, my favorite local restaurant in the neighborhood. everything on the menu is incredible, no joke. reasonably priced and very unique.  the place is always packed, so do takeout like everyone else!
author: Christine S.

description: What can I say - this place is always great.  If you don't mind waiting for 20 minutes, then you're in store for a treat..  Awesome poke and the bowls are awesome.  And so are the sweet potato fries :)
author: Lisa K.

description: So, I'll tell you a little secret about this place, most of the fish is not actually fresh, but frozen, from boxes. However, this does not take away from the yummyness of this place. Back in the fall of 2004, my best friend and I stumbled upon this place and fell absolutely in love with the food (yes, the sweet potato fries is all that). We came and hung out here so much that we started to smell like fish. Fast forward to spring of 2006, we broke our P-Catch addiction and will never have another ahi tuna bowl again, but I still recommend P-Catch to all. Inexpensive, good size portions, fast and tasty food. One of the best places the Marina has got to offer!
author: Mama L.

description: really fresh fish on a budget. rock cod tacos are delicious, as are all the fish tacos. with sweet potato fries!! yum.
author: Lisa M.

description: this is a five-star value pick.  i like everything on their menu -- especially the fried oysters, when they're in season -- it's reasonably priced, and the sweet potato fries are delicious and abundant.  i only wish this place were bigger.  the restaurant is tiny and popular, so you usually have to wait to sit down.  they keep things moving, though.
author: Jeff W.

description: Pacific Catch is a great place to grab a quick bite. You don't come here for the ambiance, the decor or the service-  you come for quick, good seafood. I suggest sitting at the counter, ordering the poke appetizer and the fish and chips with the sweet potatoe fries. Let me repeat that... sweet potatoe fries.
author: Samantha F.

description: This place is awesome.  I was dead tired from a horrible flight from a delayed flight home from DC and all I wanted was sustenance.  All I wanted was some food.  I had blown by Pacific Catch many times on my way to somewhere a lot of times and thought it looked interesting but never went in.  Idiot...  I grabbed some food to go thinking it would be OK.  It was great.  For whatever reason, I ordered the fish and chips  which I never order because so many places bread the fish like they are concealing some national secret but the tilapia they were serving was great.  My friend wanted the fish tacos which were really good too.  I am rarely excited about sweet potato fries but they were excellent.  They were about 30 minutes from closing so there was this huge vat of poki I asked about and they gave me a taste.  I am usually very suspicious of seasoned tuna because it is typically not the best quality but this was really good.  I am absolutely trying the poki next time.
author: David S.

description: Stopped in on  a Sunday night and the tiny place was packed. The smells were divine! Friends had recommended it so I couldn't pass it up. And I'm glad I didn't. The menu has plenty of fresh fish options from Salmon sandwiches to fish & chips to Ahi tuna poke bowl. Prices are reasonable given the neighborhood and freshness of the fish (and size of the place.) I chose the Chipotle Mahi Mahi salad as I had been short on greens of late. Very yummy with just the right kick. My bar counter "neighbors" were devouring their poke bowls and fried fish appetizers. Didn't try the sweet potato fries but they looked awesome. Most people I talked to who had been there multiple times claimed they had never had a bad meal. Only warning was that the fish tacos may be a little disappointing. Only negative is that this place is TINY -- seating for maybe 30 at most. My guess is that most nights you will waiting awhile for any size group bigger than 1.
author: Eddie R.

description: This place was amazing.   I had the taco platter with cabo shrimp taco, mahi mahi, and salmon and they were all incredible. The platter came with sweet potato fries, which I am normally not a fan of, but these were incredible.  I will be going back here a lot.
author: Taylor K.

description: LOVE the ahi poke bowl.  it is one of the best meals i've ever had.  their tacos are great, too, esp. the bbq shrimp taco.  seriously, this place ROCKS.   better for take-out than eating in b/c it's always packed (and definitely call in your order).
author: M D.

description: The Ahi Tuna Wasabi Bowl at $10.95 might be my favorite meal anywhere.  Really fresh fish.  The fish tacos are a little skimpy, but the Wasabi Bowl is a meal.  They mix some wasabi sauce into the rice that makes it so good.
author: Tom Z.

description: Good fish tacos.  But how is it possible to spend over $10 at a takeout place and not even be near full?
author: Nate B.

description: My favorite take out place, and my favorite eat-a-bowl-of-fish-and-drink-beers on a warm San Francisco night.  (Ok the warm nights might be just as rare as the fish).  Sweet potato fries, fun staff, great food, all tossed into a small hole in the wall.  But it works, so don't question it.
author: Benson J.

description: Ahi tuna wasabi bowl for you, tokyo salmon for her. Sweet potato fries to share and a cold beer to wash it all down. Enough said.
author: paul r.

description: This place is absolutely fabulous. It is so good!!!..especially their sweet potato fries and ahi poke wasabi bowls. The only thing I wish for is that they would expand because their space is so small and its always packed. If the owners/managers are reading this, please please please expand your restaurant.
author: Chanli S.

description: Walking down the sidewalk, I was clipped from behind and thrown into a van, after struggling with my captors, I  jumped from the moving vehicle and found myself in front of Pacific Catch. Yes, in the Marina. Upon having the salmon sandwich with crazy good sweet potato fries, I felt like a new man. I bought a glock on the corner and hunted down my abductors. How dare they bring me into the Marina, but I had to thank them or I would not have had that fantastic sandwich!
author: Niko P.

description: This place is awesome, definitely one of my favorite places to eat. The food is delicious, I've had many different things on the menu and all are fantastic. Definitely get the sweet potato fries as an appetizer, they're incredible!
author: Melanie R.

description: 8/10 times, this place is excellent. There's only been a few times that I've been here (and because it's so close, we go frequently) that the sesame slaw has been limp or the fish has been mediocre, etc. It's crowded, so prepare to wait at least 10-15 minutes for a table. It is also a tad on the pricey side ($11-15 for a salad or sandwich), but best not to cheap out on seafood.
author: Vyl C.

description: been dozens of times and will continue: consistently tasty food at reasonable price. sometimes a bit crowded for my taste (i.e. count on hearing most conversations at neighboring tables whether you want to or not), but take-out is always and easy solution.
author: linn c.

description: Quick, fresh seafood. Cheap prices. Convenient location.  Professional wait staff. Sushi-grade fish.  Highly recommend this place!  The only negative is the occasional long lines.
author: Laura B.

description: I love this place! The bowls are great with just the right portion of seafood. I think it is for sure worth whatever wait there is.
author: Cortney H.

description: Loved it!!  The fish was very fresh, and the food was reasonably priced.  Had some sorta of ahi tuna bowl, which was delicious.  Only downside was that it was reallyyy crowded.  I hear the other location near Golden Gate Park is more spacious?
author: Rebecca L.

description: The only reason why I'm giving "Pacific Catch" 4 BIG STARS is because .... drumroll please ... THE FRIGGIN' GOOD SWEET POTATO FRIES! Otherwise, they get a 2 star rating for small space, and another 2 star rating for sub-par service (not that the waitress was overtly mean,  but she just didn't really care about being nice to us ... i can't believe we still tipped her 15%) ... Anyhoo, if you're hankering for some awesome fries, go check out PC ... peace out
author: Patty C.

description: I love this place.  While the place is pretty small and cramped, the great food makes up for it.  The sweet potato fries are to die for as are their rice bowls.
author: Jennifer C.

description: I love this place and will even drive to the marina and face the horrible parking  and the "I just got out of the sorority/fraternity" people to eat here. The staff is very friendly, if busy. Please, please please, open one in the east bay!
author: Tory K.

description: We really like the food here, at this location and at the one in Marin.  The seafood is really fresh and reasonably priced.  I usually get the taco plate, on Mahi and one shrimp.  It comes with a FABULOUS salad or sweet potato fries.  I always intend on trying something new, but when I get there I order the same thing.  Its good and its consist ant.
author: Aimee D.

description: Sooo good.  I'm happy every time I make it down to this place.  The poke (hawaiian-style sashimi) is fantastic.  The mochi dessert is really good too.  My only gripe is that the place is a little small.
author: Ron J.

description: I went here for the first time recently and while it was good, I wasn't 'blown away'.  The food was very reasonably priced and big portions.  But I felt like there is a lot of fluff, for example, you get a giant bowl of rice with your three slices of seared ahi in one of the entrees.  Otherwise the drink selection was good, its cozy, and in a good neighborhood for eating before going out.
author: Lenore B.

description: I looooove Pacific catch!!! Their poke bowl is out of this world and is a must every time I visit the restaurant. Try any of their signature drinks, especially  the Lemongrass mojito which is by far the best mojito I've ever tried. For an appetizer I always go for a basket of their famous sweet potato fries.Yummy! Service is always pretty good. The other day we had a cute russian waitress, who was very friendly and attentive.
author: katie m.

description: This place is SOLID.  Nothing too fancy, and eating there can be a little crowded, but the food is just plain good.  I'm a big fan of the Ahi Tuna Wasabi bowl.  The appetizers are good, I've found service to be very good, and the price is right.  Becoming one of my neighborhood staples...
author: Green T.

description: I have been there a couple of times and honestly I don't get why it is so crowded and well reviewed. Maybe I haven't tried the right dishes, but I didn't think any of the entrees I had were outstanding. The sweet potato fries are quite good and craveable.
author: Varun B.

description: 4.5 stars, just because it's so friggin' tiny! but i LOVE this place! the staff is super friendly (which is necessary for a place this busy), and the food is fantastic. it is the perfect spot when you want something that's simple but way better than average. my favorite order is 3 tropical shrimp tacos and of COURSE the sweet potato fries (i get the pineapple salsa for the tacos on the side so that that juice doesn't seep into my pile of fries and make 'em soggy). the salads are also good, and my father in law really dug the fish and chips (and he is somewhat of a fish and chip connoisseur). keep up the good work, pac catch!
author: kimberly h.

description: not sure why i'm reviewing this; for quick bite, will satisfy; reasonable price, big portions
author: Peter L.

description: i really like this place. not only because it's close by my apartment but i'm always happy with my meal. always satisfying. the portions are a little big for me - so i often opt for the kid's size. i'm also a huge fan of corn on the cob so i always get that as well. sweet potato fries are to die for - try dipping them in the spicy sweet sauce - i always ask for extra.
author: Miss O.

description: great menu! everything looked good. first time here today and I tried the tacos, bbq salmon and shrimp.  The person I went with had the mahi mahi sandwhich and it was delicious! We shared the tuna poke for an appetizer and really, everything tasted so fresh and was presented very aesthitically pleasing! Small place, but great for a quick lunch, with reasonable prices, and staff was very friendly and accomodating. Parking garage is close too.
author: Michelle J.
